'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Do not lie to me; For whoever lies to me will go to hellfire!"

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: One day the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out to the people. Then a man came to him and said: O Messenger of Allah, what is faith (Iman)? He replied: Faith is that you believe in Allah, in His angels, in His book, in the meeting with Him, in His messengers and in the future resurrection. The man further asked: O Messenger of Allah! What is Islam? The Prophet said: Islam is that you worship Allah, do not associate with Him, perform the prescribed prayer, pay the prescribed Zakah (alms tax), and fast Ramadan. The man said: O Messenger of Allah, what is goodness (Ihsaan)? He replied: That you worship Allah as if you saw Him; for if you do not see Him, He still sees you. The man said: O Messenger of Allah, when will the Hour arrive? He said: The questioner is no more knowledgeable about this than the questioner himself. But as far as their omens are concerned, I will tell you the following: When the slave gives birth to her own master, that is one of the omens, when the naked and barefoot Becoming masters of the people is one of the omens, and when the uneducated camel drivers build high-rise buildings; This is also one of the omens. There are five things that only Allah knows. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) recited:   Verily, with Allah alone is the knowledge of the hour. He sends down abundant rain. And he knows what is in the womb of his mother, while no one knows what he will acquire the next day, and no one knows in what country he will die. Verily Allah is All-Knowing and All-Aware. [Qur'an 31:34] The man then went away, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Bring this man back! They wanted to bring him back, but they saw no more of him. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: This was Gabriel! He came to instruct people in their faith. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 10]

Zaid Ibn Khalid Al-Juhaniy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) led us in morning prayers in Al-Hudaibiya when the traces of the rainy night were still visible. When the prayer was over, he came to the people and said: Do you know what your Lord has said? They replied: Allah and His Messenger know best. Then the Prophet said: Allah said: With the dawning of the morning there became among My servants those who believe in Me and those who disbelieve in Me: whoever of them said: The rain fell on us by Allah's grace and mercy , he is a believer towards Me and an unbeliever towards the star; But whoever said: The rain fell on us through the cycle of so-and-so and so-and-so is disbelieving towards Me and believing towards the star.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 104]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:
 The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The mark of the hypocrite is his hatred of the Ansar (the Madin followers of Muhammad) and the mark of the believer is his love for the Ansar.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 108]

Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said of the Ansar (the followers of Madin): None love them except the believers, and none hate them except the hypocrites. Whoever loves them, Allah will love them, and whoever hates them, Allah will hate them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 110]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O women! Give alms and ask Allah for forgiveness often! For I have seen that you are the majority of the inhabitants of hell. Then one of the women, who was distinguished by reason and piety, asked: How is it, Messenger of Allah, that we are the majority of the inhabitants of Hell? He answered: You often curse and are often ungrateful to your husbands. Nor have I ever seen anyone with less intelligence and less religiosity than you, who can seduce even an intelligent man. The woman then asked: O Messenger of Allah! What is meant by little intelligence and little religiosity? He replied: What is meant by lack of understanding is that a woman's testimony carries only half the weight of a man's. And the lack of religiosity means that the woman goes nights without praying and breaks the Ramadan fast.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 114]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asked: What deed is best? He replied: Faith in Allah. He was then further asked: Which ones other than this one? He replied: Jihad in the cause of Allah. He was further asked: Which then other than this? He replied: A blessed, accepted pilgrimage.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 118]

Abu Zarr, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I said: O Messenger of Allah, what deed is most meritorious? He replied: Faith in Allah and commitment to His cause. I asked: And what kind of slave emancipation is most valuable? He answered: The liberation of those most highly valued (slaves) by their relatives, and of them the one whose ransom is the highest. I said: What if I can't do this? He said: Then help someone in need or help someone with a job they can't do very well. I asked again: O Messenger of Allah, and what if I myself have become so weak that I cannot help? He replied: Then do not harm anyone, for this too counts as sadaqa (charity) towards yourself.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 119]

Talha Ibn 'Ubaidillah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
 A man from Najd with unkempt hair, a loud voice and incomprehensible words came to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) and approached him and asked him about Islam. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There are five prayers per day and night! The man replied: Am I obliged to pray other than these? To this the Prophet replied: No! Unless you perform voluntary prayers! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) continued: Furthermore, fasting in Ramadan is (also an obligation). The man said: Am I obliged to observe any other Lent than this? The Prophet replied: No! Unless you fast voluntarily! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) also mentioned to him the obligation of Zakah. The man replied: Am I obliged to pay any other tax than this? The Prophet replied: No! Unless you donate voluntarily! The man then went away and said: By Allah! I will do no more and no less than this. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: He would be successful if he had told the truth!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 12]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): What deed is best? Then he said: Prayer at the right time. I further asked: And what action afterwards? He replied: Then be kind to your parents! I asked again: And what action afterwards? He said: Fighting in the way of Allah. Then I stopped asking him any more questions, just because I didn't want to stress him out.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 120]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): Which sin is the most serious before Allah? He said: That you do something equal to Allah while He is your Creator. I said: Truly, this is so difficult. Which one then? He said: That you kill your child because you are afraid that he will share the food with you. I said: Which one then? He said: That you commit fornication with your neighbor's wife.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 124]

Abu Bakra (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We were with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he said: Shall I not call you the greatest of all sins? There are three things: co-idolization, unkindness towards parents and false testimony or lying statements. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was leaning on the ground. He then sat upright and repeated this several times, making us wish he would stop.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 126]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:
 The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said regarding the greatest sins: (They are) idolatry, unkindness to parents, killing a person and telling lies.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 127]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Stay away from the seven devastating sins. It was said: O Messenger of Allah, and what are these? He said: These are: Associating with Allah, sorcery, killing a human being, which Allah has forbidden except according to law; and further, the consumption of the orphan's wealth, the consumption of the interest, the flight on the day of battle, and the slander of the honorable, careless believing women.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 129]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We have been forbidden to ask the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about matters on which he is silent. Therefore, it pleased us when a wise Bedouin came to the Prophet and asked him about something while we were listening. Once a Bedouin came to the Prophet and told him: O Muhammad, your Messenger has come to us and told us that you claim that Allah has sent you. The Prophet replied: He said rightly. The man continued: Who created heaven? The Prophet replied: Allah. He asked again: And who created the earth? He replied: Allah. The Bedouin further asked: And who built these mountains and created what is in them? The Prophet replied: Allah. Then the man said: By Him Who created the heavens and the earth and set up these mountains, has Allah sent you? The Prophet replied: Yes! The Bedouin further said: Your messenger said that five prayers are prescribed for us every day and every night. The Prophet replied: He said rightly. The Bedouin further said: By the One who sent you, is it really Allah Who has commanded you this? He replied: Yes! Then the Bedouin said: Your messenger said that a tax (zakah) has been decreed for us on our property. The Prophet replied: He said rightly. The Bedouin said: By the One who sent you, is it really Allah Who has commanded you this? The Prophet said: Yes. The Bedouin further said: Your messenger also said that we should fast in the month of Ramadan every year. The Prophet replied: He said rightly. Then the man asked: Is it really Allah, the One who sent you, who commanded you this? The Prophet replied: Yes. Then the Bedouin said: And your messenger said that we should make the pilgrimage (to the house) if we can afford it. The Prophet replied: He said rightly. The Bedouin then went away and said: By Him who sent you with truth, I will do no more and no less than what you have told me! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then said: If he had spoken the truth, he would enter Paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 13]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr Ibnal 'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: One of the gravest sins is insulting one's parents. The people asked: O Messenger of Allah, is it possible for someone to insult his parents? He replied: Yes, by insulting someone else's father, to which he returns the insult to his father, but also by insulting someone else's mother, to which he returns the insult to his mother.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 130]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever dies and associates something else with Allah will enter Hellfire. I said: And he who dies and associates nothing else with Allah will enter Paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 134]

Abu Zarr, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Gabriel, peace be upon him, came to me and told me this good news: Whoever of your Ummah (community) dies and Allah not otherwise associated, will enter paradise. I (Abu Zarr) asked: Even if he committed fornication and theft? The Prophet replied: Even if he has committed fornication and theft!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 137]

Al-Miqdad Ibnal Aswad, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I said: O Messenger of Allah, what do you mean when I was engaged in a fight against an unbeliever and during that time he struck one of my two hands with the sword and she separated? He then sought protection from me in a tree and shouted: I am devoted to Allah (Muslim)! Should I kill him now that he has spoken these words? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Do not kill him! I replied: O Messenger of Allah, he cut off one of my two hands from my body and then spoke his words after cutting off my hand. Should I kill him now? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No! If you kill him, he (as a Muslim) is in your place before you killed him, and you (as a non-Muslim) are in his place before he spoke his word that he uttered.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 139]

Abu Ayyub Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A Bedouin appeared before the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) while he was on a journey. He took the nose rope - or the reins - of the Prophet's camel in his hand and said: O Messenger of Allah, (or: O Muhammad), tell me what I must do in order to enter Paradise and avoid Hellfire! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was silent for a while, then he turned to his companions and said: He succeeded or was guided. He then said: What did you say? The Bedouin repeated his question. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then said: Worship Allah alone and do not attribute to Him any sharer in His divinity, perform the prescribed prayer, pay the legal dues (Zakah) and maintain ties with your relatives. Now let the camelin go!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 14]

Usama Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent us on a campaign. At the place of Al-Huraqat in the area of ​​Juhainah we attacked the people towards morning. When I caught a (fleeing) man, he said (la ilaha illa-llah) (= There is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah). Nevertheless, I stabbed him (with my sword). But then I felt touched inside and I told the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) the whole thing. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Did he say (There is no god but Allah) and you still killed him? I said: O Messenger of Allah, he only said that because he was afraid of death with my weapon. But he (the Prophet) said: Did you then examine his heart and know whether he really meant that or not? He repeated this sentence several times until I wished I had not come to Islam before that day. Sa`d said: And I, by Allah, will not kill any Muslim unless Zul-Butain i.e. Usama kills him. Then a man said: Didn't Allah say:   And fight against them so that there can be no temptation and (fight) until all worship is directed towards Allah alone. [Quran 8:39] Sa'd replied: We have already fought so that no temptation can take place. But you and your companions want to fight so that seduction takes place.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 140]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever uses a weapon against us is not one of us.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 143]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever uses a weapon against us is not one of us.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 145]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: We do not include the one who strikes his cheeks (while mourning), removing his clothes from their openings tears it down and uses the dirge of the pre-Islamic period (Jahiliya).   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 148]

Huzaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:
 I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: A slanderer will not enter Paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 151]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Three will not be spoken to, looked at, or purified by Allah on the Day of Resurrection. And these are the ones who face a severe punishment: A man who is in the desert and has a surplus of water, but refuses to let a traveler drink it; a man who sells a commodity to someone after the afternoon prayer, he swears to him by Allah that he bought it for so-and-so (money). So the other person believes him, even though he is lying. And a man who swears an oath of loyalty to an Imam but only in pursuit of this world. If the Imam gives him some of it, he keeps his oath, but if he does not get any of it, he does not keep his oath.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 157]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever kills himself with a knife will carry his knife in his hand and carry it into his stomach in Hellfire, and therein remain forever. And whoever takes poison and thereby kills himself will carry his poison in his hand and drink it in the fire of hell, and remain therein for all eternity; and whoever throws himself from a mountain and thereby kills himself will fall into hellfire and remain therein for all eternity.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 158]

Thabit Ibn-ad-Dahhak (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever swears by a faith other than Islam while lying is true to what he says . And whoever commits suicide with an object will be tormented with it on the Day of Resurrection. And no man shall make a vow to consecrate a thing which he does not possess.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 159]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:
 A desert Arab came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, tell me an act which, if I commit it, will bring me to Paradise! Then the Prophet said: You serve Allah and do not associate anything with Him, you perform the obligatory prayer, pay the prescribed Zakah and fast in Ramadan! The man replied: I swear by Him in whose hand my life is that I will do nothing more and nothing less than this! When the desert Arab left, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Whoever is pleased by the sight of a person who belongs to the inhabitants of Paradise should look at this man!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 16]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: We took part in the battle of Hunain with the Messenger of Allah. He said about a man who claimed to be a Muslim: He is one of the inhabitants of hell! While we were in the thick of the fighting, this man fought very hard and was injured. It was then said: O Messenger of Allah, the man whom you previously said would go to Hell fought very fiercely today and perished. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: To hell! Some Muslims were almost overcome with doubt when it became known that the man had not died, but was seriously injured. At night he could not bear his wounds and killed himself. When this was reported to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), he said: Allahu Akbar (=Allah is the Greatest). I bear witness that I am the servant and the Messenger of Allah. He then ordered Bilal to call the people and tell them: None but a Muslim soul will enter paradise. Allah supports this religion, even through an impudent person!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 162]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd As-Sa'idiy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Muslims under the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the fellow believers met and fought against each other. Finally the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) withdrew with his people to the army camp, and the enemies also retreated. But one of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) pursued all the idolaters who were retreating outside their formation and struck them down with his sword. Later they (the Prophet's companions) said: None of us has fulfilled his task today as well as so-and-so. But the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: No! He will be one of the inhabitants of hell! Then one of the Muslims said: I will follow this man and keep a close eye on him. So he went with him (to meet the enemies). Whenever he stopped, the other stopped too, and whenever he ran quickly, the other ran with him. But then that man was seriously injured and wished for a quick death. He stuck the hilt of his sword into the ground and pointed the blade of the weapon at his chest. Then he threw himself with all his might on the sword and killed himself. The man who saw this rushed to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and shouted: I bear witness that you are the Messenger of Allah. He (the Prophet) asked: What happened? He (the man) said: The man you recently said would go to hell! But the people couldn't believe it. The man continued: I said I would look into the matter. So I followed and watched him. He suffered a serious injury and wanted to die quickly. He stuck the hilt of his sword into the ground and pointed the blade of the weapon at his chest. Then he threw himself on the sword with all his might and killed himself. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Yes, indeed! There are people who seem to act like the inhabitants of paradise, but are actually inmates of hell! And there are people who seem to act like the inhabitants of hell, but will still enter paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 163]

Jundab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A man from among the previous generations had a boil. When the boil hurt him, he took an arrow from his quiver and stabbed him with it. The blood didn't stop flowing until the man finally died. Your Lord said: I have prevented this man from entering Paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 164]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: We took part in the battle of Khaibar with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), where Allah gave us victory. We took neither gold nor silver as spoils of war, only food and clothing. We then marched on to the valley. The Messenger of Allah was accompanied by a servant given to him by a man named Refa'a Ibn Zaid, from the Guzam family of Banu Ad-Dubaib. As we reached the valley, the Prophet's servant began untying his camel's saddle. Meanwhile, an arrow was thrown at him and he died instantly. Then we said: Good luck! O Allah's Messenger, he died a martyr. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No. By the one in whose hand is the life of Muhammad. The cloak he stole from the spoils of Khaibar, before the spoils were distributed according to law, burns on him. The people were very frightened when they heard this. Then a man came with one or two shoelaces and said: O Allah's Messenger! I took this on the day of Khaibar. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: This is one shoelace of fire - or these are two shoelaces of fire.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 166]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the verse:   You who believe, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet [Quran 49:2], was revealed, Thabit Ibn Qais sat at his house and said: I belonged to the inmates of Hell, and he then avoided meeting the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). The Prophet asked Sa'd Ibn Mu'az about him, saying: Abu 'Amr, what is wrong with Thabit? Is he ill? Sa'd replied: He is my neighbor, but I don't know that he is sick. Anas further reported: Sa'd then went to him (Thabit) and told him what the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had said. Thabit said: This verse was revealed and you know that I was the one among you who raised my voice most highly above the voice of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). So I am one of the inmates of hell. Sa'd narrated this conversation to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No, he is one of the inhabitants of Paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 170]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Some said to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): O Messenger of Allah! Are we being punished for the sins we committed in the pre-Islamic era? He replied: Whoever of you does good after entering Islam will not be punished for the sins he committed in the pre-Islamic period. But whoever does evil will be punished for his sins before and after Islam.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 171]

Ibn 'Abbas narrated: There were people among the idolaters who killed excessively, committed fornication excessively, and then came to Muhammad (may peace be upon him) and said: What you say, and What you are asking is good in itself. Only if you would tell us if there was an atonement for what we have done! Then the following verse was revealed: And those who do not call with Allah to another god, and do not kill a soul that Allah has forbidden except according to law, and who do not commit adultery, and whoever does so, He will be punished for willful sin [Quran 25:68] It has also been revealed: You, My servants, who have transgressed against yourself, do not despair of the Mercy of Allah. [Quran 39:53]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 174]

Hakiem Ibn Hizaam (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I said to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): Do you believe that I will be rewarded for the acts of worship that I performed in the pre-Islamic period? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You have embraced Islam and will be rewarded for all the acts of worship that you have performed before.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 175]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Qur'anic verse was revealed to those who believe and do not cover their faith with injustice... [Quran 6:82], the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) were revealed All hail be upon him, who grieved greatly, saying, Who is there among us who has not done wrong against himself? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The meaning of the verse is not what you think. But what this means is what Luqman said to his son:   My dear son, do not give Allah any fellow gods; fellow idolatry is certainly a tremendous injustice. [Quran 31:13]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ No. 178]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah has indeed forgiven the people of my Umma (community) what he has within himself, as long as he does not spread it or put this into practice.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 181]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, said (to the angels): If my servant intends to do something bad, then write it against him not down. If he does it, he writes it down as just one bad deed. And if he intends to do something good but does not carry it out, then write it down for him as just one good deed. But if he does it, then write it down as ten good deeds.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 183]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said this, which he wanted to report about his Lord (blessed and exalted be He): Verily Allah has good deeds and bad deeds written down! The Prophet then explained it as follows: So whoever intends to do something good but does not carry it out, Allah writes it down as a complete good deed. And if he intends it and then commits it, Allah will record it for him by Himself as ten good deeds, up to seven hundred times and several times more. But whoever intends to do something bad and then does not do it, Allah will write it down as a complete good deed. And if he intends it and then commits it, Allah will record it for him only as one bad deed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 187]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:
 The Messenger of Allah, may Allah be pleased with him, said: Islam is built on five pillars: belief in the Oneness of Allah, performing prayer, paying zakah Fasting during Ramadan and the Hajj (pilgrimage).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 19]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: People will keep asking questions until it is said: Allah created all creatures; but who created Allah? Whoever comes up with such thoughts should say: I really believe in Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 190]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, said: The members of your Ummah (community) will always ask: What is this? And what is that? until they say: This is Allah, who created all creatures; but who created Allah?  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 195]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Whoever swears a binding oath to appropriate the wealth of a Muslim in an unauthorized way will meet Allah, in which case Allah will be angry with him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 197]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Whoever dies defending his wealth dies as a martyr.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 202]

Ma'qil Ibn Yasaar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: There is no servant who is made ruler of a people by Allah and then dies after being had deceived the people without Allah denying them paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 203]

Huzaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:
 Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) told us two hadiths, one of which I have seen (become true) and await the arrival of the other: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). , told us that reliability was rooted in people's hearts, that when the Quran was revealed, they learned from it and from the Sunnah. Then he told us about the loss of reliability and said: "A person will go to sleep and then the reliability disappears from his heart and only its impression remains in it, and when he goes to sleep again the reliability disappears to a small extent Calluses in his heart, like a blister that is empty inside." Then he (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) took a pebble and rolled it down his foot and continued: "And then the people will go on with their business, but none of them will be trustworthy until the time comes when one says: "In such and such a people there is a reliable person," until one says about a person: "What a strong, clever and intelligent person he is," even though he has no trace of faith. It There was a time when I didn't care who I did business with: if he was (accidentally) Muslim, his religion was a good enough guarantee, and if he was a Christian or a Jew, his protection was a good guarantee. But today I don't do business except with so-and-so."  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 206]

Huzaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:
 We were with 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) when he said: Which of you has heard the Messenger of Allah speak of the Troubles? Some people said: We heard him. 'Umar said: Perhaps you mean the trial of everyone by his family and his neighbors. (meaning the preoccupation with them, which distracts from the things of the hereafter and the neglect of their rights) They replied: Yes. He said: This is atoned for by performing prayers, fasting and giving alms. But who of you heard the prophet speak of the turmoil that beats one another like the waves of the sea? Huzaifa further reported: All the people were silent and I said: I heard him. 'Umar said: Allah have mercy on your father! Huzaifa said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: The confusions are offered to the hearts of men like the mat; Crop by crop. Each heart she accepts is marked with a black mark, and each one she rejects is marked with a white mark. So there will be two kinds of hearts: a white and smooth stone, which will never be damaged by the turmoil as long as heaven and earth exist; and a black ashen heart like an upturned pitcher, recognizing no good and rejecting no evil except at will.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 207]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Verily, faith will always find its way back to Madinah, like a snake that always finds its way back to its hole.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 210]

Huzaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:
 When we were sitting with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he said: List to me those who professed Islam. Huzaifa further reported: We said: O Allah's Messenger, are you afraid for us while we are between six hundred and seven hundred? The Messenger of Allah said: You do not know, for perhaps you will face a trial. He (Huzaifa) said: It happened then that we were subjected to a severe test, so that each of us had to perform the prayer only in secret.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 213]

Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:
 Once the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) divided a loot. I said: O Messenger of Allah, let so-and-so partake of it, for he is a believer. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You mean a Muslim! I repeated this three times and he also replied three times: You mean a Muslim! Then he said: I give someone some of the spoils while another is dearer to me than him, for fear that Allah will throw him into the Fire if he apostates.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 214]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: We are more worthy of doubt than Abraham; who said:   My Lord! show me how you bring the dead to life! He said: And do you not believe? He (Abraham) said: Yes, but that my heart may be at rest. [Quran 2:260] The Prophet said: May Allah have mercy on Lot! He went to a strong support. And if I had stayed in prison as long as Joseph did, and then the messenger had come to me with the invitation, I would certainly have followed him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 216]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There is no Prophet who was not supported with a miraculous sign that made people believe (in his message). I am only the one upon whom a revelation has been sent down from Allah. So I hope that on the Day of Resurrection I will be the one who has the largest number of followers among them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 217]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There are three kinds of people who receive double reward: One of the People of the Book who believed in his own Prophet lifetime of Muhammad, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, lives, believes in him and follows him; he receives double wages. A slave who is in the possession of his master and fulfills his duties to both Allah and his master; he receives double wages. A man who has a slave, feeds her well, raises her well, then sets her free and then marries her; he also receives double wages.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 219]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) said: I swear by the One in whose hands my life is that the son of Mary (may Allah be pleased with him) will come soon will be sent to you as a just arbitrator; then he will break the cross, kill the pig, abolish the protective tax on free non-Muslims under Muslim rule and the money will multiply to such an extent that no one will want to accept it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 220]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The Hour (of Judgment) will not come until the sun rises from the west. And when the sun rises from the west, all the people will be believers. And on that day no soul will profit by his faith unless he has first believed or acquired good by his faith. [Quran 6:158]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 226]

Abu Zarr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: One day the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said (to his companions): Do you know where this sun goes? The people said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: She runs until she finally reaches her resting place under the throne, where she falls in prostration. She remains like this until she is told: Get up and return to the place from which you came. So it returns and rises in the morning from its place of emergence. She then runs again until she reaches her resting place under the throne, where she falls into prostration. She remains like this until she is told: Get up and return to the place from which you came. So it returns, rises from its place of emergence in the morning and then runs again. And people don't notice anything unusual about her until she returns to her resting place under the throne. She is told: Arise in the morning from your place of destruction. This is how it rises from the west in the morning. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Do you know when this will happen? On that day when faith will not profit a soul who has not previously believed or acquired good by his faith. [Quran 6:158]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 228]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The messengers of 'Abdul Qais once came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, we are from the tribe of Rabie'a and the disbelievers are from the tribe of Mudar block our way to you. That is why we can only come to you in the holy months. This gives us something to follow and to which we can call people after us. Then he said: I command you to observe four commandments and forbid you four things: Belief in Allah (he explained this to them by saying: Testifying that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah); the offering of prayer, the giving of Zakah and the giving of the fifth of your spoils. But I forbid you to prepare Nabith (date water) in vessels made of gourds, or those made of clay, hair, and blood, or those made of tree trunks, or in vessels coated with pitch.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 23]

'A'ishah, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: The first thing with which the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) began the revelation was the veritable dream vision during sleep; he had not seen a dream that did not come true like the morning light. After that, solitude was made dear to him (by Allah). To do this, he chose the mountain cave of Hira', where he usually retreated for several nights and sought Allah's presence - a kind of worship. He then went to his family and took care of the next round; he then returned again to Khadiga to prepare for similar provision. (And this continued to happen) until the truth came to him while he was in the mountain cave of Hira'. There the angel came to him and said: Read! Then he said: I can't read. (The Prophet reported this by) saying: 'Then (the angel) seized me and pressed me to the point of exhaustion, then released me and said again: - Read! I said (again): - I can't read. Then he grabbed me and squeezed me for the second time until I was exhausted, then he let me go and said: Read! I said (again): - I can't read. Then he seized me and pressed me the third time to the point of exhaustion, then he released me and said: Read, in the name of your Lord, who created; He created man from an adherent blood structure. Read! And your Lord is the most noble, who taught with the writing reed; He taught people what they never knew.[Quran 96:1] With this verse, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) returned with trembling shoulders. Then he went in to Khadiga and said: Wrap me up! Envelop me! So they covered him until his fear left him. He then said to Khadiga, O Khadiga, what is the matter with me? and told her about the event. He said: I feared for my life. Then Khadiga said: This cannot be so, be happy. You would never experience disgrace with Allah; for you are truly the one who maintains the ties of kinship, speaks only the truth, helps the weak, gives something to the destitute, welcomes the guest in a friendly manner and gives a helping hand to those in need. Khadiga then left the house with him and went to Waraqa Ibn Naufal Ibn Asad Ibn 'Abdel 'Uzza, the son of her paternal uncle, who converted to Christianity in the Jahiliya (the pre-Islamic period). He could write in Arabic and used to copy from the Gospel in Arabic, as long as Allah wanted it. He was also an old man who had gone blind. Khadiga said to him: O son of my uncle, hear from your brother's son what he says! Waraqa Ibn Naufal said: O son of my brother, what do you bring? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) told him what he had experienced. Then Waraqa said to him: This is the message which Allah also revealed to Moses. I wish I were young enough and alive enough to see your people drive you away! Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Will they really drive me out? Waraqa replied: Yes. No one came with anything like what you brought without becoming enemies. If I am still alive on your day, I will support you with all my might.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 231]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When As I was traveling, I heard a voice from heaven; I raised my head upwards and saw that the angel who appeared to me in the mountain cave of Hira' was sitting on a seat between heaven and earth. I was very frightened by him, returned and said: Wrap me up! Envelop me! So they enveloped me. Then Allah, Exalted and Mighty, sent down the following words: You, the Covered One! Stand up and warn! And glorify your Lord, and cleanse your garments, and remove the filthy things (i.e. idols) from them. [Quran 74:1] After that, the revelation continued without interruption.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 232]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Al-Buraaq was brought to me; a long white animal, larger than the donkey and smaller than the mule, which can reach the place with its hoof as far as the eye can see. I climbed it until I reached Jerusalem. There I tied the animal to the door handle used by the other prophets. After that, I entered the mosque, performed two rak'ahs in it and then came out. Then Gabriel came, peace be upon him, and brought me a vessel of wine and a vessel of milk. I chose the milk. Then Gabriel said: You have chosen the natural disposition. We then ascended together to the first heaven, where he asked that they (the gates of heaven) be opened for us. They asked: Who are you? He replied: Gabriel. People also asked: And who is with you? He replied: Muhammad. People further asked: Has it already been revealed to him? He replied: Yes, it was revealed to him. Then the door was opened for us. Then I saw Adam, who welcomed me and wished me blessings. We continued to climb to the second heaven. Gabriel, peace be upon him, asked for the gate to be opened for us. People asked: Who are you? He replied: Gabriel. People asked: And who is with you? He replied: Muhammad. People further asked: Has it already been revealed to him? He replied: Yes, it was revealed to him. The gate was then opened for us. Then I saw my two maternal cousins: Jesus, son of Mary, and John, son of Zechariah, may Allah bless both of them. They welcomed me and wished me blessings. We then ascended further into the third heaven, where Gabriel asked for (the gate) to be opened for us. People asked: Who are you? He replied: Gabriel. People asked: And who is with you? He replied: Muhammad, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. People further asked: Has it already been revealed to him? He replied: Yes, it was revealed to him. The gate was then opened for us. Then I saw Joseph, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who was granted half of the beauty. He welcomed me and wished me blessings. We then ascended to the fourth heaven, where Gabriel (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) asked that the gate be opened for us. People asked: Who are you? He replied: Gabriel. People asked: And who is with you? He replied: Muhammad. They further asked: And has it already been revealed to him? He replied: Yes, it was revealed to him. Then the gate was opened for us and I saw Idris. He welcomed me and wished me blessings. Allah, Exalted and Mighty, said (about him): And We have exalted him to a high place.[Quran 19:57] We then ascended further into the fifth heaven, where Gabriel asked that the gate be opened for us. People asked: Who are you? He replied: Gabriel. People asked: And who is with you? He replied: Muhammad. They further asked: And was it revealed to him? He replied: Yes, it was revealed to him. Then the gate was opened for us and I saw Harun (Aaron). He welcomed me and wished me blessings. We then ascended further into the sixth heaven, where Gabriel asked that the gate be opened for us. People asked: Who are you? He replied: Gabriel. They then asked: And who is with you? He replied: Muhammad. They further asked: And was it revealed to him? He replied: Yes, it was revealed to him. Then the gate was opened to us and I saw Moses, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. He welcomed me and wished me blessings. We then climbed further up to the seventh heaven, where Gabriel asked that the gate be opened for us. People asked: Who are you? He replied: Gabriel. They then asked: And who is with you? He replied: Muhammad, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. They further asked: And was it revealed to him? He replied: Yes, it was revealed to him. Then the gate was opened for us and I saw Abraham, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, leaning with his back against the much-visited, time-honored house (Al-Bait Al-Ma'mur). This house is entered every day by seventy thousand angels who never visit it again. He (Gabriel) then led me to the lotus tree at the far end, whose leaves looked like the elephant's ears and whose fruits looked like the clay pots. But when it (the tree) was enveloped by the command of Allah, it was changed so that no one among the creatures of Allah can describe it for its beauty. Allah then revealed to me and prescribed for me to perform fifty prayers every day and every night. I descended to Moses (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then he said: What has Allah prescribed for your community? I said: Fifty prayers. He said: Return to your Lord and ask him for relief. Your church will certainly not be able to do this, for I have already tested and tested the children of Israel. I then returned to my Lord and said: O my Lord! Make it easier for my community. So he reserved five prayers for me. I returned to Moses and said: Allah reserved five prayers for me. He (Moses) replied: Your church will not be able to do this. Return to your Lord and ask for relief! I did not stop walking between Allah, Blessed be He, and Moses until Allah said: There are five prayers every day and every night. Each prayer is equal to ten prayers and that makes fifty prayers. And whoever intends to perform a deed but does not carry it out will have it written down as a deed. But if he actually carries out the deed, it is written down for him as ten blessings. And whoever, on the other hand, intends to commit a bad deed; but if he does not commit it, nothing will be written down for him. But if he commits it, it will be recorded for him as just one bad deed. I then descended until I was with Moses (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and told him (what happened). He said: Return to your Lord and ask him for relief. I said: I returned to my Lord several times until I was ashamed before Him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 234]

Malik Ibn Sa'sa'a, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: I was half awake near the Ka'bah when I suddenly heard someone say: He is that one third among the two men. He then came to me and took me with him. Then he brought out a golden bowl filled with water from the well of Zamzam. He opened my heart to so and so. Qatada (a later narrator) said: I asked the one who was with me (i.e. the narrator) what the Prophet meant by (up to so and so). He replied: He meant that his heart was opened to the lower part of his stomach. The Prophet further said: My heart was taken out, washed with the water of the well of Zamzam and then put back, filling it with faith and wisdom. A white animal named Buraaq was brought here. This animal was larger than the donkey and smaller than the mule. His step was too big, as far as his eyes could see. I climbed onto it, then we walked until we got to the first sky. Then Gabriel commanded the gatekeeper of the gate of heaven: Open! He asked: Who is there? Gabriel replied: It is I, Gabriel. They then asked: Who is with you? He replied: Muhammad, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. People further asked: Was he sent to him? He replied: Yes! The gatekeeper opened the gate for us and said: Welcome, O sincere newcomer! We came to Adam, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. The narrator now continues the hadith himself: The prophet then met Jesus and John in the second heaven, may Allah bless and grant both of them. In the third he met Joseph; in the fourth Idris and in the fifth Aaron (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon them). The Prophet then said: We then walked until we reached the sixth heaven. There I met Moses and greeted him. He said: Welcome, O pious fellow believer and sincere prophet. As we passed him he was crying. Then he was asked: What makes you cry? He replied: O Allah, this is a young man whom You have sent as a prophet after me. Nevertheless, his followers will enter paradise in greater numbers than mine. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) continued: Then we continued until we reached the seventh heaven and I went to Abraham. Then I saw four rivers, from whose sources flowed two visible and two invisible rivers. I said: O Gabriel! What are these rivers? He replied: The two invisible are two rivers in Paradise and the two visible are the Nile and the Euphrates. Afterwards, Al-Bait Al-Ma`mur (the much-visited, time-honored house) was raised in front of me. Then I asked: O Gabriel, what is that? He replied: This is Al-Bait Al-Ma'mur (the much-visited ancient house) into which seventy thousand angels enter every day, and when they go out from this house they never visit it again. I was then offered two drinking bowls. One contained wine and the other milk. I reached for the milk. Then I was told: You have chosen the right path! May Allah also show your followers the right path of the natural kind! Then I was prescribed fifty prayers daily.... (The Prophet then continued with the hadith).   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 238]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) narrated his night journey and said: Moses was a man of tall stature and brown skin, as if he belonged to the men of Shanua . He also said: Jesus was a man of stocky body, neither very tall nor very short in stature. He also mentioned Malik, the guardian of hell and Ad-Dajal (the false messiah).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 239]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked when he was passing by the Valley of Al-Azraq: Which valley is this? The people replied: This is the Valley of Al-Azraq. He (the Prophet) said: I feel as if I saw Moses (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) coming down from the hill and uttering in a high voice the formula of Talbiya to Allah. He (the Prophet) then came to the mountain of Harsha. Then he asked: Which hill is this? They replied: This is the hill of Harsha. He said: I feel as if I saw Jonah, the son of Matthew, riding on a red, squat camelin, while he was wearing a long woolen robe. The halter of his camelin was made of palm fiber and he uttered the formula of Talbiya to Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 241]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: While I was traveling at night, I met Moses (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) described him: I saw a man of erect stature, with hair neither wavy nor straight, as if he were one of the men of Shanu'ah. He (the Prophet) further said: I also met Jesus. And he (the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) described him: I saw a man of medium height with a red face, as if he had just taken a bath. He further said: I also saw Abraham (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him); and among his sons I am the one who most closely resembles him. Two vessels were then brought to me. In one there was milk and in the other there was wine. I was told: Take what you want! I took the milk and drank it. Then he (Gabriel) said: You have been guided to the natural disposition. If you had taken the wine, your Ummah (community) would have gone astray!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 245]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: One night I saw in a dream that I was near the Ka'bah. There I saw a dark brown man who is considered the most beautiful among the dark brown men seen. He had a tuft of hair that was considered the most beautiful among the tufts of hair seen. It was combed by him and water dripped from it. He leaned on two men - or on the shoulders of two men - and made the circuit around the house. I asked: Who is that? They replied: This is Christ, son of Mary. Then I saw a one-eyed man with a stocky build and curly hair. His blind eye, namely the right one, looked like a protruding grape. I asked: Who is that? They replied: This is Al-Masieh ad-Dajal (the false Messiah).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 246]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) narrated: When I was in (Hijr) (a place in the Kaaba), the people of Quraysh asked me about my night journey. So I was asked about the characteristics and characteristics of Jerusalem, which I could not remember. So I felt more sad than ever before. He (the Prophet) further said: Then Allah caused the city of (Jerusalem) to appear before my eyes so that I could answer any question they asked me. I also saw myself among a group of prophets. I saw Moses standing in prayer; he was a man of strong build, as if he belonged to the men of Shanua. Jesus, the son of Mary (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), was also in prayer. 'Urwa Ibn Mas'du Ath-Thaqafiy is the one who most closely resembles him. I also saw Abraham (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) standing in prayer. The one who most closely resembles him is your friend. He was referring to himself. When it was time for prayer, I prayed to them. When the prayer was over, someone said to me: Muhammad, this is Malik, the guardian of hell, greet him. So I turned to him; but he quickly began the greeting.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 251]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: Masruq reported: While I was sitting leaning on 'A'ishah, she said: - O the father of 'A'isha, there are three things; Whoever claims only one of these has concocted a tremendous lie against Allah. I said: - What are they? She said: - The one who claims that Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw his Lord has concocted a tremendous lie against Allah. Then I sat upright and said: - O Mother of the Believers, give me time and don't rush me! Did not Allah, Exalted and Mighty, say:[Quran 81:23] and And he saw him descending on another. [Quran 53:13] She replied: - I was the first among this community to ask the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about it. And then he answered: That was only Gabriel, whom I never saw in his true appearance in which he was created, except these two times. I saw him descending from heaven, occupying the space between heaven and earth with his monstrously large figure. She then continued: - Have you not heard the words of Allah: Looks do not catch up with Him, and He catches up with looks, and He is the subtle, the knowledgeable. [Quran 6:103] And have you not heard that Allah says: Nor is it upon any human being that Allah speaks to him except by revelation or from behind a partition, or He sends a Messenger and he reveals with him his permission to do what he wants; He is high, wise. [Quran 42:51] She further said: - And he who claims that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) has hidden something from the Book of Allah, he has concocted a tremendous lie against Allah; for Allah says: You, Messenger, make known what has been revealed to you from your Lord, and if you do not do it, you have not made known His Message. [Quran 5:67] She also said: - And the one who claims that the Prophet has knowledge of the future has also concocted a tremendous lie against Allah. Allah says: Say: None who are in the heavens and the earth know the unseen except Allah. {[Quran 27:65]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 259]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Once the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood in our midst and spoke about five things: Allah, may He be exalted and mighty, does not sleep and is exalted above sleep. He lowers the scales and raises them again. The deeds of the night are lifted up to Him before those of the day, and the deeds of the day are lifted up to Him before those of the night. Creatures cannot see Him because of His light. According to the narration of Abu Bakr it is called (of fire). If he were to take away brightness, the radiance of his countenance would burn all his creatures.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 263]

104. Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There are two paradises in which everything - including the vessels - is made of silver. There are also two other paradises where everything - including the vessels - is made of gold. The only thing that will prevent people from seeing their God in the paradise of Eden is the veil of glory that He has before Him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 265]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Some people said to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): O Messenger of Allah, will we see our Lord on the Day of Resurrection? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: Do you have any doubts about being able to see the moon on a full moon night? They said: No, O Messenger of Allah! He further said: Do you doubt that you can see the sun on a cloudless day? They said: No! He said: In the same way you will be able to see Him (on the Day of Resurrection)! On that day Allah will gather the people and tell them: Join the one to whom you have paid divine worship! So those who worshiped the sun will join him; and those who worshiped the moon joined it; and those who served the idols join them. Ultimately, what remains is this church and the hypocrites beneath it. Allah, Blessed and Exalted be He, then turns to them, but in a form different from that which they know, and says: I am your Lord! They reply: We take refuge from you in Allah and we will stay here until our Lord comes to us! Then we will recognize him! Allah then comes to them in the form they know and says: I am your Lord! They then say: Yes, you are our Lord! and they follow him. The bridge is then laid over both pits of hell. My followers and I will be the first to cross this bridge. On this day only the prophets can speak. They shout: O Allah, save us! Deliver us! In Hell there are sharp hooks that resemble the spines of the Sa'dan (a desert bush)! Have you ever looked at Sa'dan? The listeners replied: Yes! The Messenger of Allah continued: Indeed, the hooks in Hell are comparable to the thorns of Sa'dan! However - all Allah knows their dimensions! These sharp hooks pierce people according to their actions. The believer will escape these because of his good deeds. Others will be punished until they are released from hell by Allah. Finally, when Allah has completed the judgment of people and wants to save from Hell those people on whom Allah has mercy, He gives the order to the angels to take out of Hell those of them who have worshiped only Allah. These are those on whom Allah wants to have mercy, among those who say (There is no god but Allah). They (the angels) recognize the believers by the marks left on their bodies by prostration. The fire is allowed to consume the entire body, except for the traces of prostration, for Allah has forbidden the fire to consume these traces. These people then leave hell with burnt and blackened limbs. But then the water of life is poured upon them, and they grow and flourish like the seed that grows with the flood-carried mud. When Allah finally finishes accounting, all that will be left is a man facing the Hellfire. This is the last one from hell to enter paradise. He will say: O my Lord, turn away my face from the fire of hell! Its stench poisoned me and its flames burned me! He will then call on Allah as long as Allah wants him to call on him. Allah, Blessed and Exalted, will then say: If I grant you this wish, you will make another request! The man will reply: No, I will not make any further request. And he makes his firm promise to Allah, he takes the oath as Allah wills. Then Allah turns His face away from the Hellfire. Now when his face is turned towards Paradise and he can see it, he remains silent as long as Allah wills it. Finally he says: O Lord, let me go to the gate of Paradise! Allah replied: Did you not promise not to make any further requests? Woe to you, O child of man! How unfaithful you are! But he said: O my Lord! He asks Allah until He says to him: Will you not ask for anything more if this wish is granted to you? He replies: Yes, by your omnipotence! And he makes his firm promise to Allah, he takes the oath as Allah wills. Allah then gives him permission to go to the Gate of Paradise. When he stands in front of the gate of paradise, the gate opens for him. The man contemplates the splendor of paradise, the beauties and joys of life there. He remains silent as long as Allah wills him. Then he says: O Lord, please let me enter paradise! Allah, Blessed and Exalted, says: Woe to you, O son of man! How faithless you are! Have you not made a firm promise, have you not sworn not to make any further requests? The man replies: O my Lord, do not let me be the most miserable of your creatures! He persists in his request until Allah laughs and allows him to enter Paradise. When he enters Paradise, Allah says: Now wish for what you want! The man expresses his desires and Allah points out other pleasures to him. If the man now has no desires, Allah says to him: All this is for you, and so much more! as Allah wills. Then Allah turns His face away from the Hellfire. Now when his face is turned towards Paradise and he can see it, he remains silent as long as Allah wills it. Finally he says: O Lord, let me go to the gate of Paradise! Allah replied: Did you not promise not to make any further requests? Woe to you, O child of man! How unfaithful you are! But he said: O my Lord! He asks Allah until He says to him: Will you not ask for anything more if this wish is granted to you? He replies: Yes, by your omnipotence! And he makes his firm promise to Allah, he takes the oath as Allah wills. Allah then gives him permission to go to the Gate of Paradise. When he stands in front of the gate of paradise, the gate opens for him. The man contemplates the splendor of paradise, the beauties and joys of life there. He remains silent as long as Allah wills him. Then he says: O Lord, please let me enter paradise! Allah, Blessed and Exalted, says: Woe to you, O son of man! How faithless you are! Have you not made a firm promise, have you not sworn not to make any further requests? The man replies: O my Lord, do not let me be the most miserable of your creatures! He persists in his request until Allah laughs and allows him to enter Paradise. When he enters Paradise, Allah says: Now wish for what you want! The man expresses his desires and Allah points out other pleasures to him. If the man now has no desires, Allah says to him: All this is for you, and so much more! as Allah wills. Then Allah turns His face away from the Hellfire. Now when his face is turned towards Paradise and he can see it, he remains silent as long as Allah wills it. Finally he says: O Lord, let me go to the gate of Paradise! Allah replied: Did you not promise not to make any further requests? Woe to you, O child of man! How unfaithful you are! But he said: O my Lord! He asks Allah until He says to him: Will you not ask for anything more if this wish is granted to you? He replies: Yes, by your omnipotence! And he makes his firm promise to Allah, he takes the oath as Allah wills. Allah then gives him permission to go to the Gate of Paradise. When he stands in front of the gate of paradise, the gate opens for him. The man contemplates the splendor of paradise, the beauties and joys of life there. He remains silent as long as Allah wills him. Then he says: O Lord, please let me enter paradise! Allah, Blessed and Exalted, says: Woe to you, O son of man! How faithless you are! Have you not made a firm promise, have you not sworn not to make any further requests? The man replies: O my Lord, do not let me be the most miserable of your creatures! He persists in his request until Allah laughs and allows him to enter Paradise. When he enters Paradise, Allah says: Now wish for what you want! The man expresses his desires and Allah points out other pleasures to him. If the man now has no desires, Allah says to him: All this is for you, and so much more! whatever you want! The man expresses his desires and Allah points out other pleasures to him. If the man now has no desires, Allah says to him: All this is for you, and so much more! whatever you want! The man expresses his desires and Allah points out other pleasures to him. If the man now has no desires, Allah says to him: All this is for you, and so much more!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 267]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Some people asked at the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): O Messenger of Allah, will we see our Lord on the Day of Resurrection? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Yes! Do you doubt that you can see the bright sun in a cloudless midday? And do you have any doubts that you can see the bright moon on a cloudless full moon night? The people replied: No, O Messenger of Allah! He further said: So you should not doubt that you will see Allah, Blessed and Exalted be He, on the Day of Resurrection, just as you should not doubt that you will be able to see the sun or the moon. When the day of resurrection arrives, a caller gives the command that each community should join the one to whom they have paid divine worship. Then there will be none of those who worshiped anything other than Allah among the idols and the images who will not fall one after the other into Hellfire. After that, only those who had worshiped Allah will remain; be these benefactors, evildoers, or later among the People of the Book! The Jews are then called out and asked: Whom did you worship? They will say: We worshiped 'Uzair (Ezra), the son of Allah! The answer will be: You are lying! Allah has never taken a consort or a son to Himself. What do you want? The Jews will say: We are thirsty, O our Lord, give us something to drink. You will then be shown a specific direction. If they go there, they will be driven into hellfire, which is like a mirage, with one part of it shattering the other. They will then fall into the fire one after the other. Then the Christians are called out and asked: Whom did you worship? They will say: We worshiped Christ the Son of Allah! The answer will be: You are lying! Allah has never taken a consort or a son to Himself. What do you want? The Christians will say: We are thirsty, O our Lord, give us something to drink! You will then be shown a specific direction. If they go there, they will be driven into hellfire, which is like a mirage, with one part of it shattering the other. They will then fall into the fire one after the other. After that, only those who had worshiped Allah, be they benevolent or evildoers, will remain. The Lord of the worlds then turns to them in an unrecognizable form, a form different from the one they had previously perceived. It is then said to them: What do you expect? Every church should follow what they used to worship! They will say: We distance ourselves from people in earthly life despite our urgent need for their help and friendship. Allah will then say to them: I am your Lord. Then they will say: We take refuge from you in Allah. We never put anything aside from Allah. And they will repeat this statement two or three times until some of them were almost about to make a U-turn. Allah will then say: Is there a sign between you and Him by which you can recognize Him? They will reply: Yes! The calf is exposed. There remains now none of those who voluntarily prostrated themselves before Allah without Allah allowing them to prostrate before Him. Those who prostrated themselves out of fear of people or to be looked at by them will be punished by Allah making their backs an unbending piece. Whenever they try to prostrate themselves, they fall backwards onto their backs. Then they will lift their heads and see Allah, who will appear to them in the form in which they first saw Him. He will say: I am your Lord. They will reply: Yes, You are our Lord. The bridge is then placed over hellfire and intercession is permitted. Then they will say: O Allah, save us! Save us! Then a man asked: O Messenger of Allah! What is this bridge? The Prophet replied: This is made of slippery mud, with hooks, pincers and spikes on it. Similar spikes can be found in Nagd called As-Sa`dan. The believers will pass like the blink of an eye, like the lightning, like the wind, like the birds, like the swift horses and like other riding animals. Some will be rescued and brought to safety, some will be scratched and released, and some will be thrown into hellfire. Finally, believers are saved by fire. By the One in Whose Hand is my life, there is none of you who supplicates Allah more fervently for the rights of his brothers who are in Hellfire than the believers on the Day of Resurrection. They will say: O our Lord! They fasted, prayed and performed the pilgrimage with us. It will then be said to them: Bring out (from Hellfire) those you know! So these people are kept out of hellfire; and they will bring out a great number of people partially consumed by fire, some to the middle of their legs, and some to their knees. The believers will then say: O our Lord! There is no one left of those whom your command concerns. Allah will say: Return and bring out those who have in their hearts the weight of a dinar of goodness! They will bring many people out of hell and say: O our Lord, we left no one left for Your commandment. Then Allah will say: Return and bring out those who have in their hearts the weight of a half-dinar of goodness. So they will bring out many people and say: O our Lord, we have not left any of those whom Your command concerns left. Allah will then say: Return and bring out those who have in their hearts the weight of an atom of goodness. So they bring out many people and say: O our Lord, we have left no one in there who has goodness in his heart. Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy said: If you do not believe me, then read this verse if you want  Allah does not do wrong in the weight of a speck of sunshine, and if it is a good deed, He multiplies it and gives a tremendous reward of His own accord. [Quran 4:40] (The Prophet continues:) Allah, Exalted and Mighty, will then say: The angels, the Prophets and the believers have interceded. Only the most merciful of the merciful has not done so. And so He takes a handful out of the fire and brings out a group of people who have never done any good and become ashes. Allah then throws them into a river in Paradise called the (River of Life). So they will grow like seeds in the mud brought by the flood. They can be seen near stones or trees. Those that grow in the sun are yellow, and those that grow in the shade are white. Then the people said: O Messenger of Allah, it looks as if you are a shepherd in the desert! (The Prophet continues:) They look like pearls when they come out and have seals on their necks. The inhabitants of Paradise will recognize them and say: These are the ones who have been saved by Allah. Allah will allow them to enter Paradise even though they have not sent anything good before them. Allah will then say: Enter Paradise! What you see in it is yours. They will say: O our Lord, You have given us what You have not given to anyone else in the world. Allah says: I have something better for you. They say: O our Lord, and what is it? He will answer: My good pleasure; and I will never be angry with you after that.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 269]

Mu`az (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:
 The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent me to call a certain people to Islam. He said to me: You will go to a people from among the People of the Book, so ask them to confess that there is no god but Allah and that I am the Messenger of Allah. If they follow this command, let them know that Allah has enjoined upon them the duty of offering five prayers a day and a night. If they follow this command, let them know that Allah has enjoined upon them the duty of paying alms (Sadaqa) from their wealth, which is taken from their rich and given back to their poor. If you follow this request, you will avoid taking away your valuable assets. And beware of the supplication of the oppressed, for there is no barrier between him and Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 27]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I already know who will be the last to leave Hell and enter Paradise. A man will come out of hell crawling. Then Allah, Blessed and Exalted, will say: - Go and enter Paradise! So he will come to Paradise, but it will seem to him that Paradise is full. He will return and say: - O my Lord! I found it crowded. Allah, Blessed and Exalted, will then tell him: - Go and enter Paradise! So he will come to Paradise, but it will seem to him that Paradise is full. He will return and say: - O my Lord! I found it crowded. Allah will tell him: Go and enter Paradise. In paradise you have as much as this world and ten times more - or you have as much as ten times as much as this world. He (the man) will say: - Are you laughing at me, or are you making fun of me while you are the king? He ('Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud) further reported: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) laughing until his canine teeth were visible. He further said: This man has the lowest rank among the inhabitants of Paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 272]

The Hadith of Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with them both: Abu-z-Zubair reported that Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah was asked (once) about the arrival (of the people on the Day of Resurrection). He replied: On the Day of Resurrection we (Muslims) will gather on a hill higher than the others. The people will then be called by the names of their idols and what they had worshiped, in order, the first, the second, etc. Afterwards our Lord will come to us and say: Who are you waiting for? They will answer: We wait for our Lord. So he will say: I am your Lord. They will say: (We are not sure) until we can look at you. He will then appear to them smiling and then set off, with them following Him. Each of them, believer or hypocrite, will be given light as they all continue to follow Him. And on the bridge of hell there will be hooks and spikes that some will grab at the will of Allah. The light of the hypocrites will then be extinguished and the believers will be saved. The first group to be saved will consist of seventy thousand believers who will not be reckoned with and whose faces will shine like the full moon.
