The people of the next group have faces that shine like the stars in the sky, etc. Then intercession will be permitted, and they (the believers) will intercede for their brothers, so that those who (No god is there but Allah by conviction ) said and had in their hearts the weight of a barleycorn of good, will be delivered from hell. They will then be taken to the courtyard of paradise. The inhabitants of Paradise will sprinkle water on them until they sprout, just as the flowers unfold after the flood. This will happen until the traces of fire on their bodies disappear. They will then ask Allah for mercy until He gives them as much as this world and ten times more.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 278]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) died and Abu Bakr became his successor, it happened that some of the Arabs apostatized. Then 'Umar said to Abu Bakr: How can you fight against people when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I have been commanded to fight against people until they say the words: la ilaha illal-lah (There is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah). So whoever says (la ilaha illal-lah) protects his wealth and himself from me, unless there is a violation of the law, and his accountability is left to Allah! Then Abu Bakr said: By Allah, I will fight anyone who makes a distinction between prayer and zakah; for Zakah is the right of the (poor) to goods. By Allah, if they refuse to hand over an ankle bracelet that they gave to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), I will fight them for this refusal.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 29]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: For each Prophet there is a specific accepted supplication. But I want to reserve my supplication until I say it as intercession for my Ummah (community) on the Day of Resurrection.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 293]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Every Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) made a supplication (to Allah) for his Umma (community) (which was fulfilled by Allah). But I have reserved my supplication as intercession for my Ummah on the Day of Resurrection.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 299]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I have been given an order to fight against the people until they say: la ilaha illal-lah (There is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah). Whoever then says this saves his property and his life from me, unless he violates the law; and his account is (ultimately) left to Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 30]

Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When the verse of the Qur'an, " Warn your close relatives" [Quran 26:214], was revealed, the Messenger of Allah summoned Quraysh; and so they gathered together. He gave general and special warning and said: O you sons of Ka'b Ibn Lu'aiy, save your souls from the Fire! O you sons of Murra Ibn Ka'b, save your souls from the Fire! O you sons of 'Abd Shams, save your souls from the Fire! O you sons of 'Abd Manaaf, save your souls from the Fire! O ye sons of Hashim, save your souls from the Fire! O you sons of 'Abdel Mottalib, save your souls from the Fire! O Fatima, save your soul from the fire! Because I cannot save you from Allah. But I will always preserve and maintain my family relationship with you.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 303]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: When the Qur'anic verse " Warn your close relatives " [Qur'an 26:214] and the select clan among them was revealed, the Messenger of Allah went out and climbed the mountain of As-Safa and shouted loudly: Be on your guard! They said, Who was this who called out? They answered: Muhammad. So they gathered to him. Then he said: O you children of so-and-so. Oh, you children of so-and-so. Oh, you children of so-and-so. O children of 'Abd Manaf. O children of 'Abdel Mottalib. So they gathered to him. Then he said, What do you think if I tell you that horses at the foot of this mountain would attack you? They replied: We have never seen you lie. He said: So I warn you of a severe punishment. He (Ibn 'Abbas) further reported: Then Abu Lahab said: You shall perish! Is that why you gathered us together? He then went away and the surah of: (Perish shall the hands of Abu Lahab!) was sent down; and he himself really perished.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 307]

Al-'Abbas Ibn 'Abdel Mottalib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I said: O Messenger of Allah, could you do something useful for Abu Talib, uncle of the Prophet, who died an infidel? For he surrounded you with his protection and reacted angrily with others because of you! The Prophet replied: Yes! He is in a flat place in hellfire. If it weren't for me, he would be in the deepest depths of hellfire.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 308]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: His uncle Abu Talib was mentioned by the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. Then the Messenger of Allah said: Perhaps my intercession will benefit him on the Day of Resurrection, so that he will be taken to a flat place in the Hellfire, where the fire will reach his ankles, from which his head will boil.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 310]

An-Nu'maan Ibn Basheer (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Among those who will be punished with the least punishment on the Day of Resurrection is the one whose Two embers of fire are placed on the soles of his feet, from which his head boils.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 313]

'Amr Ibnal 'As (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying openly: The people of my father's clan (he meant a certain person from among his relatives or the unrighteous relatives of him) are not my protective friends. My protective friends are only Allah and the righteous believers.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 316]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Seventy thousand of my community will enter Paradise without accounting. Then a man (named 'Ukasha) said: O Messenger of Allah! Ask Allah that I be one of them! He (the Prophet) said: O Allah, let him be one of them! Another man then stood up and said: O Messenger of Allah, ask Allah that I also be among them! He (the Prophet) said: 'Ukasha has forestalled you!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 317]

The Hadith of Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Hazim reported on the authority of Sahl Ibn Sa'd: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Among my congregation, seventy thousand - or seven hundred thousand - will enter Paradise enter. (Abu Hazim was unsure of the exact number). They hold on to each other and support each other. The first among them will not enter until the last has entered. Their faces shine like the moon on a full moon night.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 322]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The nations were brought before me. I saw a prophet with a group of less than ten people, then another who was accompanied by only one or two people, and then finally a prophet who was alone. A large crowd was then brought before me. I thought they were my community. But it was said to me: This is Moses, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, and his company. But look towards the horizon! I looked over there and saw another large crowd. People said to me: Look to the other horizon! There was another large crowd there. Then they said to me, These are your community, and among them are seventy thousand who will enter Paradise without being held accountable or punished. Then the Prophet got up and went to his house. The people then discussed among themselves those people who will enter Paradise without being held accountable or punished. Some of them said: Perhaps these are the companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Others said: Perhaps these are those who were born in Islam and have not placed anything at Allah's side. They made further guesses. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out and said: What are you discussing? They told him, and he said: These are those who neither make Ruqya nor are superstitious and who rely entirely on their Lord. Then 'Ukasha Ibn Muhsin stood up and said: Ask Allah that I may be one of them! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You are already one of them. Then another man stood up and said: Ask Allah that I also be one of them! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: 'Ukasha has forestalled you.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 323]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to us: Will you be satisfied if you make up a quarter of the inhabitants of Paradise? We said: Allah is the greatest. He further said: Will you be satisfied if you make up a third of the inhabitants of Paradise? We said: Allah is the greatest. He continued: But I hope that you make up half of the inhabitants of paradise! And I let you know why. In relation to the idolaters, the Muslims are nothing other than a white hair in the skin of a black bull - or like a black hair in the skin of a white bull.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 324]

Abu Sa'id (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah Almighty and Exalted will say: - O Adam! He will reply: - Here I am, I am at your disposal, you have the good things in your hands! Allah will then say: - Bring out the inmates of Hell! He will say: - Who are the inmates of hell? Allah will say: Out of every one thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine will enter the Fire. The Prophet further said: At that time the boy will be gray, and every pregnant woman will give birth to what she carries, and you see people intoxicated, and they are not intoxicated, but the punishment of Allah is severe. [Quran 22:2] The Companions became distressed because of this. They said: O Messenger of Allah, which of us is this man? He replied: Rejoice! There will be one thousand of Gog (Ya'gug) and Magog (Ma'gug), and one man from you. Then he continued: I swear by Him in Whose Hand is my life, that I very much hope that you make up a quarter of the inhabitants of Paradise. Then we praised Allah and said: Allahu Akbar (Allah is the Great). Then the Prophet further said: I swear by Him in Whose Hand is my life, that I very much hope that you will make up a third of the inhabitants of Paradise. Then we praised Allah and said: Allahu Akbar. He further said: I swear by the One in Whose Hand is my life that I very much hope that you make up half of the inhabitants of Paradise. In relation to the (other) nations you are no different than a white hair in the skin of a black bull, - or as a mark in the foreleg of a donkey.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 327]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I have been commanded to fight the people until they testify that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah and until they perform the prayer and pay Zakah. If they do this, they save their lives and goods from me, unless they violate the law; and their accountability is (ultimately) with Allah. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 33]

Al-Musayyab Ibn Hazn (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When Abu Talib was dying, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to him. He found Abu Jahl and 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Umayya Ibnal Mughira with him. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O my uncle, say: la ilaha illa-llah (There is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah) so that I may justify you with Allah. Then Abu Jahl and 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Umayya said: O Abu Talib, do you want to turn away from the faith of 'Abdul Mottalib (grandfather of the Prophet sallallaahu 'alayhi wa sallam)? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not stop asking him to declare his faith and repeating it to him. But the last thing Abu Talib said was that he remained with the faith of 'Abdul Mottalib. And he refused to utter the creed. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: By Allah, I will beg for your forgiveness as long as I have not been forbidden (by Allah) because of you. Thereupon Allah, Exalted and Mighty, revealed the following verse: It is not for the Prophet and those who believe to ask forgiveness for their fellow worshipers, even if they are relatives, after it has been made clear to them that they Companions of the Firebrand are. [Quran 9:113] And the following verse was also revealed about Abu Talib: You do not guide whomever you please, but Allah guides whomever He pleases, and He knows best those who are guided. But Allah guides the way to whomever He wills, and He knows best those who accept leadership. [Quran 28:56]    [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ No. 35]

'Ubada Ibn-as-Samit (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever says: I bear witness that there is no god but Allah who has no partner, and that Muhammad His Servant and Messenger, and that 'Isa (Jesus) is the Servant of Allah, the Son of His Servant, and His Word, which He gave to Maryam (Mary) from His Spirit, and (testifies) that Paradise is true and the Hellfire is true, Allah will let him enter Paradise through any of the eight gates as he pleases   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ-No. 41]

Mu'az Ibn Jabal (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I was once sitting behind the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) on a mount, and there was nothing between him and me except a part of the camel's saddle. Then the Prophet said: O Mu`az Ibn Jabal! I replied: There I am, O Messenger of Allah, I am at your disposal! The Prophet rode on for a while, then said: O Mu`az Ibn Jabal! I replied: There I am, O Messenger of Allah, I am at your disposal! The Prophet rode on for a while and then said: O Mu`az Ibn Jabal! I replied: There I am, O Messenger of Allah, I am at your disposal! The Prophet said: Do you know what right Allah has over people? I replied: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: Allah's right towards people is that they should serve him and associate nothing with him as partakers of his divinity. He then continued riding for a while and then he said: O Mu`az Ibn Jabal! I replied: There I am, O Messenger of Allah, I am at your disposal! He said: Do you know what right people have against Allah if they do this? I replied: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: That he will not punish them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 43]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Once Mu'az Ibn Jabal was sitting behind the Prophet of Allah on a mount. The Prophet said: O Mu`az! He replied: Here I am, O Messenger of Allah, I am at your disposal! The Prophet said: O Mu`az! He replied: Here I am, O Messenger of Allah, I am at your disposal! The Prophet said: O Mu`az! He replied: Here I am, O Messenger of Allah, I am at your disposal! The Prophet said: There is no servant who bears witness that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah without Allah barring him from Hellfire. Mu'az said: O Messenger of Allah, shall I make this known to the people so that they may rejoice? The Prophet replied: They would then rely on it indifferently!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 47]

The Hadith of 'Itbaan Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): Mahmud Ibn Ar-Rabie reported: I came to Madinah, met 'Itbaan and told him: I have heard a hadith reported by you. He said: My eyesight was damaged to some extent. Then I sent a messenger to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who said to him: 'Itbaan would like you to come to him and pray in his house so that he could use it as a place of worship. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then came with some of his companions and entered the house. He began to pray while his companions talked among themselves. It was about the hypocrites and their evil deeds. They write Malik Ibn Dukhshum. the hypocrisy too. They expressed their wish that the Prophet would invoke Allah against him so that he would perish or some misfortune befall him. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished the prayer, he said: Does he not bear witness that there is no god but Allah and that I am the Messenger of Allah? They replied: He says so, but not from his heart. Then the Prophet said: There is no one who testifies that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, and then he goes into the fire - or is consumed by the fire. (The Companions' belief that Malik is a hypocrite is due to some misdeeds he committed. The Companions believed that no Muslim could commit such deeds. However, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) knows this person very well and knows that he is truthful. He explained to them that despite some misdeeds, the Muslim remains a Muslim as long as he truly bears witness that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is his Messenger.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2,   Ḥadīṯ- No. 48]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Faith consists of more than seventy components, and haya' is one of the components of faith.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 50]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) heard (once) a man admonishing his brother to be modest (Haya). Then he said: Modesty is part of faith.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 52]
'Imran Ibn Husain (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Modesty brings only good.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 53]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): In what way can one live Islam well? He said: By giving food and saying salaam to everyone you know and do not know.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 56]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr Ibnal 'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: A man asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): Who is the best among the Muslims? He replied: The one from whose tongue and hand the Muslims are safe.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 57]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:
 I asked the Messenger of Allah: Who lives Islam best? He replied: The one from whose tongue and hand the Muslims are safe.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 59]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:
 The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Whoever has the following three qualities finds joy in faith when his love for Allah and His Messenger is stronger than his love for everything else, if his love for a person is dedicated only to Allah, and if he detests relapse into disbelief after Allah has saved him from it, just as he detests being thrown into the Fire.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 60]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:
 The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No servant - or human being, as it appeared in the Hadith of Abdel Warith - can be considered a believer until his love for me is stronger than his love for his family, for his property and for all people.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 62]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None of you should consider himself a believer until he grants to his brother or his neighbor the same as he grants to himself.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 64]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should either speak good or remain silent. And whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should be kind to his neighbor. And whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should show hospitality to his guest.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 67]

Abu Shurayh Al-Khuza'iy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should treat his neighbor kindly. And whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should show hospitality to his guest. And whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should either speak good or remain silent.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 69]

Abu Sa'id (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Tariq Ibn Shihab said: Marwan was the first Caliph to begin preaching on the day of the festival before offering prayers. (As he was doing this once), a man stood up and said to him: The prayer should be said before the sermon. Then Marwan said: This has already been omitted today. About this Abu Sa`id said: This man has fulfilled his task (as a believer). I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Whoever of you sees something abominable, let him change it with the action of his hand, and if he cannot, then with the words of his tongue, and if he cannot do that, then with the desire of his heart, and that is the least of faith.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 70]

Abu Mas'ud 'Uqba Ibn 'Amr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) pointed his hand towards Yemen and said: Verily faith is there. However, ruthlessness and hard-heartedness are found in the camel drivers who have high voices, where the horns of Satan stand out in Rabie'a and Mudar.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 72]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The people of Yemen have come. These are the most soft-hearted people. Faith is (most) found among Yemenis, Fiqh (Islamic jurisprudence) is found among Yemenis, and wisdom is (also) found among Yemenis.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 73]

Jarir Ibn 'Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I swore allegiance to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) for the establishment of prayer, the payment of Zakah and sincerity towards every Muslim.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 83]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If someone commits adultery, he is not a believer while he is guilty of this offense. And if anyone commits theft, he is not a believer while he steals. And if anyone drinks wine, he is not a believer while he is doing so.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 86]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Whoever possesses the following qualities is a pure hypocrite, and whoever possesses only one of them possesses it for so long a hypocritical quality until he gives it up: when he speaks he lies, when he makes contractual agreements he does not fulfill them, when he makes a promise he does not keep it and when he argues with someone he behaves impudently.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 88]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The signs of a hypocrite are three: when he speaks, he lies; when he promises something, he breaks his promise; and if you trust him with something, he behaves unfaithfully.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 89]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If one accuses his fellow believer of disbelief, it will certainly affect one of them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 91]

Abu Zarr, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:
 I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: There is no one who claims his affiliation with anyone other than his father - and he does so knowingly - who does not do so has given up faith (in Allah). And anyone who claims anything without justification is not one of us and will take his place in Hellfire. And whoever accuses another of disbelief or says to him: You are an enemy of Allah, when in reality he is not like that, he will bring this upon himself!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 93]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Do not disown your fathers; and whoever then absolves himself of his father has fallen into unbelief.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 94]

Sa'd Ibn Abi Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saying: "He who admits his affiliation with someone other than his own father in Islam while knowing that that he is not his father, paradise is denied.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 95]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Insulting a Muslim is a crime and fighting against him is disbelief (kufr).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 97]

Jarir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:
 The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me during the farewell pilgrimage: Let the people listen carefully (to my following words). He then said: Do not return after me to unbelief, some of you cutting off the necks of others.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 2, Ḥadīṯ no. 98]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: The prayer of the one who has a Hadath (event that causes impurity and requires purification, such as the passage of urine, stool, intestinal gases). ) happened, is not accepted until he has performed ablution.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 330]

The Hadith of 'Uthman Ibn 'Affan, may Allah be pleased with him: Once he had water fetched for him for ablution. He washed his hands three times, then rinsed his mouth and nose. He then washed his face three times, followed by his right and then his left forearm; he washed her up to the elbow three times; He then stroked his head and then washed first his right foot and then his left foot up to the ankles three times. Then he said: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performing ablution in the same way I performed mine, and I heard him say: Whoever performs ablution in the manner in which I performed ablution, and If he then performs two rak'a without intentionally preoccupying himself with other thoughts, he will be forgiven for all his past sins.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 331]

The hadith of 'Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Anas reported that 'Uthman once performed ablution in Al-Maqa'id (a place near the mosque) and then said: Shall I show you how the Messenger did Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to perform ablution? Then he washed three times in each part of the ablution.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 337]

The Hadeeth of 'Abdullah Ibn Zaid Ibn 'Asim Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with him): It was said to him: Perform ablution before us as the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to perform it. Then he had a bowl of water fetched for him, poured some water over his hands and washed them three times. He then inserted his hand into the water bowl, then took it out and rinsed his mouth and nose with it. He did this three times. He then inserted his hand into the water bowl again, then took it out and washed his face three times. He put his hand into the water bowl again, then took it out and washed each forearm up to the elbow twice. He then put his hand into the water bowl, then took it out and stroked his head from front to back and back to front. Finally he washed his feet up to the ankles. He then said: In the same way, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to perform ablution.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 346]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If any of you cleanse himself with stones (after relieving himself), he should do so with an odd number of stones (or in an odd number of times). And when one of you performs ablution, he should put water in his nose and then blow it out.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 348]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When one wakes up from sleep, he should put water in his nose three times and then blow it out; for Satan spends the night on his nose.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 351]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: We returned from Makkah to Madinah with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). On the way we passed a water source. There were some people in a hurry at the time of the afternoon prayer, so they hurriedly performed ablution. When we reached her, her heels were dry, for they had not been touched by the water. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Woe to the heels when they burn in the Fire. Perform ablution thoroughly.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 354]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw a man who did not wash his heels (at ablution). Then he said, Woe to the heels when they burn in the fire!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 356]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: On the Day of Resurrection you will appear with a mark on your forehead and a hoop on your ankle, as marks of thorough ablution. Whoever of you can enlarge these traces should do so.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 362]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to the graves (of the Muslims) and said: Peace be upon you, abode of the people of faith! We will - if Allah wills - be with you. I wish we could see our brothers. Then the companions said: Are we not your brothers, Messenger of Allah? He replied: You are my companions. By brothers I mean those who have not yet come. They said: O Messenger of Allah, how can you recognize those of your congregation who have not yet come? Then he said: Suppose a man had horses with white patches on their foreheads and white legs among black horses. Can't he recognize his own horses? They replied: Yes, Messenger of Allah! Then he said: They (the brothers) will come with the bright shining spot on their foreheads, legs and arms, as marks of ablution. I will stand in front of them at the pool of water. Some, however, are removed from my water basin, just as the stray camel is chased away. I will call them and say to them: Come here! But I am told: They introduced innovations (in religion) after you. Then I will say: Away with them! Away with them!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 367]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Had it not been for my hardship on the believers - or in the Hadith of Zuhair: on my Ummah (community) - I would have made it compulsory for them to use the siwak before every prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 370]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I approached the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when the end of the siwak was on his tongue.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 373]

Huzaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to clean his mouth with a siwak when he got up for prayer at night.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 374]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Fitra (natural disposition) includes five things: circumcision, shaving of pubic hair, cutting of (fingers and feet) nails, plucking armpit hair and trimming moustache.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 377]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Cut the mustache short and let the beard grow freely.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 380]

Abu Ayyub Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: When defecating, be it feces or urine, do not face or back to the direction of prayer (Qibla). ), but to the east or west direction.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 388]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: Some people said: When you relieve yourself, do not turn your face towards the direction of Qibla or Jerusalem. 'Abdullah further narrated: I once went up to the roof of a house and saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sitting on two bricks, facing Jerusalem while he was relieving himself.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 390]

Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When one of you urinates, he should not hold his penis with his right hand, and wipe it after relieving himself also cannot be done with his rights. When drinking, he should not breathe into the drinking vessel.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 392]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) always liked to start with the right when he washed or combed his hair and when he put on his shoes.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 395]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) once entered a garden accompanied by a boy who was the youngest among us. The boy was carrying a bowl full of water in his hand. He placed the bowl next to a lotus tree and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to relieve himself. He then came out to us after he had already cleaned himself with the water.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 398]

The Hadeeth of Jarir Ibn 'Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with him): Hammam reported: It happened once that Jarir urinated and then performed ablution by rubbing his shoes. Then they said to him: How can you behave like this? He replied: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performing ablution after urinating, rubbing his shoes.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 401]

Huzaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I was with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he came to a tribe's dump. He urinated while standing and I turned to the side. Afterwards he said to me: Come closer! I approached until I was just behind him. He then performed ablution, rubbing his shoes with his wet hand.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 402]

Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once went out to relieve himself. Al-Mughira followed him with a small water hose. He poured water for the Prophet when he was performing ablution. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stroked his shoes.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 404]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If one of you wakes up from sleep, he should not put his hand in the bowl of water until he has washed it three times. Because no one knows where his hand spent the night.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 416]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If the dog drinks from a vessel that belongs to one of you, you should first pour out the vessel and wash it seven times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 418]

147. Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None of you should urinate in stagnant waters. Because later he can use it to wash himself.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 424]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: A desert Arab was urinating in the mosque. When some people wanted to grab him, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to them: Leave him and do not interrupt him. When the man finished urinating, he (the Prophet) ordered a bucket of water to be brought and then poured the water over the urine.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 427]

'A'ishah, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), reported: Little boys were brought to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). He prayed for blessings on their behalf and massaged their mouths with date porridge. He was once brought a little boy who urinated on his clothes. Then the prophet sent for water, which he immediately used to rinse that spot on the garment. But he didn't wash it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 430]

The Hadith of Umm Qais Bint Mihsan, may Allah be pleased with her: Once she brought her son to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who was then fed only with mother's milk. She then placed him on the Prophet's lap. But it happened that the child urinated (on the Prophet's garment). The Prophet did nothing more than rinse his garment with water.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 432]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: 'Alqama reported: Once a guest stayed with 'A'isha (named Hamam ibn al-Hareth, who learned the prophetic hadiths from her). And when he awoke in the morning, he washed his garments. Then 'A'ishah said to him: You should only wash them (the semen stains from the garment) when you see them. But if you don't see it (the sperm), then you can only rinse the area around it with water. When I saw the (semen stains) on the robe of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), I would just rub them, and he would then pray with the same robe.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 434]

Asma', may Allah be pleased with her, reported: A woman came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: If one of us finds traces of her monthly period in her dress, what should she do? He replied: She should rub the fabric together, wash it thoroughly with water and then rinse it. Afterwards she can pray with this dress.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 438]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) passed by two graves and said: The inhabitants of these graves are being tormented, and it is not for serious sins. One of the two went around spreading slander about the others, and the other was not careful about his own urine. The Prophet then called for a fresh palm branch, broke it into two pieces and planted a piece on each grave. Then he said: Let these ease their torment while they are not yet dried.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 3, Ḥadīṯ no. 439]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: When one of us had her monthly menstruation, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) ordered her to wear the loincloth. Then he caressed her.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 440]

Maimuna (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to caress his menstruating wives, avoiding the actual menstrual area.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 442]

Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: Once I was lying under a blanket with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Meanwhile I got my monthly period. Then moved away from him, stood up and put on the dress that I always wore during my menstruation. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked me: Have you had your period? I said yes! He then called me back under the covers. She continued her report: I used to perform the ritual complete ablution after sexual intercourse together with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) using a single container of water.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 444]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) poked his head into me (into the apartment) while he was in the mosque next door, and I was able to comb his hair . When he retreated there, he only entered the apartment when necessary.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 445]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) would sometimes lean on my lap and recite the Quran while I was having my monthly period.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 454]

'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: "I was a man who often had fluid coming out of my prostate and I was ashamed to ask the Prophet about it because his daughter was my wife. So I requested Al-Miqdad Ibnal Aswad to ask him about it. He (the Prophet) said: He should first wash his limb and then perform ablution."   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 456]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) woke up once in the night, relieved himself, washed his face and hands and then fell asleep again.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 459]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to perform ablution when he wanted to lie down to sleep in the state of Janabah (state of great ritual impurity).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 460]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 'Umar said: O Messenger of Allah, may one of us lie down to sleep when he is in the state of Janabah? He (the Prophet) replied: Yes! When he has performed ablution.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 462]

The Hadith of Umm Sulaim (may Allah be pleased with her): She asked the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about the woman who sees in her dream what the man sees (i.e. who experiences her sexual climax in the dream and who liquid is found). Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When the woman sees this, she must perform complete ablution. Umm Sulaim said: I was ashamed of these words and then said: Is it possible (that the woman has fluid)? The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Yes! Then how come her child looks like her? The male's fluid is white and thick, while the female's is yellow and thin. Which of them predominates or precedes the other, after which the similarity comes.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 469]

Umm Salama, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Umm Sulaim came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah! Allah is not ashamed of the truth! Is a woman obliged to ablution completely when she experiences her sexual climax in a dream? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If she finds the liquid there! Umm Salama said: O Messenger of Allah, does a woman really have such fluidity when she experiences her sexual climax? The Prophet said: Yes! Don't be awkward. How come her child looks like her?   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 471]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to start by washing both his hands when he performed total ablution after sexual intercourse or ejaculation; then pouring water with his right hand onto his left, he washed his genital area and washed himself in the same way as for prayer; Then he put his fingers in the water and ran them through his hair, touching his scalp; When he saw that the water was getting all over his body, he would fetch water with both hands three times and pour it over his head each time. He then poured plenty of water over his entire body and then washed both his feet.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 474]

Maimuna (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: I brought water to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) so that he could wash himself from the state of Janabah (state of great ritual impurity). He washed both his palms two or three times. He then put his hand into the water, poured it on his genital area and washed it with his left hand. Afterwards he struck his hand on the ground two or three times, rubbing it violently (with the ground). He then performed ablution, fetched water with both hands three times and poured it over his head each time, then washed his entire body. Then he moved a little from his place and washed both his feet. I then brought him a cloth, but he didn't take it.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 476]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: Abu Salama Ibn 'Abdu-r-Rahman reported: Accompanied by the milk brother of 'A'ishah, I entered 'A'ishah. He asked her how the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to perform total ablution after sexual intercourse or ejaculation. 'A'isha had a vessel brought to him which contained about one Sa' (ancient measure, which is about 3 kg) of water. With this she washed herself and poured water over her head three times. There was a curtain between us and her. Salama further reported: The wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to cut their hair down to their earlobes.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 481]

The hadith of Maimuna, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him): Ibn 'Abbas reported: Maimuna told me that she used to perform the total ablution together with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), both of them doing one thing using a single water tank.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 486]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) washed himself with the water that remained in the water vessel of Maimuna.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 487]

The Hadith of Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with her): Zainab Bint Umm Salama reported: Umm Salama used to perform the total ablution after the state of Janabah (state of great ritual impurity) together with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). They used a single water container.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 488]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to use five maukuk (a unit of measurement equal to two handfuls) of water for total ablution and only one maukuk of water for prayer ablution.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 489]

Jubayer Ibn Mut`im (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The people argued about the ritual ablution in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Some of them said: We wash our heads so and so. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I will pour handfuls of water over my head three times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 493]

Jabir Ibn Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The delegation of Thaqief asked the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): We live in a cold country; How should we carry out the overall ritual ablution? He replied: I myself pour water on my head three times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 495]

The Hadeeth of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: 'Ubaid Ibn 'Umair reported: 'A'ishah heard that 'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr ordered women to untie their braided hair when performing total ablution. She said: How strange is this Ibn 'Amr. He orders the women to untie their braided hair when they perform the overall ablution. Why didn't he order them to shave their heads?! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and I used a single container of water when performing total ablution. All I did was pour water on my head three times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 498]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: A woman asked the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) how she should perform ghusl (ablution) according to the monthly rule. He then instructed her how to do the complete ablution and added that she should take a ball of wool, moisten it with musk and cleanse herself with it! The woman asked again: How should I do the cleaning? To this he replied: Purify yourself with it! Praised be allah! Then he covered himself. Sufyan Ibn 'Uyaina covered his face (demonstratively) with his hand. 'A'ishah further reported: I then drew her close to me and explained to her what the Prophet meant, namely that she rubbed it on the parts of her body that came into contact with the blood.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 499]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Fatima bint Abu Hubaish came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, I will not be free of blood, so should I stop praying? He replied: No, it is just a blood vein, not the menstrual rule. When the menstrual period is here, give up prayer, and when its usual period is over, wash away the blood from yourself and pray.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 501]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Umm Habiba bint Jahsh asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and she said: I am a woman who always has blood! Then he said: It is only a blood vein and not the menstrual rule. So do the total ablution and perform the prayer! So she used to perform total ablution before every prayer.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 502]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her): A woman once asked her: Should we make up for the prayers that were missed during menstruation? 'A'ishah said: Are you from Harura? If we were given the rule of the month during the lifetime of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he did not give us such a rule! (Harura' is a place not far from Kufa in modern-day Iraq. The Harijites, an important group at that time, had settled there around 660. They believed that prayers missed during menstruation should be made up for) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim,    Chapter 4, Hadīṯ no. 506]

Umm Hane', the daughter of Abu Talib (may Allah be pleased with her), reported: In the year of the conquest of Makkah, I once came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he was performing the complete ablution. Fatima, his daughter, was holding a large cloth behind which he was hidden.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 509]

Maimuna (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: I brought water to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and closed the curtain for him to perform complete ablution.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 511]

181. Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When the Children of Israel washed, they stripped naked and looked at each other. But Moses (Musa) used to wash himself alone. The people said: By Allah! What is stopping Moses from bathing with us? He definitely has a physical ailment! One day Moses went away to take a bath. He placed his garment on a stone. Then the stone suddenly ran with the dress. Moses ran after him and shouted: My garment, O stone! My dress, oh stone! So the children of Israel had the opportunity to see him naked. They said: By Allah, Moses has no physical ailment! Finally the stone stopped until Moses was seen. Then he took his dress and began to hit the stone. Abu Huraira further added: By Allah! The stone actually has six or seven notches from these hits!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 513]

Jabir Ibn Abdillah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon them) reported: When the Ka'bah was being rebuilt, the Prophet and 'Abbas brought stones for the Ka'bah. 'Abbas said to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him): It would be better if you lifted up your handkerchief and used stones on your shoulder as a support. He (the Prophet) did so, but he fell (fainted) on the ground and turned his gaze towards the sky. Then he stood up and said: My waistcloth, my waistcloth! and wore it correctly.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 514]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once passed by the house of a man from the Ansar and sent someone to call him . The man came out with water dripping from his head. Then the Prophet said: Have we made you haste? He (the man) replied: Yes, Messenger of Allah! He (the Prophet) then said: If you are in a hurry or if you have not yet ejected semen, then you do not need to do the total ablution, but only the prayer ablution.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 521]

184. Ubayy Ibn Ka'b, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I asked the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, about the ablution of the man who was with his wife but did not ejaculate. He replied: He should wash those parts of the body that have come into contact with the moisture of the female genitals and then perform ablution. Then he can perform the prayer.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 522]

The Hadeeth of 'Uthman Ibn 'Affan, may Allah be pleased with him: Khalid Ibn Zaid Al-Juhaniy, reported: I asked 'Uthman Ibn 'Affan: How should a man perform ablution when he has been with his wife but has not ejaculated ? 'Uthman replied: He should perform minor ablution as before prayer and also wash his penis. I heard this from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 524]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When a man has sexual intercourse with his wife, total ablution becomes necessary. (The decisive factor is the introduction of the male member into the vagina)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ-No. 525]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once ate the shoulder meat of a sheep. Afterwards he performed the prayer without ablution again.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 531]

The Hadith of 'Amr Ibn Umayya (may Allah be pleased with him): He once saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cutting off (sheep's flesh) from the shoulder with a knife. He then performed the prayer without performing ablution beforehand.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 533]

The Hadith of Maimuna, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her): The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) ate the shoulder meat (of a sheep) from her. Afterwards he performed the prayer without performing ablution.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 535]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: After the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) drank milk, he went to fetch water. He then rinsed his mouth and said: She is fatty!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 537]

'Abdullah Ibn Zaid Ibn 'Asim Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: It was complained to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) that during prayer one person felt as if he was losing his ritual purity ( through Hadath). He (the Prophet) said: Whoever experiences such a thing should not leave prayer until he hears a noise or feels a departure from the wind.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 540]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) passed by a dead sheep that had been donated to Maimuna's servant. Then he said, “Will you not use the sheepskin and tan it?” The people said: It's a dead sheep! Then he replied: What is forbidden is only to be eaten from it!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 542]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: We were with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) on one of his journeys. When we reached Al-Baida' or Zatel Jaish, my necklace was broken (and it fell somewhere). So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the others began to search for them, even though there was no water in that place and they had no water with them. Some went to Abu Bakr and said to him: Have you seen what 'A'ishah has done? She stopped the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the others in a place where there is no water and they do not have any water with them. Then Abu Bakr came to me while the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) laid his head on my thigh, sleeping. He said to me: You have stopped the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the others in a place where there is no water and they have no water with them. Abu Bakr rebuked me and said what Allah wanted him to say. He pushed my hip with his hand. But what prevented me from moving was the place of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) on my thigh. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) slept until morning. And there was still no water. Because of this incident, the Qur'anic verse about Tayammum (ritual purification with earth) was revealed and people began to perform Tayammum. Usaid Ibnal Hudair, one of the leaders of the Medina aid workers, said: This is just one of your deeds, you family of Abu Bakr. Afterwards we left the camel I was riding on and we found the necklace under it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 550]

The Hadith of 'Ammar (may Allah be pleased with him): Shaqiq reported: When I was sitting with 'Abdullah and Abu Musa Al-Ash'ariy, Abu Musa said to him ('Abdullah): O Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman! If a man is in the state of Janabah (state of great ritual impurity) and cannot find water for a month, what should he do to perform the prayer? 'Abdullah said: He cannot perform Tayammum even if he does not find water for a month. Then Abu Musa said: What is meant by the following verse of the Qur'an in Sura Al-Ma'ida (The Table): and you find no water, go to good ground and wipe it over your faces and your hands? [Quran 5:6] 'Abdullah said: If they were permitted to do so in this verse of the Quran, they would cover themselves with good soil even if the water was a little cold for them. Then Abu Musa said to 'Abdullah: Did you not hear 'Ammar when he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent me to do something. Meanwhile I was attacked by the great ritual impurity and I found no water. Then I rolled over on the ground just like animals do. Then I came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and told him about it. Then he said: It would have been enough for you if you had only done that. And he struck (demonstratively) once on the ground with both his hands, then he stroked his left hand on his right, then on the surface of his hands, and finally on his face.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 552]

Abu-l-Juhaim Ibnal Harith Ibn As-Simma Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came from the direction of the Well of Jamal, a man met him and greeted him him. However, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not return the greeting. He came to a wall, hit it with his hands, stroked his face and hands and only then returned the greeting.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 554]

The Hadith of Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him: Abu Rafi` reported: One day the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, met Abu Hurairah, who was in a state of great ritual impurity, on one of the streets of Medina. He continued unobtrusively and carried out the complete washing. When he returned, the Prophet asked him: Where were you, Abu Hurairah? He replied: O Messenger of Allah, when you met me I was in a state of great ritual impurity, and I liked to keep you company only after I had performed total ablution. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Praise be to Allah! The Muslim will never be unclean.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 556]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went out to relieve himself. (In the Hadith reported by Hushaym it is said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to the toilet, he said: Allah, I seek refuge in You from the Khubuth (male Satans) and the Khaba'ith (females). Satans).   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 563]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Once the second call to prayer sounded when the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was having a secret conversation with a man. When he stood up to pray, the people (in the mosque) were asleep.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 4, Ḥadīṯ no. 564]

Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: When the Muslims initially came to Madinah, they gathered together and waited for the due date of prayer; because in those days there was no call to prayer. One day they were talking about this together and some of them suggested that they should use a bell for this purpose, as the Christians do, while others spoke of a blowhorn that the Jews use for this purpose. 'Umar said: Is it not right that you send out a man to call to prayer? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O Bilal, stand up and call for prayer!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 568]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Bilal was instructed to repeat the wording of the call to prayer in even numbers and to say the wording of the call to prayer (Iqama) in odd numbers.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 569]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had two callers: Bilal and the blind Ibn Umm Maktoum.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 573]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When you hear the call to prayer, say the same as what the caller says.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 576]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When there is a call to prayer, the devil runs away to avoid hearing the words of the call to prayer. It makes a noise like a gust of wind. When the call to prayer ends, he returns and whispers (to the believers). When the start of the prayer is announced, he moves away again so as not to have to hear the words at the start of the prayer. When the words of the beginning of the prayer are finished, he returns and whispers to the believers again.    [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 582]

Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) (performing the prayer): When he opened the prayer, he raised his two hands until they were on high of both his shoulders were; He did the same thing before he bowed, and he did the same again when he raised his head from bowing. But between the two prostrations he did not raise his hands.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 586]

The Hadith of Malik Ibnel Huwairith (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Qilaba reported: I saw Malik Ibnel Huwaireth (performing the prayer): When he opened the prayer, he said Allahu Akbar (Allah is Greater) and then he raised his hands . And when he wanted to bow, he raised his hands; He did the same when he raised his head after bowing. He (Malik) said that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to do the same.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 588]

The Hadith of Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Salama Ibn 'Abdu-r-Rahman reported: When Abu Huraira was praying to the people, he said the Takbier (Allahu Akbar = Allah is Greater) when he bowed or stood up. When he finished the prayer, he said: By Allah, I am the one among you whose prayer is most similar to that of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 590]

The Hadith of 'Imran Ibn Hussain, may Allah be pleased with them both: Mutraf Ibn 'Abdillah said: 'Imran Ibn Husayn and I prayed (once) behind 'Ali Ibn Abu Talib. When he prostrated himself, he said: Allahu Akbar (= Allah is greater). And when he raised his head he said: Allahu Akbar. And when he rose from his seat at the end of the second portion of the prayer, he said: Allahu Akbar. When we finished praying, Imran took my hand and said: He ('Ali) was praying for us just as Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did. Or he said: He ('Ali) reminded me of the prayer of Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 594]

'Ubada Ibn-as-Samit (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No prayer counts for one who has not recited the opening Surah of the Quran (Al-Fatiha).   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 595]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A prayer without reciting it is invalid.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 599]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to the mosque and after him a man entered and prayed. After that he greeted the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) with salaam (the formula: Peace be upon you!) and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied the salaam and said to him: Go back and pray; because you haven't prayed! The man went back and prayed just as he had prayed before; Then he came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and greeted him with salaam; and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) returned the salaam and said to him: Go back and pray; because you haven't prayed! This was repeated three times. But the man said, By Him who sent you with the truth, I can do no better than this. So teach me! Then the Prophet said: When you stand for prayer, then open the prayer with the Takbir (Allahu Akbar = Allah is the Great), then recite some verses from the Quran that you have memorized; then bow down in such a way that you can do this calmly until the end; then raise your upper body so that it becomes upright; then prostrate yourself in such a way that you perform the prostration calmly until the end; then straighten your upper body so that you are sitting still; and this you shall continue in all prayer.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 602]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I prayed behind the Messenger of Allah Abu Bakr, 'Umar and 'Uthman. But I never heard any of them say the formula (In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Merciful) aloud.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 605]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: One day, while the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was sitting with us, he was taking a nap. He then lifted his head up smiling. Then we said: Why are you smiling, Messenger of Allah? He replied: A surah has just been revealed to me. He then recited: In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, the Most Merciful. We have given you abundance. Therefore pray to your Lord and slaughter (sacrificial animals). Indeed, he who hates you is the one who is cut off (from the blessing of offspring). [Quran 108:1-3] Then he said: Do you know what is meant by (abundance) here? We replied: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: This is a river that my Lord, Almighty and Mighty, promised me, and there is much goodness in it. Rather, it is a pool where my church will stand on the Day of Resurrection. The drinking vessels there are as many as the stars. The one person in my community will then be removed. Then I will say: O my Lord, this belongs to my community. Allah will reply: You do not know what He changed (in religion) after you.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 607]

Abdullah Ibn Mas`ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We used to say: As-Salaam (peace be upon Allah) when we prayed behind the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). As-Salaam be on so-and-so. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to us one day: Allah is As-Salaam. When one of you sits at prayer, he says: (At-Tahiyyatu li-llahi wa-s-salawatu wa-t-taiyibat, as-salaamu 'alaika ai-yuha-n-nabiyyu wa-rahmatu-llahi wa-barakatuh , as-salaamu `alaina wa-`ala ibadi-llahi-s-salihin = All honors, prayers and good deeds are due to Allah. Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and on the righteous servants of Allah.) - for if you say this, it will affect every righteous servant in heaven and on earth - (ashhadu alla ilaha illa-llah, wa ashhadu anna Muhammadan 'abduhu wa-rasuluh = I bear witness that there is no god but Allah and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger). Then the person praying can choose which of the supplications he likes best!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 609]

The Hadith of Ka'b Ibn 'Ugra, may Allah be pleased with him: 'Abdullah Ibn Abi Laila said that Ka'b Ibn 'Ugra met him and said to him: Shall I give you something? When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) came out to us (from his abode), we said: As for the salutation of peace (salaam) to you, we have already understood it. How can we pray for you then? He said: Say: O Allah, grant peace to Muhammad and to the family of Muhammad, just as You gave peace to the family of Abraham. You are the one to be praised, the one worthy of praise! O Allah, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, just as You blessed the family of Abraham. You are the one to be praised, the one worthy of praise!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 614]

Abu Humaid As-Sa`idiy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The people said: O Messenger of Allah, how do we pray for you? He said: Say: O Allah, grant peace to Muhammad, his spouses and his offspring, just as you gave peace to the family of Abraham. O Allah, bless Muhammad, his spouses and his offspring, just as You blessed Abraham and his family! You are the one to be praised, the one worthy of praise!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 615]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When the leader of the prayer (the Imam) says (sami'a llahu liman hamidah = Allah hears him who praises Him), so say you: Allahumma rabbana walaka-l-hamd (O Allah our Lord, and all praise is due to You); for the one whose pronunciation coincides with that of the angels will be forgiven for all the sins he has committed in the past.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 617]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When the Imam says (Amen), you also say (Amen); for the one whose (Amen) is just pronounced with that of the angel will be forgiven all sins committed by him in the past.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 618]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah once fell down from his mare and injured his right side. So we paid him a sick visit. By now the prayer was due. The Messenger of Allah prayed in front of us sitting, and we also prayed sitting behind him. When he finished the prayer he said: The Imam is therefore there to be followed. When he says the takbir, you also repeat the takbir; and when he prostrates, you also prostrate; and when he rises, you rise also; and when he says (Allah hears him who praises Him), then you say: (O our Lord, and all praise is due to You), and if he performs the prayer while sitting, then you all perform the prayer while sitting.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 622]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once suffered from an illness. Then some of his companions paid him a sick visit. (When the prayer was due), the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the prayer sitting, but the others behind him prayed standing. Then he gave them a sign that they should also pray while sitting. So they sat down. When he finished praying, he said: The Imam is there to be obeyed: when he bows, you also bow; and when he rises, you rise also; and if he performs the prayer sitting, then you also perform the prayer sitting.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 623]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The Imam is there to be followed, so do not be divided about him. When he says the takbir, you also repeat the takbir; and when he bows, you bow too; and when he says (Allah hears him who praises Him!), you say: (O our Lord, and all praise is due to You) When he prostrates, you also prostrate; and if he performs prayer sitting, you also perform prayer sitting.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 625]

The Hadeeth of 'A'ishah: 'Ubaidullah Ibn Abdullah reported: I once went to 'A'ishah and said to her: Are you not telling me about the illness of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him)? She said: Yes! When the Prophet became weak due to his illness, he asked: Have the people already prayed? We replied: No, they are still waiting for you, Messenger of Allah. Then he said, Pour water into the vessel for me. We did so and he washed himself. But when he tried to get up, he fainted. Then he regained consciousness and asked: Have the people already prayed? We said: No, they are still waiting for you, Messenger of Allah. Then he said: Pour water into the vessel for me. We did so and he washed himself. When he tried to get up, he fainted again. Then he regained consciousness. He then asked: Have the people already prayed? We said: No, they are still waiting for you, Messenger of Allah! He said: Pour water into the vessel for me. We did that and he washed himself. When he tried to get up, he fainted again. Then he regained consciousness. Then he said: Have the people already prayed? We said: No, they are still waiting for you, Messenger of Allah. Meanwhile, the people were gathered in the mosque, waiting for the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to perform the night prayer. 'A'ishah further reported: Then the Messenger of Allah sent a messenger to Abu Bakr asking him to lead the people in prayer. The messenger came to him and said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commands you to lead the prayer. Abu Bakr, who was a very sensitive and tender-hearted man, said: O 'Umar, pray to the people! 'Umar said to him, 'You are more worthy of praying than I am. Accordingly, Abu Bakr prayed to the people in those days when the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was ill. Once, when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) felt a little better, he went to the mosque to perform midday prayers, relying on two men - one of them was Al-'Abbas . Meanwhile, Abu Bakr was already leading the people in prayer. When he saw the Messenger, he wanted to let him lead the prayer. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) signaled him to stay in his place. He said to the two who accompanied him: Let me sit down next to him! They then sat him down next to Abu Bakr. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) led the prayer while sitting, Abu Bakr followed him while standing, and those praying followed Abu Bakr.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 629]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Abu Bakr used to lead the people in prayer when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was suffering from the disease to which he finally succumbed. That Monday, when people had lined up to offer prayers, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) pushed aside the curtain in his room and looked out at us. He had straightened himself up and his face glowed like a page from the Koran. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) smiled, and we were overjoyed in prayer when we saw him. Abu Bakr wanted to retreat to the ranks of those praying because he thought that the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) would come out to pray. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) signaled to continue the prayer, returned and closed the curtain again. On the same day, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) died.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 636]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was struck by an illness and was suffering severely from it, he said: Tell Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer. Then 'A'ishah said: O Messenger of Allah, Abu Bakr is a very sensitive person. He is not capable of taking on the role of prayer leader in your place.
