But the Prophet said again: Tell Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer! You (women) are like Joseph's companions who always argued. Thus Abu Bakr led the people in prayer during the lifetime of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 638]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd As-Sa'idiy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went to the tribe of Banu 'Amr Ibn 'Auf to settle their dispute. When the prayer was due, the caller went to Abu Bakr and asked him: Would you lead the people in prayer so that I call for the prayer to be performed? Abu Bakr replied: Yes. So Abu Bakr led the people in prayer. Soon after, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came while the people were saying prayers, and he walked through the ranks until he stood in the front row. People started clapping their hands. As a rule, Abu Bakr never turned around during prayer. Only when the people clapped louder did he look behind him and see the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) instructed him to stay in his place. Then Abu Bakr raised his hands, thanked Allah, Mighty and Exalted, for what the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had commanded him, and finally he returned to the ranks of those praying. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to the front and prayed to the people. After the prayer he turned around and said: Why didn't you stay in your place when I asked you to? Abu Bakr replied: It is not for Ibn Abu Quhafa to pray in front of the people in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Why did you clap so much? If something unexpected happens during prayer, one should praise Allah because everyone who hears it will pay attention. Clapping is only appropriate for women.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 639]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (When something happens during prayer), it is appropriate for men to praise and for women to clap.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 641]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: One day the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prayed to us. After he finished the prayer, he said: O so-and-so, can't you perform the prayer better? When praying, shouldn't the person who prays think about how he does it? For one prays for oneself. Truly, I see behind my back as well as I see in front of me.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 642]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Perform bowing and prostration thoroughly. By Allah, I see you behind me (or he said: behind my back) when you bow and when you prostrate.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 644]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Does not the one who raises his head (in prayer) before the Imam fear that Allah will make his head the head of a donkey?   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 647]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Straighten your ranks; for straightening the ranks is part of complete prayer!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 656]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Fill the ranks, for I see you behind my back.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 657]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Stand in straight lines when praying. Because the even rows are part of the perfection of prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 658]

An-Nu'maan Ibn Basheer (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Either you straighten your ranks (in prayer) or turn your faces towards Allah from different directions. (i.e., strife will prevail among you.)    [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 659]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When people know the reward for saying the call to prayer and standing in the front row (at congregational prayer) and no other option If they found a way to share this among themselves except by drawing lots, they would let the lot decide! And if they knew of the reward for performing the midday prayer as soon as it was due, they would race for it, and if they knew of the reward for performing the night prayer and the morning prayer in congregation, they would compete for it (in the mosque), even if they had to crawl to get there.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 661]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If you knew about the reward for standing in the front row (at the congregational prayer), you would let the lot decide!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 663]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I saw men tying their waistcloths like children because of the tightness of their necks, while they were praying behind the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Then one said: O women, do not raise your heads until the men have raised theirs.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 665]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If your wives ask you for permission to go to the mosque, you should not stop them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 666]

'A'ishah, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: If the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) had seen what women were doing these days, he would have forbidden them to go out to the mosque, just as he did it was forbidden to the wives of the children of Israel. (Ibn Sa'id, a narrator) asked 'Amra: Was it forbidden for the wives of the Children of Israel to go out to the mosque? She replied: Yes.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 676]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The words of Allah, the Almighty and the Most Exalted: And do not make your prayer loud and do not use a quiet voice, seeking a way between them [Quran 17:110] were revealed when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) secretly called the people of Mecca to Islam. When he led his companions in prayer, he would recite the Quran aloud. When the fellow devotees heard this, they reviled the Qur'an, the One Who sent it down and the one who transmitted it. Then Allah, Exalted be He, said to his Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him): And do not make your prayer loud so that those who worship with you do not hear your recitation , and do not use a low voice so that your companions may hear your recitation. So you shouldn't recite too loudly, but strive for a path in between, that is, between loud and quiet recitation.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 677]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The words of Allah, the Almighty and Exalted: And do not make your prayer loud and do not use a quiet voice [Quran 17:110] were revealed in relation to supplication.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 678]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him): He reported the words of Allah, the Exalted and Almighty: Do not move your tongue with him [Quran 75:16] The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) used to experience one great effort when Gabriel came down to him with the revelation, and this usually came about when he (the Prophet) tried to move his tongue and lips with it (with the Qur'anic verses). This condition was noticeable in him. Then Allah, the Exalted, sent down the following verse from the Qur'an: Do not move your tongue with him, and make haste with him. It is up to Us to collect and recite it [Quran 75:16-17]. That is, it is our responsibility to collect the Quran in your heart and teach you to read it. And when We have recited him, follow his reciting [Quran 75:18]. That is, when We send down (the Quran), listen carefully. Then it is up to Us to clarify it [Quran 75:19]. That is, it is our responsibility to clarify the Qur'an through your tongue. Accordingly, the Prophet used to listen when Gabriel came to him, and when Gabriel left, he could recite the Quran as Allah had promised him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 679]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) never read the Quran to the jinn, nor could he see them. Once it happened that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out with a group of his companions and headed for the bazaar of 'Ukaaz. At this time the Satans were prevented from bringing news from heaven and burning shooting stars were sent down upon them. So they returned to their people, who asked them, “What is the matter with you?” They (the Satans) replied: We were prevented from bringing news from heaven and burning shooting stars were sent down upon us. They (their people) replied: Something strange must have happened. Go around the world and find out what is preventing us from bringing the news of heaven! So they traveled all over the world, and a group of them, on their way to Tihama and aiming for the bazaar of 'Ukaaz, passed by the Prophet who was offering morning prayers with his companions in a palm garden. When they heard the Qur'an, they listened carefully and said: This is what has prevented us from bringing the news of heaven. They then returned to their people and said: O people! Verily we have heard a wonderful Quran that guides righteousness, so we have believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord [Quran 72:1-2]. Allah then revealed to His Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) the verse: Say: "It was revealed to me that a host of jinn were listening... [Quran 72:1]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ No .681]

Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) led us in prayer, he used the opening words of the Qur'an (Al -Fatiha) and to recite two more surahs. Sometimes he recited the verse audibly. He recited longer in the first rak'a of the midday prayer and shorter in the second. He also did the same in the morning prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 685]

Abu Barza, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, recited from sixty to a hundred verses at the morning prayer.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 702]

244. Al-Bara', may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was on a journey, he performed the night prayer, reciting in one of the two rak'ahs the surah of (Bey the figs and the olives) recited.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 706]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Mu'az used to pray with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and then he would return to his people to lead them in prayer. One night he performed night prayer behind the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and then he returned to his people and led them in prayer. He recited Surah Al-Baqara (The Cow) at the beginning of the first part of the prayer. Then a man went away and said At-Taslim (concluding formula of the prayer). Then he said the prayer alone and went away. The people later said to him: (O so-and-so, are you a hypocrite?) He replied: (No, - by Allah - I will go to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and tell him.) The man then went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said to him: O Messenger of Allah, we provide camels to carry water and work all day long. Mu`az performed the night prayer with you and then came to us and recited Surah Al-Baqara (the Cow) at the beginning of the first portion of the prayer. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then turned to Mu'az and said to him: (O Mu'az, do you want to scare people away from prayer? Recite like this and recite like that!) Sufyan reported: I said ' Amr: Abu Az-Zubair reported from Jabir that the Prophet said: Recite: (By the sun and its splendor); (In the forenoon, At the night when it covers), or (Praise the name of your Most High Lord!) 'Amr replied: (Almost so!)    [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 709]

Abu Mas'ud Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man came to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) and said: I am not coming to the morning prayer because of so-and-so who prolongs the prayer when he prays for us. I have never seen the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) so angry when giving an instruction as he was that day; for he said afterwards: O people! There are those among you who scare away (people)! Whoever of you leads people in prayer should keep it shorter; for among them are the sick, the weak, and others who want to take care of some concerns.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 713]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If one of you leads the people in prayer, let him make it easy; for among them there are little ones, old ones, weak ones and sick ones. But if one of you prays alone, he can prolong it as long as he wants.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 714]
Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed his prayer briefly but completely.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 719]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) heard the crying of the child who had come to pray with his mother, he would recite short or small surahs.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 722]

Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I observed the prayer of Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). So I saw him standing, bowing, standing upright again after bowing, prostrating himself, sitting between the two prostrations, prostrating himself, and then sitting between saying the final formula and walking away. All of this took about the same amount of time.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 724]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I am ready to guide you in prayer just as the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) guided us. Thabit said: But Anas did something that I do not see you doing. When he raised his head after bowing, he stood upright (for a long time), so that people said: He forgot to prostrate. And when he raised his head after prostration, he remained in that state, so that it was said: He forgot to make the second prostration.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 726]

Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: They performed prayer behind the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He raised his head after bowing, and I did not see anyone bowing his back until the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) placed his forehead on the ground. Then they threw themselves down behind him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 728]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to say (in his prayer) in both prostration (Ruku') and prostration (Sugud): (Subhanaka -llahumma rabbana wa bihamdika, allahumma-gh-fir li). (Praise be to You, O Allah our Lord, and all praise is due to You; O Allah, forgive me!) He followed the Koran.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 746]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was commanded to perform prostration on seven parts of his body. But he was forbidden to tie his clothes and hair together (during prayer).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 755]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When prostrating, stand straight and none of you should put his arms on the ground like a dog.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 762]

'Abdullah Ibn Malik Ibn Buhaina (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to spread his arms (when he prostrated in prayer) so that the fair skin of his armpits could be seen could.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 764]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: Whenever the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out to the place of prayer on the occasion of the festival, he ordered that a spear be taken with him. This lance was stuck into the ground on the prayer site in front of him. He then performed the prayer with his face turned towards her, and the people prayed behind him. He did the same when traveling. The (later Muslim) rulers and commanders maintained this approach.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 773]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had his riding camel laid down so that it stood across him and the direction of prayer, and then performed the prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 775]

Abu Juhaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I came to the Prophet in Mecca. At that time he was in a red leather tent in Al-Abtah. Bilal received the water with which the Messenger of Allah had performed ablution. People rushed to get some of this water. Anyone who got some of it rubbed it on themselves. And those who had come too late were satisfied with the wetness of their companions' hands. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out. He was wearing a red robe. I remember now the whiteness of his legs that I saw then, as if I saw them now. Then Bilal called for prayer. I followed his mouth here and there, right and left, as he said: Come here to pray! Come to salvation! A short spike was stuck in the ground in front of him. He came forward and prayed two Ra'kas for the midday prayer. Meanwhile, donkeys and dogs ran past in front of him on the other side of the spit. He also prayed two rak'a for the afternoon prayer. In this way he performed two rak'a for every prayer until he returned to Medina.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 777]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: It once happened that when I was about to reach maturity, I came on a donkey while the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) was praying to the people of Mina. I passed in front of the line, dismounted, let the donkey graze and then joined the line. Nobody had anything against it.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 780]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When one of you performs prayer, he should not allow anyone to pass in front of him and, if possible, push him away. But if he resists, you should use force. Because this one is a Satan.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 782]

Abu Juhaim (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If he who goes before a person praying knew what kind of crime he was committing, he would prefer to pay forty ( ...) to stand still rather than walk in front of the person praying. Abu An-Nadr (another narrator) added: I don't know whether the Prophet mentioned forty days, months or years!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 785]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd As-Sa'idiy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The space between the place of worship of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the wall was just large enough for a sheep to pass through.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 786]

Salama Ibnal Akwa', may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I sought carefully the place where the tablets in which the verses of the Koran were written were kept in order to perform the voluntary prayers there. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) also sought this place, which was between the pulpit and the qibla wall. This space was just big enough for a sheep to walk through.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 787]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the prayer at night while I lay across him and the direction of the prayer, just like the bier in the funeral prayer.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 791]

Maimuna, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) performed the prayer while I was next to him having my menstrual period. When he prostrated, his robe would sometimes touch me.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 797]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: One asked the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) about performing prayer with a single piece of clothing. Then the Prophet said: Would each of you have two pieces of clothing? [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 799]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None of you may perform prayer wearing a garment that leaves the shoulders uncovered.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 801]

'Umar Ibn Abi Salama (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) praying in Umm Salama's house. He covered himself in a single robe, placing both ends on his shoulders.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 802]
Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I saw the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) praying covered with a single robe.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 5, Ḥadīṯ no. 805]

Jaber Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: On the day of the Battle of the Trench (Al-Khandaq), 'Umar Ibnal Khattab rebuked the disbelievers of Quraysh and said: O Messenger of Allah! By Allah, when I was about to say the afternoon prayer, the sun had already set. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: By Allah, I have not done it yet. Then we went down to Buthaan and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed ablution and we did the same. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the afternoon prayer after the sun had set, then he performed the evening prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1000]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The angels take turns day and night to be with you always. They meet with you at the time of the morning prayer and at the time of the afternoon prayer. And after the morning prayer, the angels who spent the night with you ascend to heaven. Allah then asks them, even though He Himself knows best: In what condition did you leave My servants? They answered: They were praying as we went away. And when we came the afternoon before, they were praying too!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1001]

Jarir Ibn 'Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We were with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and saw him looking at the full moon at night and saying: You will certainly see your Lord so clearly how you see this moon without having any doubts when you look at it. If you cannot allow yourself to be prevented from performing the prayer before sunrise or sunset (meaning the afternoon and morning prayers), then do so. Then Jarir recited: And praise your Lord with praise before the rising of the sun and before its setting... [Quran 20:130]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1002]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever performs the two cool-time prayers (meaning the morning and afternoon prayers) enters Paradise." "   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1005]

Salama Ibnal Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the evening prayer when the sun set and disappeared behind its hiding place.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1006]

Rafi' Ibn Khadieg (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We performed the evening prayer with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) at a time when we could just recognize the person who then left when he behaved like that was far away, like an arrow flying.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1007]

'A'ishah, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon her), reported: One day the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) postponed the night prayer, which was called Al-'Atma (the Darkness). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not come out until 'Umar Ibnal Khattab told him: The women and children were already asleep. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out and said to the people in the place of worship: No one is waiting for this prayer except you. This happened before Islam spread among the people.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1008]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: One night we were waiting for the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to perform the last prayer - the night prayer - with him. Only after a third of the night or more had passed did he come out to us. We didn't know whether he was busy with his family's affairs or something else. He said when he came out: You are waiting for a prayer that no other possessors of the Scriptures perform except you. But if it wasn't difficult for my congregation, I would have prayed with them at that hour. Then he ordered the caller to prayer and he called for prayer and the Messenger prayed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1010]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Thabit asked me about the ring of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). I said: One night the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) postponed the night prayer until midnight (or midnight was almost over). He then came and said: The people have been praying some time ago and are already sleeping. But you prayed as long as you waited for the night prayer. It occurs to me now as if I were seeing the shine of his silver ring. He then raised his left little finger to show how the Prophet did it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1012]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: My friends who left with me in the ship and I were in the Valley of Buthaan while the Messenger of Allah was in Madinah. Every night a group of us went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) at the time of night prayer. Abu Musa further said: We, my friends and I, went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He was busy with some things, so he postponed prayer until it got too dark, namely until midnight. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out. He prayed with them and said to those who prayed with him: Slowly! I will teach you and declare to you that it is a favor from Allah for you that none but you pray at this hour, or He said: None pray at this hour except you. We don't know what sentence he said. Abu Musa said: We went back happy because we heard this from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1014]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: One night the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) postponed the night prayer so that people lay down and woke up, then slept again and woke up. 'Umar Ibnal Khattab stood there and said: The prayer! 'Ata' reported that Ibn 'Abbas said: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out to us and it occurs to me now as if I saw the water dripping from his head and he put his hand on one side of his head and said: If it were not difficult for my congregation, I would have ordered them to perform the prayer like this (that is, this late). I asked 'Ata how the Prophet put his hand on his head as Ibn 'Abbas had told him. So he removed between his fingers, placed his fingertips on the side of his head, and stroked his head with his hand until his thumb reached behind his ears, on the part nearest his face. Then he stroked his temples and his beard. He wasn't slow or fast, just that way.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1015]

The hadeeth of 'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her): The believing women used to attend the morning prayer (Fagr) with the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him); They were so well wrapped up in their garments that no one could recognize them when they returned home after the prayer was over.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1020]

The Hadith of Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with him: Muhammad Ibn 'Amr Ibnal Hasan Ibn 'Ali reported: When Al-Hajaj came to Madinah, we asked Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah some questions about the times of prayer. He replied: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the midday prayer in the heat of the day, the afternoon prayer when the sun was bright, and the evening prayer when the sun had already set. He sometimes postponed the night prayer and sometimes he performed it early. If he saw that they were all there, he would offer the prayer early, and if he saw that they were late, he would postpone the prayer. He performed the early prayer at dawn.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1023]

The Hadith of Abu Barza (may Allah be pleased with him): Sayyar Ibn Salaama reported: I heard my father Abu Barza asking about the prayer of the Messenger (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). He said: He did not give any request to postpone the night prayer until midnight. He also didn't like sleeping before or talking after. Shu'ba said: I met him afterwards and asked him again. He said: He used to perform the midday prayer when the sun had already crossed the meridian, and the afternoon prayer at the time after which one could go to the end of the medina, and the sunlight was still bright. The narrator further narrated: But I do not remember what time he mentioned when the Prophet used to perform the evening prayer. I met him again afterwards and asked him more questions. He said: He used to perform the morning prayer at a time after which one of them would look into the face of his neighbor, whom he already knew, and could recognize him. He used to recite from sixty to a hundred verses.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1024]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Praying in congregation is twenty-five times better than praying alone.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1034]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Prayer in congregation is twenty-seven times better than praying alone.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1038]

The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) found that some people were absent from some congregational prayers. Then he said: I have thought of commanding someone to pray before the people, so that I can go to those who are not present at prayer and set their houses on fire. If one of them knew that he would find a fat bone (in the mosque), then he would definitely come to the night prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1040]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): His grandmother, Mulaika, invited the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to the food she had cooked. He ate it and then said: Come! I will say a prayer with you. Anas Ibn Malik said: Then I took a mat that had already turned black because it had been spread out for a long time and moistened it. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was written on it. The orphan and I lined up behind him and the old woman was still behind us. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed two rak'ahs with us and then left.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1053]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had the best morals among all people. It may be that it was prayer time when he was with us. Then he ordered the mat lying under him to be cleaned and moistened. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood as Imam and we stood behind him and performed the congregational prayer. (Their mats were then made of palm branches.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1054]

The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): Once the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to us. It was just my mother, my maternal aunt, Umm Haraam, and I there. He said to us: Up! I will pray for you - back then it was not the time of a prescribed prayer. And he prayed for us. A man asked Thabit: Where did he leave Anas of him? He (Thabit) replied: He made him stand on his right side. Then he asked Allah for all of us, all the inhabitants of the house, for all the good in this world and the hereafter. Then my mother said: O, Messenger of Allah! Call on Allah for your young servant! He (Anas) said: Then he asked Allah for all good things for me and ended his supplication as follows: O Allah! Increase and bless his wealth and his offspring!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1055]

The hadeeth of Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The one who receives the greatest reward for prayer is the one whose walking distance (to the mosque) is the furthest away; the further away the route, the more the reward. And whoever waits (in the mosque) to perform prayer with the Imam, his reward is greater than that of the one who prays and then lies down to sleep.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1064]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Imagine if one of you had a river at his doorstep in which he would wash five times a day; would some of his dirt remain on him? They said: No, none of his dirt would remain on him. The Prophet said: So it is with the five prayers by which Allah removes sins.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1071]

The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him): The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever goes to the mosque in the morning or in the evening, Allah prepares him a place in Paradise every time he goes to the mosque in the morning or in the evening goes in the evening.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1073]

The Hadith of Malik Ibn al-Huwairith (may Allah be pleased with him): We came to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) and were boys of almost the same age at that time. We stayed with him for twenty nights. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was merciful and tender; he thought that we longed for our relatives. So he asked us about our families that we were leaving. We informed him. Then he said to us: Return to your families, stay with them, teach them and instruct them that at the time of prayer one of you should call for prayer and the eldest among you should lead the prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1080]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished the recitation at early prayer, uttered the formula of At-Takbir and then raised his head, he used to say: Allah hears the one who who praises Him. Our Lord, praise be to You! He then said standing: O Allah save Al-Walid Ibn al-Walid, Salama Ibn Hisham, 'Ayyash Ibn Abu Rabie'a and the helpless among the believers! O Allah, make Your violence more destructive upon Mudar and cause it to suffer famine like that which broke out in the time of Joseph! O Allah curse Lahjan, Ri'l, Zakwaan and 'Usayya who disobeyed Allah and His Messenger. Then it came to our attention that the prophet had omitted this as a result of the revelation of the following verse. It does not depend on you whether he turns to them again to forgive or to punish them; for they are wicked. [Quran 3:128]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1082]

The Hadith of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) Abu Salama Ibn 'Abdu-r-Rahman reported that he heard Abu Hurairah saying: By Allah! I will pray for you, just as the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to pray for us. Thus, in the midday prayer, the evening prayer and the morning prayer, Abu Hurairah made a supplication after bowing (Du'a' Al-Qunuut), invoking Allah for the believers and cursing the disbelievers.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1084]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) invoked Allah against those who killed the people of Ma'una well for thirty days in the morning prayer. He called upon Allah against Ri'l, Zakwaan, Lihyaan and 'Uzziah who disobeyed Allah and His Messenger.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1085]

The Hadith of Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave a sermon and said: You will walk all evening and all night until you reach the water tomorrow, Allah willing will. People walked in such a way that no one paid any attention to the other. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was riding on his mount and I was also riding near it. At about midnight the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asleep, so that he leaned to one side on his mount. Then I came to him and supported him on his camel without waking him up. So he got up on his camel and rode on until the night was almost gone. Then he leaned to one side again and I propped him up on his camel again without waking him up. He rode on until just before dawn. Then he tilted again, but this time more than the previous two times, until he almost fell. I came to him and propped him up again. Then he raised his head and said: Who is this? I said: I, Abu Qatada. He said: Since when have you been riding next to me like this? I replied: Since the beginning of the night. He said: May Allah preserve you, just as you preserved His Messenger! Then he said: Have we been separated from the others? Can you see any? I said: There is a rider. Then I said: There is another rider. We came together and there were seven of us. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood on one side of the path, bowed his head and said: Pay attention to the times of prayer. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was the first to wake up with the sun visible behind his back. We woke up quickly. The Messenger said: Mount your camels! We mounted and rode until the sun was up. Then he got down and asked for a pot, which I had and in which there was a small amount of water. He performed ablution, but it was not comparable to his usual ablution. A little water still remained in the pot. Then he (the Prophet) said to Abu Qatada: Keep your pot, for it will play a wonderful role! Then Bilal called for prayer. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed two raqqahs and then the morning prayer as he used to do every day. Some of us began to whisper among ourselves, saying: What is the atonement for our neglect in prayer? Then the Messenger of Allah said: Do you not have an example in me? There is no neglect in sleeping. It is neglect if one does not perform the prayer until the next prayer comes. Whoever does this should perform the missed prayer as soon as he remembers it. But if he remembers it the next day, then he should perform it at the time of the same prayer. Then he said: What did the (other) people do? He said (Abu Qatada): When the people woke up, they found that they had lost their Prophet. Abu Bakr and 'Umar told them: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) should be behind you. He can't leave you behind him. Some said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) is with you. If you obey Abu Bakr and 'Umar, then you are on the right path. We reached the people at midday when it had become very hot. They said: O, Messenger of Allah! We almost died of thirst. Then he said: You should not die of thirst! Bring me my little cup! Then he asked for the water pot. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) began to pour the water for Abu Qatada to water the people. When they saw the water, they fell headlong. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Fill (the glass) well! You will all drink. People did it. So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) continued to pour and I watered them until there was no one left except the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and me. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) poured me (water) and said to me: Drink! I said: O Allah's Messenger! I won't drink before you drink. Then he said: He who gives water to the people drinks the last. Then I drank and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) also drank. The people reached the place of water happy, full and content. He (Abu Qatada) said: 'Abdullah Ibn Rabaah said: I was narrating this hadith in the mosque of Al-Gami' when 'Imran Ibn Hasien said: You, youth! Pay attention to what you say! I was one of the riders that night. He (`Abdullah Ibn Rabaah) said: I said: Then you know the Hadith better. Then he (‘Imran) said: Who are you? I said: I belong to the Ansar. He said: Tell me! You know your hadith better. He said: I told the people (the hadith). 'Imran said: I experienced (the events of) that night, but I have not seen anyone who memorizes the Hadith as well as you. so that Abu Qatada watered the people. When they saw the water, they fell headlong. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Fill (the glass) well! You will all drink. People did it. So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) continued to pour and I watered them until there was no one left except the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and me. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) poured me (water) and said to me: Drink! I said: O Allah's Messenger! I won't drink before you drink. Then he said: He who gives water to the people drinks the last. Then I drank and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) also drank. The people reached the place of water happy, full and content. He (Abu Qatada) said: 'Abdullah Ibn Rabaah said: I was narrating this hadith in the mosque of Al-Gami' when 'Imran Ibn Hasien said: You, youth! Pay attention to what you say! I was one of the riders that night. He (`Abdullah Ibn Rabaah) said: I said: Then you know the Hadith better. Then he (‘Imran) said: Who are you? I said: I belong to the Ansar. He said: Tell me! You know your hadith better. He said: I told the people (the hadith). 'Imran said: I experienced (the events of) that night, but I have not seen anyone who memorizes the Hadith as well as you. so that Abu Qatada watered the people. Then he said: He who gives water to the people drinks the last. Then I drank and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) also drank. The people reached the place of water happy, full and content. He (Abu Qatada) said: 'Abdullah Ibn Rabaah said: I was narrating this hadith in the mosque of Al-Gami' when 'Imran Ibn Hasien said: You, youth! Pay attention to what you say! I was one of the riders that night. He (`Abdullah Ibn Rabaah) said: I said: Then you know the Hadith better. Then he (‘Imran) said: Who are you? I said: I belong to the Ansar. He said: Tell me! You know your hadith better. He said: I told the people (the hadith). 'Imran said: I experienced (the events of) that night, but I have not seen anyone who memorizes the Hadith as well as you.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1099]

'Imran Ibn Husain, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: Once when I was traveling with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), we traveled all night and got down just before dawn to get some rest. But sleep took hold of us until the sun began to rise. It was Abu Bakr who woke up first among us. We did not wake up the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) when he fell asleep, but we let him wake up on his own. 'Umar then woke up, stood next to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and recited the formula of At-Takbir several times in a loud voice until the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) woke up. When he raised his head and found the sun beginning to rise, he said: Continue your journey! He continued the journey with us until the sun's rays were already well spread. Then the Prophet dismounted from his mount and led us in the morning prayer. A fellow passenger walked away from us and did not pray with us. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished the prayer, he said to this man: O so-and-so, what prevented you from offering the prayer with us? He replied: O Messenger of Allah, I am afflicted with ritual impurity. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commanded him to perform tayammum (dry ablution) with sand; and so he could perform the prayer. The Prophet then urged me to go immediately with some of my fellow passengers to look for water because we were very thirsty. On the way we met a woman with her feet dangling between two leather water bags. We asked them: Where can you find water? She replied: Very far from here, very far. You can't find water here. We further asked: How long is the distance between the dwellings of your tribe and the water? She replied: A journey of one day and one night. We said: You should go to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). She said: Who then should be the Messenger of Allah? We were then able to somehow take her with us to the Prophet. When she was in front of him, he asked her about her circumstances. She told him the same thing she had told us and told him that she was a widow and had orphans. He then ordered their camel to kneel down. The camel spat water into the upper openings of the two water bags and then stood up. We - forty thirsty men - drank until our thirst was completely quenched. We also filled all the water bags we had and let our friend, who was previously unclean, wash himself. But we didn't let the camel drink the water, even though the water bags almost burst from the water. The Prophet then said: Bring everything you have with you! So we collected pieces of bread and dates for them. The Prophet packed what he had gathered into a bundle, gave it to the woman and said to her: You must now go and feed your children with it. And you should also know that your water has not diminished in the slightest. When the woman returned to her tribe, she said: I have met the greatest sorcerer among men, or he is truly a prophet, as he claimed. And she told what happened. So Allah guided these people through this woman; she and her people professed Islam.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1100]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Whoever forgets a prayer should make it up when he remembers it; there is no other penance for it except this.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 1102]

Abu Zarr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I said: O Messenger of Allah, which mosque was first built on earth? He said: The Haram Mosque (the Holy Mosque in Mecca). I asked again: Which one then? He replied: The Al-Aqsa Mosque (in Jerusalem). I said: What was the length of time between the two? He replied: Forty years. When it is time for prayer, perform prayer wherever you are because that is a mosque.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 808]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I have been given five (features) which were not given to anyone before me: any of the (former) Prophets was sent only to his own people, while I am sent for all of humanity. The spoils of war were allowed to me that no one else was allowed to do before me. The earth has been made pleasant and pure for me, as well as a place of prayer, and if anyone wants to perform prayer when it is due, he can perform it wherever he happens to be. My victory over the enemy was made by terror, the effectiveness of which is equivalent to the distance of a month's journey. And I was given intercession (on the last day).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 810]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I was preferred to other Prophets by six points. I was given words that are brief but express broad meanings. My victory over the enemy was made through terror. I am allowed the spoils of war. The earth was cleansed for me and made a place of prayer. I have been sent for all of humanity and the line of prophets has ended with me.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 812]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to Madinah, he lived in the upper part of Madinah, with the tribe of Banu 'Amr Ibn 'Auf. He spent fourteen nights with them. Then he sent to Banu An-Najar, and the men of this clan arrived with him a little later, armed with swords. I feel like I can still see the following scene in my mind: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was sitting on his camelin, and Abu Bakr was mounted behind him. The members of the Banu An-Najar tribe grouped around them. In this formation they moved to the courtyard of Abu Ayyub's house. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to perform prayer wherever he happened to be, even if it was a sheep pasture (as long as the place was clean)! But finally he ordered that a mosque should be built. He summoned the tribe of Banu An-Najar and said to them: You people of Banu An-Najar, tell me the price of this piece of land! They replied: No, by Allah, we don't want any money for it! We only seek the reward of Allah. Anas further reported: Date palms, graves of idolaters and rubble (of old buildings) were found on that property. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered the palm trees to be cut down, the graves of the associates to be dug up and the ruins to be leveled. The trunks of the palm trees were placed on the side of the mosque that corresponds to the direction of prayer and supported by two stone walls. People brought stones and recited poems. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was with them and shouted: O Allah, only in the Hereafter is there true happiness! O Allah, have mercy on the Ansaar and the Muhajirun!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 816]

Al-Bara'Ibn 'Azib, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I prayed with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) in the direction of Jerusalem for sixteen months until the Qur'anic verse in Surah Al-Baqara (The Cow): and wherever you are, turn your faces towards them [Quran 2:144] has been revealed. This Quranic verse was revealed to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) after he had already finished praying. A man from the people went on his way until he passed some people from the Ansar who were performing prayer (in the direction of Jerusalem); He informed them (that he was praying with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) facing the Ka'ba.) Then they turned their faces towards the Ka'ba.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 818]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: While the people were at the morning prayers in (the mosque of) Quba, someone came to them and said: Upon the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) is Something from the Qur'an was revealed that night, and he was commanded to head towards the Ka'bah. Then the people took this direction, while just before their faces were turned towards Palestine; So they now turned to the Ka'bah.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 820]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Umm Habibah and Umm Salama, in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him), mentioned a church in which there were images or sculptures that they had seen in Abyssinia . Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: These are the people who, when a righteous person dies among them, build a place of worship on his grave and decorate it with such images or sculptures. These are the worst people with Allah on the Day of Resurrection.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 822]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said while he was suffering from the disease from which he finally succumbed: Allah curses the Jews and the Christians because they destroy their graves Prophets have made places of worship. If it had not been so, the Prophet's grave would have been in an open place. It was feared that people would turn it into a place of worship.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 823]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: May Allah condemn the Jews; for they made the graves of their prophets places of worship!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 824]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was dying, he took one of his clothes and covered his face with it; But when this became annoying to him, he removed it from his face and said while he was in this state: Allah's curse has fallen on the Jews and the Christians because they have made the graves of their prophets places of worship. He warned about the deed they committed!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 826]

'Uthman Ibn 'Affan said when the people were talking about him when he was rebuilding the Prophet's Mosque: You have spoken a lot, and I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saying: Whoever builds a mosque - Bukair said: I believe that he said: and in order that Allah's favor is the only goal, Allah will build a house like it in Paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 828]

Sa'd Ibn Abu Waqqas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Mus'ab Ibn Sa'd said: I prayed next to my father and put my hands together between my knees. My father said to me: Put your hands on your knees! However, I did that again. Then he struck me on the hands and said: This was forbidden to us (by the Prophet). We were instructed to put our hands on our knees.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 832]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We used to greet the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) while he was performing prayer and he would return the greeting to us. When we returned from the land of An-Nagashiy (Abyssinia), we greeted him (the Prophet) once, but he did not return the greeting to us. Then we said: O Messenger of Allah, we had always greeted you during prayer and you had always returned the greeting to us. He said: Prayer requires attention.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 837]

Zaid Ibn Arqam (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We used to talk to each other during prayer. So the man spoke to the one who stood next to him during prayer until the verse And stand before Allah as the obedient [Quran 2:238] was revealed. So we were commanded to be silent (during prayer) and not to speak.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 838]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent me to deal with a matter. I then caught up with him while he was riding. (Qutaiba said: And while he was doing the prayer.) I greeted him, but he just waved to me. When he finished the prayer, he called me and said: You just greeted me while I was saying the prayer. He (the Prophet) was facing the East.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 839]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A devil among the jinn suddenly attacked me last night to interrupt my prayer. But Allah made me defeat him, and I gained power from Allah over him. I wanted to tie him to one of the pillars of the mosque so that you all could see him in the morning. But I remembered the words of my brother Sulaiman: "O my Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom fit for none after me; verily, You are the Bestower." [Quran 38:35] Then Allah caused the jinn to return to a despicable state.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 842]

Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) was performing the prayer while he (the child) Umama Bint (= daughter of) Zainab, daughter of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). him, whose father was Abul 'As Ibnal Rabie': when he prostrated, he put it down, and when he got up, he carried it again.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 844]

The Hadith of Sahl Ibn Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with him: Some people came to Sahl Ibn Sa'd after arguing over the question of what wooden planks the pulpit (minbar) was made of. He said: By Allah, I know what planks of wood it is made of and who made it. I also saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sitting on it for the first time. Then Abu Hazim said: O Abu 'Abbas (surname of the narrator), tell us about it! He narrated: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent a message to a woman (Abu Hazim said that he named the woman) as follows: Instruct your servant, who is a carpenter by profession, to cut some wooden planks to make for me (on which I can sit) and give the sermon in front of the people. The servant made these three stairs. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then put them in this situation. These are made from Athal (a tree that grows in the desert). I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) standing on it and saying Allahu Akbar (=Allah is Greater). People repeated this formula after him. Then he knelt, stood up, went down the stairs and prostrated himself at the base of the pulpit. Then he repeated this until he finished his prayer. Then he came to the people and said: O people, I have done this so that you may take me as an example and learn my prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 847]

Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: (The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade placing the hands on the waist in prayer.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ   No. 848]

Mu'aiqib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) spoke about removing stones from the ground (of the mosque during prostration). He said: If you absolutely have to do this, then only once.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 849]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw saliva on the Qibla wall (in the direction of prayer), which he scraped off, and then went to the people and said: When any of you pray, let him not spit in the direction of his face; for Allah is in his sight when he is in prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 852]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw nasal mucus on the wall in the prayer direction of the mosque, so he scraped it off with a stone and forbade one to turn to the right or spits forward, but to the left or under his left foot.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 853]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw saliva or nasal mucus or sputum on the Qibla wall. He scratched it off.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 854]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When one of you prays, he has a private conversation with his Lord; then none of you shall spit either in front of you or to your right, but only to the left of your foot.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 856]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Spitting in the mosque is an iniquity, the atonement for which is burying the sputum.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 857]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): Sa'id Ibn Yazid Al-Azdi reported: I asked Anas Ibn Malik: Did the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) pray in his sandals? He (Anas) said: Yes!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 862]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the prayer in an ornate robe. Then he said: These decorations distracted me (from prayer). So take it (the robe) to Abu Gahm and bring me his thick and unadorned robe!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 863]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When dinner is ready when the prayer is due, you start eating.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 866]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When dinner is ready for one of you and at the same time you are called to perform prayer, you begin eating and do not hurry until this is over.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 868]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said in the Battle of Khaybar: Whoever has eaten this plant (and he meant garlic) should not approach our mosque approach!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 870]

The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): Anas was asked about garlic. Then he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever has eaten this plant should not come near us or perform prayer with us.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 872]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade eating onions and leeks. However, we were overcome by a longing desire (for it) and we ate these plants. Then he (the Messenger of Allah) said: Whoever has eaten these foul-smelling plants should not come near our mosque. For what is unpleasant to men is also unpleasant to angels.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 874]

'Umar Ibnal Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I never contradicted the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when I contradicted him on Al-Kalala (the question of the heirless deceased), and he never attacked me so harshly As soon as he snapped at me, he poked me in the chest with his finger and said: O 'Umar! Isn't the last verse of Surah (An-Nisa' = the women), which was revealed in the hot summer, enough for you?! And if I were to live longer, I would make a decision in this regard that can be used as a rule for those who can derive judgments from the Qur'an and those who are unable to do so. He (`Umar) then said: O Allah! I call you as a witness against the princes of the cities. I only sent them to spread justice among the people, to teach them the religion and Sunnah of their Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), to distribute the spoils among them, and to trace to Me everything that they find difficult to deal with . Oh you people! You eat two types of plants that I find smelly. These are onions and garlic. I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordering a man to leave the mosque and go to Al-Baqie' when he found the smell of one of these two plants from him. Whoever of you wants to eat them should first cook them well until the smell is no longer there.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 879]

'Abdullah Ibn Buhaina (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) led us in prayer. At the end of the 2nd rak'ah, he stood up instead of taking the sitting position. The people also stood up behind him. As he finished the prayer, we waited to hear him say the formula of greeting (the closing formula). On the other hand, he pronounced the formula of At-Takbir (=Allah is Greater), made - without standing - two prostrations before the greeting, then finally he pronounced the formula of the greeting.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 885]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) prayed - and I do not know (said Ibrahim, one of the narrators of this hadeeth) whether he performed the prayer with more or less Rak 'a had done. When he finished the prayer with the Taslim (concluding formula of the prayer), the people asked him the following question: (O Messenger of Allah, has something new happened in the prayer?) Then the Prophet inquired about the reason for this question and the people said him: (You prayed so and so!) Then he pulled his legs towards him, took the direction of prayer, prostrated himself twice and then said Taslim. Afterwards he came towards us with his face and said: If something new had happened in prayer, I would have told you of myself. But I am nothing other than a person like you, who also forgets as you forget. If I forget something, remind me of it. If any of you are in doubt about your prayer, let him assume the greatest probability. One accordingly completes the prayer and adds two prostrations.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 889]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was leading us in one of the daily prayers, either the midday or the afternoon prayer, he recited the final formula only after two rak'a and departed went to a tree trunk that was in the direction of the prayer and leaned against it with an angry face. Abu Bakr and 'Umar were among those praying; but awe prevented her from speaking to him. And the people came out of the mosque very quickly saying: The prayer has been shortened! Then a man named Zul-Yadain stood up and said: O Allah's Messenger, has the prayer been shortened or have you forgotten? The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) looked to the right and to the left and said: What does Zul-Yadain say? They replied: He speaks the truth, you have only performed two rak'a. Then he (the Prophet) performed two more rak'a, pronounced the final formula and then the formula of At-Takbir, then he prostrated himself, then he pronounced the formula of At-Takbir, then he stood up, then spoke He uttered the formula of At-Takbir, then he prostrated again, then he said the formula of At-Takbir, then he rose.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 896]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: When reciting the Quran, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to prostrate when he recited a verse of the Quran containing passages for prostration, and all of us also prostrated in this way. that hardly any of us found a place for his forehead.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 900]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited the surah (An-Najm = the Star) and in the meantime prostrated himself. All the people who were with him also fell into prostration except one old man. He took a handful of stones or sand, raised them to his forehead and said: That's enough for me.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 902]

Zaid Ibn Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 'Ata' Ibn Yasaar asked me (Zaid Ibn Thabit) about reciting the Quran with the Imam. I said: There can be no recitation with the Imam. He said that once he recited Surah (By the Star when it descends) before the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him); but he (the Prophet) did not prostrate himself.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 903]

The Hadith of Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him: Abu Salama Ibn 'Abdu-r-Rahman, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Abu Hurairah recited to them the surah of (When the sky falls) and prostrated himself. When he finished reciting it, he told them that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prostrated while reciting this surah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 904]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: We knew from Takbir (the formula: Allah is Greater) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had finished his prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 917]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Two old Jewish women from Medina came to me and said: The people are being punished in their graves. I rejected what they said and found it inappropriate to believe them. They then went away and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to see me. I said to him: O Messenger of Allah! Two old Jewish women from Medina came to me and claimed that the people were being punished in their graves. He said: They spoke the truth. People are punished so severely that the animals would hear it. She (`A'ishah) further reported: Every time after that, when he performed the prayer, I saw him taking refuge in Allah from the punishment in the grave.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 922]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) seeking refuge (in Allah) against the tribulations of the false Messiah (Antichrist) during prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 923]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If any of you says At-Tashahhud (witnessing in prayer), he should seek refuge in Allah from four things. He should say: O Allah my God, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hellfire, from the punishment of the grave, from the temptation in life and at death, and from the tribulations of the false Messiah.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 924]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to make the following supplication in prayer: O Allah, I truly seek refuge in You from the torment of the grave ; and I seek refuge in You from the turmoil of the false Messiah; and I seek refuge in You from temptation in life and (from temptation) in death. O Allah my God, I truly seek refuge in You from sinfulness and indebtedness. One said to him: (O Messenger of Allah, it happens so often that you seek refuge from over-indebtedness!) And he (the Prophet) replied: (When a person is over-indebted, he usually lies when he speaks, but also not fulfilling what he promises!)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 925]

The Hadith of Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba, may Allah be pleased with him: Warrad, the free slave of Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba, reported: Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba wrote to Mu'awiya that the Messenger of Allah, Allah's blessings and peace be upon him, after finishing the prayer and reciting the Taslim (concluding formula of the prayer), he used to say the following: There is no god except Allah, the One Who has no partner. To Him alone belongs the kingdom and to Him alone is due all praise and He is powerful over all things. O Allah my God, there is none who withholds what You have given; and there is no one who gives what you have withheld. Nothing will be of any use to a wealthy person; because wealth comes from you.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 933]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The poor emigrants (the Makkans who migrated to Madinah in the early days of Islam) came to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) and said: The wealthy, who have a lot of money possess, claim the highest positions and eternal bliss (in paradise). He (The Prophet) said: Why? They continued: They pray like we pray, fast like we fast, they give alms and we don't, and they buy slaves while we can't! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said to them: Let me tell you something by which, when you perform it, you will catch up with what others have done and by which you will surpass others (in terms of reward). ) and will not be surpassed by anyone unless another does what you do? Then they said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah! He said: You say the praises of Allah (Allah be praised), the Tahmid (thanks be to Allah) and the Takbir (Allah is Greater) thirty-three times after each prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 936]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to remain silent for a moment between the Takbir (Allah is Greater to say) (at the opening of the prayer) and the recitation of the Quran. I said to him: (O Messenger of Allah, may my father and mother be sacrificed to you for this, tell me what you are saying during your silence between the takbir and the recitation!) He replied: (I say: O Allah, do between me and my sins a distance like that which You have made between the East and the West; O Allah, free me from all sins, as a white garment is cleansed from the dirt; O Allah, wash away my sin with snow , water and hail.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 940]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: When the Iqama (the second short call to prayer by which the caller calls for the beginning of the prayer) is pronounced, then go to prayer, not at a rapid pace, but at a normal pace, (not hastily) but go quietly, and do what you can of the prayer; But what you missed, you make up for.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 944]

Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Once while we were praying with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he heard the noise of some men. (After finishing the prayer) he asked: What was wrong with you? The people said: We hastened for prayer! The Prophet said: Don't do that! When you come to prayer, be quiet and do (with the community) what you can manage from the prayer; But what you missed, you make up for.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 948]

Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When the prayer sounds, do not get up until you see me.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 949]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Iqamah was announced and we lined up before the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out to us. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came and stood up for prayer, he remembered that he was in a state of great impurity. Wait! he called to us and went away to do the great ablution. When he returned, water was still dripping from his head. He praised Allah and we prayed with him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 950]

Jabir Ibn Samurah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Bilal called for prayer when the sun was about to set. However, he only gave the second call to prayer when the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out to pray. So when he saw him, he began to say the second call to prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 953]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever manages to perform one rak'ah of a prayer at the right time has said the prayer at the right time.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 954]

Abu Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Gabriel descended (to the earth) and prayed to me. I prayed with him, then prayed with him, then prayed with him, then prayed with him, then prayed with him. He said this by counting five prayers with his fingers.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 959]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to perform the afternoon prayer at a time when the sun was still shining in my room and there was no shade yet.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 961]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If it is very hot among you, seek a cool time to perform prayers; for the intense heat is a breath of hellfire.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 972]

Abu Zarr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The caller of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once called for midday prayer. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Wait until it cools down! Wait until it cools down! The intense heat is a breath of hellfire.
