If it is very hot where you are, find a cool time to perform your prayers.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 976]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Hell complained to its Lord and said: O God! Some of my parts ate the others. So allow me two breaths; one in winter and one in summer. This is the strongest heat (in summer) and the strongest cold (in winter).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 977]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We performed prayer with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in the intense heat. If one of us couldn't put his forehead on the ground, he would put the corner of his garment and throw it down on it.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 983]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the afternoon prayer when the sun was still high in the sky with the same heat and color. If someone then wants to go to Al-`Awali, it would still be daylight when he got there. (Some houses of Al-`Awali were about four miles from Medina).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 984]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): According to Abu Umama, it was narrated that he visited Anas Ibn Malik at his house in Basra after he had finished the midday prayer, because the house was next to the mosque. When we came in, he asked us: Have you performed the afternoon prayer? We said: We have just come from midday prayer. He said: So perform the afternoon prayer now! When we finished the prayer, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Such is the prayer of the hypocrite. It sits and looks at the sun until it stands between two horns. Then he performs the prayer very quickly, so that he thinks little of Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 987]

Rafi' Ibn Khadieg (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We performed the afternoon prayer with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), then the camels were slaughtered, divided into ten parts and then cooked. We ate well-cooked meat before the sun went down.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 990]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever of you fails to perform the afternoon prayer, it will seem to him that his family and his wealth have been lost to him .   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 991]

'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: On the day of the battle of the factions, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: May Allah fill their graves and houses with fire as they imprisoned us and distracted us from performing the afternoon prayers until the sun went down.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 6, Ḥadīṯ no. 993]

'A'ishah, the wife of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Allah made the prayer - when it initially became obligatory - consisting of two rak'as (prayer sections), both for the sedentary and for the travellers . Later, the prayer for the travelers was kept as it was, and additional rak'as were added to the prayer for the sedentary people.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1105]

The hadeeth of Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them: Hafs Ibn 'Asim reported that Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, said to him: O my nephew! I accompanied the Messenger of Allah on trips. He used to perform the prayer with only two rak'as until he died. I also accompanied Abu Bakr on trips, who also did not perform more than two raka's until he died. I also accompanied 'Umar, who, even when traveling, used to perform no more than two rak'as until he died. Then I accompanied 'Uthman, who did not perform more than two rak'as even while traveling until he died. Allah also says: You have a fine example in the Messenger of Allah. [Quran 33:21]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ No. 1112]

The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) performed four rak'as in Madinah at midday. However, in Zul-Hulaifa he performed only two rak'as in the afternoon.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1114]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): We rode with the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) from Medina to Mecca. He only performed two rak'as at a time until we returned (to Medina). I said: How long did he stay in Mecca? He replied: Ten days.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1118]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, performed the Traveler's Prayer in Mina and other places using only two rak'as.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1119]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): Abdur-Rahman Ibn Yazid (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 'Uthman Ibn 'Affan recited four rak'as for us in Madinah. This was reported to 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud. But he said: We belong to Allah, and to Him we will return. I prayed two rak'as in Mina with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). I also prayed two rak'as in Mina with Abu Bakr As-Siddiq. As well as with 'Umar Ibnal Khattab, I prayed two rak'as in Mina. So I hope that Allah will accept (at least) two rak'as out of the four I prayed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1122]

Haritha Ibn Wahb (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I performed two rak'as with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in Mina at a time when the people enjoyed maximum security.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1123]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) instructed the caller to say the following phrase on cold and rainy nights: Ala Sallu Fir-Rihaal (Ensure that you pray in your quarters!).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1125]

The Hadith of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them: He said to the caller on a rainy day: After you have said (I bear witness that there is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah. I bear witness that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah), then say not (Come here to pray), but say: Perform prayer in your houses. When the people reacted disapprovingly, Ibn Abbas said: Are you surprised at this? This instruction was given by one who far surpasses us, namely the Prophet. The Friday prayer is out of the question; it is obligatory, but I did not want to take you out of your houses (to go to the mosque) where you would have to walk in mud and on slipping earth.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1128]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them: The Messenger of Allah performed voluntary prayers (on his camel) in the direction where the camel was walking.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1129]

The Hadith of 'Amer Ibn Rabie'a (may Allah be pleased with him): He saw the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) performing voluntary prayer while traveling at night on the back of his camel in the direction where the camel was went.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1137]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): Anas Ibn Sirin reported: We received Anas Ibn Malek when he came from Ash-Sham in 'Ain-at-Tamr. I saw him praying on his donkey. His face was directed to the left side of the direction of prayer. I told him: I saw you praying, but in a direction other than the direction of prayer. Then he said: If I had not seen the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) doing the same thing, I would not have done it either.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1138]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him): When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was traveling in a hurry, he combined the evening prayer and the night prayer by performing them both in succession.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1139]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went on a journey before the due date of the midday prayer, he postponed the midday prayer until the time of the afternoon prayer, at the due time of which he (from his mount) dismounted and did the two of them one after the other. If the midday prayer was due before the start of the journey, he first said the midday prayer and then rode for the journey.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1143]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the midday prayer and the afternoon prayer, the evening prayer and the night prayer one after the other, without being in a state of fear or on a journey.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1146]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): None of you should make a portion of himself for Satan by making him believe that he should leave his place of prayer only from the right side; for I have often seen the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) leaving his place of prayer from the left side.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1156]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Malik Ibn Buhaina (may Allah be pleased with him): Once the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) passed by a man who was performing a prayer at that time and was called to morning prayer for the second time. The Messenger of Allah told him something that we could not hear. After the prayer, we surrounded the man and asked him: What did the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say to you? He replied: He told me: One of you was about to perform four rakkas for the morning prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1162]

The Hadith of Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When one of you enters the mosque, he should perform a prayer of two rak'ahs before sitting down.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1166]

The Hadith of Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was in debt to me. He paid it back and gave me more than that amount. I then came to him when he was in the mosque. He said to me: First perform two rakkas!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1168]

The Hadith of Ka'b Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): When the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) returned from a journey, he came only during the morning. He used to first go to the mosque, perform two rak'as and then sit there.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1171]

The Hadeeth of 'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her): I have never seen the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) perform the morning prayer. But I used to pray this prayer. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) omits an act even though he likes to do it, it is so that people do not do it all the time, which would then become obligatory for them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1174]

The Hadith of Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him: My dearest friend; The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recommended three things to me: fasting for three days a month, performing a prayer of two rakkas in the morning, namely the Doha prayer, and praying an odd-numbered prayer on Rakk'as, namely performing the Witr prayer before going to bed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1182]

The Hadith of Hafsa (may Allah be pleased with her): Ibn 'Umar said that Hafsa, the mother of the believers, reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to - when the caller to prayer completed the call to morning prayer and the time for this prayer was due - to perform two short rakk'as before the obligatory prayer began.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1184]

The Hadeeth of 'A'ishah: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to perform two short rak'as before the morning prayer after hearing the call to prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1187]

The hadeeth of Ibn 'Umar (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): I performed two rakk'as with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) before the noon prayer and another two rakk'as afterwards. After the evening prayer we performed two rakk'as, after the night prayer two rakk'as and after the Friday prayer also two rakk'as. I performed the evening prayer, the night prayer and the Friday prayer with him in his house.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1200]

The hadeeth of 'A'ishah: I never saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sitting while reciting night prayers until he grew old. Only then did he begin to recite the Koran verses while sitting. When he had about thirty or forty verses left of the surah, he stood up, recited them standing and then bowed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1205]

The Hadeeth of 'A'ishah: 'Abdullah Ibn Shaqiq reported: I once asked 'A'isha: Did the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) perform the prayer while sitting? She answered: Yes, when he grew old.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1209]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to perform eleven rakk'as at night, concluding it with a prayer with an odd number of rakk'as. Then he lay on his right side until the caller to prayer came to him. Then he got up and performed two short rakk'as before the morning prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1215]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: Abu Salama Ibn 'Abdu-r-Rahman reported that he once asked 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: What was the voluntary night-time prayer of the Messenger of Allah, Allah's blessings and peace be upon him, in Ramadan? She said: The Messenger of Allah did not perform more than eleven raqqas in Ramadan and on other days. He first performed four Rakk'as, the beauty and length of which are difficult to describe. Then he performed other four Rakk'as, the beauty and length of which are also difficult to describe. Then he performed three rak'as. 'A'ishah further reported: I said: O Messenger of Allah! Will you sleep before performing Witr prayer? Then the Messenger of Allah replied: O 'A'isha! My eyes are asleep, but my heart is not.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1219]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: Abu Ishaq reported: I asked Al-Aswad Ibn Yazid what he had heard from 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, about the prayer of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). , had told. She said: He used to sleep at the beginning of the night and perform religious exercises at the end. If he wanted to have sexual intercourse with his wife, he would have sexual intercourse with her and then sleep. When he heard the first call to prayer, he jumped up. By Allah! She didn't say: He stood up. ('A'isha continued) Then he poured the water on himself. By Allah! She didn't say: He washed himself. And I know exactly what she meant by that. (Then 'A'ishah said) Unless he was in a state of great ritual impurity, he performed partial ablution for prayer, then performed two rak'as before the obligatory prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1223]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: Masruq reported: I asked 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, about the deed of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). She said: He loved the deed that one constantly performed. I further asked her: When did he perform the prayer? She replied: When he heard the rooster, he would get up and say the prayer. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1225]

The hadeeth of 'A'ishah: I never found the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) at the time of early dawn - when he was in my house or with me - in a state other than sleep.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1226]

The hadeeth of 'A'ishah: When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished the two rakkas of the morning prayer, he then spoke to me if I was awake; if not, then he lay down.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1227]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her): The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) used to perform night prayers. And when he wants to perform the Vitr prayer (a prayer with an odd number of rakkas), he would say: Wake up, 'A'ishah! and perform the Witr prayer!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1228]
The hadeeth of 'A'ishah: Every night the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) performed the Witr prayer and ended it at dawn.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1230]

The Hadeeth of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: Zurara reported that Sa'd Ibn Hisham Ibn 'Amer wanted to go to fight in the way of Allah. When he came to Medina, he met some Medina residents who dissuaded him. They told him that during the lifetime of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), a group of six men wanted to do the same thing, but the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) stopped them and told them: You have done it not a good example in me? After they told him this, he remarried his former wife, whom he had previously separated from, and took some people to witness his remarriage. Then he went to Ibn 'Abbas and asked him about the Witr prayer of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Ibn 'Abbas said: Shall I direct you to the one who best knows the Witr prayer of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)? He asked: Who is this? Ibn 'Abbas replied: 'A'ishah. Go to her and ask her, then come back to me and tell me her answer to your questions. So I went to Hakim Ibn Aflah and asked him to guide me to her. He said: I will not go to her because I have warned her about involvement in the prevailing conflict between both groups. But she refused and expressed her opinion about it. But I demanded it from him with an oath and he finally complied with my wish. We went to 'A'ishah and asked permission to enter her. When we came in she said: Are you Hakim? She recognized him. He said: Yes! She said: Who is with you? He said: Sa`d Ibn Hisham. She said: Who is Hisham? He said: Ibn 'Amer. She invoked Allah's mercy on him and spoke well of him. (Qatada said that he was one of the martyrs of Uhud.) I said: O Mother of the Faithful! Tell me about the character of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). She replied: Don't you read the Koran? I told you! She said: The character of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was the Qur'an. (That is, he behaved according to the Koran.) He said: Then I planned to get up and never ask for anything until I die. However, I changed my mind and said: Tell me about the nightly prayer of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). She replied: Do you not recite: O you veiled one? I replied: Yes! She further said: Allah, Exalted and Mighty, prescribed the night prayer at the beginning of this surah. So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and his companions performed this prayer for a year. However, Allah reserved the concluding verses of this surah in heaven for twelve months and sent them down at the end of that period, containing relief. Nighttime prayer has since become voluntary after being compulsory. He continued: I said: O Mother of the faithful! Tell me about the Witr prayer of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him! She said: We used to prepare his siwak and water for him. Allah caused him to wake up at the time He wanted to wake him up. He then cleaned his teeth with the stick, performed the ritual partial ablution and performed nine rakk'as, sitting only in the eighth. He remembered Allah, thanked Him, called upon Him and then stood up without saying the end of the prayer. He then performed the ninth raqqa, sat afterwards, remembered Allah, thanked Him and then recited the audible conclusion of the prayer. Then he performed two rakk'as and pronounced the conclusion while sitting. So these are eleven Rakk`as, my son. When he grew old, he performed nine Rakk'as for Witr prayer; first seven and then two, doing the same thing in the two Rakk'as as he used to do before. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) wished to continually perform the prayer he used to perform. However, if he was prevented from performing the night prayers by sleep or pain, he would perform twelve voluntary rakk'as a day. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) never read the entire Quran in a single night, prayed until morning in one night, or fasted for a whole month, except for Ramadan. He said: I then went to Ibn 'Abbas and told him what she had said. Then he said: She told the truth. If I could go to her or talk to her, I would have gone to her to hear it from her herself. He continued: I said: If I had known that you wouldn't come to see her, I wouldn't have told you. has never read the entire Quran in a single night, prayed until morning in one night, or fasted for a whole month, except Ramadan. He said: I then went to Ibn 'Abbas and told him what she had said. Then he said: She told the truth. If I could go to her or talk to her, I would have gone to her to hear it from her herself. He continued: I said: If I had known that you wouldn't come to see her, I wouldn't have told you. has never read the entire Quran in a single night, prayed until morning in one night, or fasted for a whole month, except Ramadan. He said: I then went to Ibn 'Abbas and told him what she had said. Then he said: She told the truth. If I could go to her or talk to her, I would have gone to her to hear it from her herself. He continued: I said: If I had known that you wouldn't come to see her, I wouldn't have told you.[Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1233]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him): Once a man asked the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) about the night prayer. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) told him: The night prayers should be performed two and two rak'as. If one of you fears that the morning has approached, then he should perform a single rakk'a so that the number of rakk'as he has performed becomes odd.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1239]

The hadeeth of Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him): Whoever performs night prayers should close them with the Witr prayer, for the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) often commanded this.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1244]

The Hadith of Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Our God, blessed and exalted, comes down to the lower heavens every night in the last third and says: Who calls on Me so that I may answer him? And who asks Me to give it to him? And who asks Me for forgiveness so that I may forgive him?  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1261]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever spends the nights of Ramadan in performing religious exercises out of faith and in the hope of Allah's reward, his past sins will be wiped out forgive.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1266]

The hadeeth of 'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her): One night the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) was performing the night prayers in the mosque; and some people performed the prayer behind him. The next night he prayed and the people multiplied behind him. On the third and fourth nights the people gathered, but the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not go out to them. The next morning he said: I saw what you did (yesterday). But what prevented me from going out to you is that I was afraid that At-Taraweeh prayers would be made obligatory on you! The narrator added: This happened in Ramadan.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1270]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him): Once I stayed overnight with my maternal aunt Maimuna, wife of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). He got up during the night, relieved himself, then washed his face and hands and went back to sleep. After some time he got up again, fetched the water skin, opened its throat and washed himself for the prayer in a moderate manner, that is, he did not use a lot of water, but he washed himself thoroughly. He then began to perform the prayer. Then I stood up and stretched so that I wouldn't give him the impression that I had been watching him the whole time. I washed myself for prayer and stood on his left side as he stood up again to continue praying. Then he led me to his right side. He performed thirteen Rakk'as in total. Afterwards he lay down and slept until his breathing became audible, which usually happened when he slept. Then Bilal came to him and called for prayer. The Prophet then performed the prayer without performing ablution (Wudu') again. In his supplication (Du'a) he used to say the following: O Allah my God, give me light in my heart, light in my eyes, light in my ears, light on my right side, light on my left side, above me Light, light beneath me, light in front of me, light behind me and give me light!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1274]

The Hadith of Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with them both: Once I was traveling with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and we reached a waterhole. Then he asked me: Won't you go down there, Jabir? I replied: Yes. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went down and I also went down into the waterhole. He (Jabir) further reported: The Prophet then went away to relieve himself. On my part, I prepared water for him for partial ablution. He then came, performed the partial ablution and began to perform the prayer with a single garment, the two ends of which he tied together. I stood behind him; but he took me by the ear and placed me on his right hand.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1285]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to utter the following supplication in his nightly prayer: O Allah my God, all praise is due to You. You are the light of the heavens and the earth. And all praise is due to you, since you are the sustainer of the heavens and the earth. And all praise is due to you, you are the Lord of heaven and earth and what is in them. You are the truth; Your promise is true, your word is true, the encounter with you is true, paradise is true, hellfire is true. O Allah my God, I surrender to you, I believe in you, I trust in you, I return to you in repentance, I fight with others because of you, and I take you as the judge of all things. So forgive me for all that I have committed and all that I manifestly do. You are my God. There is no god but You.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1288]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Wa'el reported that 'Abdullah said: I performed prayer with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). He prolonged the prayer so much that I almost did something bad. It was said: What did you almost do? He said: It occurred to me to sit and leave him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1292]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: It was reported to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) of a man who slept all night until the next morning. He said: This is a man in whose ears (or he said in whose ear) Satan has urinated.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1293]

'Ali Ibn Abu Talib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: One night, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) unexpectedly visited us, Fatima and me, and asked us: Will you not perform At-Tahajud prayers? I said: O Messenger of Allah! Our souls are in the hands of Allah. If He wants to wake us up, He will wake us up. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) left after I told him this. Then I heard him slap his thigh and recite the following verse: Of all creatures, man is the most quarrelsome. [Quran 18:54]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1294]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Satan ties three knots on the necks of each of you when he is sleeping, and closes each knot with the instillation, 'You have one very long night, so sleep!' Then when one of you wakes up and remembers Allah, the one knot will be untied. When he then performs ablution, two knots will be untied. And when he performs the prayer, all three knots will be untied. So he goes out cheerful and in a good mood, or else he starts his day grumpy and full of sluggishness.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1295]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Perform part of your prayers in your houses so that you do not turn them into cemeteries.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1296]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The parable of the house in which Allah is remembered and the house in which Allah is not remembered is like this living and one dead.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1299]

The Hadith of Zaid Ibn Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him): The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once built a small room out of palm leaves or mats. He went there to offer voluntary prayers. Then some men followed him to pray with him. They came again one night and waited for the Prophet, but he was late. When he did not come out to them, they began shouting with a loud voice and throwing pebbles at the door. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out to them in anger and said to them: What you have been doing constantly (in the last few days) made me fear that such prayer would be prescribed for you. So you should perform your prayers in your houses, for the best prayer to perform is your prayer in your own house, apart from the prescribed prayers.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1301]

The Hadith of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): Once the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) entered the mosque and found a rope tied between two pillars. Then he said: What is this? The people said: This is for Zainab. If she feels weary or tired while performing the prayer, she can hold on to it. Then the Prophet said: Untie it! Each of you should pray as long as you have the strength to do so. But if he becomes weak or tired, then he should sit.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1306]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If any of you feels sleepy during prayer, he should first lie down until his drowsiness passes is; for it may happen that if he performs the prayer in a sleepy state, instead of asking for forgiveness, he curses himself.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1309]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her): One night the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) heard a man reciting the Quran. Then he said: Allah have mercy on him! He reminded me of the verses so-and-so from Sura so-and-so, which Satan made me forget.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1311]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The one who memorizes the Quran is like a man who has a tied camel. If he pays careful attention to it, he will be able to hold it, and if he releases it, it will go away.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1313]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: What a wicked man who says: I have forgotten the verse so and so. But Satan made him forget him. Remember the Quran often, for it is easier to escape (from memory) than a camel from its shackle.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1314]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Recite the Quran again and again, for with Him in whose hand is the life of Muhammad, it (the Quran) is easier ( from memory) to flee like a camel from its shackle.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1317]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah has never listened to anything the way He listens to a Prophet reciting the Quran in a beautiful voice.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1318]

The Hadith of Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah said to Abu Musa: If you had seen me yesterday when I was listening to you reciting the Quran! It looks as if you were given one of David's Psalms, that is, you have a very beautiful voice like David himself.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1322]

'Abdullah Ibn Mughaffal Al-Musani (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited Surah Al-Fath (The Victory) once in the year of the conquest (of Mecca) while riding on his she-camel rode by repeating the words several times while reciting them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1323]

Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Once, while a man was reciting Surah Al-Kahf (the Cave) and had his mare tied next to him with two long ropes, a cloud overshadowed him. This cloud gradually approached, so that the mare began to be frightened. The next morning this man went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and told him what had happened. The Messenger of Allah said to him: This was the peace that was revealed because of the recitation of the Quran.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1325]

Abu Musa Al-Ash`ariy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The parable of the believer who recites the Quran is that of a citrus fruit that tastes good and smells good. And the parable of the believer who does not recite the Quran is that of a date that has no fragrance but tastes good. And the parable of the hypocrite who recites the Koran is that of a lemon balm that smells good but tastes bitter. And the parable of a hypocrite who does not recite the Koran is that of a coloquin which has no fragrance at all and tastes bitter.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1328]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: He who recites the Quran with excellence is one of the righteous messengers who are noble and virtuous. The one who recites the Quran while stammering because it is difficult for him will be rewarded twice.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1329]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to Ubayy: Allah has commanded me to recite the Quran to you. He said (Ubayy): Has Allah mentioned my name to you? He (the Prophet) said: (Yes,) Allah has mentioned your name to me. He (Anas) said: Then Ubayy began to cry.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1330]

Ibn Mas`ud (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said to me: Read me some of the Quran. I said: O Messenger of Allah, shall I read to you what was revealed to you? He said: I want to hear it from another. Then I read Surah An-Nisa' to him, and when I read the verse And what if we bring a witness from each people, and bring you (O Muhammad) as a witness against them? [Quran 4:41], I raised my head, or a man winked at me from my side, then I raised my head and saw his tears (that is, the tears of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) flowing).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1332]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When I was in Hims, some people asked me to read some of the Quran to them. I read Surah Yusuf to them. A man from these people said: By Allah! (The Recitation) This surah was not sent down like that. Then I said: Woe to you! By Allah! I read it to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and he said to me: Good!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1334]

Abu Mas'ud Al-Badriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever recites the last two verses of the Qur'an from Surah Al-Baqara (The Cow) in one night will be these be sufficient.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1340]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her): The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) sent a man to command a fighting force. He used to recite something from the Koran for his companions in prayer and then end with: Qull Huwa-llahu Ahad (Say: He is Allah, one and only...). When they returned, they reported it to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and he said: Ask him why he is doing this. When they asked him, he said: Because this is the attribute of the Most Merciful, and I love to recite these verses! Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Tell him that Allah loves him!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1347]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Never wish to be like others, except in two cases: a person to whom Allah gave the ability, the Qur'an to recite by heart, and with it he performs his prayers during the night and during the day; and a person to whom Allah gave wealth, and he spends it during the night and during the day.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1350]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Never wish to be like others, except in two cases: like a man to whom Allah has given him a fortune has given, which was used by him in a righteous manner; and like a man to whom Allah has given wisdom, and he acts according to it, and thereby teaches others (people).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1352]

'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reported: I heard Hisham Ibn Hakim Ibn Hizaam reciting the surah of (Al-Furqan), but in a different manner from the way in which I recite it. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had previously taught me their recitation. I was about to interrupt the man, but I waited until he finished reciting. Then I held him by his robe and brought him to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). I said: O Messenger of Allah! I heard this man reciting the surah of (Al-Furqan) in a different reading than the one you taught me. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Leave him! And he ordered the man to read the surah to him. The man recited in the same reading that I heard him recite. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: This is how she was sent down. Then he said to me: Recite! I recited and he said: This is how she was sent down. This Quran was revealed in seven readings. So read out what is easy of it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1354]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Gabriel taught me the Quran in one reading. But I asked for several readings (to make it easier for the Arabs to recite the Koran) until they became seven readings.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1355]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Wa'el reported: A man named Nahik Ibn Sinan came to 'Abdullah and said: O Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman, how do you recite this following verse: min maa'in ghairi aasin or maa'in ghairi jasin? [Quran 57:15] Then 'Abdullah said: I remember all the verses of the Quran except this (verse). He (Nahik) said: I recite the entire last seventh (mufassal) of the Qur'an in one rak'ah. Then 'Abdullah said: (You then recite) just like the recitation of the poems. There are actually people who recite the Quran; but it does not exceed her collarbone. It is important when the Koran penetrates into the heart and then stands firm with it. The best part of prayer is bowing and prostration. I know the Surahs, similar in meaning or length, which the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited together. In every rak'a he recited two surahs of it. Then 'Abdullah stood up. 'Alqamah followed him and went out (with him). He (Nahik) said: He ('Alqama) mentioned them (the Surahs) to me.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1358]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Abu Ishaq said to us: I saw a man asking Al-Aswad Ibn Yazid while he was teaching the Quran in the mosque: How do you recite this verse of the Quran: (fahal min muddakir ) (So is there anyone who draws a lesson from this?) [Quran 54:15] Do you recite the word   muddakir with d or (mudsakir) with ds? Then he said: I heard 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud say: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) pronouncing it as muddakir with d.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1362]

The Hadeeth of Abu Ad-Darda (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Alqama reported: When we came to Ash-Sham, Abu Ad-Darda came to us and said: Is there anyone among you who, after reciting 'Abdullah recited? I said yes! I. He then asked: How did you hear 'Abdullah recite this (following) verse of the Qur'an: (wal-laili iza jaghscha) (At night when she covers)? [Quran 92:1] I said: I heard him recite thus: (wal-laili iza jaghscha) (By the night when it covers) (Wazzakari wal untha) (By the male and the female). Then he said: By Allah, I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reciting the same things. But these (people of Ash-Sham) want me to say (wama khalaq azzakara wal untha) (and by Him Who created the male and the female!), and yet I do not fulfill their demand.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1364]

'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the performance of prayer in the intervals between the morning prayer and the rising of the sun, and between the afternoon prayer and the setting of the sun lie in the sun.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1367]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No prayer should be performed during the period between the afternoon prayer and the setting of the sun, as well as between the morning prayer and the rising of the sun.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1368]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None of you should deliberately seek the times of rising and setting of the sun to perform prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1369]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When the first contours of the sun have become visible, wait until it has gained height before beginning prayer has; and when the last contours of the sun begin to disappear, wait until it has completely disappeared before beginning prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1371]

The Hadith of Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with her): 
Kuraib reported: 'Abdullah Ibn 'Abbas, 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Ashar, Al-Miswar Ibn Makhrama sent him to 'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet, and said to him : Greet her from all of us and ask her about the two rak'a after the afternoon prayer! Say to her: We have been informed that you are praying them, while we have already been informed that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) has forbidden them. Ibn 'Abbas said: I used to dissuade people with 'Umar Ibn Al Khattab. Kuraib further reported: I then went in and asked her the questions they sent me with. She then said: Ask Umm Salama! I went out to them and said what she said. They then sent me to Umm Salama with the same questions that I asked 'A'ishah. Umm Salama said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prohibiting them. Then I saw him praying these two rak'ahs. He did this after performing the afternoon prayers. He came to me while some women from the Banu Haraam of the Ansar were with me, and he prayed them (the two rak'a). I sent the servant to him and said: Stand up next to him and say to him: Umm Salama says: O Messenger of Allah, I hear you prohibiting these two rak'a. You pray them now! She said to the servant: If he points with his hand, step aside! The servant fulfilled the order. The Prophet gestured with his hand and she stepped aside. When he completed (his prayer), he said: O Bint Abu Umayya, you asked for the two rak'a after the afternoon prayer. Some people (from the tribe) of 'Abdul Qais came to me and informed me that their people had professed Islam. They occupied me with the two rak'ahs that one performs after midday prayers. So the two rak'a are the ones (which I have already performed).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1377]

The hadeeth of 'A'ishah: Abu Salama narrated that he once asked 'A'isha about the two rak'a that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said after the afternoon prayer cared for. Then she ('A'ishah) said: He used to perform it before the afternoon prayer. Then once he became so busy that he could not do it (before the afternoon prayer) or he forgot to do it (at that time). Therefore, he performed it after the afternoon prayer. Afterwards he performed them regularly in their time. If he performed an (additional) prayer, he also performed it regularly.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1378]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: During the lifetime of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), we used to pray two rak'ahs after sunset and before the evening prayer. Then a man said to me: Did the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) use to perform these two rak'ahs? Anas replied: He saw us when we prayed them and neither commanded nor forbade us to perform them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1382]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the caller finished calling for evening prayers in Madinah, the people stood to pray, preferring the proximity of the pillars as a place of protection, and then performed two rak'a after two rak'a . When the strange man entered the mosque, he believed that the (prescribed) prayer had already been performed because a large number of people were performing them (the two rak'a).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1383]

'Abdullah Ibn Mughaffal Al-Muzaniy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, repeating his words three times: Between the two calls to prayer there is another (voluntary) prayer. The third time he said: If anyone wants to do it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1384]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the prayer in fear with one of the two groups, praying one rak'ah while the other group turned towards the enemy gifted. Then the first group went to the place of the other group. When they (fighters for prayer) stood, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prayed one rak'a with them, then said Taslim (conclusion of prayer). Then each of the two groups prayed one rak'a for themselves.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1385]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I attended prayer with the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) in fear. He arranged us in two rows. There was a line behind the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and the enemy was in a place that was between our place and the direction of prayer (Makkah). The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allahu Akbar! (Allah is Greater) We also said the same. He bowed and we all bowed. He picked up his head, and then we picked up our heads. Then he prostrated himself, and so did the line behind him, while the line remaining faced the enemy to protect those praying. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prostrated and the row behind him stood up, the row behind him prostrated and then stood up. Then the row left behind stepped forward and the row ahead stepped back. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) bowed, and we all bowed. He lifted his head and we lifted our heads. He then prostrated himself, and so did the line standing behind him, which had previously remained at the first rak'ah, while the line that had remained behind faced the enemy. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the prostration, and when the line behind him did the same, the line left behind prostrated. Finally, at the end of the prayer, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: As-Salamu 'Alaikum! (Peace be upon you), and so we all said: As-salamu 'Alaikum! (Peace be upon you) Jabir said: (They protected each other) just as your protectors do with their princes today.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1387]

Sahl Ibn Abu Hathma, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, recited the prayer to his companions in fear. He arranged them in two rows behind him. He recited a rak'ah to the row behind him and then stood up. He remained standing until the other row, standing behind the first, prayed a rak'ah. This then stepped forward while the row at the front stepped back. He (the Prophet) prayed a rak'ah to her. He then sat until the row behind him prayed a rak'a, and then he said the Taslim (conclusion of the prayer).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1389]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We traveled with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) until we reached Zat-ar-Riqa'. There we came to a shady tree, which we left to the Messenger of Allah. An unbeliever came when the Prophet's sword (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was hanging on a tree. But he took the sword and drew it from its scabbard. He asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): Do you fear me? The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: No! The man asked again: Who will protect you from me? The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah protects me from you. But the companions of Allah's Messenger threatened the man. So he put the sword in its scabbard and hanged him. Then there was a call to prayer. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited two rak'ahs to a group. But she withdrew. And the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) also prayed two rak'ahs to the other group. So the Messenger of Allah prayed four rak'a and the others prayed only two.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 7, Ḥadīṯ no. 1391]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: If any of you wants to attend Friday prayers, he should perform Ghusl (full ablution of the body).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1393]

'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commanded (the Muslims) to perform total ablution of the body.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1395]

'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: When one of you comes to Friday prayers, he should first perform ghusl (full ablution) of his body.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1396]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Ghusl (full ablution of the body) on Friday is obligatory for every adult!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1397]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: People came in groups from their homes in Al-'Awali (the villages around Madinah) for Friday prayers. They wore outer garments that became covered with dust. Because of this, they smelled unpleasant. One of them came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) while he was at my home. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You should perform ablution on this day (Friday).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1398]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him): He (Ibn 'Abbas) mentioned the saying of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) about complete ablution on Friday.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1401]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Every Muslim is obliged to Allah to undergo a total ablution of the body every seven days, including the head and body washes.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1402]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever performs ghusl on Friday and then goes (to the mosque) in the morning will have the same reward as him , who sacrifices a she-camel. Whoever leaves in the next hour will have the same reward as the one who sacrifices a cow. Whoever leaves in the third hour has the same reward as the one who sacrifices a horned goat. Whoever leaves in the fourth hour has the same reward as the one who sacrifices a hen. Finally, whoever leaves in the fifth hour has the same reward as the one who sacrifices an egg. When the Imam appears, the angels come to listen to the sermon.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1403]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If you say (Listen!) to your companion (in the mosque) on Friday while the Imam is giving the sermon, then Did you just make a pointless joke?  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1404]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) spoke (of the features of) Friday and said (in this context): There is a period of time during this day in which there is no Muslim servant is in prayer and asks Allah for something without Allah giving him what he asks for.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1406]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: We are the last (in the revelation), but the first on the Day of Resurrection; only each ummah (community) (Jews and Christians) received their book before us, and we received our book at a later date. This is the day (Friday) that Allah has prescribed for us. Then Allah gave us guidance, and people are our followers: the Jews tomorrow (Saturday) and the Christians the day after tomorrow (Sunday).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1412]
Sahl, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: We took a nap and had lunch only after the Friday prayers. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1422]

Salama Ibnal Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We used to perform Friday prayers with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when the sun passes through the meridian. Afterwards we returned, looking for the shade of the afternoon.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1423]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to preach on Friday while standing, then sitting down, then standing up again, as they (Muslims) do today.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1425]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: While the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was standing up to deliver the sermon on Friday, a camel caravan arrived from Ash-Sham (Syria). Most people were very concerned that in the end only twelve men remained with the Prophet. Thereupon the following verse of the Koran was revealed, which deals with Friday: But when they see a bargain or a game, they immediately go to it and leave you standing [Quran 62:11]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ No. 1428]

The Hadith of Ya'la Ibn Umayya, may Allah be pleased with him: Safwaan Ibn Ya'la reported from his father that he (his father) heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, recite the following verse from the pulpit: And they will cry: "O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "You must stay." [Quran 43:77]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ No. 1439]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man entered (the mosque) while the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was delivering his Friday sermon. The Prophet said to him: So-and-so, have you prayed? When the man said no, the Prophet said: Get up and perform the (two) rak'ah!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1444]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used at dawn on Friday the Surah (Al-Sajda) which begins with the following verse: (Alif Laam Mim. The Revelation of the Book undoubtedly comes from the Lord of the Worlds), and to recite the Sura (Al-Insan), which begins with the following verse: (Was there not a time for man when he was nothing worth mentioning?).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1455]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): When he ('Abdullah) performed the Friday prayer, he would go home and perform a prayer there with two rak'ahs. He said that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to do it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 8, Ḥadīṯ no. 1460]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: I witnessed the prayer of breaking the fast with the Prophet of Allah Abu Bakr, 'Umar and 'Uthman. They all used to perform it (the prayer) first and then deliver the sermon. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came down (from the pulpit) after the sermon. I can still remember, as if I could still look at him, when he made hand signals for the men to sit and walked with Bilal through their rows until they (both) reached the women. Then the Prophet recited: O Prophet! When believing women come to you and swear allegiance to you that they will not associate anything with Allah... [Quran 60:12] The Prophet recited the entire verse to the end and then said: Will you swear to me ( that you will follow Allah's instructions)? Only one woman, who no one knew at the time, answered him by saying: Yes! O Allah's Prophet! He said: Give alms! And Bilal unfolded his robe and then said: Come here! May my parents be sacrificed for you! The women threw their rings in.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 9, Ḥadīṯ no. 1464]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood up on the day of the breaking of the fast and began to pray; then he gave the sermon to the people. When he finished this, he came down and went to the women. He admonished them while he leaned on the hand of Bilal, and Bilal in turn held open his robe; and the women threw in their alms.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 9, Ḥadīṯ no. 1466]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas and Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah Al-Ansariy, may Allah be pleased with them both: Ibn Guraig reported: 'Ata told me about Ibn Abbas and Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah Al-Ansariy that they said: There are both in the day There is (usually) no call (to the festival prayer) on the feast of breaking the fast or on the day of the feast of sacrifice. I asked him (‘Ata’) about it (again) after some time. Then he said to me: Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah Al-Ansariy told me that there is no call (to prayer) on the day of breaking the fast, both when the Imam goes out for prayer and after he goes out for prayer. On that day there is no announcement of the beginning of the prayer and there is no kind of call (to the festival prayer).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 9, Ḥadīṯ no. 1468]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), Abu Bakr and 'Umar both used to perform celebratory prayers before the sermon.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 9, Ḥadīṯ no. 1471]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to go out (to the place of prayer) on the Day of the Sacrifice and the Day of the Breaking of the Fast and perform prayer first. If he had already performed his prayer and said Taslim (the conclusion of the prayer), he stood up and then turned to the people while they were still sitting (in their rows) in their place of prayer. If he wanted to send a fighting force or order anything else, he gave them the order accordingly. He also used to say: Give alms! Give alms! Give alms! It was women who did this most. He then left the place.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 9, Ḥadīṯ no. 1472]

Umm 'Atteyya, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: He - she meant the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) - instructed us to take virgins who do not leave their familiar homes and who sit behind the curtains ( to go out for prayer on that day. He ordered menstruating women not to go to the Muslim prayer place.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 9, Ḥadīṯ no. 1473]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Abu Bakr came to me while two of the Ansar slaves were with me. They sang the poems with which the Ansar spoke to one another on the day of (the battle of) Bu'aith. However, they were not singers. Abu Bakr said: How can such a psalm of Satan be used in the house of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) while it is the day of the festival? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O Abu Bakr, every society has its festival, and this is our festival. (So ​​let them sing!)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 9, Ḥadīṯ no. 1479]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: While the men of the tribe of Habasha were practicing fighting with their spears in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him), 'Umar Ibnal Khattab entered. When he saw them, he stretched out his hands for small stones and wanted to throw them at them to drive them away. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Leave them alone! You 'Umar!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 9, Ḥadīṯ no. 1485]

'Abdullah Ibn Zaid Al-Mazni (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out to the mosque to pray for rain. When he took the direction of prayer, he turned his outer garment.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 10, Ḥadīṯ no. 1486]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) raising his hands until the bright spots on his armpits were visible.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 10, Ḥadīṯ no. 1490]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man entered (the mosque) on Friday through a door opposite the Courtyard, with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) preaching standing. The man stopped in front of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, the cattle have died and we are cut off from the outside world, so ask Allah to give us salvation! Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) raised his hands and said: O Allah our God, give us salvation! O Allah our God, give us salvation! O Allah our God, give us salvation! Anas further reported: By Allah, there were no clouds or traces of them in the sky, nor any other signs, and there were no houses between us and Mount Sala', high or low, to hinder our view. Then a giant cloud appeared behind it - like a shield - which took up the middle of the sky, spread out and then gave rain. By Allah, we did not see the sun for a week. The following Friday, a man came through the same mosque door while the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was standing there delivering his sermon. The man stood before him and said: O Messenger of Allah, our goods have been destroyed and we are cut off from the outside world, so ask Allah to stop the rain! Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) raised his hands and said: O Allah our God, let it rain around us, not on us. O Allah our God, let it rain on us on heights, hills, depths of valleys and plantations. Then it stopped raining and we went for a walk in the sunshine.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 10, Ḥadīṯ no. 1493]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: On the days when there was a strong wind and the sky was cloudy, there was an expression of discomfort on the face of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). on him, to recognize. And he used to go back and forth. When it rained, he became happy and his uneasiness disappeared. When I asked him the reason (his discomfort), he said: I was afraid that it was a punishment that Allah would have brought upon my Ummah (community). He also used to say this when he saw it raining: O Allah, let it be a mercy!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 10, Ḥadīṯ no. 1495]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I won victory with the help of the east wind (As-Saba). 'Aad were destroyed by the west wind (Ad-Dabbur).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 10, Ḥadīṯ no. 1498]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: There was a solar eclipse in the time of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the prayer, standing for a long time; and when he bowed, he also did so for a long time. Then he raised his head and stood there for a long time, but it was shorter than the first time. He made the second bow very long, but it was shorter than the first time. Then he prostrated himself and then he stood up straight; He extended this standing position, but this was shorter than the first standing position. Then he bowed and extended this bow too; but that was shorter than the first time. He then lifted his head and stood up straight. He extended this erection, but it was shorter than the first time. Then he bowed and extended this bow too; but it was shorter than the first time, and finally he threw himself down. He finished the prayer when the sun shone again and spoke to the people, first praising and praising Allah, then saying: Verily, the sun and the moon are two of the miraculous signs of Allah. They do not become dark because of a person's death and life; So if you experience something like that, say takbeer, ask Allah (for salvation), pray and give alms! Then he continued: O community of Muhammad! There is none other than Allah Who is concerned when His servant commits fornication. O community of Muhammad! If you knew what I know, you would laugh little and cry a lot. O Allah be witness that I have told you (everything).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 11, Ḥadīṯ no. 1499]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed two rak'a (prayers) in which he bowed four times and prostrated four times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 11, Ḥadīṯ no. 1503]

The Hadith of Asma' (may Allah be pleased with her): Fatima reported that Asma' said: The sun was darkened at the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). I entered 'A'ishah while she was praying. I said: Why do people pray? She pointed her head in the direction of the sky. I said: Is this a sign (of something)? She said yes! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood for too long in prayer so that I almost fainted. I grabbed a water skin that was lying next to me and poured water over my head or face. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then left and the sun shone. He gave a sermon to the people. First he praised Allah and praised Him. Then he said: Now to the topic: I have now seen everything that I have never seen here in my place, including paradise and hell. It has been revealed to me that you will soon be tested in your graves, or just like those who will be tested with the sedition of the false Messiah. One of you will be brought and it will be said to him: What do you know about this man (the Messenger)? The believer or the strong believer - I don't know - will say: This is Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah. He has come to us with clear evidence and guidance. We listened to him and obeyed him. He will repeat this three times. Then he is told: Sleep well! We already knew that you believed in him after all. So sleep like a pious person! Regarding the hypocrite or the doubter - I don't know - he will say the following: I don't know. I heard people saying something, so I said the same thing.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 11, Ḥadīṯ no. 1509]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr Ibn Al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: There was a solar eclipse in the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then the call was made: As-Salatu Gami'a (Now come to a congregational prayer!) The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, bowed twice in the (first) portion of the prayer (Rak'a), then he stood up straight , and bowed twice in the (second) portion of the prayer (Rak'a). Then the sun shone again.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 11, Ḥadīṯ no. 1515]

Abu Mas'ud Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The sun and the moon are two of the miraculous signs of Allah. Through them Allah scares His servants to prevent them from going astray. Indeed, they do not become dark because of someone's death. So if you experience something like this, pray and ask until this is over from you!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 11, Ḥadīṯ no. 1516]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: There was a solar eclipse in the time of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then the Prophet stood up in horror and went to the place of prayer. As he did so, he was seized by the fear that the hour would arrive. When he reached the mosque, he stood up for prayer, prolonging the standing, bowing and prostration, which I have never seen him do in any other prayer. Afterwards he said: Verily, these miraculous signs sent by Allah do not occur because of the death and life of a person, but Allah sends them to inspire fear in His servants. So if you experience something like this, immediately turn to Allah to remember Him, call upon Him and ask Him for forgiveness (for your sins). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 11, Ḥadīṯ no. 1518]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Verily, the sun and the moon do not become dark because of the death and life of a person. Rather, they are one of the miraculous signs of Allah. So if you experience something like this, pray!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 11, Ḥadīṯ no. 1521]

Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: There was a solar eclipse in the time of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), on the very day that (his son) Ibrahim died. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The sun and the moon are two of Allah's miraculous signs. They do not become dark because of a person's death and life. So if you experience something like this, ask Allah (for peace) and pray until it passes.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 11, Ḥadīṯ no. 1522]

Usama Ibn Zaid, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: We were with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) when one of his daughters sent him a messenger saying that she was informing him that her child or son had died, and he should come to her. He (the Prophet) ordered the Messenger to return to her and say to her: Verily, everything belongs to Allah, whatever He takes and whatever He gives, and everything is predestined with Him! So let her persevere with patience in anticipation of Allah's reward. When she sent to him again the messenger that he should come by Allah, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood up, and Sa'd Ibn 'Ubada and Mu'az Ibn Gabal and I were with him, and we we went there. There the boy was laid in his lap, his breaths rattling as if they had been in an old waterskin. Then tears flowed from the eyes of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Sa'd said to him: What is this, O Messenger of Allah? He said: This is a mercy that Allah has placed in the hearts of some of His servants whom He has chosen. And Allah has mercy on only those of His servants who are merciful.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1531]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: When Sa'd Ibn 'Ubada was ill, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) called him 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn 'Ubada, Sa'd Ibn Abu Waqqas and 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud visited. When he entered he found him unconscious. Then he said: Is he dead? They said: No, O Messenger of Allah! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) wept profusely. When the people saw him crying, they cried too. Then he said: Are you not listening? Allah does not torment either with the tears of the eye or with the pain of the heart, but with this - and he pointed to his tongue - or He has mercy on him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1532]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Patience as such is only at the first shock!   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1534]

'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The dead person is tormented by the weeping of his relatives for him.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1536]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Mulaika reported: I was sitting next to Ibn 'Umar while we were waiting for the funeral procession of Umm Abban Bint 'Uthman. 'Amr Ibn 'Uthman was also next to him. Then Ibn 'Abbas came accompanied by a man who guided him Ibn 'Abbas. He probably showed him the place of Ibn 'Umar. He came and sat next to me so that I sat between the two. Suddenly a voice was summoned from the house. Then Ibn 'Umar - as if urging 'Amr to forbid the people in this house from wailing - said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: The dead will be accompanied by the weeping of his relatives tormented over him. 'Abdullah (Ibn 'Umar) said it in general terms. Ibn 'Abbas said: We were (one day) with 'Umar Ibnal Khattab, Prince of the Faithful. When we were in the desert he saw a man sleeping in the shade of a tree. He said to me: Go there and tell me about this man! I went and knew that he was Suhaib. I returned to him and said: You have commanded me to tell you about this man. He is Suhaib. He said: Let him follow us! I said: But his relatives are with him. Then he said: Even if his relatives are with him! Maybe Ayyub (another narrator) said: Let him follow us! As soon as we came (to Madina), the prince of the creditors was injured. Suhaib then came and said: O my brother! O my friend! Then 'Umar said: Did you not know or hear? Ayyub said that he may have said: Did you not know or did you not hear that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The dead person is tormented by the crying of his relatives in certain situations? 'Abdullah said it in general terms, while 'Umar limited it to specific situations. I then got up and went to 'A'ishah. I told her about what Ibn 'Umar said. She then said: No! By Allah, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) never said that the dead would be tormented by crying from any person. But he said that the disbeliever is more tormented by the weeping of his relatives, and that it is Allah Who causes laughter and tears [Quran 53:43] and And no burden-bearing soul shall bear the burden of another [Quran 17:15 ]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1543]

Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: The one who is loudly complained about will be tormented on the Day of Resurrection.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1549]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: When it was reported to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) that Ibn Haritha, Ga'far Ibn Abu Talib and 'Abdullah Ibn Rawaha were killed, he sat Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him. You could tell how sad he was. I looked at him through a crack in the (open) door. Then a man came to him and said: O Messenger of Allah, the women of Ga'far are weeping for him with a loud voice. He commanded him to go to them and forbid them from complaining. He left and then returned to the Prophet and told him that the women had not obeyed him. He ordered him to do the same again. He did so and came back to the Prophet and said: By Allah, I cannot dissuade them, O Messenger of Allah! I believed that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Go and throw dust into their mouths. But I said (to the man): Allah humble you. By Allah, you have not carried out the command of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Nevertheless, you grieved the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1551]
