Umm 'Atiyya, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: When we swore allegiance to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he made us promise that we would never lament loudly for the dead. None of us fulfilled that promise except five women. These are: Umm Sulaim, Umm-al-'Ala', the daughter of Abu Sabra, who is the wife of Mu'az, or the daughter of Abu Sabra and the wife of Mu'az.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1552]

Umm 'Atiyya, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: We (women) were forbidden (by the Prophet) from taking part in a funeral procession, but this (ban) was not strictly enforced.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1555]

Umm 'Atiyya, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) came to us (women) while we were washing the body of his daughter; He said: Wash them three or five times or as many times as you see fit with water and lotus, and to the last wash add camphor or something like it. When you're done with it, let me know. When we were done, we notified him; and he gave us his loincloth, saying, Wrap her in it last.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1557]

Khabbab Ibnal Aratt (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We migrated with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in the way of Allah and out of desire for the face of Allah. Therefore, Allah will provide our reward. There are some of us who died before taking any of their reward in this world. This includes Mus'ab Ibn 'Umair. He was killed on the day of the Battle of Uhud. Even for his shroud there was nothing available except a piece of cloth, and if you covered his head with it, his feet would remain bare, and if you covered his feet, his head would remain uncovered. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Cover his head and put Izkhir (a sweet-smelling plant) on his feet. But there are others among us whose fruit has become ripe and therefore they can pick it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1562]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was wrapped (when he died) in three white cotton sheets, under which there was no shirt or turban. As for the robe, the people doubted that it was bought for him (the Prophet) to be clothed in it. So they left the robe and wrapped him in three white cotton cloths. 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Bakr took it (the robe) and said: I will keep it so that I may be wrapped in it when I die. He further said: If Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, wanted to keep it for his Prophet, he would have wrapped it in it. Then he sold it and gave its price as alms.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1563]

'A'ishah, Mother of the Believers, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) died, he was covered with an ornamented robe.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1566]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Move quickly with the bier; because if it is a good (dead person), - perhaps he said - then you are doing something good for him; and if it is the opposite, you remove an evil from your neck.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1568]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever takes part in a funeral procession until the funeral prayer has been performed will be rewarded with a Qirat. And whoever attends until the funeral is completed will be rewarded with two Qirat. Someone asked the Prophet: How much are two Qirat? The Prophet replied: They are equivalent to two huge mountains.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1570]

Thauban, servant of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever performs the funeral prayer at a funeral will receive a Qirat as a reward. But whoever stays until the dead person is buried will be rewarded with two Qirat, one Qirat being the size of the mountain of Uhud.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1575]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A funeral procession passed by and the deceased was praised. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: It became due. It was then due. It was then due. Another funeral procession passed by and people made negative comments about the deceased. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: It has become due - or it is destined for him! It was then due. It was then due. Then 'Umar said: May my parents be sacrificed for you. A funeral procession passed by and people praised the dead man, then you said: It was due with that, it was due with that, it was due with that. And another funeral procession passed by, and people spoke disparagingly about the dead man, and you said: It was due with that, it was due with that, it was due with that. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: For the one you praised, Paradise was due. And the one you spoke negatively about was subjected to hellfire. You are Allah's witnesses on earth. You are Allah's witnesses on earth. You are Allah's witnesses on earth.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1578]

Abu Qatada Ibn Rab'iy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A funeral procession passed by the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He said: Either redeemed or been redeemed! The people asked: O Messenger of Allah, who will be saved and from whom will the salvation be? He replied: The believing servant of Allah will be delivered from the toils of this world. And from a sacrilegious person, fellow human beings, the towns, the plants and the animals are redeemed.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1579]

512. Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, announced to the people the sad news of the death of Negus on the same day that he died. He (the Prophet) went out with them to the prayer hall and said takbir four times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1580]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the funeral prayer for Negus Ashama. He said takbir four times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1582]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the funeral prayer at a grave after the dead person was buried. He said takbir four times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1586]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: A black woman (or a young man) used to make it his job to sweep the mosque. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once missed her and asked about her. They said: She died. He replied: Why didn't you tell me about it? It appeared that they were trying to make her look contemptuous. But the Prophet said: Show me her grave! When they showed it to him, he performed the funeral prayer for them and said: These graves are full of darkness for their inhabitants. Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, illuminates them for them because of my prayer for them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1588]

'Amer Ibn Rabie'a (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If you see a funeral procession, stand up until it passes by you or (until) the coffin is set down !  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1590]

Abu Sa'id (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When you go on a funeral procession, you should not sit down until the coffin has been set down.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1591]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: A funeral procession passed us. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood up because of this, and so we stood up too. We said: O Messenger of Allah, it is a funeral procession of a Jew! He replied: Verily, death is a state of dismay. So if you see a funeral procession, stand up!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1593]

The Hadith of Qais Ibn Sa'd and Sahl Ibn Hunaif, may Allah be pleased with them both: Ibn Abu Laila reported: When Qais Ibn Sa'd and Sahl Ibn Hunaif were in Al-Qadisiyya, a funeral procession passed them. Then they stood up. They were told that it was a funeral procession of an infidel local. They said: When a funeral procession passed by the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he stood up. He was told that the dead man was a Jew. He replied: Was he not human?!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1596]

Samurah Ibn Gundab, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I performed the funeral prayer behind the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) for Umm Ka'b, who died in childbirth, with the Messenger of Allah standing in the middle (of the bier).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 12, Ḥadīṯ no. 1602]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You are not required to pay alms tax for property worth less than 5 wasaq (unit of measurement = 60 saa' of dates, etc.). .) amounts. This also applies to property that is less than 5 Zauad (unit of measurement = from 3 to 10 camels) or 5 Auqiya (unit of measurement = 40 silver dirhams)!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1625]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: It is not incumbent upon a Muslim to give alms to his slave or his horse.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1631]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) assigned 'Umar to collect alms. It was said that Ibn Gamil, Khalid Ibnal Walid, and Al-`Abbas, uncle of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), refused to give alms. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Ibn Gamil refused because he was poor, and Allah made him rich. As for Khalid, you do to him (Khalid). Wrong, (if they believe that he refuses to pay the alms tax.) He bequeaths his shields and equipment in the way of Allah. Regarding Al-`Abbas, I will give alms double in his place. Then he said: O 'Umar, don't you know that a man's uncle is just like his father?  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1634]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) made Zakatu-l-Fitr (alms tax to the needy on the occasion of breaking the fast) obligatory during the fasting month of Ramadan in the form of a unit of dates or a unit of barley to be given out to every person (in the household), whether free or slave, male or female of the Muslims.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1635]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: We used to take Zakatu-l-Fitr (alms tax to the needy on the occasion of breaking the fast) as one Saa' (measurement) of food, one Saa' of barley, one Saa' of dates Saa` powder milk or one Saa` raisins to pay.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1640]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave instructions that Zakatu-l-Fitr should be paid before people go to the festival prayer .  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1645]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There is no one who has gold or silver and does not pay their share (alms tax) without giving him plates of fire on the Day of Allah Resurrection will be spread, which will be heated in hellfire. Then his side, his forehead and his back are burned with them (the plates). Every time they get cold, they get heated up again for him. All this will happen in a day whose extent will be fifty thousand years until it is decided between the servants. Afterwards he sees his way either to paradise or to hell. Then it was said to him: O Messenger of Allah, what is the case with camels? He said: Anyone who owns camels and does not give their share - which includes giving some milk on the day of their watering - will be thrown to the furthest ground on the Day of Resurrection. All his camels - not a single son of camels will not be there - will tread on him with their hooves and bite him with their mouths. Every time the first of them passes by him, the last one is led to him again on a day whose extent is fifty thousand years until it is decided between the servants (of Allah). Afterwards he sees his way either to paradise or to hell. It was then said: O Messenger of Allah, what is the case with cows and sheep? Then he said: Anyone who owns cows or sheep and does not give their share will be thrown to the farthest place on the Day of Resurrection. Among these there are no crooked-horned, no-horned, or split-eared sheep. They will all push him with their horns and trample him with their hooves. Every time the first of them passes by him, the last one is led to him again in a day whose extent is fifty thousand years until it is decided between the servants. Afterwards he sees his way either to paradise or to hell. Then it was said to him: O Messenger of Allah, what is the case with horses? He said: Horses are divided into three groups: They can be a burden or a security to their owner, or they can bring him reward. The man whose horses are a burden to him keeps them out of pomposity, pride and enmity against the Muslims. So they will be a burden to him. The man whose horses are his security keeps them in the path of Allah, does not forget to fulfill his duties to Allah and does not overwork them. So they are a backup for him. The man whose horses will bring him reward keeps these animals for the sake of Allah for the sake of the Muslims. He binds them in the pasture or garden so that they can eat, and whatever they eat from that pasture or garden is credited to the owner as good deeds. Their dung and dung are also credited to him as good deeds. And when the horses break their rope and gallop over one or two hills, their tracks and their dung are counted as good deeds to the horse owner. And if their owner leads them to a river and lets them drink, that too is credited to him. Finally he was asked: O Messenger of Allah, what is the case with donkeys? He replied: Nothing was revealed to me about donkeys, except the following universal Quranic verse:Whoever has done an atom's weight of good will see it on the Day of Judgment, and whoever has done an atom's weight of evil will see it too! [Quran 99:7]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ No. 1647]

Abu Zarr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I went to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) while he was sitting in the shadow of the Ka'bah. When he saw me, he said: You are the biggest losers, by The Lord of the Ka'bah! I came and sat. But it didn't take long before I got up again. Then I said: O Messenger of Allah, may my father and mother be sacrifices for you! Who are you? He said: They (the losers) are the ones who have more money, except so-and-so who (donates) forward, backward, right and left. But there are few such people. If someone owns camels, cows or sheep and does not pay alms tax for them, then on the Day of Resurrection they will come the largest and fattest and will poke him with their horns and tread on him with their hooves. Every time the last of them passes him, the first is led back to him until it is decided between the people.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1652]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If I had a mountain of gold the size of Uhud, I would not want to keep one dinar of it for more than three days , except for one dinar, which I need to pay off my debts!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1653]

The Hadith of Abu Zarr (may Allah be pleased with him): Al-Ahnaf Ibn Qais said: When I was sitting in Madinah in a circle of the dignitaries of Quraish, there came a man who had rough clothes, coarse face and coarse skin. He stood before them and said: Announce to those who hoard money and do not use it in the way of Allah, that a stone heated in Hellfire will be placed on their nipple until it emerges from the cartilage of their shoulders; and that it (the stone) is placed on the cartilage of her shoulders until it comes out of her nipple, etc. The people turned their heads away from him and made no answer. He then turned his back (on them) and I followed him. Finally he sat at a pillar (in the mosque). I said: I saw that these people detested everything you said to them. Then he said, These have no understanding. My friend Abu-l-Qasim (the Messenger), may Allah bless him and grant him peace, once asked me to come to him, and I came. Then he said: Do you see (the mountain of) Uhud? I saw the sun above me and believed that he wanted to commission me to do something for him. So I said: Yes, I see him. Then he said: If I had a mountain of gold the size of this (Uhud), I would not be satisfied if I only kept three dinars of it with me (that is, he is satisfied only if he donates all this gold). And these (people) (unfortunately) only care about accumulating wealth in this world, they understand nothing. I (Al-Ahnaf) said: What is wrong with you and your brothers of Quraysh? Why don't you order or take anything from them? He then said: No! By your God, I will not order anything from them that concerns this world. Nor will I ask them about anything related to religion until I meet Allah and His Messenger.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1656]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) narrated that Allah, the Most Blessed and Exalted, said: O son of Adam, donate so that I may donate for you! He (the Messenger of Allah) also said: The right hand of Allah is filled (with bounty). Ibn Numair said: It (His hand) is full and generous day and night, so that nothing can diminish (its generosity).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1658]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man from Banu 'Uzra promised his slave freedom after his death. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) heard about this, he asked (the man): Do you have any other property besides him? He said: No! Then he (the Messenger) said: Who will buy him (the slave) from me? Nu'aim Ibn 'Abdullah Al-'Adawiy bought it for eight hundred dirhams. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then gave him (the man) the money and said: Start with yourself and give yourself alms! If there is surplus, give it to your loved ones! If your relatives have something in more abundance than necessary, then give it to your relatives! The same applies to your relatives, etc. Then he said: (Spend) forward, to the right and to the left! (i.e., that he should give alms to those who come to him and then to the people next to him.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1663]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Abu Talha was the richest among the Ansar in Madinah. Of all his possessions, he liked his Bairaha garden, which was directly opposite the mosque, the best. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to visit his garden and drink its sweet water. As the Qur'anic verse: You will not attain goodness (piety) until you donate of what you love. [Quran 3:92], Abu Talha went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: Allah says in His Book: You will not attain goodness unless you spend of what you love. ..and the possession I love the most is Bairaha. Therefore, I offer it as alms to Allah and hope only for good and reward from Him. O Messenger of Allah, you may decide how Allah guides you. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Well, this is a very profitable possession, this is a very profitable possession. I heard what you said, and I think you should divide it among your relatives. So Abu Talha divided that palm grove among his relatives and the descendants of his paternal uncle.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1664]

The Hadith of Maimuna Bint Al-Harith (may Allah be pleased with her): Kuraib reported: Maumuna released a female slave at the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). When she reported it to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he said: If you had given it to your maternal uncles, your reward would have been greater.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1666]

Zaynab (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Women! Give alms, even if it is from your jewelry! I went to (my husband) 'Abdullah and said to him: You are a poor and needy person, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) has commanded us to give alms. So go to him and ask him if it counts as alms if I give you something, otherwise I can also give it to someone else. 'Abdullah said: You should go and ask him yourself. So I went to him and found a woman from the Ansar already at the door of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), who had come for the same reason as me. But we hesitated to go in because of the dignity and majesty of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Meanwhile, Bilal, may Allah be pleased with him, came out and we said to him: Please go to Allah's Messenger (may Allah be pleased with him) and tell him that two women have come and want to know whether it counts as alms if donate to their husbands and to the orphans under their care, but don't tell him who we are. Bilal (may Allah be pleased with him) went to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and explained our case to him. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) asked: Who are they? Bilal, may Allah be pleased with him, said: One is from the Ansar and the other is Zainab. He asked: Which Zainab is it? He replied: Abdullah's wife. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: They will receive a double reward: once for (kindness to) relatives and once for alms.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1667]

Umm Salama, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: I said: O Messenger of Allah, am I entitled to the reward (of Allah) if I take care of the children of Abu Salama (my late husband)? They cannot be left uncared for or run back and forth (in search of livelihood). After all, they are my children? He (the Prophet) said: Yes, you have the reward for every expense you have made for them. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1668]

Abu Mas'ud Al-Badriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If a person sincerely spends on his family in the hope of Allah's retribution, this will happen to him counted as alms in his favor.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1669]

Asma', may Allah be pleased with her, reported: I said: O Messenger of Allah, my mother came to me seeking my favor. Should I accommodate her so that I can maintain the kinship bond with her? He said: Yes!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1670]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: A man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, my mother died suddenly and did not make a will. I think if she had been able to speak, she would have given alms. Will she be rewarded if I give alms for her? Then he said: Yes!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1672]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: It is incumbent on every Muslim to give alms. It was said: And what if you have nothing? He said, Let him work with his hands and earn something that will benefit himself and give alms. (People) asked: What if you can't find a job? He replied: He should then help a disabled person in his time of need! It was said: And what if you can't do it? He answered: He should then command what is right or invite what is good. The question was then asked: And what if you don't do it? Then he said, Let him then keep away from evil; for this is alms from him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1676]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Every person is required to give alms for each member of his body every day: to judge fairly between two (persons) is alms. To help a man with his mount by lifting him up or loading his things is alms. Even a good word is a charity. And every step he takes to pray is alms; to remove evil from the path is alms. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1677]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No day begins that people receive in the morning without two angels being sent down (to the earth) by one of the two says: O Allah our God, give the stingy man ruin (in his wealth)! And the other says: O Allah our God, give a (good) replacement to the generous! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1678]

Haritha Ibn Wahb (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Give alms; for a time will come when a man will go about with his alms, and when he offers it to another (man), he will say: If you had come with it yesterday, I would have accepted it from you; But today I no longer need it. So the man will not find anyone to accept his alms.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1679]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: A time will surely come to people when a person will go around with his donation of gold and will not find anyone to take it from him accepts; and it is seen that the one man is followed by forty women, who seek shelter from him, because of the fewness of the men and the multitude of the women.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1680]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The Hour (of the end of the world) will not come until the wealth increases to such an extent that it abounds, and that man goes around with his alms tax and finds no recipients to pay it, and also until the land of the Arabs becomes meadows and rivers again. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1681]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If someone gives alms from a lawful way - and Allah does not accept anything other than lawful - then the Most Merciful takes it with His own right hand, even if it is a date. Then it (alms) will be raised in the hand of the Most Merciful until it becomes greater than a mountain, just as the one of you who raises his colt.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1684]

'Adiy Ibn Hatim (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saying: Whoever of you can prevent the punishment of Hellfire should do so, even if it is by half a date (as alms) would be.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1687]

Abu Mas`ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When we were ordered to give alms, we worked as burden bearers so that we could donate something. Abu 'Aqil gave alms for half a Saa' (unit of measurement). And then another person came and gave more (alms). Then the hypocrites said: Allah is not dependent on the alms of that man (Abu 'Aqil). Besides, the other person only did this to be seen by people. Then the following verse of the Qur'an was revealed: Those who scold those believers who freely give alms, as well as those who find nothing (to give) except their own efforts. [Quran 9:79]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ No. 1692]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If a man gives a family a she-camel that gives milk early in the morning and in the evening, which fills a drinking bowl, then is the reward (for this gift) tremendous.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1693]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade certain things and mentioned such things. Then he said: If anyone gives a mount that suckles, it brings alms (to its owner) early in the morning and in the evening through the milk that is given in the morning and in the evening.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1694]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The parable of a miser and a generous person is like that of two men with armor that goes from their chests to their necks enough, are girded. Each time the generous person donates something, the armor expands and covers his body until it covers his fingertips and hangs down to the ground, covering his tracks. And every time the miser decides not to give anything away, each link of his harness tightens around his body and he tries to loosen it, but he cannot.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1695]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A man said: I will give alms this evening. He took the alms with him and went out. Then he gave it to a whore. In the morning (the people said): Alms was given to a harlot last night. Then he said: O Allah my God, all praise is to You (that I gave alms to someone), even if it is for a whore. I'll give a (different) alms. He took the alms with him and went out. Then he gave it to a rich man. In the morning the people said: Alms was given to a rich man last night. Then he said: O Allah my God, all praise is to You (that I gave alms to someone), even if it is for a rich man. I'll give another alms. He took the alms with him and went out. Then he gave it to a thief. In the morning the people said: Alms was given to a thief last night. Then he said: O Allah, all praise is to You, that I gave alms to a whore, a rich man and a thief. Then (the angels) came to him and it was said to him: Your alms has been accepted (by Allah). As for the whore, perhaps she abstains from fornication. Perhaps the rich man will be admonished and donate from what Allah has given him. Regarding the thief, perhaps this means he abstains from stealing.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1698]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: The Muslim trustworthy treasurer who gives (alms to the poor) completely, completely, and generously - or perhaps he said handed over, is one of the charitable ones.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1699]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If a woman donates from the food of her household without causing hardship, she will receive her reward for her donation (from Allah), and her husband is due a reward for what he sent ahead; and the same for the warehouse manager. One person does not reduce anything from the wages of another.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1700]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A woman must not fast while her husband is present unless with his permission. Furthermore, she may not allow anyone to enter his home while he is present, unless with his permission. And whatever donation she makes from his money without his permission, half of the reward will go to him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1704]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever donates the same thing twice in the way of Allah will be called to him in Paradise (on the Day of Judgment): O servant of Allah , that was good! Whoever once belonged to those who prayed (in this world) is called to enter through the gate of prayer. And whoever once belonged to the people of the holy battle will be called to enter the gate of the holy battle. And whoever was among the donors will be called to enter through the gate of alms. And whoever was fasting will be called to enter through the Ar Rayyan Gate. Abu Bakr As-Siddiq said: O Messenger of Allah! It is unanimous for the one who is called to enter through one of these gates. Will there also be some who will be called out to enter through all these gates? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: Yes! And I hope that you will be one of them!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1705]

Asma' bint Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: Donate, give, or bestow. Do not count what you donate, lest Allah make things difficult for you.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1708]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) used to say: You Muslim women! No neighbor should consider it small what she wants to give to her neighbor, even if it is the foot of a sheep.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1711]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Seven enjoy the protection of Allah (on the Last Day) when there is no shadow except His protection: These are: A righteous ruler; a young man who spent his youth in worship and service to Allah, the Almighty and Exalted; the one whose heart is constantly attached to the mosque; two people who love each other for Allah's sake - they joined together for His sake and separated for His sake; someone who is invited to sin by a charming and pretty woman but refuses, saying he fears Allah; one who gives alms without making a fuss, so that his left hand does not know what his right hand has given; and one who remembers Allah in solitude, so much so that his eyes overflow.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1712]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man came to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, which charity is best? He answered: That you give alms while you are still healthy and insist on your possessions, fearing poverty and hoping for wealth, and that you do not wait until the soul is stuck in your throat just before it leaves the body and you now say : for so-and-so so much and for so-and-so so much, and in fact the alms had now been given to so-and-so (the heirs).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1713]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) delivered a speech from the pulpit and mentioned almsgiving and refraining from begging; he said: The upper hand is better than the lower hand; for the upper hand is the giver and the lower hand is the beggar.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1715]

Hakim Ibn Hizam (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The best alms is that which one gives after satisfying one's needs; and the upper hand is better than the lower hand. Start with the one you are entertaining. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1716]

Mu'awiyah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Verily I am like a treasurer. If I like to give (something) to someone, then it will be blessed for them. But if I give someone (something) at his request and desire, then he is like the one who eats but is not satisfied.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1719]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Poor is not the one who goes around among the people with one or two pieces of bread, or with one date, or with two Dates are sent away. They (the people) asked: Who is the poor man, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Rather, he is poor who cannot find a way out of distress; he is the one to whom no one will pay attention to give him alms; But he is also not the one who begs the others.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1722]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: One of you will not stop begging until he meets Allah (on the Day of Resurrection) and not a scrap of meat will have in his face. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1724]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: The one of you who goes early in the morning and collects firewood and carries it on his back, then gives alms (from his proceeds) and so that people do not need it, is better than the one who begs a man who either gives him (something) or does not give him (something). The top hand is always better than the bottom hand. Start with the one you are entertaining.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1727]

'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) gave me something, I used to say to him: Give it to the one who needs it more than me. Once he gave me money. Then I said: Give it to the one who needs it more than me! But the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Take it! If any of this is offered to you without asking or begging, take it. But if this is not the case, do not degrade yourself for it. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1731]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The heart of an old man remains young with two things: the love of possessions and wealth and the love of long life.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1734]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The son of Adam is advancing in age, and with him two things are also advancing: the desire for possessions and the desire for a long time Life.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1736]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If the son of Adam had two valleys of money, he would wish for a third. And nothing can fill the belly of the son of Adam except sand; and Allah has mercy on the one who repents and abstains from his evils.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1737]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: If the son of Adam owned a valley full of money, he would have liked to have a second valley with it. And nothing can fill the soul of the son of Adam except sand; and Allah has mercy on the one who repents and abstains from his evils. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1739]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Being rich is not the possession of many goods, but rather being rich consists of the virtue of frugality that a person has for himself Own power.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1741]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood up and delivered a sermon to the people, saying: By Allah! I fear for you, people, nothing other than what Allah gives you from the adornments of this world. Then a man said: O Messenger of Allah, can good bring evil? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was silent for a while. Then he asked: What did you say? He said: I said: O Messenger of Allah, can good bring evil? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Good brings nothing other than good. Of what spring sprouts, there are plants that will either cause death to anyone who overeats them or bring him close to death. This affects all but one herbivore, who eats until full. Then he turns toward the sun, simply defecates, urinates, chews again, and then eats again. So whoever takes money that he has a right to, it will be blessed for him. But whoever takes money without having any right to it is like the one who eats but is not satisfied. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1742]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Some people from the Ansar begged the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and he gave them. They begged him again, and he continued to give to them until everything he had ran out; Then he said to them, If I had any goods, I would never withhold them from you. And whoever is frugal, Allah will give him plenty. Whoever behaves patiently, Allah gives him the strength to do so. No one is given anything better and more abundant than patience.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1745]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O Allah my God, give food to the family of Muhammad.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1747]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I was traveling with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He was dressed in a burda (an outer garment) made of Nahgran, which had a wide, strong hem. A Bedouin approached him and tugged at his robe. His tearing was so strong that the hem of the burda left a mark on the shoulder of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Bedouin shouted: O Muhammad, give me some of Allah's property that is with you! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) turned to him. Then he smiled and ordered something to be given to him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1749]

Al-Miswar Ibn Makhrama (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) distributed some outer garments and gave none of them to Makhrama. Then Makhrama said: O my son, go with us quickly to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). I went away with him. Then he said, Come in and let him come out to me. I then let him come to him. He (the Messenger) came out. He was wearing one of the robes. He said: I hid this for you. He looked at him and said: Makhrama is happy.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1750]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When Allah gave Hunain (some of the property of Hawazin) to His Messenger as a booty on the day of battle, and the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) gave a hundred men of Quraish to him When camels began to be given, some people from the Ansar said: May Allah forgive the Messenger of Allah! He (the Messenger) gives (the people of) Quraish and leaves us while their blood is still dripping from our swords. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was informed of their saying, he summoned the Ansar and gathered them together in a tent made of tanned leather. As they gathered, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to them and said: What a saying is what was told to me! Then the scholars of Ansar said to him: O Messenger of Allah, the intelligent people among us said nothing. But the younger people among us said: May Allah forgive His Messenger! He gives (the people of) Quraish and leaves us while their blood is still dripping from our swords. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I am giving to men who have not disbelieved for a long time, in the hope that these people will be won over to the cause of Islam. Aren't you happy when people return with wealth and you return to your homes with the Messenger of Allah? By Allah, what you bring with you when you return is better than what they bring with you when they return. They said: Yes, Messenger of Allah! We are satisfied. He then said: You will find strong favor (after my death). Be patient until you meet Allah and His Messenger! I will stand at the pool (on Judgment Day). Then they said, We will endure patiently.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1753]

'Abdullah Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) conquered Hunain, he distributed the spoils and gave them to those whose hearts he wanted to win. He was then informed that the Ansar wished to take some of what these people received. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood up and delivered a sermon to them. He praised Allah and praised Him. Then he said: Your Ansar! Did I not find you astray, and then Allah guided you through me? Did I not find you poor, and Allah made you rich through me? Did I not find you divided, and Allah united you through me? And they (the Ansar) said: Allah and His Messenger are more benevolent. Aren't you answering me? They said: Allah and His Messenger are more benevolent. Then he said: You said so-and-so when so-and-so happened. - and he mentioned some things which 'Amr (another narrator) did not remember - Aren't you happy when the people go with the sheep and camels and you return to your homes with the Messenger of Allah? The Ansar are the lower garments, that is, they are too close to me, and the (other) people are the upper garments. If there had been no emigration, I would have been one of the Ansar. If people move through a valley or on a mountain path, then I choose to move through the valley or on the Ansar mountain path. You will receive favoritism after my death. So be patient until you meet me at the pool (on Judgment Day)!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1758]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: On the day of Hunain, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) favored some people (above others) in the distribution (of the spoils). He gave Al-Aqra' Ibn Habis a hundred camels and 'Uyayna the same. On that day he gave to some of the nobles of the Arabs and favored them in the distribution of the spoils. Then a man said: By Allah, this distribution lacks justice, and it is not from the desire of the face of Allah. I said: By Allah, I say this to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). I then came to him and told him what he (the man) said. Then his face turned red like blood (with anger) and he said: Who else will act righteously if Allah and His Messenger do not act righteously? He then said: May Allah have mercy on Moses! He suffered more than I did and yet he endured patiently. Then I said: I will certainly not convey anything to him afterwards.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1759]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: A man came to the Messenger of Allah in Al-Gi'rana on his return from Hunain. There was silver in Bilal's robe at that time, from which the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took it and gave it to the people. Then he (the man) said: O Muhammad, be just! He (the Prophet) said: Woe to you! Who else will be righteous if I am not righteous? But you are the failure and the loser if you think that I do not act fairly. 'Umar Ibnal Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, said: O Messenger of Allah, let me kill this hypocrite! Then he said: Allah forbid that people say that I kill my companions. When this (man) and his companions recite the Quran, it does not go beyond their larynxes, and they pass through (through Islam), just like the arrow that passes through the animal shot. (i.e. they fall away from the faith.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1761]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When 'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, was in Yemen, he sent to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, a piece of gold alloyed with dust . The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) distributed it among four groups: Al-Aqra' Ibn Habis Al-Hanzaliy, 'Uyayna Ibn Badr Al-Fazariy, 'Alqama Ibn 'Ulatha Al-'Ameriy, one of Banu Kilaab, Zaidu-l-Khair At-Ta'iy and one of Banu Nabhan. Quraish was angry at this and said: Why do you give to the nobles of Nagd and leave us (without giving us anything)? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I did it only in the hope that their hearts would be united. A man who has a thick beard, thick cheeks, deep-set eyes, high forehead and shaved head came and said: O Muhammad, Fear Allah! Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Who else will obey Allah if I disobey Him? Does He entrust the inhabitants of the earth to me, while you do not entrust me? When the man turned his back (and walked away), a man among the people, who was believed to be Khalid Ibn Al-Walid, asked (the Prophet) for permission to kill this (man). Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: From this man's descendants come people who recite the Quran, and it does not go beyond their throats. They kill the people of Islam and let the idolaters (live). These penetrate through Islam, just like the arrow that penetrates through the animal that was shot. If I were still alive until I saw these people, I would kill them just like 'Aad.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1762]

'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: At the end of time, people appear who are young and immature. They say words that seem best among people. They recite the Quran and it does not go beyond their throats. They pierce through faith (that is, they fall away from faith), just like the arrow that pierces through the animal shot. If you come across such, kill them! Whoever kills them will have his reward from Allah on the Day of Resurrection.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1771]

The Hadith of Sahl Ibn Hunaif (may Allah be pleased with him): Jusair Ibn 'Amr reported: I said to Sahl Ibn Hunaif: Did you hear the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) mentioning the Kharijites? He said: Yes! I heard him say: -and he pointed his hand towards the East - They are people who recite the Quran only with their tongues, and it does not cross their collarbones. They pierce through faith (that is, they fall away from faith), just like the arrow that pierces through the animal shot.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1776]

Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Al-Hassan Ibn 'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, took a date from the charity (as a child) and put it in his mouth; Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: Kich, kich (Bah, bah). Throw them away! Did you not know that we are not allowed to eat of the alms?  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1778]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Sometimes it happens that I come home and find a date on my bed when I put it in my mouth, I have concerns that it might be part of charity, and that's why I'm leaving it out.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1779]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once found a date and said: If I had no concerns that this date was for charity, I would have eaten it!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1781]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Barira gave the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) meat that was given to her as a donation. He said: For them it is alms, and for us it is a gift.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1786]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Beef was brought to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and it was said that it was given as a donation to the Barira. He said: For them it is alms, and for us it is a gift.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1787]

Umm 'Atiyya, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah be pleased with him, sent me a sheep, and I sent part of it to 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to 'A'ishah, he said: Do you have anything (to eat)? She ('A'ishah) replied: Nothing there except what Nusaiba sent us in the form of sheep's meat that you sent to her. He said: (Bring it here!) It has reached its destination!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1789]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to inquire about the food that was brought to him. If someone told him that the food was a gift, he ate it. If he found out that it had been given as alms, he would not eat of it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1790]

'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to say, when people brought alms to him: O Allah my God, bless them! And when the father of Abu Aufa came to him with his alms, he said: O Allah my God, bless the family of Abu Aufa.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 13, Ḥadīṯ no. 1791]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When Ramadan comes, the gates of Paradise will be opened, the gates of Hellfire will be closed, and the satans will be bound in chains.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1793]

Ibn 'Umar narrated: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said in connection with Ramadan: Do not fast until you see the new moon, and do not break your fast before you see it, and when its Sighting is not possible, estimate the time for it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1795]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When you see the new moon, fast. And when you see him again, break your fast. And if the sighting is not possible, then fast for thirty days.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1808]

596. Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None of you should fast for one day or two days before the beginning of Ramadan; unless he has usually started fasting days before, then he can fast that (one day).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1812]

Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) swore to stay away from some of his wives for a whole month. When twenty-nine days had passed, he went to them. He was told: O Prophet of Allah, you have sworn to stay away from us for a whole month. He replied: A month is (sometimes) twenty-nine days long.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1816]

Abu Bakra, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There are two months with which two festivals are associated. These months should never be considered incomplete months, even if they were 29 days long, because the wages of those two months are counted as if both months were complete. These months are Ramadan and Dhu-l-Hijjah. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1822]

The Hadith of 'Adiy Ibn Hatim, may Allah be pleased with him: When the Qur'anic verse: until the white thread from the black thread of the dawn becomes visible to you [Quran 2:187] was revealed, 'Adiy Ibn Hatim (to the Prophet) said: O Messenger of Allah, I put a white and a black rope under my pillow so that I can distinguish the night from the morning. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Your pillow is wide. (He was joking with him, implying that he misunderstood the verse.) This just means the darkness of the night and brightness of the day! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1824]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When the Qur'anic verse: And eat and drink until the white thread from the black thread becomes clearly visible to you [Quran 2:187] was revealed, they took one white and one black thread and ate until he could see the difference in color. That was until Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, sent down the dawn to supplement the verse. So it became clear what was meant by that (the threads). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1825]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Bilal calls during the night, so eat and drink until you hear the call to prayer from Ibn Umm Maktoum.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1827]

Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None of you should interrupt his suhoor (meal on the last part of the night before fasting) when he hears the call to prayer through Bilal hears: for he announces the time - or he calls - during the night, so that he can alert those who are praying and also awaken those who are sleeping. The dawn is actually not this way, but this way. He raised his palm and then spread his fingers. By this he meant that the dawn is not like fingers drawn together through which the light does not penetrate (the dark night), but rather like fingers spread apart through which the light penetrates (the white thread of twilight).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1830]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Eat the meal before dawn (in Ramadan); because this is a blessed meal.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1835]

Zaid Ibn Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We had the pre-dawn meal with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and then we rose to pray. Then Anas asked: And how long was the time between the two (eating and praying)? He (Zaid) replied: The time between the two was enough that one could recite fifty verses in it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1837]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: People will always prosper if they eat as soon as the fast is due.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1838]

'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When night falls and the day fades away and the sun sets, the fasting person breaks his fast.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1841]

'Abdullah Ibn Abu Awfa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: In Ramadan (the month of fasting for Muslims) we were traveling with the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace). When the sun had disappeared below the horizon, he (the Messenger of Allah) said: O so-and-so, come down and cook for us (sawik) (a dish of barley and water)! He said: O Messenger of Allah, we are still in daylight. He (the Prophet) said: Come down and cook (Sawik) for us! Then he came down, cooked the food (liquid) and offered it to the Messenger of Allah. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took the food, then said with a sign of his hand: When the sun sets on this side and night falls on that side, then the fasting person breaks the fast.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1842]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us to fast continuously and the people said to him: You are fasting continuously! Then he replied: My situation is different from yours; for I am nourished by (Allah) and my thirst is quenched (by Him).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1844]

Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah be pleased with him, forbade (us) to fast. As he gave this instruction, a man from the Muslims stood up and said: O Allah's Messenger, you are fasting continuously! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: And which of you is like me? My Lord gives me food and drink at night. Since they refused to maintain continuous fasting, the Prophet fasted continuously for a whole day and the Muslims also fasted with him. Then the Prophet continued his fast another day and the Muslims imitated him. Then they saw the new moon, and the prophet said: If the new moon had not yet appeared, I would have continued the fast. (He meant) He would have continued the continuous fasting as a punishment for them because they refused to stop the continuous fasting.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1846]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: While the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was offering prayers in Ramadan, I came and stood next to him and prayed with him. Then another man came and stood next to us and prayed. So it came about that a group of less than ten men formed up behind the Prophet. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) noticed that we were praying behind him, he shortened the prayer and then went to his house. There he performed his prayer in a way that he did not do with us (in the prayer place). The next morning we said to him: Did you notice us last night? He said: Yes, and that drove me to do what I did. In the last days of the month, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) fasted continuously. Some of his companions also fasted continuously. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said when he learned this: Why do some (men) fast continuously? You are not like me. By Allah, if the month had been extended for me, I would have continued the continuous fasting so that those who act strictly and fanatically in relation to the faith would have refrained from their (strict) fanatical behavior.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1848]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to kiss one of his wives while he was fasting. Then she laughed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1851]

'Umar Ibn Abu Salama (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): Is it permissible for a fasting person to kiss (his wife)? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Ask Umm Salama about it! When he asked Umm Salama whether a fasting person could kiss his wife, she informed him that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did so. 'Umar said: O Allah's Messenger, Allah has forgiven you for your past and future sins. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: By Allah, I am more pious than you! I fear Allah more than you!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1863]

'A'ishah and Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sometimes experienced during Ramadan that he would get up in the morning while still in the state of Janabah (the great ritual impurity). which was not caused by a dream, and yet he fasted.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1864]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, I am perishing! The Prophet asked: What causes you to perish? The man said: I fell on my wife (and had sexual intercourse with her) in the month of Ramadan (during my fast)! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Can you find a slave to ransom? The man replied: No! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked: Can you fast for two months in a row? The man replied: No! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked: Can you feed sixty poor people? The man replied: No! The man sat down. Then a bucket of dates was brought to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then the Prophet said: Donate these (dates)! The man replied: Should I give these, O Messenger of Allah, to another person who is said to be even poorer than us? There are no other people in the entire neighborhood who need them (the dates) more than my family! Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) laughed until his canine teeth were seen and said: Then feed your family with it!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1870]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: A man came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: (O Messenger of Allah), I caught fire! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Why? He replied: I had sexual intercourse with my wife on the day of Ramadan (during the period of fasting). He (the Prophet) said: Donate, donate! The man said: I have nothing to donate. Then he ordered him to sit down. Then two buckets of food were brought. After that, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered him to donate the two buckets.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1873]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out in Ramadan in the year of the conquest. He fasted until he arrived at Al-Kadid and then broke the fast. The Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to follow him in every new behavior (and so they followed him in these things).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1875]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: While the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was on a journey, he saw a man in the middle of a crowd being given shade. The Prophet asked: What happened to him? The people said: It is a man fasting! Then the Prophet said: It is not one of the virtues to fast while traveling!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1879]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) was asked about fasting in Ramadan while traveling. Then he said: When we were traveling with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), neither the fasting person reproached the non-fasting person nor the non-fasting person reproached the fasting person.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1884]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: We were on a journey with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Some of us fasted. But the others broke their fast. We then camped in one place and there was great heat (that day). Whoever had the most shade was the one who shielded himself under his own clothing. Some of us protected ourselves from the heat of the sun with our hands. Those who fasted (wanted to rest and) did no work, while those who did not fast pitched their tents and watered their mounts. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Those who broke their fast today have gone with their wages alone.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1886]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Hamza Ibn 'Amr Al-Aslamiy asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about fasting while traveling. He replied: If you want, you can fast on the journey. And if you want, you can do without it!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1889]

Abu Ad-Darda' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We went out with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in Ramadan, and it was too hot for each of us to put our hands on our heads. None of us were fasting except the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and 'Abdullah Ibn Rawaha.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1892]

Umm Al-Fadl Bint Al-Harith (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Some people who were with her on the day of 'Arafa were in doubt as to whether the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) fasted on that day or not. Some said: He is fasting. The others said: He broke his fast. To put an end to their argument, she sent for him a cup of milk while he was standing on Mount 'Arafat on his mount. He drank it (the milk)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1894]

Umm Al-Fadl (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When we were with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in 'Arafa, some of the Companions of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) were in doubt about fasting on the day of 'Arafa. For this reason, I ordered a cup of milk to be brought to him while he was at 'Arafat Plain. He drank it (the milk).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1895]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: In the pre-Islamic period the Quraish fasted on the day of 'Ashura'. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to fast on this day. After migrating to Madina, he fasted on that day and instructed (the Muslims) to observe the fast on that day. Later, when fasting was prescribed in Ramadan, he said: Whoever wants to continue fasting on the day of 'Ashura' should do so. And if you want to do without it, don't do it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1897]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: In the pre-Islamic period, people used to fast on the day of 'Ashura'. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) fasted on this day and so did Muslims before fasting was made mandatory in Ramadan. But when fasting was prescribed in Ramadan, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Ashura is one of the days of Allah, and whoever wishes to continue fasting on that day should do so. And if you want to do without it, don't do it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1901]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): Abdur-r-Rahman Ibn Yazid reported that Al-Ash'ath Ibn Qais once entered 'Abdullah's house when he was having lunch. Ibn Mas`ud said to him: O Abu Muhammad, approach the food! Then Al-Ash'ath said: Is not today the day of Ashura? Ibn Mas'ud replied: Do you know what kind of day the day of Ashura is? Al-Ash`ath asked: What? Ibn Mas`ud said: Rather, it is a day on which the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to fast before fasting was prescribed in Ramadan. Later, when fasting was prescribed in Ramadan, he refrained from fasting on that day.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1905]

The Hadith of Mu'awiya Ibn Abu Sufyan, may Allah be pleased with him: Humaid Ibn 'Abdu-r-Rahman reported: He (Humaid) heard Mu'awiya Ibn Abu Sufyan deliver a sermon in Madina when he was visiting Madina. Mu'awiya gave his sermon on the day of Ashura. He said: Where are your scholars, O inhabitants of Madinah! I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying about this day: This is the day of Ashura. Allah has not prescribed fasting for you on this day. I myself will fast. Whoever of you wants to fast on the day of Ashura, let him do so. And if you want to do without it, don't do it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1909]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to Madinah, he saw that the Jews were fasting on the day of Ashura. You were asked about it. They replied: It is the day when Allah saved Moses and the children of Israel from Pharaoh! So we fast on this day to glorify him. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: We have a greater right to Moses than you! Then he (the Muslims) ordered them to fast on that day.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1910]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Ashura Day was a day that the Jews revered and considered a festival. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said (to the Muslims): Fast on the day of Ashura!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1912]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them: Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, was asked about fasting on the day of 'Ashura'. He said: The day on which the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) fasted, and whose reward he most hoped for, was no day except this day ('Ashura'). The month in which he fasted, and whose reward he most hoped for, was no month but this month. And he meant Ramadan.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1914]

Salama Ibn Al-Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: On the day of Ashura, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent a man from the tribe of Aslam to say: Whoever has not eaten, should fast until evening. And whoever has eaten something (this morning) should also fast (the rest of the day).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1918]

Ar-Rubaiyi 'bint Mu'auwiz Ibn 'Afra' (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: On the morning of the Day of Ashura, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) sent (a messenger) to the villages of Ansar, who lay around Madina to proclaim this: Whoever has not eaten this morning should fast until evening. Anyone who has eaten something should also fast for the rest of the day. We fasted on the day of Ashura and also encouraged our children to fast. We went to the mosque and made toys for them out of wool. If one of them cried and asked for food, we gave it to him until it was finally time to break the fast in the evening.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1919]

'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: These are two days on which the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade fasting. It is the day on which you break your fast and the other day on which you eat of your sacrificial animals.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1920]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: There are two days when there is no fasting: the day of the Feast of Sacrifice and the day of breaking the fast after Ramadan.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1922]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: A man came to Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, and said: I have taken a vow to fast on a (certain) day which (coincidentally) coincides with one of the both days of the festivals (either the Feast of Sacrifice or the Feast of Breaking the Fast). Ibn 'Umar said: Allah, the Most High, commanded us to fulfill the vow, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade (us) to fast on one of these two days.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1924]

The Hadith of Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them: Muhammad Ibn 'Abbaad reported: I asked Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them, while he was walking around the House: Has the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) on him, (Muslims) forbidden to fast on Friday? He said: Yes, by the Lord of this house!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1928]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None of you may fast on Friday (except in Ramadan); unless he fasts (in addition) one day before (the Thursday) or after (the Saturday). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1929]

Salama Ibn Al-Akwa', may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When the verse of the Qur'an was revealed, And those who can endure it with great difficulty, as a substitute, feeding the poor is enjoined... [Quran 2:184], everyone was allowed , who did not want to fast, should break the fast and impose feeding a poor person as a substitute. But when the next verse of the Koran was revealed, he abrogated it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1931]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: In Ramadan I broke the fast on some days (because of menstruation) and could not make up for the missed days in any other month except Sha'ban, because in this month the Messenger of Allah fasts , may Allah bless him and grant him peace, very often.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1933]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If someone dies at a time when he is yet to fast, a close relative should fast in his place .  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1935]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: A woman came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: My mother died when she had one month left to fast. Then he said, If she had been in debt, would you pay her debt? She said yes! Then he said: A debt to Allah deserves more than any other debt to be paid.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1936]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: If one of you fasts on a day, he should not speak lewdly or behave foolishly; and if anyone insults him or fights him, he should say twice: I am a fasting person.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1941]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There is a gate in Paradise called Ar-Rayyan, through which those who fast will enter on the Day of Resurrection, and none other than them shall enter through. (On that day) it will be proclaimed: Where are those who are fasting? Then they enter through it. When the last of them enters, the gate is closed and no one enters through it after that.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1947]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever fasts for a day voluntarily and only for the sake of Allah, Allah will keep his face at a distance from the Hellfire because of that day far away, which has to be covered in seventy years.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1948]
