Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If the fasting person eats or drinks during the fast due to forgetfulness, then he should continue his fast; for Allah has given him food and drink with it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1952]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) never fasted for a whole month except Ramadan. He used to fast so continuously that one had to say: By Allah, he would never break his fast. Then he broke his fast in such a way that one had to say: By Allah, he would probably never fast again.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1959]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to fast in such a way that one had to say: He fasted, he fasted (and perhaps would never break the fast.) And he broke the fast in such a way that one had to say: He broke the fast, he broke the fast (and would probably never fast again.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1961]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr Ibnal 'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: It was once told to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) that I said: I will spend the night in prayer and during the day fast as long as I live! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: Are you the one who said that? I said yes! This is what I said, O Messenger of Allah. Then he said: You can't do it! Fast and break the fast! Sleep and then wake up at night (to perform prayers)! Fast three days a month, because you know the good deed will be rewarded tenfold, and it will be as if you had been fasting the whole time! I replied: But I can do more than that! Then he said: Then fast on one day and break the fast on the following two days. I said: But I can do more than that! He said: Then fast one day and break the fast the next. So David (Dawud), peace be upon him, fasted. And that is the best fast ever. I said: But I can do an even better fast! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No! There is no better fast than this at all! Then 'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr (the Narrator) said: If I accept to fast these three days which the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) mentioned, then I prefer it to my relatives and my wealth.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1962]

'Imran Ibn Hussain (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him or to another man: Did you fast on the last days of Sha'ban? He said: No! Then the Prophet said: If you did not fast (on those days), then you shall fast for two days.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1975]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: Some of the Companions of the Prophet were shown the signs of the Night of Power (Lailatu-l-Qadr) in a dream in the last seven days (of the month of Ramadan). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I see that your dream visions agree that this night coincides with one of the last seven nights (of the month of Ramadan). Whoever makes the effort can expect it in the last seven days (of Ramadan).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1985]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to retire to the mosque on the middle ten days of the month of Ramadan. But when twenty nights had passed, and the twenty-first night now came, he and those who were with him returned to their houses. Once he withdrew on the night he used to return home. Then he gave a sermon in which he commanded the people to do what Allah wanted. He said: I used to withdraw during these ten days of Ramadan. Then it occurred to me that I should withdraw for the last ten days. Anyone who has withdrawn with me will spend the night in their own place! And I saw that night (the night of Al-Qadr in which the Quran was revealed), but Allah made me forget it. Look for this night for the last ten nights, on the odd nights. I saw myself prostrating myself in the water and mud. Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy added: It rained on the twenty-first night, and the rainwater dripped from the roof of the mosque in the place where the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was offering prayers. I looked at him as he finished the morning prayer and found his face wet with water and mud.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1993]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Expect Lailatu-l-Qadr (the Night of Power) in the last ten days of Ramadan.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 14, Ḥadīṯ no. 1998]

Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to retire during the last ten days of Ramadan.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 15, Ḥadīṯ no. 2002]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to spend the night on the (last) days of (Ramadan) performing religious exercises and awakening his family (to participate). to engage more intensively in religious practices and not to have sexual intercourse with his wives. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 15, Ḥadīṯ no. 2008]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to engage in religious exercises much more intensively on the last days (of Ramadan) than on the other days.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 15, Ḥadīṯ no. 2009]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: Once a man asked: O Messenger of Allah, what kind of clothing can a man wear when he is in the state of ihram? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You must not wear the following: the shirt, the turban, the trousers, the burnus and the leather stockings; unless you can't find sandals. In this case, you can wear leather stockings, but only after you have freed them below the ankles by cutting off the leather. Furthermore, you are not allowed to wear any clothing that has traces of coloring from saffron or wars (a yellow plant).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2012]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying when he was giving the sermon: Whoever cannot find the loincloth may put on the trousers. If you can't find sandals, you can wear leather stockings. By this he meant the one who is in a state of consecration.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2015]

Ya'la Ibn Umayya narrated: Once a man wearing a long robe open from the front and showing traces of khaluq or sufra (yellow perfume) came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) in Al -Gi`rana and asked him: What ceremonies do I have to undertake on the visit trip? At that moment it was revealed to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He was covered with a cloth. I (Ya'la) said: I wanted to see the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) while it was being revealed to him. Then 'Umar called me and said: Does it make you happy to see the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when it is revealed to him? Then I went to 'Umar, who lifted one end of the cloth a little, and then I was able to look at the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). He was snoring. I (a later narrator) think he said: He snored like a young camel! Then he continued: When the revelation was over, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked: Where is the man who wants to inquire about the visit? After that man was pointed out to him, he turned to him and said: Wash off the Sufra or Khaluq and take off your robe. Then perform the same rites on the visit as you did on the pilgrimage!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2017]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: For the purpose of putting on ihram (accepting the state of consecration), the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) named Zul-Hulaifa for pilgrims as the place from which the residents of Medina put on ihram should. For the same purpose, he also named Al-Guhfa for the people of Syria, Qarnu-l-Manazil for the people of Nagd and Yalamlam for the people of Yemen. He said: These places are considered starting points not only for the residents there but also for the travelers who want to undertake the pilgrimage or the visit and have not yet put on ihram. But whoever is at a distance (from Mecca) that is closer to these places or is one of the inhabitants of Mecca, he should put on ihram from one of these places.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2022]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The people of Madinah should put on ihram when they reach Zul-Hulaifa. Those from Ash-Sham should put on ihram in Al-Guhfa and those from Nagd in Qarn. I then learned that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) also said: And the people of Yemen should put on ihram in Yalamlam.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2024]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Talbiya of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was as follows: (Labbaika-llahumma labbik. Labbaika la Sharika laka labbaik. Inna-l-Hamda wan-Ni' mata, laka wal-Mulk. La Sharika lak.) (O Allah, I have come to you in haste; there I am. Then I have come to you, you have no partner, and there I am. Verily, all praise is due To you, the grace is only from you, and the kingdom belongs only to you. You have no partners.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ-No. 2029]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: You claim that your Baydah is the place from which the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) placed ihram (the step into consecration). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) performed his ihram only from the place near the mosque; namely Dhul-Hulaifa.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2033]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: I perfumed the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he put on ihram and when he freed himself from it, before he went around the Ka'bah (the house). of Allah).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2040]

As-Sa'b Ibn Gathama Al-Laithiy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: He (As-Sa'b) gave a wild donkey to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) while he was in Al-Abwaa' or in Waddan was. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) refused to accept it. He further reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw the disappointment on my face, he said: We refused to accept him just because we are in the state of consecration.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2059]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: As-Sa'b Ibn Gathama gave the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) a wild ass while he was in the state of consecration. The Prophet refused to accept it and said to the man: If we had not been in the state of consecration, we would have accepted it from you.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2060]

Abu Qatada, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Once when we were going out with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, we arrived at Al-Qaha (a place between Mecca and Medina). Some of us were in a state of consecration for the pilgrimage, but others were not. I noticed that my companions were looking at something. So I took a look too. It was a wild donkey. Then I put the saddle on the horse, took my lance and rode on the horse. My whip fell down. I said to my companions who were in the state of consecration: Pass me the whip, please! But they refused and said: By Allah, we will not help you in the least. So I dismounted, took the whip and rode my horse again. Then I began to pursue the wild ass until I reached him (from behind) as he stood behind a hill. I stabbed him with my lance and cut his tendons. Afterwards I brought the prey to my companions. Some said: Eat of it!, but others said: Do not eat of it (because it is forbidden)! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was some distance ahead of us. I sped up my horse to catch up with him. When I caught up with him and asked about it, he replied: It's allowed! Eat of it!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2062]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saying: Four evil animals must be killed, regardless of whether one is in a state of ihram located or not. These are: the harrier, the crow, the rat and the vicious dog.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2068]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: It is not an offense to kill (certain) five animals, apart from whether they are found in the sanctuary in Mecca or whether one is in a state of consecration. These are: the rat, the scorpion, the crow, the harrier and the ravenous dog.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2073]

K'ab Ibn 'Ugra (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to me at the time of Al-Hudaibiyah while I was lighting fires under the cooking pots (Al-Qawarieriy said: It was a cooking pot and Abu Al-Rabi said: It was a stone pot. The lice crawled onto my face. Then the Messenger of Allah asked me: Are the vermin that are in your head harming you? I replied: Yes. Then he said: Shave your head and fast for three days, or feed six poor people, or sacrifice an animal to Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2080]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) underwent bloodletting while he was in the state of ihram.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2087]

Ibn Buhaina (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) underwent bloodletting in the middle of his head while he was in a state of ihram on the way to Mecca.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2088]

The Hadith of Abu Ayyub Al-Ansariy (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Abdullah Ibn Hunain reported: 'Abdullah Ibn 'Abbas sent me to Abu Ayyub Al-Ansariy, whom I found washing between the two poles of the well, with him behind him hidden in a robe. I greeted him. He said: Who is this? I replied: This is 'Abdullah Ibn Hunain. 'Abdullah Ibn 'Abbas sent me to ask you: How did the Messenger of Allah wash his head while he was in ihram? Abu Ayyub, may Allah be pleased with him, put his hand on the robe and lowered it until I could see his head. Then he said to the one who poured water: Pour me water! Then he poured water over his head. Abu Ayyub moved his head with his hands, moving his hands both forward and backward. Then he said: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) doing this.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2091]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: A man who was in a state of ihram fell from the back of his mount, breaking his neck and dying. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Wash him with water and lotus water, wrap him in his two cloths and do not cover his head; for Allah will raise him up on the Last Day (as a pilgrim), pronouncing the Talbiya.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2092]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: Once the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to Duba'a Bint Az-Zubair and said to her: Do you intend to go on the pilgrimage? She replied: By Allah, I intend to, but I don't feel well. Then he said to her: Then undertake the pilgrimage on condition that you say: O Allah, I release myself from ihram where You restrain me. She (Duba`a) was the wife of Al-Miqdad.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2101]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: We went out with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in the year of the Farewell Pilgrimage. We assumed the state of Ihram for a visitation trip. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Whoever has brought his sacrificial animal with him must undertake the pilgrimage and the visitation journey with the same ihram and free himself from the state of ihram only after performing both. When I arrived in Mecca I was menstruating. Therefore, I could neither complete the circuit of the Ka'bah nor the circuit between As-Safa and Al-Marwa, which I complained to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him). He told me: Dissolve your hair and comb it, accept ihram for the pilgrimage and now forego the visit! I did that. After we completed the pilgrimage, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent me with (my brother) 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Abu Bakr to At-Tan'iem and said: This is the place from which you can accept Ihram for your visit. So I also completed the visit trip. Those who accepted Ihram only for the visit performed the Tawaf around the Ka'bah and the walk between As-Safa and Al-Marwah. Then they liberated themselves from ihram and performed another circuit for the pilgrimage after returning from Mina. But those who wanted to combine the pilgrimage and the visit (that is, to undertake both with the same ihram) performed only one circuit.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2108]

'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with them) narrated: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered him to let 'A'ishah ride behind him so that they could perform the ihram of At-Tan'iem could lose weight.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2126]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We went with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) with the intention of only making the pilgrimage, while 'A'ishah came with the intention of making the visitation and to combine the pilgrimage with the same ihram. 'A'ishah menstruated in Zarif. When we arrived (in Mecca), we circumnavigated the Ka'bah and completed the run between As-Safa and Al-Marwa. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered those who did not have sacrificial animals with them to free themselves from the state of ihram. We asked (the Prophet): What kind of deliverance? He replied: Total deliverance. So we had sex with our wives, put perfume on ourselves and put on our normal clothes. This happened four days before 'Arafa (the 9th day of the month of Dhul Hija). Then we resumed Ihram on the day of Tarwija (the 8th day of Dhul Hija). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to 'A'ishah and found her weeping. He asked her: What's wrong with you? She replied: I have my period. Therefore, I did not break away from the state of ihram, even though people had already done so. And I did not walk around the Ka'bah while people are now going to perform pilgrimage. He said: This is a thing that Allah has prescribed for the daughters of Adam. So wash yourself and accept ihram for the pilgrimage! 'A'ishah did this and performed the rites of pilgrimage. And when she purified herself (of her monthly rule), she undertook the circuit of the Ka'bah and the course between As-Safa and Al-Marwah. The Prophet then said to her: Have you freed yourself from the state of ihram for both pilgrimage and visitation? Then she said: O Messenger of Allah, I feel that I performed the circumambulation of the Ka'ba only during the pilgrimage (i.e. I missed the circumambulation of the visit). Then the Prophet said: Take her, O 'Abdu-r-Rahman, and let her visit from At-Tan'iem! This was on the night of Al-Hasba (the night on which the pilgrims leave Makkah after the days of At-Tashriq).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2127]

The Hadith of Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with them: 'Ata reported: I heard Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with them, say the following among a group: We, the companions of Muhammad (may Allah be pleased with him), laid the Ihram only for the pilgrimage. On the 4th of the month of Zul-Hijjah, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commanded us to free ourselves from the state of ihram, saying: Get rid of the state of ihram and sleep with your wives! 'Ata' said: He did not oblige them, but allowed them. We said: Five days before our arrival in 'Arafa, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered us to have sexual intercourse with our wives. So we arrived in 'Arafa in such a state caused by close sexual intercourse that we had ejaculation. 'Ata' added: (Jabir pointed to this with his hand and I noticed as if I saw his hand moving.) Jabir further narrated: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood among us and said: You already know that I, the most truthful, the most pious, and the one among you who fears Allah most. And if I had not had sacrificial animals with me, then I would have freed myself from the state of ihram, just like you, and if I had known what I knew later, then I would not have brought the sacrificial animals with me. So detach yourself from the state of ihram! So we freed ourselves from the state of ihram, listened to the Prophet and obeyed him. Then 'Ali (from Yemen) came with the tax collection. The Prophet asked him: With what intention did you put on ihram? 'Ali replied: With this of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) (i.e. I plan to combine the visitation and the pilgrimage like you, Messenger of Allah). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: Then slaughter your sacrificial animals and maintain the state of ihram. 'Ali slaughtered his sacrificial animals and gave one to the Prophet. Suraqa Ibn Malik Ibn Gu'shum said: O Messenger of Allah! Is this just for this year or forever? He answered: Forever.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2131]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Quraish and those who followed his religion used to stay in Muzdalifah in the pre-Islamic period. They were called Al-Hums (the strictly pious). The remaining Arabs used to stay in 'Arafa. In the time of Islam, Allah commanded His Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) to stay in 'Arafat and move on from there, as the Qur'an says: Then move on to where people are moving on from . [Quran 2:199] [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2140]

Gubair Ibn Mut'im (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I lost a camel and went out looking for it on the day of 'Arafa. Then I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) standing with the people on 'Arafa. Then I said: Oh! By Allah, he belongs to the Al-Hums! What is he doing there? Quraish was then thought to be one of the Hums.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2142]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, when he was encamped in Batha'. He asked me: Have you undertaken the pilgrimage? I replied: Yes! He said: With what intention did you put on ihram? I said: Labbaika! Here I come with the intention like that of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He said: You have done well. Then perform the circulation of the Ka'bah and the course between As-Safa and Al-Marwa and then detach yourself from the state of ihram! So I walked around the Ka'ba and between As-Safa and Al-Marwa. Then I went to a woman from Banu Qais who deloused me. Then I accepted Ihram again for the pilgrimage. Accordingly, I used to give legal opinions to the people about the pilgrimage until it was the Caliphate of 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him. Then a man said to me: O Abu Musa! or O 'Abdullah Ibn Qais! Holds off a bit on giving your legal opinions. You don't know what the Prince of the Faithful introduced into the rites after you. Then I said: O people! To whomever We have given a legal opinion, let him wait until the Prince of the believers comes to you, and you should follow him. 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, came after that and I told him about it. He said: If we follow the Book of Allah (the Quran), we find that it commands us to complete the pilgrimage and visitation. And if we follow the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), we find that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) broke away from the state of ihram only after the sacrificial animal reached its destination.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2143]

'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Abu Musa said that he used to give legal opinions on At-Tamattu' (the separation between the visitation and the pilgrimage by releasing ihram). A man once said to him: Hold off a bit on giving your legal opinions. You don't know what the Prince of the Faithful introduced into the rites after you. Later he (Abu Musa) met him and asked him about it. 'Umar replied: I already know that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and his companions had done this (tamattu). But I detested that a man should have sexual intercourse with his wife under the shade of the trees and then begin the pilgrimage while the water was still dripping from his head (for washing).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2145]

The Hadeeth of 'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: 'Abdullah Ibn Shaqieq reported: 'Uthman used to prohibit At-Tamatt'u (the separation between the visitation and the pilgrimage by dissolving ihram), while 'Ali used to allow it . Once he said a few words to 'Ali. Then 'Ali said: You know that in the time of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) we made Tamattu. 'Uthman said: Yes, but we were afraid then.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2146]

The Hadith of 'Imran Ibn Hussain, may Allah be pleased with them both: Mutarif reported: 'Imran Ibn Hussain told me: Today I am telling you a hadith that will be useful to you in the future. The hadeeth is that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) made some of his family put on ihram to visit during the first ten days of Dhul Hijah. No Quranic verse has been revealed to abrogate this. He did not forbid it until the Messenger of Allah died. If anyone has a different opinion about it, that is a personal opinion.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2153]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: In the farewell pilgrimage, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) undertook At-Tamatt'u (the separation between the visitation and the pilgrimage by resolving ihram) and slaughtered the sacrificial animals he brought from Zul-Hulaifa. First, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) accepted ihram for the visit and then again for the pilgrimage. The people performed At-Tamatt'u with him. Some of them have already brought the sacrificial animals with them; but not the others. When the Messenger of Allah arrived in Makkah, he said to them: Whoever of you brought the sacrificial animals must not end his state of ihram until he performs the pilgrimage. But whoever has not brought sacrificial animals with him should walk around the Ka'bah, walk between As-Safa and Al-Marwa, cut his hair, then end his state of ihram for the visit, put on a new ihram for the pilgrimage and slaughter sacrificial animals. Anyone who cannot afford the sacrificial animals should fast for three days during the pilgrimage and another seven days after returning home. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the circumambulation when he arrived in Mecca. First he kissed the corner of the Ka'bah, went around it three times and then went around the remaining four times. When he completed the circumambulation, he performed two rak'as at Abraham's stand and then recited the final formula of the prayer, namely: As-Salamu 'Alaikum (Peace be with you!). He then went to the hill of As-Safa and ran seven times between the hills of 'As-Safa and Al-Marwa'. He did not complete his state of ihram until he performed the pilgrimage and slaughtered the sacrificial animal on the day of sacrifice (10th of Zul Hija). Then he hurried on and walked around the Ka'bah. Then he was allowed to do everything that was forbidden to him in the state of ihram. Whoever among the people brought the sacrificial animals did the same as the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2159]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) undertook At-Tamattu (the separation between the visitation and the pilgrimage by resolving ihram); and people did that.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2160]

Hafsa, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: I said to the Messenger of Allah: O Messenger of Allah, why did you not free yourself from the state of ihram after the visit when the people had already freed themselves from the state of ihram? He said: I tied up my hair and appointed the animals to be sacrificed. So I will free myself from the state of ihram only after slaughtering the sacrificial animals.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2161]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: Nafi' reported that 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar left during the commotion to make the visitation journey. He said: If we are prevented from reaching the House (the Ka'bah), then we will do as we did in the time of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). So he accepted Ihram for the visit and set off until he approached the desert of Al-Baida. Then he turned to his fellow travelers and said: I take you as my witnesses that I undertake to undertake both the pilgrimage and the visit, for their business is the same. He then went and completed the seven circumambulations of the Ka'bah and walked seven times between the two hills of As-Safa and Al-Marwa. Besides, he didn't do anything; he believed that was enough. He also slaughtered the sacrificial animal.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2164]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) give the formula of Talbiya (Labbaika Allahuma Labbaik) = (Here I come, O Lord! Here I come, O Lord!) for both - the pilgrimage and the visit trip - say together.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2168]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) arrived in Makkah, he walked around the Ka'bah seven times. He then prayed two rak'as behind Al-Maqaam (Stand of Abraham) and then performed the walk between As-Safa and Al-Marwa. Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) is the best example for you!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2172]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) arrived in Makkah to perform the pilgrimage, he first performed ablution and then walked around the house (of the Ka'bah). .  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2173]

The Hadith of Asma', may Allah be pleased with her: 'Abdullah, the servant of Asma' Bint Abu Bakr, said that whenever Asma' passed by Al-Hagun, she used to say: May Allah bless His Messenger ! We stayed here with him. That day we had light loads, few mounts, and small traveling supplies. I did the visitation and so did my sister, Az-Zubair, so-and-so and so-and-so. After stroking the Ka'bah by hand (i.e., completing the circulation of the Ka'bah and the course between As-Safa and Al-Marwa), we ended the state of ihram. That same evening we put on ihram again for the pilgrimage.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2175]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) accepted ihram for a visit, while his companions accepted ihram for pilgrimage. So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and one of the companions who brought their sacrificial animals did not end the state of ihram, while the rest of the companions freed themselves from the state of ihram. Talha Ibn 'Ubaidillah was among those who brought their sacrificial animals. Therefore, he did not free himself from the state of ihram.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2177]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: They (the Arabs in the pre-Islamic period) regarded visiting people during the months of pilgrimage as one of the most sinful things on earth. They confused the month of Muharram with the month of Safar and said: When the camels rest and their backs become well again, and when the traces of the pilgrims disappear from the paths and the month of Safar comes to an end, then one may undertake the visitation journey. On the fourth day of the month of Dhul-Hijjah, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and his companions arrived in a state of ihram for the pilgrimage. The Messenger of Allah ordered them to accept ihram for visiting instead of pilgrimage. This was unbelievable to them; so they asked the Messenger of Allah: What liberation (from the state of ihram) do you mean? He replied: Complete liberation from ihram.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2178]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) performed the midday prayer in Dhul-Hulaifa. He then summoned his camel to him, wounded her on the right side of her hump (as a sign that she was a sacrificial animal), and then removed the blood from her. He then garlanded her, tying two sandals to her neck. Afterwards he rode on his camelin. When he reached Al-Baida', he pronounced the Talbiya for the pilgrimage. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2184]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Mu'awiya said to me: Do you know that I cut off some of the hair of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) near the hill of Al-Marwah with the help of a broad-headed arrow have? I replied: I only know this as an argument against you!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2188]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When 'Ali came from Yemen, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) asked him: With what intention did you put on ihram? 'Ali replied: I put it on with the same intention as that of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Then the Messenger of Allah said: If I had not brought sacrificial animals, I would have ended the state of ihram!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2193]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: (I am here to serve you, O Allah, for visitation and pilgrimage - I am here to serve you, O Allah, for the visitation and the pilgrimage) So with these words he accepted the state of ihram for both the visitation and the pilgrimage.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2194]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, made the visit trip four times. Each time it was in the month of Dhul-Qi'da, except for the visitation which he made in connection with his pilgrimage. These visits were: The one that was from Al-Hudaibiya or at the time of the Al-Hudaibiya Agreement; the second took place the following year; the third was that of Gi'rana, when he distributed the spoils of the campaign of Hunain; and he made the last visit together with the farewell pilgrimage.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2197]

The Hadith of Zaid Ibn Arqam (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Ishaq reported: I asked Zaid Ibn Arqam: How many military campaigns did you take part in with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)? He said: seventeen. Zaid Ibn Arqam also told me that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) undertook nineteen military campaigns and performed only one pilgrimage after leaving Mecca, namely the Farewell Pilgrimage.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2198]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: 'Urwa Ibn-az-Zubair, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Once Ibn 'Umar and I were sitting, leaning on the wall of 'A'ishah's room. We could hear her cleaning her mouth with a siwak (wood for cleaning and polishing teeth). I then said: O Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman, did the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) perform the visitation in the (month) of Ragab? He replied: Yes! Then I said to 'A'ishah: O mother, do you not hear what Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman is saying? She asked: And what does he say? I said: He says that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) made the visit in the month of Ragab. Then she said: May Allah forgive Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman (for his sins)! By my life, the Prophet never made the visitation in the (month) of Ragab. He also never performed it without being accompanied by (Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman). Ibn 'Umar heard what 'A'ishah said and said neither yes nor no, but remained silent.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2199]

The hadeeth of Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: 'Ata' Ibn 'Abbas reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once said to a woman from the Ansar (the Muslim helpers of Madinah) who Ibn ' Abbas, whose name I still forgot: What prevented you from making the pilgrimage with us? The woman answered: We have only two camels: the one on which my husband and son rode for the pilgrimage, and the other camel on which the water is brought. Then the Prophet said to her: When Ramadan (the month of fasting for Muslims) comes, make the visitation in it; because the reward of a visit in Ramadan is like that of a pilgrimage!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2201]

Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to come out of Madinah by the Shagara Way and enter by the Way of Al-Mu'arras. On the other hand, in Mecca he used to enter through the upper bottleneck and come out through the lower bottleneck.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2203]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to Makkah, he entered through the upper pass and came out through the lower pass.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2204]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) spent the night in Zu-Tuway. Only then did he enter Mecca when morning came.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2206]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) turned his face towards the two passages of the mountain that separated it from the Long Mountain, towards the Ka'bah. As a result, the mosque built there was on the left side of the mosque built at the end of the black hill. The place of worship of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was below, on the black hill. He left about ten cubits from the black hill, then stood facing the two passages of the long mountain that lay between him and the Ka'bah and performed the prayer.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2209]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to do the first three circumambulations at a running pace when he first circumambulated the Ka'bah (in pilgrimage) and the remaining four by walking normally . He also used to run into the valley floor while doing the race between As-Safa and Al-Marwa.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2210]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them: Abu-t-Tufail reported: I said to Ibn 'Abbas: Is it really Sunnah that one should walk the first three circumambulations of the Ka'bah and the remaining four? should go? Your people claim that this offense is Sunnah. He replied: They told the truth and they lied. Then I said: What does that mean? He replied: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and his companions came to Makkah, the idolaters said: Muhammad and his companions cannot walk around the Ka'bah because of their emaciation. They were filled with envy back then. Therefore, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commanded his companions to run around the Ka'bah three times and walk four times. I further said to him: Tell me whether it is also part of the Sunnah to do the run between the two hills of As-Safa and Al-Marwa while riding! Your people claim that this is Sunnah. He replied: They told the truth and they also lied. I said: What does that mean? He said: Huge crowds gathered around the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), so much so that even the virgins came out of their houses. The people said: This is Muhammad! This is Muhammad! The people around the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not back down or make any way for him. When crowds of people surrounded him, he had to ride (on his camelin). However, running and walking are better.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2217]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: I saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, touch no place in the (holy) house except the two Yemeni corners.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2222]

The Hadith of 'Umar Ibnal Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) kissed the Black Stone and said: I know well that you are just a stone. If I myself had not seen that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) kissed you, then I would not have kissed you!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2228]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: In the farewell pilgrimage, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) rode on a camel while circumambulating the Ka'bah and touched the corner with a crooked stick.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2233]

Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: I complained about my illness to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then he said: You may ride around the Ka'bah behind the people. So I went around the Ka'ba on horseback while the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) performed prayer next to the Ka'ba and recited the Quranic verse (By the Mountain and by the Book that is written).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2238]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: 'Urwa reported: I once said to 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: I believe that it does not matter if one does not run the race between Safa and Marwa. She said: Why do you say that? I replied: Because Allah, the Most High, says: Verily, As-Safa and Al-Marwa are among the places of worship of Allah... [Quran 2:158] until the end of the verse of the Quran. Then she said: Allah does not consider a person's pilgrimage or visit to be complete unless he runs between As-Safa and Al-Marwah. If it had been meant as you said, it would have been 'It is not an offense if one does not carry out the race between them (As-Safa and Al-Marwa).' Do you know the reason for the revelation of this Quran verse? It was revealed because of the Ansar (the Muslim helpers from Medina), because in the pre-Islamic period they used to consecrate two idols named Isaf and Na'ela, which were located near the sea shore, the race between the to carry out two hills, As-Safa and Al-Marwa, and then have one's hair shaved off. After they embraced Islam, they detested running the race between As-Safa and Al-Marwa because of what they used to do in the pre-Islamic period. Therefore Allah revealed the Qur'anic verse: Verily, As-Safa and Al-Marwa are among the places of worship of Allah... And they (the Ansar) had to run the race between the two.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2239]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Ansar detested running the race between As-Safa and Al-Marwa until the Qur'anic verse Verily, As-Safa and Al-Marwa are among the places of worship of Allah; and whoever makes the pilgrimage to the house or makes the visit, it is no offense for him if he walks around both [Quran 2:158] was revealed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2243]

Usama Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I rode behind the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) when he returned from 'Arafa. When he reached the left side of the mountain near Al-Muzdalifa, he dismounted his mount to urinate. Then I poured water for him to wash. But he performed a light ablution. I said to him: Prayer, O Messenger of Allah! But he said: The prayer is waiting for you in front (in Al-Muzdalifa). He rode further to Al-Muzdalifa. There he performed the prayer. Then Al-Fadl rode behind the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) on the morning when they were to go to Al-Muzdalifa (Gam' Day).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2245]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not stop uttering the formula of Talbiya (Here I am at your service, O Allah) until he said: threw stones.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2246]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): Muhammad Ibn Abu Bakr Ath-Thaqafiy asked Anas Ibn Malik when they came out from Mina towards 'Arafat: What do you have to do with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). made this day? He said: Some of us pronounced the formula of Talbija (I am here to serve you, O Allah) without being reprimanded, and others pronounced the formula of Takbir (Allahu Akbar = Allah is Greater), without being blamed for it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2254]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came hastily from 'Arafa with Usama riding behind him. Usama said: We continued in this state until we reached Gam' (Al-Muzdalifa).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2262]

The Hadeeth of Usama Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Urwa Ibn-az-Zubair reported: Usama was asked when I was with him, or he said: I myself asked Usama Ibn Zaid, since he was behind the Messenger of Allah, How fast did the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ride when he came from 'Arafa? Usama replied: Normally at medium speed and higher in open country.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2263]

Abu Ayyub (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I performed the evening and night prayers (just one after the other) in Al-Muzdalifa during the farewell pilgrimage with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2264]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: There were only two times when I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) perform prayer at a time other than its appointed time: once he performed it the evening and night prayers one after the other in Gam` (Muzdalifa); and the other time he performed the dawn prayer the next morning before its usual time.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2270]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: Sauda asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) for permission to leave from Al-Muzdalifah to Mina at night ahead of him and the other pilgrims. Sauda was a very obese woman (Al-Qasim said: 'obese' means fat and therefore can only walk slowly). The Prophet allowed her to do so. So she rode off before his departure. We stayed in Al-Muzdalifa until morning then left with the Prophet. I wish (on the way) that I, like Sauda, ​​had asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) for permission to leave early; for nothing pleased me at that time except that I had set out with his permission.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2271]

The Hadith of Asma', may Allah be pleased with her: 'Abdullah, the servant of Asma', reported: While we were in Al-Muzdalifa, Asma' asked me: Has the moon set yet? I said: No, not yet! So she prayed for an hour and then asked again: O my son, has the moon set yet? I replied: Yes! Then she said: Then let's set off! So we rode off (to Mina). There she threw the stones and performed the prayer in her place. I then said to her: O madam, we set out (early) before dawn, (and thereby we violated the rites of pilgrimage). Then she said: No, my son! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) allowed women traveling to do this (leaving early before the other pilgrims).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2274]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent me on the night of Gam' (al-Muzdalifa) with the luggage or with some weak people.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2277]

The hadeeth of 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: Salem Ibn 'Abdullah reported: 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar used to let the weak among his relatives go ahead of him, so that they could go to Al-Mash'ar Al-Haram at night (the pilgrimage station) were able to stay in Muzdalifa. Meanwhile, they could remember Allah as much as they wanted and then flock to the abode and streaming of the Imam. Some of them reached Mina at the time of the dawn prayer and some came later. When they came, they threw the stones. Ibn 'Umar used to say: It was the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who permitted them (the old and the weak people).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2281]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Yazid reported: 'Abdullah threw the stones from the bottom of the valley. So I said to him: O Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman, some people throw stones from above. Then 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud replied: By Allah, besides Whom there is no other god, this is the place where Surah Al-Baqara (the Cow) was revealed to the Messenger of Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2282]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and some of his companions shaved their heads; but the others had it cut short. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O Allah, have mercy on those who shave their heads! He said this once or twice and then said: Have mercy also on those who have their hair cut off!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2292]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O Allah, have mercy on those who have shaved their heads! Some people said: O, Messenger of Allah! And also those who have cut off the hair on their heads. Then he said: O Allah, have mercy on those who have shaved their heads! Some people said: And also to those who have cut off the hair of their heads, O Messenger of Allah. He replied: O Allah, have mercy on those who have shaved their heads! The people said again: O Messenger of Allah, and those who cut off the hair of their heads. Then he said: And to those who have cut off the hair of their heads!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2295]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, had his head shaved on his farewell pilgrimage.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2297]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to Mina. He came to the rite of throwing stones and threw them (the stones); then he returned to his camp in Mina and offered his sacrifice. Afterwards he said to the hairdresser, 'Take!', pointing to his right side and then to his left. Then he gave (the cut hair) to the people.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2298]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr Ibnal 'As, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: During the farewell pilgrimage, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stayed in Mina, and the people there asked him about the rites of the pilgrimage. A man said: O Messenger of Allah, I accidentally shaved myself before slaughtering the sacrificial animal. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Slaughter your sacrificial animal now, it doesn't matter! Another man said: O Messenger of Allah, I accidentally slaughtered the sacrificial animal before throwing the stones! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Throw the stones now, it won't matter! Many other questions were put to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) that day regarding the rites of the Hajj that were performed in the wrong order, and he always replied: Do it now, it doesn't matter!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2301]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asked about the slaughtering of sacrificial animals, shaving, throwing stones, and setting aside (the rites of pilgrimage). Then he said: That doesn't matter!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2306]

The hadeeth of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Abdul-'Aziz Ibn Rufai' said to Anas Ibn Malik: Share with me something that you have learned from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Where did he perform the midday prayer on the day of Tarwiya? He (Anas) said: In Mina. He asked: And where did he perform the afternoon prayer on the day of An-Nafr (when he returned from Mina to Mecca)? He (Anas) said: In Al-Abtah. So do as the people in charge of the pilgrimage do!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2308]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, Abu Bakr and 'Umar used to stay in Al-Abtah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2309]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Staying in Al-Abtah is not Sunnah. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took up residence there because it was easier for him to return from there (to Madinah).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2311]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: At-Tahsieb (staying in Al-Muhassab) is nothing other than a place where the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) stayed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2313]

Abu Huraira (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Tomorrow, Allah willing, we will stay at Khaif Banu Kinana, where they (the Quraish and the Kinana) are took oaths to impose a boycott on Muslims.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2315]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: Al-'Abbas Ibn 'Abdel Mottalib asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to allow the pilgrims to spend the nights in Mina in Mecca instead of Mina to stay overnight because of his task of giving water to the pilgrims. He (The Messenger of Allah) allowed him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2318]

'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commanded me to supervise his (slaughter) of his sacrificial animals; to donate their flesh, hides and saddlecloth; and not to give any of it to the butcher as a reward for his work. He said: We'll give him something different.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2320]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: In the year of Hudaibiya, we slaughtered with the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) a camel for seven people and a cow for seven people.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2322]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: Ziyad Ibn Gubair reported that Ibn 'Umar came to a man while he was slaughtering his camel, which was kneeling down. Then Ibn 'Umar said to him: Leave it tied up (then slaughter it) according to the Sunnah of your Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2330]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to send the sacrificial animals from Medina to Makkah. So I made necklaces for his sacrificial animals. After that, he avoided anything that the Muhrim (the one who is in the state of Ihram) avoids.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2331]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw a man driving a camel that he wanted to bring as a sacrifice. He said to him: Ride the animal! The man replied: But it is a sacrificial animal! He said (the second time or the third time): Woe to you! Get on and ride it!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2342]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, passed by a man who was driving a camel that he was about to bring as a sacrifice. He said to him: Ride the animal! The man replied: But it is a sacrificial animal! - Get on and ride it! He repeats this sentence two or three times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2344]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: After completing the rites of the Hajj, the people went their way without visiting the Ka'bah again. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No one should leave until he performs the final circumambulation (Tawaf) around the House (Ka'bah).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2350]

The hadeeth of Bilal (may Allah be pleased with him): 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) entered the house (the Ka'bah) with Usama, Bilal and 'Uthman Ibn Talha Al-Hagbiy . He closed the door behind him and then stayed inside. Ibn 'Umar continued his report: I asked Bilal when he came out of the Ka'bah: What did the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) do? He said: He stood in it, where there were two pillars on his left, one pillar on his right, and three pillars behind him, and then he prayed. At that time the Ka'ba was founded on six pillars. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2358]

The Hadith of Usama Ibn Zayd, may Allah be pleased with both of them: Ibn Guraig told us the following: I asked 'Ata: Did you hear Ibn 'Abbas say: It is prescribed for you to circumambulate the Ka'bah, but not to enter it? 'Ata' replied: Ibn 'Abbas did not forbid entering the Ka'bah. But I heard him say: Usama Ibn Zaid informed me that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) called upon Allah on all sides of the Ka'bah when he entered it. He did not pray therein until he went out. After he came out of the Ka'ba, he prayed two rak'ahs in front of (the door of) the Ka'ba and said: This is the direction of your prayer. I said: What are their sides? Is she her corners? He said: That means all of their walls.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2364]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) entered the Ka'bah, which (at that time) contained six pillars. At a pillar he made a supplication and did not pray.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2365]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Abi Aufa, may Allah be pleased with him: Isma'il Ibn Abu Khalid reported: I said to 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa, Companion of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him): The Prophet entered the Ka' ba during his 'Umrah (visitation)? He replied: No.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2366]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: If your tribesmen (Quraish) had not recently accepted Islam, I would have torn down the Ka'bah and them rebuild on the old foundation built by Ibrahim (Abraham) and make a back door for them; When the Quraish built the Ka'ba, they only had limited resources for reconstruction. So they downsized the building.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2367]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: As Al-Fadl Ibn 'Abbas was riding behind the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), a woman from the tribe of Khath'am came to seek instruction from the Messenger of Allah ask, and Al-Fadl started looking at her as she also started looking at him. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) turned the face of Al-Fadl in the other direction. The woman then said: O Messenger of Allah, the pilgrimage that Allah has made obligatory to His servants was announced when my father became very old and could no longer hold on to the mount. Can I make the pilgrimage for him? He (The Prophet) replied: Yes! And this happened during the last pilgrimage.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2375]

Al-Fadl, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: A woman from the tribe of Khath'am said: O Messenger of Allah, my father grew very old and Allah made pilgrimage obligatory for him (like the other servants). He can no longer hold on to his mount. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Make the pilgrimage for him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2376]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) addressed us and said: People, Allah has made the pilgrimage obligatory for you, go on the pilgrimage. A man asked: Do we have to do this every year, Messenger of Allah? He remained silent until the man repeated the question three times. Then he said: If I had said yes, it would have been your duty and you couldn't do it. Since I have been silent, don't ask me earnestly! Those who lived before you perished because of their many questions and differences of opinion about their prophets. Whatever I have commanded you, do as best you can! But what I have forbidden, abstain from.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2380]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A woman must not travel alone for more than three days, otherwise she must travel with a Mahram (a man from the group of people from whom... marriage to the woman is excluded, like father, brother, uncle, son, grandson... etc.) travel.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2381]

Abu Sa'id (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You should only travel to three mosques: My Mosque, the Holy Mosque (Al-Masjid Al-Haram) and Al -Aqsa Mosque. I also heard him say: A woman is not allowed to travel for two days without being accompanied by a Mahram (A man who is not allowed to marry her, like your brother, father, uncle...) or by her husband.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2383]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: It is not permissible for a Muslim woman to travel for a day unless it is a man whom she does not marry allowed to accompany her.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2386]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day must not travel for three days or more, otherwise she will have to they travel with their father, son, husband, brother or with a mahram (a man from the group of people from whom marriage with the woman is excluded).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2390]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: No (stranger) man may enter into seclusion with a (stranger) woman without a mahram; and a woman is only allowed to travel with a mahram. A man stood up and said: O Messenger of Allah, I have volunteered to take part in the battles of so-and-so and so-and-so, and my wife has already left as a pilgrim! He (The Prophet) said to him: Go (follow her) and perform the pilgrimage with your wife.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2391]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) returned from military campaigns, expeditions, pilgrimages or visits, and was near a small passage (between two mountains) or a high place, he said the takbir three times. Then he said: There is no god but Allah, the One Who has no partner, to Him alone belongs the kingdom and to Him alone is all praise, He is Mighty over all things. We will return as Allah has ordained. We repent of our wrongdoings, pray to Allah, prostrate ourselves before Him and praise Him. Allah fulfills His promise and supports His servant! It is he alone who defeats the enemies!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2394]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Abu Talha, Safiyya and I returned (to Medina) with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Safiyya sat behind the Prophet on his she-camel. When we were near Medina, he (the Prophet) said all the way: We will return, repentant, serving Him and praising our Lord. He kept saying this until we got to Medina.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2395]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) made his camel kneel in the valley of Dhul-Hulaifa and prayed there.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2396]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was staying in Dhul-Hulaifa at night and it was said to him: You are in a blessed valley.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2399]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Abu Bakr As-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, sent me during the pilgrimage for which the Messenger of Allah, may Allah be pleased with him, had appointed Abu Bakr as a guide - and this was before the farewell pilgrimage on the day of the Feast of Sacrifice - to announce the following to all the people gathered: After this year, no idolaters are allowed to take part in the pilgrimage, and no one is allowed to walk around the house (the Ka'ba) naked!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2401]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: From the visitation trip to the next visitation trip there is an atonement for the time that lies between the two. And for the pilgrimage carried out according to the regulations, there is no other reward than paradise!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2403]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever undertakes the pilgrimage for Allah and does not commit sexual intercourse or any wrongdoing during it, he returns from the pilgrimage (sinless), as the day his mother gave birth to him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2404]

Usama Ibn Zaid Ibn Haritha (may Allah be pleased with them both) reported: I said: O Messenger of Allah, will you be accommodated in your house in Makkah? Then he (the Prophet) said: Has 'Aqil (cousin of the Prophet) left us somewhere to stay (for us)?  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2405]

Al-'Ala' Ibn Al-Hadramiy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: The Muhagir (the Muslim emigrant from Makkah to Medina) is only allowed to stay in Makkah for three days after completing the pilgrimage or visit.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2408]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said on the day Makkah was conquered: There is no emigration, but struggle and good intentions. And when you are told to leave, leave! He also said on that day: This city was declared protected by Allah when He created the heavens and the earth. Because of this divine declaration, it cannot be violated until the Day of Resurrection. No one before me was allowed to fight (in Makkah); I was also only allowed to fight in it during a certain hour of a day. Because of the divine declaration, this place is inviolable until the Day of Resurrection. Their thorns must not be cut. Your hunting animals must not be scared away. And whoever finds something is not allowed to eat it until he tells them about it. And their pastures must not be uprooted. Then I (Al-`Abbas) said: O Allah's Messenger, but Izkher (a type of fragrant plants) is excluded from this; for the blacksmiths use it (for firing), and it is used in every house. He (The Prophet) replied: Yes, Izkher is exempt from it!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2412]

The Hadith of Abu Shurayh Al-'Adawiy (may Allah be pleased with him): He said to 'Amr Ibn Sa'id while sending the troops to Makkah: Allow me, O prince, to give you a saying from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). on him to tell. He said this saying, which my ears heard, my heart grasped, and my eyes saw, on the next day of the conquest. First he praised Allah and praised him then he said: Allah, and not people, made Makkah a protected area. So it is forbidden for anyone who believes in Allah and the Last Day to shed blood or cut down a tree in Makkah. If anyone uses my struggle in it as an argument, then say to him: Allah allowed His Messenger to fight and not you; at a certain hour on a day. Today it (Makka) is a protected area again, as it was yesterday; and the person present should tell the person absent!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2413]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When Allah caused His Messenger to conquer Makkah, he stood up among the people and praised Allah and praised him, saying: Allah protected Makkah from the elephant; he gave his messenger and the believers the power to conquer Makkah and defeat the infidels. No one before me was allowed to fight in Makkah; But I was only allowed to fight for one hour in one day; and no one after me will be allowed to do so! Therefore, one must not scare away their hunting animals, one must not pull out their thorns, and anyone who finds something lost must not take it without making an effort to find the owner. And if someone is unlawfully killed, the relatives of the dead person have the choice between retaliation and compensation payments. Al-`Abbas said: O Messenger of Allah, the exception to this is Al-Izkher (kind of fragrant plants) which we use in our graves and houses! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Yes! Al-Izkhar is exempt from this. Then a man from Yemen named Abu Shah stood up and said: O Messenger of Allah, let this be written down for me! Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Write this down for Abu Shah!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2414]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) entered Makkah in the year of the conquest with a helmet on his head. As he took off his helmet, a man came to him and said: Ibn Khatal holds on to the curtains of the Ka'bah. Then he (the Prophet) said: Kill him!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2417]

'Abdullah Ibn Zaid Ibn 'Asim (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Ibrahim declared Makkah a sanctuary and made supplication for its people; and I declared Medina a protected area as Ibrahim had declared Makkah a protected area. I prayed for blessings on Medina, just as Ibrahim had asked for blessings on the people of Makkah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2422]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O Allah, give twice as much blessing to Madinah as you gave to Makkah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2423]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 'Asim said: I said to Anas Ibn Malik: Has the Messenger of Allah made Medina a protected area? Then he said: Yes, from a certain mark to another certain mark. Whoever commits a crime there ('Asim interrupts: Anas said to me: The following words are serious.) will be the curse of Allah and of the angels and of men all. This rejects any course of action.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2429]

'Ali Ibn Abu Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Yazid Ibn Shariek Ibn Tariq said: 'Ali Ibn Abu Talib delivered a sermon before us and said: Whoever claims that we have any other (book) than the Qur'an and this leaf, that was hanging on the scabbard of his sword, he is a liar. This sheet contains the ages of the camels, according to which the alms tax is determined, and different types of compensation payments. Therein the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) also said: Medina is a protected area from 'Air to Thaur (two mountains). Whoever commits a crime there or harbors a crime-doer will be subject to the curse of Allah and of the angels and of all men. This rejects any course of action. The protection of Muslims is indivisible, and the lowest of them is enough to provide this protection. Whoever claims that he is the son of another father or that he associates himself with others as his guardian companions, upon him rests the curse of Allah and of the angels and of men all. This rejects any course of action.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2433]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Medina is a protected area. Whoever commits a crime there or harbors a crime-doer will be subject to the curse of Allah and of the angels and of all men. He rejects any course of action on the Day of Resurrection.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2434]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: We came to Medina when it was polluted. Then Abu Bakr fell ill and so did Bilal. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw the illness of his companions, he said: O Allah, make Madinah as dear to us as you made Makkah to us, or even dearer! Make them healthy for us! Bless their Saa' and their Mudd (measures of grain) for us! And give their fever to Al-Guhfa!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2444]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There are angels at the entrances to Madinah. Therefore, neither the plague nor the Daggal (the false Messiah) pushes in.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2449]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: One day the man will call his paternal cousin and his relatives to prosperity; and Medina is better for them, if only they knew. By the one in whose hand my soul lies, whoever goes out of Madinah turning away, Allah will let people better than him follow him in it. Medina is like a bellows, driving out the bad ones. The hour comes only when Medina drives out all her evil, just as the bellows expels the iron dross.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2451]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: A Bedouin swore allegiance to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. In Medina he suffered from illness. So he came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: (O Muhammad, revoke my oath of allegiance!) The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) but rejected it. Later he came back and said: (Revoke my oath of allegiance!) He (the Messenger of Allah) refused. Later he (the Bedouin) came back and said: (Revoke my oath of allegiance!) He (the Messenger of Allah) rejected it again. Then the Bedouin came out, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (Medina is like the bellows, driving out its bad and purifying its good.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ   No. 2453]

Zaid Ibn Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: She is Taiyeba. (other name of Medina) She rejects evil (including iniquities, sins and hypocrisy) from herself as fire removes dross from silver.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2454]

Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with him, reported The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: (Never will anyone plot against the people of Al-Madinah without dissolving himself like the salt in... water dissolves.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2458]

Sufyan Ibn Abi Zuhair (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (When Ash-Sham is conquered, a group of people with their families move away from Madinah; and also inflame the people to leave from Medina, although Medina is better for them, if only they knew it. If Yemen is conquered, a group of people move away from Medina with their families; and also inflames the others to move away from Medina, while Medina is better for them if If only she knew it. If Iraq is conquered, then a group of people and their families move away from Medina; and inflame the others to move away from Medina as well, while Medina is better for them if they only knew.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim   , Chapter 16, Hadīṯ No. 2459]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah said of Medina: Its inhabitants are leaving it, even though it (Medina) is better for them. Nevertheless, it does not remain fertile land for predators and birds.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2461]
