'Abdullah Ibn Zaid Al-Mazniy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Between my dwelling and my pulpit (Mimbar) there is a garden from the Gardens of Paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2463]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with them both) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Between my abode and my pulpit (Mimbar) is a garden from the gardens of Paradise, and my pulpit is on my basin (Haud). .  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2465]

Abu Humaid, may Allah be pleased with him, reported that We accompanied the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, on the Tabuk campaign. We continued until we reached the valley of Al-Qura. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (I am going on quickly. Whoever of you wants to come with me quickly, then go on with me. But whoever wants to come more slowly, may come slowly afterwards.) So we go on until we were near Medina. Then he (the Prophet) said: This is Taba (Other name of Medina) and this is Uhud, the mountain which we like and which likes us.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2466]

Anas Ibn Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, reported The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: (This is a mountain that loves us and that we love!) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ   No. 2467]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Performing one prayer in my mosque is better than a thousand prayers in any other place, except the Sacred Mosque (Al-Masjid Al- Haram in Mecca).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2469]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Only three mosques are traveled to: the Mosque of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) (in Madinah), the Sacred Mosque and Al-Aqsa Mosque.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2475]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to visit Quba both on horseback and on foot.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 16, Ḥadīṯ no. 2478]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him 'Alkama) reported: I was walking with 'Abdullah in Mina when we met 'Uthman. So he went with him and talked to him. 'Uthman said to 'Abdullah: (O Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman, do you want us to marry you to a virgin? She would awaken in you some days of your youth!) 'Abdullah said: Regarding the question you raised the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You young people! Whoever of you is able to marry, let him do so; because this helps to protect one's gaze (from other women and chastity from shameful things). But whoever cannot do this should fast; because it is rather a protection for him (from sinful actions)!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2485]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Some of the Companions of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) asked the wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) about his acts of worship in his private life. Some of them said: (After being given the relevant information) (We will never marry.) Some said: (We will never eat meat.) Others said: (We will never sleep on a bed.) (As the Messenger Allah learned about it), he praised and said: I admire those who said this and that. But I pray and sleep, fast and break my fast and marry women. Whoever turns away from this path (Sunnah) does not belong to me!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2487]

Sa'd Ibn Abi Waqqas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, did not allow 'Uthman Ibn Maz'un to live in celibacy. If the Prophet had allowed this, we would have been castrated!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2488]

'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We were on a military campaign with the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) and had no women with us. So we said to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): (Isn't it better if we get castrated?) He forbade us to do so, but allowed us to marry women for a limited period of time. In this context he recited: Believers! Do not deny yourself the good things that Allah has allowed you! And do not commit any transgression! Allah does not love those who commit transgressions! [Quran 5:87]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2493]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The caller of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came before us and said: (The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) permitted you to have a temporary marriage was closed for a short time for the purpose of sexual enjoyment.) By this he meant sexual enjoyment with women.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2494]

'Ali Ibn Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that on the day of Khaybar, Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade temporary marriage with women and eating tame donkeys.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2510]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (A man must not be married to a woman and her maternal or paternal aunt at the same time.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17,   Ḥadīṯ -No. 2514]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, married Maimuna when he was in a state of ihram.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2527]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade one of us to go out to buy goods that his brother intended to buy, and one of us to ask for his hand in marriage to a woman whose engagement to his brother is imminent.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2530]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade trade between a sedentary and a nomad and said: Do not engage in sham business (nagash), and none of you may seek to purchase the same goods , which his brother intends to buy. Nor may one seek the hand of a woman whose engagement to his brother is imminent. And the woman must not cause her sister to be divorced in order to be in her place.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2532]

Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade shighar. And Shighar is when a man gives his daughter in marriage to another man on the condition that he also gives his daughter to him in marriage, and that the cancellation of a payment of bridewealth is reciprocal.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2537]

'Uqba Ibn 'Amer (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saying: The conditions that you should give priority to fulfilling are those under which you have the private parts (of women). through marriage).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2542]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (A woman who is about to remarry must not be married until she allows it herself. On the other hand, a virgin may not be married until she her consent was previously asked.) Some people asked: (O Messenger of Allah, what does her consent look like then?) The Prophet said: (By remaining silent!) [   Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ No. 2543]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) whether the virgins who want to marry their families should allow this themselves or not. The Messenger of Allah said to her: (Yes! She must allow it herself.) 'A'ishah said: (I then told him that the maiden is shameful.) The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then said : (This is her consent to remain silent!)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2544]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) married me when I was six years old and did not have marital relations with me until I was nine years old was. We went to Medina and there I had a fever for a month and my hair grew until it reached the earlobe. Umm Roman came to me while I was on a swing with my playmates. She called me loudly. So I went to her and I didn't know what she wanted from me. She grabbed my hand and left me standing on the door. I said: Ha, Ha. As if my breath had been taken away. She led me to a house where some Ansar women were gathering. They expressed blessings and wished me all the best and happiness. She (Umm Roman) left me to these women. They washed my head and decorated me. Nothing frightened me except that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came in the morning and that I was entrusted to him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2547]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A woman came to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) and said: (I have come to you to give myself as a gift to you.) The Messenger Allah's blessings and peace be upon him, raised his gaze to her, looked at her for a while, then lowered his head to the ground. When the woman saw that he had not made a decision about her offer, she sat down. Then a man stood up from his companions and said: (O Messenger of Allah, if you have no plans for her, then give her to me as a wife!) The Prophet asked him: Do you have anything (as a dowry)? He said: (No, by Allah, O Messenger of Allah.) The Prophet said to him: (Then go to your family and see if you find anything!) The man went, came back (after a while) and said: ( No, by Allah! I have found nothing.) The Prophet said to him: (Go and look for a ring, even if it is made of iron!) The man left, then came back (after a while) and said: (No, by Allah! I have found nothing, not even a ring of iron. But here is my loincloth, of which she can have half.) Sahl replied: But the man had no outer garment, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). him, said to him: (What shall she do with your loincloth? If you have it on, she has nothing on your body.) The man sat down and after a long time, he stood up. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw that he was about to leave, he called for him, and when he returned, he said to him: (What do you know of the Quran by heart?) The man said: (I know them Surah So-and-so and Surah So-and-so by heart.) He then told him several surahs. Then the Prophet said: (Can you recite these by heart?) The man said: (Yes!) Then the Prophet said to him: (You can go then! We have given her to you as a wife for what you have memorized from the Quran .)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2554]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw that 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn 'Auf had yellow marks on his body. When he asked him why, he said: I married a woman and gave her (as a dowry) as much gold as the rub of a date stone. The Prophet said to him: May Allah bless you with this (marriage). Have a feast, with at least one sheep!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2556]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I saw the wedding feast of Zainab in which he (the Prophet) served bread and meat to the people. He used to send me to invite people. When he was finished, he stood up and I followed him. But two men remained at home after the banquet and were busy talking. Then he visited his wives' houses and greeted them with the words: As-Salamu 'Alaikum (Peace be upon you), how are you, O members of the house? They replied: (O Messenger of Allah, we are well. How do you find your relatives?) He replied: (Good.) When he had finished, he returned home and I was with him. When he reached the door, he found the two men still engaged in conversation. But when they saw him return, they went out. By Allah, I did not know whether I or a revelation told him that the two men were going out, so he returned and I was with him. As he reached the threshold of the door he let the curtain fall between him and me. Then Allah, the Exalted, revealed the Quranic verse: Believers! Do not enter the Prophet's houses unless you are given permission (to enter) (if you are invited) to a meal. [Quran 33:53]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ No. 2565]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (If one of you is invited to a wedding feast, then he should attend it.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter   17 , Ḥadīṯ number. 2574]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The worst meal is the wedding banquet, to which the rich are invited and the poor are left out, and whoever accepts the invitation (to a wedding banquet) Whoever rejects it is disobedient to Allah and His Messenger.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2585]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The wife of Refa'a came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: (O Messenger of Allah, Refa'a divorced me, and the divorce took place in force. I subsequently married 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Az-Zubair. But he is impotent!) The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) smiled and said: (Do you want to go back to Refa'a? No, This is not possible until you consummate your marriage with 'Abdu-r-Rahman!) She said this when Abu Bakr was with the Messenger of Allah and Khalid was waiting at the door for permission to enter. So he shouted: (O Abu Bakr, do you not hear what this woman is saying to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him!)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ No. 2587]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If one of you wants to have sexual intercourse with his wife, saying: Bismillah Allahumma gannibna Ash-Shaitan, wa gannib Ash-Shaitana ma razaktana! (In the name of Allah! O Allah, keep us away from Satan and keep Satan away from what you have given us!) If they have a child, it will never be harmed by Satan.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2591]

Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Jews used to say: If someone has sex with his wife from behind, but in the normal genitals, the child is born with crossed eyes! The following verse from the Koran was then revealed: Your wives are a field of seed for you; therefore come to your seed field as you please [Quran 2:223]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ-No. 2592]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (If a woman avoids her husband's marriage bed, she will be cursed by the angels until she gets up the next morning.)   [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2594]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We undertook the campaign of Banu Al-Mustaliq with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and captured some noble Arab women. Since the state of celibacy lasted for a long time, we wanted to have sexual intercourse with them and practice 'Azl (withdrawal of the male sexual organ before ejaculation to avoid conception). But We said: (Why do we do such a thing without asking the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him)?) So we asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). He replied: (It is not necessary that you do this. There is no living being that will not be brought into existence until the Last Day.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2599]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We practiced Al-'Azl (expulsion of semen outside the vulva during sexual intercourse) at the time when the Qur'an was revealed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 17, Ḥadīṯ no. 2608]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was with me. Meanwhile, I heard a man in Hafsa's house asking to be let in. Then 'A'ishah said: O Messenger of Allah, this man is asking to enter your house. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I saw him so-and-so, an uncle of Hafsa by virtue of the milk sibling. I said: If so-and-so, her dairy uncle, was still alive, would he be allowed to enter my house? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: Yes, because what is forbidden because of birth is also forbidden because of milk siblings (that is, milk siblings are not allowed to marry each other).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2615]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Aflah, brother of Abu-l-Qu'ais, came to me and asked to be admitted. This was my uncle on the basis of the milk siblinghood after the revelation about the obligation to wear the veil was sent down. I prevented him from entering until the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came. When I told him about it, he ordered me to allow him (to enter).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2617]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The daughter of Hamza was offered in marriage to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). But he said: (It does not allow me to marry her because she is the daughter of my milk brother. And the milk sibling forbids what consanguinity also forbids.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ   No. 2624]

Umm Habiba bint Abi Sufyan (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to me, and I said to him: (Do you have any affection for my sister, the daughter of Abu Sufyan?) He said: What shall I do (with her)? I said: (Marry her!) He said: (Do you like that?) I said: (I am not your only wife, and there is no one but my sister to whom I wish to bestow good upon me.) Then he said : (I am forbidden to marry your sister.) I said: (I was informed that you have courted Dorra Bint Abi Salama) He said: (Bint Umm Salama?) I replied: (Yes!) He said: (If she had not been my stepdaughter, who grew up under my care, I would not be allowed to marry her because she is the daughter of my milk brother. Thuwaiba suckled me and her father. So do not ask your daughters and sisters to come to me marriage!)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2626]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Sahla Bint Suhail came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). She said: O Messenger of Allah, I noticed that Abu Huthaifa makes an angry face when Salim, who was under his patronage, enters our house. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: (Breastfeed him!) She said: (How should I breastfeed him while he is an adult?) The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) smiled and said: ( I know that he is an adult.) 'Amr added to his hadith that he (Salim) took part in the Badr campaign. In the narration of Ibn Abi 'Umar he said: Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) laughed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2636]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to my house while a man was with me. He was very annoyed about it. I said to him: He is my milk brother. The Prophet replied: See who your brothers are; for the milk brotherhood (Rada'a) is only through satisfying hunger.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2642]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: S'ad Ibn Abi Waqqas was arguing with 'Abdullah Ibn Zam'a over a child. Sa'd said: O Messenger of Allah, he is the son of my brother 'Utba Ibn Abi Waqqas. He (`Utba Ibn Abi Waqqas) explicitly explained to me that it (the child) is his son. See the similarity between them! 'Abd Ibn Zam'a said: (O Messenger of Allah, it is my brother. It was born on my father's bed from his servant.) Then the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) saw the similarity between the two ; and he saw a clear resemblance between the child and 'Utba. Nevertheless he said: He is yours, O 'Abd. The child belongs to the one on whose bed it was born, and the stoning is for the fornicator ('Utba, the real father of the child). You, Sauda Bint Zam'a, should wear the veil before him (the child)!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2645]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (The child belongs to the one on whose bed it was born; and the whore must be stoned.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim,   Chapter 18, Hadīṯ no. 2646]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) visited me and he looked so pleased. His features lit up with joy. Then he said: Did you not see that Mugazziz looked at Zaid Ibn Haritha and Usama Ibn Zaid and said: (Some of these feet are similar.) [   Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2647]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: According to the Sunnah, if someone who married a deflowered woman wants to marry another virgin, he should stay with her for seven nights. But if someone who is already married to a virgin wants to marry a deflowered woman, he must stay with her for three nights.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2654]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: I have never loved a woman like Sauda bint Zam'a. So I wish I was just like her. She was a hot-tempered woman. When she grew up, she gave me ('A'ishah) her day with the Messenger of Allah. She said: (O Messenger of Allah, I granted 'A'ishah my day with you.) Therefore, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) allocated to 'A'isha two days, her day and the day of Saudah .  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2657]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: I felt jealousy towards the women who devote themselves to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him); and the women are allowed to give themselves. When Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, revealed the following verse of the Qur'an: You may release those of them whom you desire (to dismiss), and you may retain those whom you desire (to retain); and if you want to take back one whom you have dismissed [Quran 33:51] Then I said: (By Allah, I only see that your Lord hastens in your inclination.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no . 2658]

Hadith from Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: 'Ata' reported: We attended a funeral with Ibn 'Abbas in Zarif. Ibn 'Abbas said: (This is the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). So when you raise her bier, you should neither shake nor sway it, but be gentle with it. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). , had new wives, among only eight of whom he shared his time.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2660]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When a woman gets married, she will usually be desired for four reasons: (For her wealth, her parentage, her beauty and her piety. Take So a happy outcome with the woman who is pious, so that your hands can get a considerable profit.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2661]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (The woman is like a rib. If you straighten her, you will break her; and if you leave her like that, you enjoy it while it remains crooked.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ no. 2669]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (If it had not been for Eve, a woman would never have acted unfaithfully to her husband!) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 18, Ḥadīṯ   No . 2673]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: I spoke at the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) who declared my wife's divorce while she was on her menstrual period. Then (his father) asked 'Umar Ibnal Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said to him: (Command him to restore his marital relationship with his wife and with her for as long lives as usual until she is free from her period. Then he should wait until she has her period again and then becomes free again. Then he can decide before he touches her. This is the waiting time for the woman who Allah for their divorce.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2675]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: If one declares that his wife is forbidden to him (without divorcing her), then one must atone for this oath. Ibn 'Abbas also said: You have a fine example in the Messenger of Allah. [Quran 33:21]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ No. 2692]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to stay with Zaynab Bint Gahsh and drink honey with her. Then Hafsa and I agreed that the one of us to whom the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) would come next should say to him: (You smell of Maghafir. Have you eaten Maghafir?) The Prophet shouted : (No, I did not eat Maghafir. I ate honey at Zaynab, but I will never eat it again.) Then the Quranic verses for 'A'ishah and Hafsa were revealed. Why do you forbid what Allah has allowed you ? .until (When you both turn to Allah in repentance...) [Quran 66:1] and the Quranic verses And when the Prophet had spoken in confidence to one of his wives.. [Quran 66:3] revealed for the Prophet, there he said: (No, I ate honey.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2694]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was ordered to let his wives decide, he began with me. Then he said: (I will tell you something. But don't rush into your decision until you get advice from your parents!) She ('A'isha) said: He already knew that my parents wouldn't let me go to separate from him. He then said that Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, said: O Prophet! Say to your wives: "If you desire the life of this world and its adornments, then come, I will give you a gift and then send you off in a fair way. But if you desire Allah and His Messenger and the Abode of the Hereafter, then Indeed, Allah has prepared a great reward for those of you who do good." [Quran 33:28-29] Then I said: What do I seek advice from my parents about? I choose Allah, His Messenger and the abode hereafter. The rest of the wives of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did the same.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2696]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to ask us for permission when he had to spend the night with one of our wives (his wives). He did so after the following Qur'anic verse was revealed: You may release those of them whom you desire (to dismiss), and you may retain those whom you desire (to retain). [Quran 26:97] Then Mu'aza said to her ('A'ishah): (How do you answer the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he asks you for permission?) She ('A'ishah) said: (If I had the decision, then I would not have preferred anyone but myself.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2697]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave us choice. But we didn't consider this choice to be a case of divorce.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2698]

'Umar Ibnal Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was away from his wives, I entered the mosque. Then I found the people throwing pebbles on the ground and saying: (The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) divorced his wives.) This was before they were ordered to veil. Then I said (to myself): I have to inquire about it today. So I went to 'A'ishah and said: You, daughter of Abu Bakr, are you reaching the point of inflicting trouble on the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)? She replied: O Ibnal Khattab, you have nothing to do with me and I have nothing to do with you. So concern yourself only with your container (i.e. go and advise your daughter Hafsa!) Then I went to Hafsa Bint 'Umar and said: O Hafsa, are you reaching the state of inflicting trouble on the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)? By Allah, I knew that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) does not love you, and if it were not for me, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) would have divorced you. She cried too much. I said to her: Where is the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)? She answered: (He is in his attic) I went to him. Then I found Rabah, servant of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), sitting on the doorstep of the attic. He dangled his legs from a wooden trunk. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used this trunk to go up and down. I shouted: You Rabah, ask the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to let me enter! Rabah looked towards the chamber then looked at me and said nothing. Then I said: You Rabah, ask the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to let me in! Rabah looked at the chamber again and then at me and said nothing. Then I raised my voice and said: You Rabah, ask the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to let me enter! I believe that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) suspected that I came for Hafsa. By Allah, if the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) orders me to cut off Hafsa's head, then I will cut off her head. I raised my voice. Then he (Rabah) gave me a sign to go up. I went to see the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). That's when I found him lying on a mat. I sat and he lowered the loincloth he was wearing. I also found that the mat left marks on his side. I looked at the storeroom of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and I found only a handful of barley weighing about one Saa' (measurement of grain). I also found in one side of the chamber the same quantity of leaves from a plant that is used for tanning, and a hung leather that has not been tanned. Then tears came to my eyes. He said: (What makes you cry, O Ibnal Khattab?) I said: O Prophet of Allah, why do I not cry, and this mat left signs on your side; and I see nothing different in your storage room than what I see now. Caesar and Chosroes live in abundance of fruits and rivers, while you are the Messenger of Allah and his chosen one; and this is your storage room. He said: O Ibnal Khattab, are you not satisfied that the Hereafter is for us and this world is for them? I replied: Yes! When I walked in he looked angry. Then I said: What bothers you with women? If you divorced them, then Allah and His angels, Gabriel, Michael, I, Abu Bakr and all the believers are with you. I said little and thanked Allah for it. I hoped that Allah would confirm what I said! Then the Quranic verse of decision was revealed:Perhaps, when he separates from you, his Lord will give him better wives than you, Muslim, believing, obedient, penitent, pious, fasting (women), Thaiyibat and virgins, in your place. [Quran 66:5] and But if you support one another against him, verily, then Allah is his Protector; and Gabriel and the righteous among the believers (are also his protectors); and besides, the angels are (his) helpers. . 'A'ishah bint Abi Bakr, and Hafsa, among all the wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), supported each other against him. I said: O Messenger of Allah, do you separate from them? He said: (No.) Then I said: O Messenger of Allah, I entered the mosque and found the Muslims throwing pebbles on the ground and said: (The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) has separated from his wives divorced.) Shall I go down to them and say that you have not divorced your wives? He (the Prophet) said: Yes, if you want. I continued to talk to him until he stopped being angry and smiled. He had the most beautiful mouth of all people. After that, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went down. I went down there too, holding on to the trunk. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) also went down as if he were walking on the ground. He didn't even touch the trunk. I said: O Messenger of Allah, you stayed in the chamber for twenty-nine days. He said: The month is twenty-nine days. Then I stood in front of the door of the mosque and shouted in a loud voice: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not divorce his wives; and the following verse of the Qur'an was revealed: And when anything concerning security or fear comes to their ears, they make it known. But if they had brought it before the Messengers and those in command among them, then surely those among them who could reveal it would know it. And were it not for Allah's grace and mercy upon you, you would all have followed Satan, with a few exceptions. [Quran 4:83] So I was the one who was able to reveal this matter. Then Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, revealed the Qur'anic verse Al-Takhjir (Decision).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2704]

The Hadith of Subai'a, may Allah be pleased with her: 'Umar Ibn 'Abdillah wrote to 'Abdullah Ibn 'Utba to inform him that Subai'a informed him that she was the wife of Sa'd Ibn Khaula, who belonged to Banu `Amer Ibn Lu'ay, and took part in the day of the Battle of Badr. He (Sa`d Ibn Khaula) died during the farewell pilgrimage while she was pregnant. Immediately after his death, she gave birth to what she had been carrying. When she recovered from the suffering of childbirth, she adorned herself for the suitors for her hand in marriage. Abu As-Sanabel Ibn Ba'kak, a man from Banu 'Abd Ad-Dar, came to her and said: Why do you adorn yourself? Do you want to marry? By Allah! You can't get married until four months and ten days (the waiting period) is over! Subai'a said: (When he told me this, I put on my clothes and when it got dark, I went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and asked him about it. He gave me a legal opinion that allowed me to marry again after my confinement; and he told me that I can marry as I want.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2728]

Abu Salama, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Umm Salama said: Subai'a Al-Aslamiya (of the tribe of Banu Aslam) gave birth to a child a few nights after the death of her husband. When she reported it to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he ordered her to get married.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2729]

The Hadith of Umm Habiba, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: Zainab Bint Abi Salama said: I came to Umm Habiba, wife of the Prophet, when her father Abu Sufyan died. She had yellow perfume or something similar brought, perfumed a servant girl with it, and rubbed it on her cheeks. Then she said: By Allah, I have no need to put perfume on myself, but I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying in the pulpit: A woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day should ask for one The dead cannot be mourned for longer than three days, unless the dead person was her husband. In this case, the mourning period lasts four months and ten days!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2730]

The Hadith of Zainab Bint Gahsh (may Allah be pleased with her): Zainab Bint Abi Salama said: I came to Zainab Bint Gahsh when her brother died. She had perfume brought, rubbed herself with it and said: By Allah, I have no need to perfume myself. But I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying from the pulpit: A woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day should not mourn for a dead person for more than three days; unless the dead man was her husband. In this case, the mourning period lasts four months and ten days.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2731]

Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: A woman came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, my daughter's husband has died and my daughter has a problem with her eyes. Can we put collyrium (ointment to make eyes black) on her eyes? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No! He repeated this answer two or three times. Then he said: The mourning period should last four months and ten days. In pre-Islamic times, a widowed woman was only allowed to throw away dung after a year!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2732]

Umm 'Atiyya, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A woman should not mourn for a dead person for more than three days unless the dead person was her husband. In this case, the mourning period lasts four months and ten days. (During the mourning period) she is not allowed to wear colored clothing, except the Yemeni decorated robes, nor to use perfume. She may use something made from incense or azfar (a type of perfume) only after purification from the menstrual period.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 19, Ḥadīṯ no. 2739]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd As-Sa'idiy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 'Uwaimer Al-'Aglaniy came to 'Asim Ibn 'Adiy Al-Ansariy and said to him: You 'Asim, what do you think if a Husband finds a strange man with his wife. Should he kill him and that's why you kill him (the husband) or what? O 'Asim, ask the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about this matter for me! When 'Asim asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about this, he saw that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was dissatisfied with such a question and declared it bad. Because of what he heard from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), 'Asim became very distressed. When he returned to his family, 'Uwaimer came to him and said: What did the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say to you? 'Asim said to 'Uwaimer: Your cause has brought me no blessing. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was dissatisfied with such a question and declared it bad. 'Uwaimer replied: By Allah! I won't stop until I ask him about it! After that, 'Uwaimer came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) while he was sitting with the people and said: O Messenger of Allah, what do you think about a husband finding a strange man with his wife? Should he kill him and you kill him (the husband) as a result, or what? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah has already revealed a decision about your affair and that of your companion. Then go home and bring your companion with you! When he appeared there with her, they performed li'an while I was sitting with the people with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). When the two had finished, 'Uwaimer said: It would have meant that he ('Uwaimer) had previously divorced her three times before the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had asked him to do so.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 20, Ḥadīṯ No. 2741]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: Sa'id Ibn Gubair reported: I was asked about the curse-callers during the reign of Mus'ab whether they should be separated or not. But I didn't know the answer. So I went to the house of Ibn 'Umar in Mecca and said to his servant: Ask permission for me to enter! But he replied: My master is taking a nap. Meanwhile, Ibn 'Umar heard my voice and asked: Is this Ibn Gubair? I replied: Yes! He said: Come in! With Allah, what has brought you now is something important. When I entered, I saw Ibn 'Umar sitting on a saddle and leaning on a cushion made of fibers. I said to him: You, Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman, should the cursers be separated? He replied: Allah be praised! Yes! The first person to ask was so-and-so. He said: O Messenger of Allah, what does he do who discovers that his wife is committing adultery? When he speaks, he says something embarrassing; but if he is silent, is he also hiding something embarrassing? The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) remained silent and did not answer him. Later that man came to him (the Prophet) again and said to him: What I asked you about has befallen me. Thus, Allah, the Exalted and Almighty, revealed the following verses And if someone accuses his spouse... [Quran 24:6] in Surah An-Nur (the Light). He (The Prophet) read these verses to the man, admonishing him and reminding him that the torment of this world is much lighter than that of the Hereafter. He (The Man) said: By Him Who sent you with the truth, I have not devised lies against them. But the Messenger of Allah called this man's wife to him, admonished her and reminded her that the torment of this world is much easier than the torment of the Hereafter. She said: No! By the One who sent you with the truth, he lied. Then he started with the man. He swore by Allah four times that he was certainly one of the truthful. And the fifth time, may Allah's curse come upon him if he is one of the liars. Second came the woman who swore by Allah four times that he was certainly a liar. And the fifth time, may the wrath of Allah come upon them if he is one of the truthful. Finally he (the Prophet) separated them from each other.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 20, Ḥadīṯ No. 2742]

Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Li'an was mentioned in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). 'Asim Ibn 'Adiy gave his opinion and then left. Later, a man from his family members came to him and complained that he found a strange man with his wife. Then 'Asim said: I am distressed because of my pronunciation. He brought him to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and told him about his wife's deed. This (the husband) was a pale and thin man with straight hair. But the man whom the husband accused of being with his wife was a fat man with fat legs. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O Allah make the matter clear! The woman gave birth to a child who is similar to the suspected man. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) made them perform the oath of cursing (Li'an). In the meeting, a man said to Ibn 'Abbas: Is she the woman about whom the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: If I were to stone someone without clear evidence, would I stone that woman? Ibn 'Abbas said: No, she was a woman who publicly spreads wickedness in Islam.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 20, Ḥadīṯ No. 2750]

The Hadith of Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him): Sa'd Ibn 'Ubada said: If I had caught a man with my wife, I would have struck him with a sword and would not have forgiven him. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) found out about this, he said (to his companions): Do you wonder at Sa'd's sense of honor? By Allah, my sense of honor is stronger! And it is even more intense with Allah. Because of his sense of honor, Allah forbade the visible and hidden abominations. No one's sense of honor is stronger than that of Allah. And none accepts the excuses (of his servants) more readily than Allah. Therefore he sent the messengers as bringers of good news and as warners. And no one loves praise better than Allah, so he promised (his righteous servants) Paradise.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 20, Ḥadīṯ No. 2755]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man from Banu Fazaara came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, my wife has given birth to me a black son! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: Do you own camels? The man said: Yes! Then he (the Prophet) asked: What color are they? The man said: They are red. Then he (the Prophet) said: Are there dark camels among these? He (The Man) said: Yes! among them there is also a dark camel. He (The Prophet) said: Where does it come from? The man replied: It may have come through from an ancient race. The Prophet said: Your son may also have come from a previous lineage.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 20, Ḥadīṯ No. 2756]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever wants to give up his share in a slave and thereby sets the slave free, and if he has enough money, then he should value the slave upright and give the other partners their shares in the slave. Thus the slave becomes free unless only the portion of the man who wants to free the slave is free.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 21, Ḥadīṯ No. 2758]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said about the slave owned by two men: If one of them wants to give up his share (of the slave) and thereby sets him free, then he should give his share (in the slave) to the partner if he can afford it   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 21, Ḥadīṯ no. 2759]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar reported that 'A'ishah wanted to buy a slave and then free her. Her owners said: We sell her to you on the condition that her loyalty and our right to her inheritance remain with us. She told this to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then he said: This shall not hinder you. The right to inheritance remains (in fact) with the one who freed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 21, Ḥadīṯ No. 2761]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the sale and donation of the slave's inheritance.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 21, Ḥadīṯ No. 2770]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If one grants freedom to a believing slave, then for every member of the slave's body, Allah saves an equal member of his own body from Hellfire.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 21, Ḥadīṯ No. 2775]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade purchasing by touching (Mulamasa) and also by throwing (Munabaza).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2780]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us two types of sales and two types of clothing. He banned selling by just touching (Mulamasa) and also by throwing the goods (Munabaza).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2782]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the sale of the fetus of a female camel, assuming that it was a female.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2784]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None of you should outbid his brother after he has already completed the deal.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ No. 2788]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the sham transaction (Nagash).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2792]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the goods to be caught on the way until they had taken their place in the market. This hadith was narrated according to the narration of Ibn Numair. The other two scholars (Abu Bakr Ibn Shaiba and Muhammad Ibnal Muthanna) said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the interception of goods on the way.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2793]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the goods to be intercepted on the way.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2794]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the riders (merchants) to be intercepted on the way; and he also forbade trade between a sedentary and a nomad. (The point is that a gullible, inexperienced nomad should be protected from abuse compared to a clever city dweller. The city dweller should therefore not be an intermediary for the nomad.) [Ṣaḥīḥ   Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2798]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We are forbidden to trade between a sedentary and a nomad; even if he were his father or his brother.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2800]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever bought a sheep whose milk was retained in its udder should first milk it at home. If he is satisfied with his milk, he should keep it, otherwise he should give it back to the seller and add a Saa' (a measure) of dried dates to him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2802]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever has bought food must not sell it again until it has become his possession.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2807]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The buyer and the seller always have freedom of choice until they separate from each other. Trade with the right of withdrawal is excluded from this.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2821]

Hakim Ibn Hizaam (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The buyer and the seller always have freedom of choice until they part ways. If they were truthful and honest with one another, the transaction between them was a blessing; and if they had lied or concealed anything, all blessing was cut off from their business.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2825]

Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man mentioned to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) that he was being cheated out of business. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: When you enter into a transaction, you should say (in the contract): There shall be no fraud. After that he used to say when he made a sale: There should be no fraud.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2826]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prohibited the trade in fruits before their quality was determined. He prohibited both the seller and the buyer from doing this.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2827]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us to sell fruits before they ripen.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2831]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the sale of dates until they could be eaten or until they became edible, and also until their weight was determined. I asked: How can you determine that? Then a man with him said: They can be judged on the palm trees.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2833]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Do not sell the fruits until they ripen.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2834]

Zaid Ibn Thabit (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) permitted the borrower of palm trees to appraise the fruits of his palm trees and sell them for an equivalent quantity of dried dates.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2838]

Sahl Ibn Abu Hathma (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the sale of the fruit for dried dates. He said: Such selling is usury called muzabana. However, he allowed the fruits to be sold for dates of equal value, or allowed the family to sell the fruits on the two palm trees for dates of equal value by valuation.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2842]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) permitted the sale of the fruits of the palm trees after a presumptive assessment of their quantity for less than five Wasaq (Wasaq = 60 Saa`, i.e. a unit of measurement for the grain) or against 5 wasaq.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2845]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the muzabana, and the muzabana is the sale of fruits for dried dates with the same unit of measurement and the sale of fresh grapes for raisins with the same unit Unit of measurement.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2846]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever sells date palms that have already been fertilized is entitled to the harvest unless the buyer obtains it through an additional one Acquired with agreement.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2851]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the leasing of the land.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2861]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, said: We used to think that there was nothing wrong with us renting out the fields (in return for a portion of the produce in return). It continued like this until Rafi' claimed last year that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2879]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Giving land to one's fellow believer for free is better than paying a certain tribute for his land.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2892]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) dealt with the inhabitants of Khaybar in such a way that they gave half of what the land given to them yielded from trees and agriculture brings.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2896]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: No Muslim will plant a tree or plant a seed in the ground for birds, people or animals to eat without his being responsible for it (from Allah) will receive the reward of alms (Sadaqa).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2904]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the sale of palm fruits before they began to ripen. When we asked Anas how exactly to determine this time, he said: When they turn red or yellow. What do you think if Allah does not allow the fruits to ripen? How then could you allow yourselves to keep your brothers' money (the prize)?  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2906]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) heard loud voices at the door. It was a dispute between some opponents. One of them asked the other to reduce his debts and to be forgiving of him, while the other said: By Allah, I will not do that. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out to them and said: Where is he who swears by Allah that he will not do charity? He said: I, O Messenger of Allah, let him do whatever he wished.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2911]

The Hadith of Ka'b Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): Ibn Abu Hadrad owed Ka'b some money at the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Later, Ka'b asked him to repay his debts, and that was in the mosque. They got into an argument and shouted at each other. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) heard their loud voices while he was in his house. So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to meet us, opened the curtain of his house and called Ka'b Ibn Malik. He (the Messenger) said: O Ka'b! I (Ka'b) said: Yes, Messenger of Allah. He gestured with his hand that I should forgive half of the debt. Then I said: Done, Messenger of Allah. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said (to Ibn Abu Hadrad): Get up and pay back your debts.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2912]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Whoever finds his own cause in a man or a person who has become bankrupt, he is more likely to receive justice (on the matter) in front of the others.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2913]

Huthaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The angels received the spirit of one of the forefathers and asked him: Have you done something good? He said: No. Then they said: Remember! Then he said: I used to give credit to people and to instruct my assistants to give time to the person in need of money and to be lenient with the wealthy. (The Messenger) then said: Allah, the Exalted and Glorious said (to the angels): Then bear with him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2917]

Abu Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A man who lived before you was brought to justice. It was then revealed that he had done nothing good except that deed. He was a wealthy man and people used to borrow money from him. He used to instruct his assistants to forgive the debts of people in need of money. Allah, the Exalted and Glorious, said: We are more worthy of this decree than he. Forgive him the guilt!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2921]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A man used to give credit to people and instruct his assistant as follows: If you come across a person in need of money, forgive him Guilt, may Allah forgive our debt too! And when he went to Allah, He forgave him his guilt!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2922]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A rich man's delay in repaying his debts is a gross injustice. If the right of repayment towards one of you is transferred to another man, he should accept it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2924]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The excess water should not be blocked for the purpose of preventing the growth of pasture grass!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2927]

Abu Mas'ud Al-Ansary, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, declared it impermissible to take money for a dog. The same applies to prostitution and fortune telling.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2930]
Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave his order to kill the dogs.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2934]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever keeps a dog, his good deeds will be reduced by two parts every day; This does not apply to dogs kept for the purposes of hunting and sheep-keeping.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2940]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever keeps a dog that is not kept for the purpose of hunting, sheep herding or farming, his good deeds will be taken care of daily reduce two parts.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2947]

Sufyan Ibn Zuhair (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If a person keeps a dog, he will receive one Qirat of the reward for his good deeds every day unless the dog is used to protect the fields and livestock.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2951]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik, may Allah be pleased with him: Anas Ibn Malik was asked about the reward of the person who performed bloodletting. Then he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) allowed Abu Taiba to treat him with bloodletting. In return, he had Abu Taiba take two Saa' (measurement of grain) of food. The Messenger of Allah also spoke to his Lord to reduce his tax. The Messenger of Allah further said: The best medicine for you is bloodletting treatment or it is among your best medicines.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2952]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: When the last verses of the second Surah Al-Baqarah were revealed, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out and recited them in front of the people and then banned trading in them the alcohol.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2958]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying this when he was in Makkah in the year of the conquest: Verily Allah forbids, and so does His Messenger Trade in alcohol, dead animals, pigs and idols (or idol figures). He was then asked the following question: O Messenger of Allah, what about the fat of dead animals? Because it is used to paint ships and care for leather and is used by people as fuel for their lamps. The Prophet said: No! That is forbidden! Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: May Allah curse the Jews; for indeed Allah has forbidden them the fat of these animals, and they melted it, sold it, and consumed the proceeds thereof.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2960]

The Hadith of 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him: Ibn 'Abbas reported: 'Umar was informed that Samurah was selling alcohol. He said: Allah curse Samura! Did he not know that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah curses the Jews, for Allah has indeed forbidden them the fat (of dead animals), and they melted it and then sold it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2961]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: May Allah curse the Jews; for Allah forbade them the fat of dead animals, and they sold it and consumed the proceeds of it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2962]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Do not sell gold for gold, except (exchange) of like for like, that is, adding neither to it take some more of it! Neither sell silver with silver, except as one with another, neither adding to it nor taking away from it. Trading with it is permitted as long as there is no delay.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2964]

'Umar Ibnal Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Exchanging silver for gold is usury unless it is an instantaneous exchange. The exchange of wheat for wheat is usury, unless it is (an exchange) on the spot. Barley for barley is usury, unless it is (an exchange) on the spot. And the exchange of dates for dates is usury, unless it is (an exchange) on the spot.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2968]

The Hadith of Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him): Abul Minhal said: A partner of mine wanted to sell me silver on credit until the next season or the time of the Hajj. He came to me and told me this. But I told him: That's not possible. Then he said, I sold silver like this in the market, and no one blamed me for it. Then I went to Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib and asked him about it. He said: At the time when the Prophet came to Madina, we were used to selling on credit. So he said: What is sold on the spot is blameless, but what is sold on credit is usury. Al-Bara' further said: You can better go to Zaid Ibn Arqam because he has bigger trade than mine. Then when I came to him and asked him about it, he said the same thing.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2975]

Abu Bakra (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us to sell silver for silver or gold for gold, except for equal for equal. He commanded us to buy silver with gold, and gold with silver, as we please. A man asked the narrator whether the Prophet said (on the spot). He said: This is what I heard (from the Prophet).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2977]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) appointed a man from Banu 'Adiy Al-Ansary as the administrator of Khaibar. One day this man came to Madina and brought with him dates of a very good variety called Ganib. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked him: Are all the dates in Khaibar that good? The man replied: No, by Allah! O Messenger of Allah, we exchange one Saa' (a measure) of this good kind for two of the other bad kinds. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You must not do that! Not even with the help of a weight measure! Either sell like for like or sell your dates for money and buy these delicious dates for money!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2983]

Abu Sa'id (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Bilal came and brought with him dates of a very good variety called Barniy. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked him: Where did you bring these from? Bilal replied: I had bad dates. For the Prophet's (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) food, I sold two Saa' of these bad dates for one Saa' of good quality dates. The Messenger of Allah said: O woe! But that is usury! Do not do that! If you want to buy dates of a good variety, then sell the bad variety and buy the good variety at its price!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2985]

The Hadith of 'Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Nadra reported: I asked Ibn 'Abbas about exchanging gold for gold or for silver or vice versa. He said: Was it hand to hand (personally). I replied: Yes. He said: There is nothing wrong with that. I informed Abu Sa'id that I asked Ibn 'Abbas about the barter and what he said. He (Abu Sa`id) said: Did he say that? I will write to him not to give an opinion on this matter. By Allah, some of the servants of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) brought him a type of date that was strange to him. Then he said: These dates look as if they were not from our country. One of them replied: Our dates were poor in quality this year. So I took the dates, added some and exchanged them for a smaller measure of better quality dates. He (the Prophet) said: This is already usury. Don't eat it! If you are not satisfied with some of your dates, then sell them and use their price to buy whatever dates you want.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2988]

Abu Sa`id Al-Khudry, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Dinar (monetary unit) should be sold with dinars and so the dirham (monetary unit) with dirhams, one equal with one equal. Whoever gives or demands more is engaging in usury. I (Abu Salih) said to him: Ibn 'Abbas says something different. He (Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry) said: I met Ibn 'Abbas and said to him: Have you heard your sayings from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) or have you found them in the Book of Allah, the Exalted and Almighty ? He said: I have not heard it from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) nor have I found it in the Book of Allah, but Usama Ibn Zaid reported to me that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Usury lies in deferment of payment.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2990]

Usama Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Indeed, there is usury in deferred payment. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2991]

An-Nu'maan Ibn Bashir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saying (An-Nu'maan pointed to his ears with his two fingers): What is permissible is obvious and the forbidden is obvious, and between the two there are doubtful things of which many people have no knowledge. Whoever avoids doubtful things thereby ensures that his faith and his honor are impeccable; but whoever is involved in doubtful things, he is involved in what is forbidden and resembles a shepherd who grazes his flock around someone else's territory and almost violates the property rights of another. Verily, every king has his own territory, and the things forbidden by Allah constitute the territory of Allah. Verily, there is a small piece of flesh in the human body; if this is good, the whole body is good; but if it is corrupt, the whole body is corrupt. Verily, this is the heart!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 2996]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had a debt to a man, and the man demanded that he repay his debt in a rude manner. The companions of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) wanted to approach the man, but the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said to them: Whoever has a right to something is also entitled to the word! Then he said to them, Buy him a camel and give it to him. They said: We only find camels that are better than his camel. Then he said: Buy a camel for him, for the best of you or among you is the one who pays off his debts in the best way.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 3003]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) bought food from a Jew on credit and left his coat of mail with him as a pledge.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 3007]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to Madinah and found that the people were giving loans in exchange for fruits for periods of one and two years. He said: Whoever grants a loan against something, only a certain measure and a certain weight and at a certain time.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 3010]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Swearing for the purpose of selling a commodity destroys profit.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 3014]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever has a partner in a house, land or date palms must not sell his share until he notifies his partner. He should give his partner the right of first refusal. If his partner wants to buy it, he buys it. If he doesn't want to buy it, the first one is free to sell it to someone else.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 3016]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None of you should prevent his neighbor from fixing a piece of wood on his own wall.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 3019]

Sa'id Ibn Zaid Ibn 'Amr Ibn Nufail (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever appropriates a piece of land unlawfully, even if it is as large as the span of a hand, Allah will cause it to be carried on his neck as a sevenfold burden on the Day of Resurrection.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 3020]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever usurps a piece of land, even if it is the size of a hand's span, bears it as a sevenfold burden his neck (on the Day of Resurrection).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 3025]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If you disagree about a passage (between two pieces of land), let its width be seven cubits.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 22, Ḥadīṯ no. 3026]

Usama Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The Muslim does not inherit the disbeliever and the disbeliever does not inherit the Muslim!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 23, Ḥadīṯ no. 3027]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The inheritance shares must be given to their beneficiaries. Whatever remains afterward belongs to the nearest male relative.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 23, Ḥadīṯ no. 3028]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: I was sick and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and Abu Bakr paid me a sick visit. They came to me on foot as I lay there unconscious. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) washed himself for prayer and poured the water from him on me; Then I came to my consciousness and said: O Messenger of Allah, how should I decide about my wealth? He gave me no answer (and this was not forthcoming) until the Qur'anic verse about inheritance was revealed: They ask you for instruction. Say: "Allah teaches you about lateral kinship: If a man dies and leaves no children,... [Quran 4:176]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 23, Ḥadīṯ No. 3031]

Al-Bara', may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The last verse of the Qur'an revealed (in Surah Al-Nisaa') is: They ask you for instruction. Say: "Allah teaches you about relatives: If a man dies and leaves no children, but has a sister, then she receives half of his inheritance; and he inherits her if she has no children. But if there are two (sisters ), then they receive two thirds of his inheritance. And if they are siblings, men and women, there is the same amount for one male as for two females." Allah makes this clear to you, so that you do not err; and Allah knows all things. [Quran 4:176]    [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 23, Ḥadīṯ No. 3036]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When the dead man, who was in debt, was brought to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), he first asked: Did the dead man leave enough money to pay off his debts? If so, then he (the Prophet) performed the funeral prayer for him. If not, he said: Perform the funeral prayer for your brother! When Allah opened the way of conquest to His Messenger, he said: I am closer to the creditors than to himself. Whoever dies in debt, I will pay back his debts. But if the dead person left money, the money goes to his heirs.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 23, Ḥadīṯ No. 3040]

'Umar Ibnal Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I donated a noble horse for the cause of Allah. But the man to whom it was given treated it very badly. For this reason I wanted to buy it back. I also thought it would get me a good price. I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about this matter. He said: No, don't buy it and don't take back your donation. Because whoever revokes his donation is like a dog who eats what he previously vomited!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 24, Ḥadīṯ no. 3044]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: (His father) 'Umar Ibnal Khattab (once) donated a horse to the cause of Allah so that one of the Muslim fighters could ride on him. He later found the horse at the market while it was being offered for sale. Then he wanted to buy it back and asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about this matter. He (The Messenger of Allah) said: No, do not buy it and do not take back your donation!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 24, Ḥadīṯ no. 3046]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The parable of the one who asks for his gift back is like the parable of the dog that vomits and eats its vomit again.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 24, Ḥadīṯ No. 3048]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever asks for his gift again is like one who eats his vomit again.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 24, Ḥadīṯ No. 3050]

The Hadeeth of An-Nu'maan Ibn Bashir (may Allah be pleased with him): His father took him to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said to him: I gave this son of mine a young servant to me belonged, as a gift. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Have you given the same gift to your other children? He said: No! Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: Then take back your gift.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 24, Ḥadīṯ No. 3052]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever is given a gift for his lifetime and for the lifetime of his offspring is entitled to this gift.
