The donor is not allowed to revoke it because it is now a matter of inheritance rules.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 24, Ḥadīṯ No. 3062]
Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Lifetime donation is permissible.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 24, Ḥadīṯ No. 3073]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: It is not right for a Muslim who has something he wants to make a legacy to spend two nights without that he keeps with him a will that he has written down.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 25, Ḥadīṯ No. 3074]

Sa'd Ibn Abu Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I was so sick that I thought I would die soon. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) paid me a sick visit. That was the year of the farewell pilgrimage. I said to him: O Messenger of Allah, you can see the pain I am suffering from. But I have great wealth and only one daughter who will inherit me. Can I give two-thirds of my wealth as alms? He replied: No! Then I said: Then half? Then the Prophet said: Only a third, and a third is a great deal. It is much better if you leave your relatives as wealthy people than if they are poor and have to beg people for gifts. And all the expenses you incur in seeking the favor of Allah will be rewarded to you, even every single morsel you put in your wife's mouth! I said: Will my companions leave me here? (i.e. Will I die here?) The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: You will not continue to live and do good deeds without Allah raising you to ranks. May Allah let you live until you become useful to people and harmful to other people. O Allah, let my companions receive the reward of their migration in full and do not let them turn back on their heels (i.e. Do not let them deviate from the right path). However, poor Sa`d Ibn Khaula is unhappy as he died in Makkah. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) felt sad because of this.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 25, Ḥadīṯ no. 3076]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: If the people (given the right to dispose of their wealth before their death) reduced from a third to a quarter. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A third? Even a third is a lot.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 25, Ḥadīṯ no. 3080]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 'Umar acquired a piece of land in Khaibar. He then went to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) to seek advice from him. He said: O Messenger of Allah, I have acquired a piece of land in Khaibar. I have never acquired anything more valuable to me than this piece of land. What do you advise me to do? He replied: If you wish, you can donate the land and give the produce from it as alms. 'Umar donated the land on the condition that it may not be sold, bought, inherited or given away. 'Umar then donated it for the poor, the relatives, the slaves, those on the path of Allah, the travelers whose provisions for the journey had run out, and for the guests. It is not a sin for the manager of the estate if he makes a living from it or feeds a friend of his who does not intend to unjustly enrich himself.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 25, Ḥadīṯ no. 3085]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa, may Allah be pleased with them: Talha Ibn Musrif reported: I asked 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa, may Allah be pleased with them, the following question: Did the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, leave a will? ? He replied: No! I then said to him: How is it that he made it compulsory for Muslims to draw up a will? Or why were they ordered to make a will when he didn't do it himself? He replied: His testament was to adhere to the Book of Allah, the Almighty and Exalted.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 25, Ḥadīṯ no. 3086]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not leave behind a dinar, a dirham, a sheep, a camel, or a will.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 25, Ḥadīṯ no. 3087]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: Sa'id Ibn Gubair reported: Ibn 'Abbas said: Thursday, and what about Thursday. And then he wept until his tears moistened the stones (on the earth). I asked him: What about Thursday, Ibn 'Abbas? He said: When the pain overwhelmed the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he said: Come to me! I would like to write something down for you so that you don't deviate from the right path after my death! But they quarreled, even though there should be no quarrels in the presence of a prophet. Some said: What's wrong with him? Was he rambling (because of his pain)? (Others said:) Ask him! He then said: Let me! What I am suffering now is better for me. I leave you with three testaments: First: Bring out the fellow gods from Arabia! Second: Allow the delegations to enter (Arabia) and be hospitable to them, as I always do! Here Sa'id Ibn Gubair said: But he (Ibn 'Abbas) was silent about the third testament, or perhaps he said it, but I forgot.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 25, Ḥadīṯ no. 3089]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: Sa'id Ibn 'Ubada asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to clarify the vow that his mother made for a votive offering and then died before she received it fulfilled. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Do it in their place!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 26, Ḥadīṯ No. 3092]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) one day forbade us to make a vow of offering, saying: A offering neither brings about anything nor abolishes anything that exists. The only purpose of votive offering is to get something from a miser.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 26, Ḥadīṯ no. 3093]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Do not make vows. The vow is of no use compared to predestination. Its only purpose is to get something out of a miser.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 26, Ḥadīṯ no. 3096]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw an old man leaning on his two sons. He said: What's wrong with this? They said: He has made a vow (to Allah) to walk (to the Ka'bah). He said: Verily Allah has no need of this man's self-torture, and he commanded him to ride.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 26, Ḥadīṯ No. 3100]

'Uqba Ibn 'Amer (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: My sister made a vow (before Allah) to go to the Ka'bah barefoot. Then she ordered me to ask the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) for information. So I asked him for information and he said: She should walk (as long as she can) and then ride.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 26, Ḥadīṯ no. 3102]

'Umar Ibnal Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, forbids you from swearing by your fathers.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3104]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever of you has sworn by Al-Lat (an idol) shall la ilaha illal-lah (there is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah) speak; and whoever says to his companion, “Come, I want to gamble with you!”, he shall give alms (Sadaqa).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3107]

Abu Musa Al-Ash'ariy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) when he was with a small group of Ash'arites so that he could give us the opportunity to ride. He said: By Allah, I cannot provide you with anything that will transport you, and I have nothing that you can ride on. He (Abu Musa) said: We waited as long as Allah wanted. Then camels were brought to him. He gave us three camels with white humps. When we set out we said, or some of us said: Allah bless us not. We came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to give us the opportunity to ride. He swore that he could not provide us with mounts. Then he gave it to us. They came to the Messenger of Allah and asked him about it. He said: I was not the one who gave you this, but Allah did. And by Allah, if I swear about something and then find that it would be better if I did otherwise, I do what is better, Allah willing, and make atonement for my swearing.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3109]

'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Samurah reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: O 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Samurah! Don't ask for leadership; for if you hold it according to desire, you will be at its mercy, and if you are given the task without being asked, you will be helped. And if you swear about something and see that it would be better if you did otherwise, make atonement for your vow and do what is better!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3120]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Sulaiman (Solomon) had sixty wives. He said: I will go round with them this night, and each of them will be pregnant, and each of them will give birth to a knight who will fight in the way of Allah! None of the women became pregnant, except for one woman who gave birth to a demihuman. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If he (Insha'Allah) had said (Allah willing), they would all have given birth to knights who would have fought in the way of Allah!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3123]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: By Allah, it is more sinful for one of you to persevere in his oath and carry it out to the detriment of his family than if he did he makes the atonement that Allah has ordained for it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3127]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, said: O Messenger of Allah, I made a vow in the pre-Islamic period that I would retire to the Sacred Mosque for one night. He said: Fulfill your vow!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3128]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Abul Qasim (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Whoever accuses his slave of fornication, the punishment will be carried out against him on the Day of Resurrection, unless he (the slave) is the same, as he (his master) said.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3138]

Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I once got into an argument with one of my fellow believers whose mother was non-Arab. So I insulted him because his mother was of foreign origin. The man complained to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about me. When I (later) met the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he said: O Abu Dharr, you are a person who behaves in some ways as in the (pre-Islamic) period of ignorance. Then I said: O Allah's Messenger, if someone insults men (or others), they also insult his father and mother. But he said: O Abu Dharr, you are a person who behaves in many ways as in the (pre-Islamic) era of ignorance. They are your brothers, Allah has given them into your hands. You shall feed them with what you eat, and clothe them with what you wear. And you shall not impose on them anything that is beyond their strength, and if you impose on them, you shall help them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3139]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When one of you his servant has cooked food and brought it to him, and he was near the fire and smoke (to cook). , then he should let him sit with him and eat with him. And if the food is very little, he should give him (at least) one or two morsels of it in his hand.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3142]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If a slave offers sincere advice to his master and worships Allah well, he earns double wages.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3143]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The righteous slave is entitled to a double wage.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3144]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A most excellent slave is the one who died after truly serving Allah and accompanying his master in the right manner. He is an excellent slave.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 27, Ḥadīṯ no. 3146]

Rafi' Ibn Khadig and Sahl Ibn Abu Hathma, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 'Abdullah Ibn Sahl Ibn Zaid and Muhaiyesa Ibn Mas'ud Ibn Zaid went to Khaibar. Once they were there, they separated from each other. Later, when Muhaiyesa saw 'Abdullah Ibn Sahl, he was dead. He buried him and then he ascended to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) with Huwaiyesa Ibn Mas'ud and 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Sahl, the youngest among them him. Then 'Abdu-r-Rahman first began to speak in front of his two companions. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: You should let the older ones speak first. So he remained silent. Then his two companions spoke, and he spoke to them (to the Messenger). They reported the murder of 'Abdullah Ibn Sahl to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He said to them: Are you willing to swear fifty oaths (that 'Abdullah was murdered by a Jew) so that you can claim blood money for your companion or your dead person? They said: But how can we swear unless we have seen this? He said: Then let the Jews swear fifty oaths (that they did not kill him and do not know the perpetrator) and that you may break away from your oaths. They said: But how can we accept the oaths of unbelieving people? When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw this, he gave them the blood money for their dead. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3157]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Some people from 'Uraina came to Madinah to see the Messenger of Allah. They had stomach pains and their illness lasted for some time. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to them: If you wish, you can go to the camels used for alms and drink their milk and urine. They did that and that's why they got well again. Then they killed the shepherds (of the camels), apostatized from Islam and drove the camels of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). When this was reported to the Prophet, he sent after them and brought them to him. He had their hands and legs cut off, their eyes plucked out, and then left them crucified in Al-Harra (a rocky land near Madina) until they died.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3162]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A Jew killed a girl with a stone to steal her silver jewelry. The girl was brought to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when she was dying. He asked her: Did so-and-so attack you? She shook her head negatively. He asked her again and she said no. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked her for the third time, she nodded in agreement. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) killed the girl's murderer with two stones.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3165]

'Imran Ibn Hussain (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: A man named (Ya'la Ibn Munya or Ibn Umayya) was fighting another man. One of them bit the other's hand. He tore his hand out of his adversary's mouth and a front tooth fell out - Ibnal Muthanna said: (two front teeth) - They then turned to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) with their problem. He called out: Does one of you bite like the camel stallion does? You are not entitled to any compensation for this! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3168]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Umm Haritha, the sister of Ar-Rabi', wounded a person. They went to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to judge between them. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The retaliation, the retaliation! Then Umm Ar-Rabi' said: O Messenger of Allah, will retaliation be exercised against so-and-so? By Allah, there will be no retaliation against her! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Praise be to Allah, Umm Ar-Rabi', retaliation is the duty of Allah. She replied: No, by Allah, no retaliation will ever be taken against her! He (the narrator) said: She repeated it until they (the injured woman and his people) accepted the blood money. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Among the servants of Allah are those whose prayers, when they invoke Allah, are heard by Him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3174]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The blood of a Muslim who has testified that there is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah and that I am the Messenger of Allah, shall not be shed except in one of three cases: in the case of fornication by one who has married, in the case of retaliation for murder, and in the case of the one who apostates from his faith and breaks his ties with the community (Muslims).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3175]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No human being will be murdered unjustly unless the first son of Adam bears a share of such guilt, for he was the one first person to commit murder.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3177]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The first thing that will be judged between people on the Day of Resurrection is the shedding of blood.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3178]

Abu Bakra, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Time completed its cycle and returned to the form when Allah created the heavens and the earth. The year consists of twelve months, including four holy months during which waging war is forbidden. Three follow each other, namely Dhul-Qi'da, Dhul-Hija and Muharram. The fourth is Ragab of Modhar, and it lies between Jumada and Sha'ban. Then the Prophet said: What month is this? We replied: Allah and His Messenger know best. The Prophet was silent for a while, so we thought he would call the month something different. Then he said: Isn't he Dhul-Hijab? We said: Yes! The Prophet further said: Which country is this? We said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He was silent for a while until we thought he would call it something else. Then he said: Isn't it Al-Balda (one of the names of Makkah?) We said: Yes! The Prophet further said: What day is this? We said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He was silent for a while, so we thought he would call him something else. Finally he said: Isn't it the day of nourishment (on which the pilgrims slaughter the sacrificial animals)? We said: Yes, Messenger of Allah! Then he said: Your blood, your property (Muhammad, another narrator, said: I believe he also said your honor), is as sacred and inviolable among you as this day, in this month of yours, in this locality of yours. But you will meet Allah and He will ask you about your deeds. So do not turn after me to unbelief and deviation from the right path, some of you cutting off the necks of others. The person present should report this to the person who is absent, because it may be that the person present tells someone else who understands this more than he himself.   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3179]

Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: There were (once) two women from the tribe of Huthail. One of the two beat the other so that she was aborted. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) ruled that half a tenth of a slave's blood money should be paid.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3183]

Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A woman killed her concubine with a pole from a tent (made of haircloth) when she was pregnant. One of the two women belonged to the Lihyan tribe. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered the murderer's relatives to pay the blood money of the killed and the tenth of the blood money of a slave for what was in her womb (belly). A man from the murderer's relatives said: Should we pay blood money for someone who neither ate nor drank nor made a cry, he is nothing. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: This is rhyming prose like that of the Bedouins. And he obliged them to pay the blood money.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ no. 3186]

The Hadith of Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba and Muhammad Ibn Maslama, may Allah be pleased with them both: 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab asked the people about the blood money for aborting a woman. Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba said: I was present when the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) passed the verdict that half a tenth of the blood money of a slave should be paid to the family of the killed. 'Umar said: Bring me a man who will testify that the Prophet said this. Muhammad Ibn Maslama testified that he saw the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he pronounced this judgment.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 28, Ḥadīṯ No. 3188]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to cut off the thief's hand if the value of the stolen item was a quarter of a dinar and upwards.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3189]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: During the lifetime of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), the punishment of cutting off the hand was not carried out if the value of the stolen item was less than the value of a leather or iron shield . And both were worth a lot.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3193]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cut off the hand of a thief who stole a shield worth three dirhams.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3194]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: May Allah curse the thief: he steals the egg and his hand is cut off; and steals the rope, whereupon his hand is cut off!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3195]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The people of the tribe of Quraish were worried about a woman from the tribe of Makhtzum who had committed theft. They asked: Who can speak to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) for them? They said: And who else can dare to approach him except Usama, the favorite of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)? Then Usama spoke to him. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: Are you interceding for a right that belongs only to Allah? The Prophet then rose and delivered a sermon in which he said: O people, verily those before you perished, because when one of the chief among them committed a theft, they let him go unpunished, and when If one of the weaker among them committed a theft, the punishment was carried out against him. I swear by Allah! If Fatima, the daughter of Muhammad, had stolen, I would cut off her hand.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3196]

'Umar Ibnal Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Allah sent Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) with truth. He revealed to him the book (the Quran), including the verse about stoning. We recited this verse, understood it and kept it in our minds. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) punished with stoning, and after him we also used stoning (as a punishment). But I'm afraid if it takes a long time for people (after the Prophet) before someone says: We don't find anything about stoning in the Book of Allah. And then they go astray by omitting a decree that Allah has revealed. Verily stoning is written in the Book of Allah and is a just punishment for those, men and women, who commit fornication after getting married, as long as there is proof or pregnancy or confession.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3201]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A Muslim man came to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) while he was in the mosque and called out to him: O Messenger of Allah, I have committed fornication! Then the prophet turned away from him. The man repeated his saying, and the Prophet turned away from him. But he repeated his saying four times. But when he gave the testimony against himself four times, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) brought him closer and asked him: Are you mentally ill? The man said: No! The Prophet further asked him: Have you married? The man replied: Yes! Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Then take him and stone him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3202]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked Ma'iz Ibn Malik: Is what I heard about you correct? He replied: What have you heard about me? The Prophet said: I heard that you committed fornication with the slave of so-and-so. The man said: Yes. He testified against himself four times. Thereupon the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered him to be punished by stoning.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3205]

Abu Huraira and Zaid Ibn Khalid Al-Guhaniy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A Bedouin came to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, I beseech you by Allah to decide between us according to the Book Allah! His adversary, who had more knowledge than his, came up and said: Yes, so be it! Decide according to Allah's Book. But I want to say something. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Please! Then the man said, My son worked for this man and committed fornication with his wife. People said my son should be stoned. So I paid the ransom for him - one hundred sheep and one female slave. Later I asked some scholars about this matter and they said: Your son must be punished with a hundred lashes and expelled from the country for a year. This man's wife must also be stoned. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: By the One in whose hands my life is, I will judge between you according to the Book of Allah. The slave and the sheep must be returned! Your son will receive a hundred lashes and be expelled from the country for a year! And you, Unais, go to this woman tomorrow morning! If she confesses, stone her! Unais went to see her the next morning. When she confessed, he carried out the command of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3210]

Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: A Jew and a Jewess were brought to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who had committed fornication with one another. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to the Jews and said to them: What do you find in the Torah about those who committed fornication? The Jews said: We blacken their faces and make them sit on a mount with opposite faces and walk around. Then he said: If you tell the truth, then bring the Torah! They then brought the Torah and read it. One of them placed his hand on the verse about stoning. He started reading, reading only what came before and what came after. Then 'Abdullah Ibn Salaam, who was with the Messenger of Allah, said: Command him to remove his hand. When he took them away, it became clear that the verse about stoning was under his hand. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered them to be taken away and the two of them were stoned. I (`Abdullah Ibn 'Umar) was one of those who stoned them. I then saw the Jew bending over her to protect her from the stones!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3211]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa (may Allah be pleased with him): Ash-Shaibany reported: I asked 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa the following question: Did the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) apply the punishment of stoning? He replied: Yes! I further asked him: Was this before or after the revelation of Surah An-Nur (No.24)? He said: I can't remember!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3214]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: If the slave of one of you committed fornication and this became clear, then he should give her the punishment (one hundred lashes) and then don't blame them anymore. If she commits fornication again, he should punish her again and not blame her afterwards. If she commits fornication for the third time, and this has become clear, he shall sell her, even if she is only sold for a rope of hair.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3215]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): A man who had drunk wine was brought to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). The Prophet gave him about forty lashes with two palm branches (the leaves of which were torn away).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3218]

Abu Burda Al-Ansary (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: No one will be punished with more than ten lashes unless it is a crime acts whose punishment has already been determined by Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3222]

'Ubada Ibn As-Samit (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said to us in a gathering: "Swear allegiance to me that you will neither associate with Allah nor commit fornication, nor steal, and that you do not kill anyone whose life Allah has made inviolable, except when it is in accordance with Allah's law. Whoever of you fulfills this will have his reward from Allah; and whoever commits any of these things and suffers a punishment in this world for it, this shall be considered as atonement for it. But if someone commits an act of this kind and is protected by Allah from public view, then the judgment is with Allah: If He wills, He will forgive him, and if He wills, He will punish him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ No. 3223]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If an animal (a freely grazing animal) causes any damage, no compensation is due to its owner. If someone falls into a well or mine, the owner of the well or mine is not liable for compensation. The fifth should be paid in the mineral resources.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 29, Ḥadīṯ no. 3226]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: If people's lawsuits were upheld, then each person would sue each other for his life and property. Therefore, the accused has (the right) to take an oath (of his innocence).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 30, Ḥadīṯ no. 3228]

Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You let me decide your disputes. It may happen that some of you are more fluent in the Word than others, and so I give judgment in their favor according to what I have heard from them. In whose favor I then give his brother's right, he does not have to accept it, because I give him an ember from hellfire.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 30, Ḥadīṯ no. 3231]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Hind bint 'Utba, wife of Abu Sufyan, came to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, (my husband) Abu Sufyan is in In fact, he is a stingy man and does not provide me and my children with sufficient support. That's why I have to take some of his money without him knowing about it. Is it a crime for me? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to her: Take as much of it as you need for yourself and for your children.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 30, Ḥadīṯ no. 3233]

Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, has certainly forbidden you the following: unkindness towards mothers, burying children living girl and the denial of a charitable gift and its unlawful taking. And Allah also abhors three things for you: chatter, asking questions frequently, and wasting money (and goods)!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 30, Ḥadīṯ no. 3237]

'Amr Ibn Al-'As (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: When a ruler strives to make the most appropriate decision and makes the right decision, he acquires two wages. But if he tries hard and misses the goal, he still has a reward.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 30, Ḥadīṯ no. 3240]

Abu Bakra (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: A judge cannot judge between two people when he is angry.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 30, Ḥadīṯ no. 3241]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever introduces an innovation in our cause (faith), his innovation must be rejected (and not followed, for it is one). kind of return to the time of ignorance).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 30, Ḥadīṯ no. 3242]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There were two women who lived with their two sons. One day the wolf came and dragged one of them away. One of the two women said to the other: It was your little son who was dragged away! And the other said to the first: It was your little son who was dragged away! Both then sought a judicial ruling from Dawud (David), who decided to hand the child over to the older one. They then went out and met Sulaiman, the son of Dawud (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon them) and told him about the incident. Then he said, Bring me a knife, that I may cut the child in half and divide it among you. Then the younger of the two said (beseechingly): Don't do that! May Allah have mercy on you. It's her son! He then decided to hand the child over to the younger one.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 30, Ḥadīṯ no. 3245]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A man bought a piece of land from another, and the buyer later found a jar containing gold in his piece of land. The buyer went to the seller and said to him: Take your gold from me; because I bought the land from you, but not the gold! The seller replied: I sold you the property and everything that was there! The two then went to a man and asked him to act as a referee to decide between them. He asked the two of them: Do you have children? One of the two stated that he has a son and the other stated that he has a daughter. The referee then said to them: Give the son the daughter as a wife, provide them with a living from this find and also donate it!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 30, Ḥadīṯ no. 3246]

Zaid Ibn Khalid Al-Guhaniy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and asked him what should be done with a lost item. He replied: Look at the packaging of the found object and the ribbon with which it is bound! Then, for a year, tell everyone what you found. If the owner comes forward, give it back to him, otherwise you can keep it for yourself. The man asked: What about a lost sheep? The Prophet said: This is for you, for your brother, or for the wolf! He further asked: And what to do with a stray camel? He said: What is the camel to you? It carries its own water and has its own soles! It finds its way to water sources and feeds on wild plants until its owner finds it again.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 31, Ḥadīṯ no. 3247]

Ubayy Ibn Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: During the lifetime of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), I found a purse containing 100 dinars. I brought him to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He said: Make this known for a year! So I made it known for a year. However, no one came forward. So I went back to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He told me: Make this known for a year! I followed his instructions, but again no one answered. So I went to the Messenger of Allah again. He said again: Make this known for a year, but again no one came forward. Then he said: Look at the money, the packaging and the ribbon with which the purse is tied. Then take this for yourself. If the owner comes forward later and provides proof of his claim, you should give him his money back. I met the owner after three years in Makka. Salama Ibn Kuhail (the narrator) is not sure whether this hadith is about one year or three years.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 31, Ḥadīṯ no. 3251]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No one should milk another's cattle without his permission. Would any of you like to have your living space broken into, your pantries destroyed, and your food disappearing? For people, the cattle's udders do nothing other than store food for them. Well then, no one is allowed to milk another's cattle unless only with his permission.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 31, Ḥadīṯ no. 3254]

'Uqba Ibn 'Amer (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We said: O Messenger of Allah, if you send us on a mission and we come to people who refuse to accept us, what should we do? He replied: When you come to people who welcome you as guests, let them entertain you. But if you are denied hospitality, then take what you are entitled to as guests.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 31, Ḥadīṯ no. 3257]

Salama Ibnal Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We went on a military campaign with the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him). We were so exhausted that we were about to slaughter some of our mounts (to feed on their meat). The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered us to collect our provisions bags. We laid out a leather carpet in front of him, and put the people's supplies on this leather carpet. I tried to walk around to see the supplies and then estimate them. I found it could fill the space of a sitting goat. We were fourteen hundred men. We ate until we were all full. We also filled our sacks. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Is there water for ablution? Then a man brought his waterskin, which contained little water. He poured it into a small vessel. We all performed ablution. Each of the fourteen hundred men used a lot of water in their ablution. Afterwards eight men came and said: Is there water for the great ritual ablution (Al-Ghusl)? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The water is running out.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 31, Ḥadīṯ No. 3259]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Jews of Banu An-Nadir and Qurayza took up arms against the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), whereupon the people of An-Nadir were expelled, while those of Qurayza continued to tolerate became. But when the Banu Quraiza took up arms again afterwards, their men were killed and their wives and children and wealth were distributed among the Muslims. Only some of them followed the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and he gave them safety. They then converted to Islam. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) expelled all the Jews from Madinah. They were Banu Qainuqa', the people of 'Abdullah Ibn Salam, the Jews of Banu Haritha, and all the other Jews who lived in Madina.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 1025]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both: Nafi' reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, made a surprise attack on Banu Al-Mustaliq when they were watering their cattle. He kills their fighters and takes their women and children prisoner. On that day he captured Juwairiya. 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar took part in this army.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3260]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent one of his companions on a mission, he used to say: Bring good news (to the people) and scare them away from religion ) not off; makes it easy (for them with religion) and doesn't make it difficult (for them) (the path to it)!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3262]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Make it easy (for people with religion) and do not make it difficult (for them); bring (them) good news and do not scare (them) away (from religion)!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3264]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When Allah gathers the former and the later on the Day of Resurrection, a flag of identification will be kept for each of those who embezzle. It is said: This is the betrayal of so-and-so the son of so-and-so   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3265]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: For every embezzler there will be a flag on the Day of Resurrection. It is said: This is the betrayal of so-and-so.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3268]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: For every embezzler there will be a flag on the Day of Resurrection by which he will be recognized.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3270]
Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "War is a trick." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3273]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa, may Allah be pleased with him: Abu-n-Nadr reported the book of a man from (the tribe of) Aslam. He was a companion of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). His name is 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa. He sent a written message to 'Umar Ibn 'Ubaidillah when he went to Haruriyya (Kharijite group). In it he informed him that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to say when he was fighting against the enemies and the evening came: O people, do not wish to meet the enemy and ask Allah for life force . When you have faced the enemy, stand firm and know that Paradise lies under the shadow of swords. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then stood up and said: O Allah, You have revealed the Scripture, moved the clouds and defeated the allies, so defeat our enemies and help us against them!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3276]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A woman was found dead during a battle waged by the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Messenger of Allah abhorred the killing of women and children.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3279]

As-S'ab Ibn Jathamah narrated: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) was asked about the wives and children of the Mushrikeen (idolatries) who were (inadvertently) killed during the night attack. He said: You are of them (the idolaters).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3281]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) burned and cut the date palm of Banu An-Nadir. Qutaiba and Ibn Rumh added in their tradition that it (the date palm) was called Al-Buwaira. So Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, has revealed the following verse: Whatever you cut down palm trees or caused to stand on roots, it was by Allah's permission and that He might cause shame to the transgressors. [Quran 59:5]    [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ No. 3284]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: One of the Prophets once went out to fight and said to his people: None of you should follow me who is with me married to a woman and has not yet touched his bride; he also built a building but has not yet roofed it over. Neither shall anyone who buys sheep or pregnant she-camels and is expecting to give birth, follow me. So he set out until he arrived near the village at or near the time of the afternoon prayer. Then he said to the sun: You are commanded (by Allah), just as I am commanded. O Allah, let the sun (remain) bright for me! So she remained radiant for him until Allah granted him victory over his enemies. The people then gathered the spoils, and the fire came to consume these spoils, as it is written in the Torah. But she refused. Then the Prophet said: There is embezzlement among you. So one man from each tribe must swear allegiance to me. As they did so, one man's hand stuck to the Prophet's. Then he said: There is embezzlement among you. Your tribe must swear allegiance to me. Then the hands of two or three men stuck (to his hand). He said: There is embezzlement among you. You embezzled. They then brought him gold equal to the weight of a cow's head and placed it on the ground with the spoils. Then the fire came and consumed the spoils. He further said: The spoils were not allowed to anyone before us (the Muslims) because Allah, the Most Blessed and Exalted, saw our weakness and powerlessness and therefore He allowed us the spoils.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3287]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent a fighting party to Najd, and I was with them. There they took many camels as spoils of war. The share (of each fighter) was twelve or eleven camels. Each person was given an additional camel.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3290]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave us additional spoils of war in addition to our appointed share of the fifth. I got an old camelin.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3293]

Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We went out to fight with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in the year of the Battle of Hunain. When we encountered the enemy, the Muslims suffered defeat first. I saw a man from the idolaters about to kill a man from the Muslims. I turned to him, approached him from behind and struck him (with the sword) on his neck. He came closer to me and grabbed me so hard that I sniffed the smell of death from it (i.e. almost died). Then he died and let me go. Then I caught up with 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab. He (`Umar Ibn Al-Khattab) said: How is the spoil distributed among the people? I said: As Allah commanded us. People returned. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sat down and said: Whoever killed one (of the disbelievers) and had proof of it, he may take his things (weapons, clothing and mount). Then I stood up and said: Who will bear witness for me? (And I got no answer.) Then I sat. He (the Prophet) repeated what he said. Then I stood up and said: Who will bear witness for me? And then I sat. He said the same thing for the third time. I got up. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: What is wrong with you, Abu Qatada? I told him what had happened. Then one of the people said: He was telling the truth, O Messenger of Allah. The dead person's personal belongings are with me. So give him his share of the spoils (in replacement of it)! Abu Bakr As-Siddiq said: No! By Allah, that can never happen. No one may deny a lion (fighter) of Allah who fights for the cause of Allah and His Messenger his right to the personal belongings of the person killed. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: He (Abu Bakr) is right. Give him (Abu Qatada) the belongings of the killed man. He (the man) gave it to me (Abu Qatada). I sold the sign for a garden in Banu Salima. This garden was my first possession since I converted to Islam.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3295]

'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn 'Auf (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: On the day of the Battle of Badr, as I was standing in the line of fighters, I saw two Ansar boys on my right and left sides. I hoped I was standing between two stronger boys (he feared for her life). One of the two said to me secretly: Uncle! Do you know where Abu Jahl stands (among the opponents)? I said: Yes, but my brother's son! What do you want to do with him? He said: I was told that he was insulting the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). By the One in Whose hands my life is - if I see him - I will kill him or I will perish because of it. I admired it. Then the other boy also told me the same thing in confidence. It didn't take long until I saw Abu Jahl moving among the people. I said: Don't you see? This is the man you are asking about. They now attacked each other, attacked him violently and slew him with their swords and killed him. Then they went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and told him. Then he asked: Which of you killed him? Each of them said: I. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, Have you cleaned your swords? They said: No! He looked at the two swords and said: You both killed him. Then he decided that Abu Jahl's personal belongings would be given to Mu'az Ibn 'Amr Ibnal Gamuh. The two boys were Mu'az Ibnal Gamuh and Mu'az Ibn 'Afra'.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3296]

Salama Ibnal Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We set out with the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) to fight against the tribe of Hawazin. As we were having lunch with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), a man suddenly came on a red camel. He made his camel kneel down. Then he pulled a leather rope from his waist belt with which he tied the camel. He came and began to eat with the people. As he ate he looked at the people. We were exhausted, our mounts were tired, and some of us even had no mounts. Suddenly he quickly went back to his camel and untied the rope. He made it kneel down, sat on it and drove it very quickly. A man on a she-camel whose whiteness was mixed with black spots pursued him. I ran behind them on foot until I caught up with the she-camel's leg. (SaIama said:) I kept running until I reached the camel's leg. I overtook it so that I grabbed the camel's halter. I made it kneel down. As he laid his knee on the ground, I unsheathed my sword and cut off the man's head, and he fell to the ground. I led the camel, which had the man's saddle and weapons on it. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) received me with the people. He (the Messenger of Allah) asked: Who killed the man? They (the people) said: Ibnal Akwa'. He said: (He may then take all the man's things.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3298]

'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The property of Banu An-Nadir was part of what Allah had given to His Messenger as spoils of war. And the Muslims did not trot any of the horses or mounts for this purpose. This belonged in particular to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He gave his family their living for a year. What remained afterward he dedicated to the cause of Allah, that is, for the war horses and the weapons.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3301]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) intended to bring 'Uthman Ibn 'Affan to Abu Bakr after the death of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). to claim their inheritance shares from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). 'A'ishah said to them: Didn't the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: We (Prophets) will not inherit. What we left behind is a pittance?  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3303]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: My heirs will not be allowed to share dinars among themselves (after me). What I leave behind, with the exception of the subsistence of my wives and the wages of my servant, is alms.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3306]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) divided the spoils of war as follows: the mount was given two shares and the fighter was given one share. (i.e. a rider was given three shares.)   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3308]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent a cavalry to Najd, and on their way home they brought with them a man from Banu Hanifa named Thumama Ibn Uthaal, chief of Al-Yamama . He was tied to a pillar in the mosque. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then came to him and said: What do you expect from me, Thumama? Thumama said: Only good things! If you kill me, you kill a person whose blood is protected; and when you show mercy, you show it to a grateful person. But if you ask for a ransom, then ask what you want, and you will have it. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then kept him alive until the day after next. He came to him again and said: What do you expect from me, Thumama? Thumama said: The same thing I told you before. When you show mercy, you show it to a grateful person, and when you kill, you kill a person whose blood is protected. But if you ask for a ransom, you will receive it. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then kept him alive until the next day. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to him again and said: What do you expect from me, Thumama? Thumama said: I told you what I expect! When you show mercy, you show it to a grateful person, and when you kill, you kill a person whose blood is protected. But if you ask for a ransom, you will receive it. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then said: Release Thumama! Thumama went to a palm tree near the mosque, performed a total ablution, entered the mosque and said: I bear witness that there is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah, and that Muhammad is the servant and messenger of Allah. O Muhammad, I swear by Allah that there was no face on this earth that I hated most than your face. Today your face has become the one I love the most. I swear to Allah that there was no religion I hated most than your religion. Today your religion has become the one that I love the most among all religions. I swear to Allah that there was no place I hated more than your place. Today your town has become the one I love most among all towns. Your troops arrested me when I was about to perform Umrah. What do you think of it? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave him good news and instructed him to go on the visit. When he arrived at Makkah, someone said to him, “You have disbelieved!” But he replied: No, by Allah! Rather, I became a Muslim with Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). No, by Allah!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3310]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: While we were in the mosque, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out to us and said: Go to the Jews! So we rushed there with him, and when we reached them, the Messenger of Allah called them and said: O Jews! Become Muslims and you will be safe! Then they said: O Abu-l-Qasim, you have delivered (your message). Then he said: This is what I want. Become Muslims and you will be safe! They said: O Abu-l-Qasim, you have conveyed (your message). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: This is what I want. and repeated the same words for the third time. Then he further said: Know that the earth belongs to Allah and His Messenger, and that I intend to expel you from this land. Then whoever of you finds a buyer for his wealth should sell it, otherwise you should know that the earth belongs to Allah and His Messenger!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3311]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When Banu Quraiza submitted to the judgment of Sa'd Ibn Mu'az, the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) sent to Sa'd. He came riding on a donkey. As he approached the mosque, the Messenger of Allah said to the Ansar (the helpers): Arise for your Lord! - or maybe he said: For the best among you. Then he said: These (Banu Quraiza) will accept your judgment. Then Mu'az said: Let their fighters be killed, and their children be taken captive. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You have the judgment of Allah (or perhaps he said: of The Sovereign). Al-Muthanna did not mention the last sentence in his narration.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3314]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Sa'd was injured on the day of the Battle of the Trench (Al-Khandaq) when a man of Quraish named Ibnal 'Ariqa shot him with an arrow and wounded him in the middle vein of his arm. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) pitched a tent for him in the mosque so that he could visit him up close. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came home from the trench battle, put down his weapon and was about to wash himself, Gabriel came to him just as he was shaking off the dust from his head and said: Have you put down your weapon? By Allah, it is not yet time for us to lay down our weapons! Go out to them! Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Where then? Then Gabriel pointed to (the tribe of) Banu Quraiza. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) fought them until they finally submitted to his judgment. However, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) allowed Sa'd to decide. His verdict was that their fighters would be killed, their wives and children taken prisoner, and their wealth distributed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3315]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) announced among us on the day he returned from the battle of Al-Ahzab (the parties): None shall perform midday prayers at any place except Banu Quraiza. Some people feared that time would pass before they reached Banu Quraiza and would not be able to perform the prayer at the right time. Therefore, they performed prayer before reaching Banu Quraiza. Others said: We will only perform prayer where the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commanded us to perform it, even if we fail to do so. He (the Prophet) did not rebuke either group (i.e. he did not blame either group).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3317]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Emigrants (Al-Muhagirun) from Makkah came to Madinah, they had nothing in their hands, while the Helpers (Al-Ansar) had the land and the date palms. The helpers let the emigrants take over the management of their date palms for half of the harvest each year. The mother of Anas Ibn Malik, whose name was Umm Sulaim, and at the same time the mother of 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Talha, the brother of Anas on his mother's side, gave the benefit of a date palm to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him). But the Messenger of Allah gave it to Umm Aiman, his servant, the mother of Usama Ibn Zaid. Ibn Shihab said: Anas Ibn Malik reported to me: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished dealing with the people of Khaibar and returned to Madinah, the emigrants sent to the helpers the gifts they had previously given them, back. He (Anas Ibn Malik) said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) sent back to my mother the benefit of her palm tree and gave Umm Ayman part of his garden in its place.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3318]

'Abdullah Ibn Mughaffal (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: On the day of the battle of Khaibar, I captured a skin containing fat. I took it and said: Today I won't give it to anyone. When I looked around, I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) smiling.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3320]

Abu Sufyan (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I was on a journey at the time when I made the agreement (of Al-Hudaibiya) with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). While I was in the territory of Syria, a messenger came with a letter from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) addressed to Heraclios, King of the Byzantines. It was the letter that Dihya Al-Kalbiy carried to the governor of Busra, who in turn had it forwarded to Heraclios. Heraclios asked: Is there anyone in this area who is one of the people of this man (Muhammad) who claims that he is a prophet? People said: Yes! Then I was called with some people from the tribe of Quraish; then we entered Heraklios. He made us sit before him and said to us: Who among you is closest in lineage to this man who claims to be a prophet? I said, that I! Then they made me sit in front of him and my companions behind me. He called for his interpreter and said to him, "Tell them that I want to ask him questions about this man who says he is a prophet." If he (Abu Sufyan) doesn't tell me the truth, tell me he's lying! Abu Sufyan said: I swear by Allah, if the people who know the honesty of Muhammad did not accuse me of lying, I would definitely have lied. Heraclios said to his interpreter: Ask him: What is his lineage among you? I said: He (Muhammad) is of noble birth among us. Heraclios asked: Was one of his forefathers a king? I said no! He further asked: Did you accuse him of lying before he said what he announced? I said no! Heraclios said: Does the elite of men follow him or do the weak follow him? I said: The weak follow him! He said: Are their numbers increasing or decreasing? I said no! She's constantly gaining weight. He said: Did any of them renounce their faith after accepting it because of dissatisfaction with it? I said no! Heraclios said: Did you fight him? I said yes! He said: How was your fight against him? I said: The success of the fight was variable: we win one round and he wins the other. He asked: Is he breaking his agreement with you? I said no! But there is now an agreement between us. We don't know what he's going to do. I swear by Allah that I could not use any other word against him than this. Heraclios said: Has anyone before him made such a claim? I said no! Then Heraclios turned to his interpreter and said: Tell him: I asked you about his descent among you, and you said that he is of noble descent among you. The same is true of the messengers: these are usually chosen from among the nobles of their people. I also asked you whether there was a king among his forefathers, and you denied this. If there had been a king among his forefathers, I would assume that he would be a man who wanted to fight to regain the kingdom of his forefathers. I asked you about his followers, whether they are the elite or the weak, and you said that the weak follow him. These are always the followers of the messengers. I asked you if you accused him of lying before he said what he claimed and you said no. I did not think it possible that he would refrain from lying to people in order to fabricate a lie against Allah. I asked you if any of your followers resigned from their faith after accepting it because they were not satisfied with it, and you also said no. This is common for faith when it takes root in the joy of a person's heart. I asked you if the number of his followers is increasing or decreasing and you said it is increasing. This is the case with faith; because this constantly increases until it reaches its goal! I further asked you whether you had fought him, and you stated that the fight between you is alternating, and that you win one round and he wins the other. This is precisely the case with the messengers: they are first examined; but the end goal is on their side. I asked you if he is breaking his agreement with you and you said he is not. It's the same with the envoys: they don't break their agreement. I asked you if anyone before him made such a claim and you said no. I said to myself: If there had been someone before him who said such a thing, I would have assumed that he would imitate him! Heraclios continued: What does he command you? I said to him: He commands us to perform the prayer, pay the alms tax, maintain the ties of kinship, and maintain chastity. Heraclios said: If what you said about him is the truth, then he is a prophet. I already knew that a prophet was coming, but I did not assume that he would come from your side. If I knew that I could obey him, I would gladly have made the long journey to him. If I were with him, I would wash his feet. Verily his power will reach the ground that I have here under my feet. Afterwards he had the letter of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) presented and read out. It said the following: what he claimed and you denied this. I did not think it possible that he would refrain from lying to people in order to fabricate a lie against Allah. I asked you if any of your followers resigned from their faith after accepting it because they were not satisfied with it, and you also said no. This is common for faith when it takes root in the joy of a person's heart. I asked you if the number of his followers is increasing or decreasing and you said it is increasing. This is the case with faith; because this constantly increases until it reaches its goal! This is precisely the case with the messengers: they are first examined; but the end goal is on their side. I asked you if he is breaking his agreement with you and you said he is not. It's the same with the envoys: they don't break their agreement. I asked you if anyone before him made such a claim and you said no. I said to myself: If there had been someone before him who said such a thing, I would have assumed that he would imitate him! Heraclios continued: What does he command you? If I knew that I could obey him, I would gladly have made the long journey to him. If I were with him, I would wash his feet. Verily his power will reach the ground that I have here under my feet. Then he had the letter of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) presented and read out. It said the following: what he claimed and you denied this. It's the same with the envoys: they don't break their agreement. I asked you if anyone before him made such a claim and you said no. I said to myself: If there had been someone before him who said such a thing, I would have assumed that he would imitate him! Heraclios continued: What does he command you? I said to him: He commands us to perform the prayer, pay the alms tax, maintain the ties of kinship, and maintain chastity. Heraclios said: If what you said about him is the truth, then he is a prophet. I already knew that a prophet was coming, but I did not assume that he would come from your side. If I knew that I could obey him, I would gladly have made the long journey to him. If I were with him, I would wash his feet. Verily his power will reach the ground that I have here under my feet. Afterwards he had the letter of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) presented and read out. It said the following: They are first checked; but the end goal is on their side. I asked you if he is breaking his agreement with you and you said he is not. It's the same with the envoys: they don't break their agreement. I asked you if anyone before him made such a claim and you said no. I said to myself: If there had been someone before him who said such a thing, I would have assumed that he would imitate him! Heraclios continued: What does he command you? I said to him: He commands us to perform the prayer, pay the alms tax, maintain the ties of kinship, and maintain chastity. Heraclios said: If what you said about him is the truth, then he is a prophet. I already knew that a prophet was coming, but I did not assume that he would come from your side. If I knew that I could obey him, I would gladly have made the long journey to him. If I were with him, I would wash his feet. Verily his power will reach the ground that I have here under my feet. Afterwards he had the letter of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) presented and read out. It said the following: They are first checked; but the end goal is on their side. I asked you if he is breaking his agreement with you and you said he is not. It's the same with the envoys: they don't break their agreement. I asked you if anyone before him made such a claim and you said no. I said to myself: If there had been someone before him who said such a thing, I would have assumed that he would imitate him! Heraclios continued: What does he command you? I said to him: He commands us to perform the prayer, pay the alms tax, maintain the ties of kinship, and maintain chastity. Heraclios said: If what you said about him is the truth, then he is a prophet. I already knew that a prophet was coming, but I did not assume that he would come from your side. If I knew that I could obey him, I would gladly have made the long journey to him. If I were with him, I would wash his feet. Verily his power will reach the ground that I have here under my feet. Then he had the letter of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) presented and read out. It said the following:In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful! This letter is from Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah, to Heraclios, ruler of the Eastern Roman Empire! Peace be upon him who follows the guidance. Then: I call you to follow the path of Islam. Become a Muslim and you will save yourself, and when you become a Muslim, Allah will double your reward. But if you turn away from it, you bear the sin twice over, both because of your leadership and because of your subordinates. (A quote from the Qur'an 3:64 followed in the letter): Say: "O People of the Book, come to an equal word between us and you, namely, that we serve Allah alone and put nothing next to Him and that not the one of us to take the others as masters other than Allah." And if they turn away, say: "Testify that we are devoted (Muslims)." As the reading of the letter came to an end, voices were raised and there was much palaver. Then the order was given that we should go out. When we were outside, I said to my companions: It seems to me that the cause of Ibn Abu Kabsha (Muhammad) has gone so far that the king of Banu Al-Asfar (the Byzantines) feels the fear of it. Since that time, I became convinced that the matter of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) would one day come through until Allah instilled Islam in my heart.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3322]

The Hadith of Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him) A man asked Al-Bara': O Abu 'Umara, did you flee on the day of Hunain? He said: No. By Allah, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) has not turned. But young rash men among his companions came out unarmed. they had no weapons. They met a group of experienced (accurate) throwers who rarely missed an arrow. These people were from Hawazin and Banu Nasr. They knocked these young men down violently, they barely missed. Then they returned to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he (the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)) was on his white mule and Abu Sufyan Ibn Al-Harith Ibn 'Abdel Mottalib was leading him. He dismounted, asked (them) for assistance and said: I in the Prophet, there is no lie I am Ibn 'Abdel Mottalib Then he lined them up.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3325]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, besieged the people of At-Ta'if, but he was unable to defeat them. He said: We will return, InshaAllah (if Allah wills). His companions said: Will we return before we have conquered them? The Messenger of Allah said to them: Do they rush into battle? Because if they rush into battle, they will be injured. Then the Messenger of Allah said to them: We will return tomorrow. You will be happy about it. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) smiled.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3329]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) entered Makkah on the day of its conquest, when three hundred and sixty idols were placed around the Ka'bah. He started pushing them with a tree branch in his hand, saying:[Quran 17:81] "The truth has come, and falsehood can neither create nor bring anything back." [Quran 34:49] Ibn Abu 'Umar added: On the day of conquest (of Makkah).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3333]

Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 'Ali Ibn Abu Talib wrote the document of the peace agreement between the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the idolaters on the day of Hudaybiya. He wrote: Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah, commits himself to the following. Then they shouted: Do not write to the Messenger of Allah! If we knew that you were the Messenger of Allah, we would not fight you. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to 'Ali: Strike out these words! 'Ali replied: No! I will never do that! (Then) the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) (himself) grabbed the paper and removed it with his own hand. One condition put forward by the idolaters was that Muslims could only stay in Makkah for three days. They were not allowed to carry any weapons that were not safely stored in the Gulban. I asked Abu Ishaq: What is the Gulban? He said: They are the sheaths and what is written in them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3335]

The Hadith of Sahl Ibn Hunaif (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Wa'el reported: Sahl Ibn Hunaif stood up on the day of Siffin and said: You people! Blame yourselves! We were with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) on the day of Hudaibiya, if we were asked to fight, we would fight. This was in the peace treaty between the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the idolaters. 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, are we not in the right and they in the wrong? He said: Yes, yes! He ('Umar) said: Do our martyrs enter Paradise while theirs enter the Fire? He (the Prophet) said: Yes indeed! He (`Umar) said: Why will we give in to the lack of our religion and return when Allah has not yet passed judgment between us? He (the Prophet) said: O Ibn Al-Khattab, I am the Messenger of Allah and Allah will never leave me helpless alone. Then 'Umar, angry with impatience, came to Abu Bakr and said to him: Are we not in the right and they in the wrong? He said: Yes, yes! He said: Do our fallen enter Paradise while theirs enter the Fire? He (Abu Bakr) said: Yes, yes! He (`Umar) said: Why will we give in to the lack of our religion and return when Allah has not yet passed judgment between us? He (Abu Bakr) said: O Ibn Al-Khattab, he is the Messenger of Allah and Allah will never leave him helpless alone. So the Quran was revealed to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), bringing the good news of victory. He sent to 'Umar and made him read these verses. He said: O Messenger of Allah, is it a victory? He said: Yes. So he was happy and returned.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3338]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Quranic verse Verily We have bestowed on you a manifest victory... [Quran 48:1] was revealed when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came from Al- Hudaibiya came back. The Muslims were so sad when the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) slaughtered the sacrificial animals (thereby ending his ihram). He then said: A verse has been revealed to me that I love more than anything in this world.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3341]

The Hadith of Sahl Ibn Sa`d (may Allah be pleased with him): He was once asked about the injury of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) on the day of the Battle of Uhud and he said: The face of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him). and peace be upon him, suffered a wound, a tooth between his front teeth and his canine was broken. and his helmet was broken on his head. Then Fatima, daughter of Allah's Messenger, washed the blood from him, while 'Ali poured water over the wound from the shield he used as a vessel. But when she saw that the blood was not less, and that it flowed even more because of the water, she tore off some of a straw mat and burned it until it was completely reduced to ashes; She then took it and pressed it against the wound, and it stopped bleeding.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3345]
