'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I remember as if I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) before me today, telling about a Prophet who spoke about his own people was beaten, then he wiped the blood from his face and said: O Allah my God, forgive my people; because they are ignorant!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3347]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Mighty is the wrath of Allah on those who did this to the Messenger of Allah. He pointed to a broken tooth between his front teeth and his canine. The Prophet further said: Mighty is the wrath of Allah against the man whom the Messenger of Allah killed in the way of Allah, the Exalted and Almighty.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3348]

Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was offering his prayers at the Ka'bah, Abu Jahl and his companions were sitting nearby. The previous day a she-camel was slaughtered. Abu Jahl said: Which of you dares to take the afterbirth of the she-camel of the tribe of So-and-so and place it between the shoulder blades of Muhammad while prostrating himself in prayer? The meanest of these people got up and a little later brought the said organ. He waited until the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prostrated in prayer and placed it between his shoulder blades. They made each other laugh and leaned toward each other. I stood there and witnessed this misdeed. If I had power over these people, I would take the afterbirth from his back. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) remained in his position and did not raise his head. They went to Fatima and told her this. She came, and she was still a girl then, and took the afterbirth from his back. Then she went to them and insulted them. When the Prophet completed his prayer, he raised his head and shouted three times (as he used to do when he called or asked Allah): O Allah, punish this Quraish! When they heard his voice, they stopped laughing and were afraid of his invocation. He then shouted: O Allah, punish Abu Jahl Ibn Hisham, 'Utba Ibn Rabi'a, Shaiba Ibn Rabi'a, Al-Walid Ibn 'Uqba, Umayya Ibn Khalaf and 'Uqba Ibn Abu Mu'ait. He also mentioned the name of the seventh man, but I have forgotten it. By Him Who sent Muhammad (may Allah be pleased with him) with truth! I saw these people killed on the day of Badr, their bodies were then dragged to the well of Badr.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3349]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) reported: I said to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him): Have you seen a day more difficult than the day of the battle of Uhud? He said: I have experienced many hard things from your people, and the most difficult thing I experienced happened on the day of Al-'Aqaba, when I approached Ibn 'Abd Yalil Ibn 'Abd Kulal with my request, and he asked me for it what I wanted didn't come along. I then walked away aimlessly and was very distressed. I came to myself only when I reached the area of ​​Qarn Ath-Tha'alib. I raised my head and found a cloud shading me. I looked and saw Gabriel in there. He called to me, saying: Verily Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, has heard the words of your people, which they addressed to you and answered your request. He is now sending you the angel of the mountains so that you can give him orders as to how you want to act against these people. Then the angel of the mountains called to me, greeted me with the greeting of peace and said: O Muhammad, Allah has heard the words of your people. I am the angel of the mountains. Your God sent me to you to give me the commandment. Command whatever you want! If you want, I'll let the two mountains fall over them! But I (the Prophet) said: No! Rather, I hope that Allah will raise up from their offspring those who will serve Allah alone and not associate anything with Him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3352]

Gundab Ibn Sufyan (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The finger of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was injured and bled in one of the battles in which he took part. He (the Prophet) said: You are nothing but a finger that bleeds, and that which befell you is dedicated to Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3353]

Gundab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Gabriel was late (once) in visiting the Messenger of Allah with the revelation. Then the idolaters said: Muhammad has been forsaken. Then Allah, the Exalted and Almighty, revealed the following verse In the morning and at night when everything is quiet. Your Lord has neither forsaken nor abhorred you. [Quran 93:1-3]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ No. 3354]

The Hadith of Usama Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him): The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) rode on a donkey with a saddle under which there was a mat made in Fadka. He had Usama ride behind him when he went to Sa'd Ibn 'Ubada to visit Banu Al-Harith Ibn Al-Khasraj. But that happened before the Battle of Badr. He rode on until he passed a mixed congregation of Muslims, idolaters and Jews. Among them were 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy and 'Abdullah Ibn Rawaha. When the dust caused by the hooves of the mount floated over the congregation, 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy covered his nose with his robe and said: But do not spread the dust on us! (Ignoring this statement) the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) greeted the group. He stopped and got off the donkey. But he called them to Allah and read them some verses from the Koran. Then 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy said: O man, if you speak the truth, that is good, but keep it to yourself and do not disturb us in our meetings. You shall ride again on your mount and tell those of us who come to you. Then 'Abdullah Ibn Rawaha said: Come upon us in our assemblies! We like it (i.e. come to us often!). But the Muslims, the idolaters and the Jews reproached each other until they were about to fight against each other. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) tried to calm them down until he finally succeeded. Then he rode on until he came to Sa'd Ibn 'Ubada. When the Prophet came to him, he said to him: O Sa'd, have you not heard what Abu Hubab said (meaning 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy). He said this and that. He (Sa'd) replied: Forgive him, Messenger of Allah! For by Allah, Allah has given you the most exalted position, while the people of this city agreed to crown him king and to give him the turban (crown). Since that was corrupted, when Allah sent you with the truth, he became jealous (of you). And therein lies the cause of his behavior. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forgave him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3356]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Someone said to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): (It would be good) if you went to 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy! The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) made his way to this man. He was riding a donkey and some Muslims accompanied him on his way through a salt marsh. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy, he said to him: Go away! By Allah, the smell of your donkey is disgusting to me! Then one of the Ansar exclaimed: By Allah, the donkey of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) smells better than you! Because of these words, one of 'Abdullah's people got angry and wanted to stand up for 'Abdullah, then everyone got angry and started hitting each other with palm branches, shoes and bare hands! Then came the revelation of the verse: And if two parties of the believers fight one another, then make peace between them; but if one of them offends against the other, fight the one who is wrong until he submits to Allah's command. If she submits, then make peace between them in justice and be just. Verily Allah loves the righteous. [Quran 49:9]   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ No. 3357]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Who brings us news of what happened to Abu Jahl? Then Ibn Mas`ud went to collect information about it. He found Abu Jahl being beaten by the two sons of 'Afra' until he knelt down. Ibn Mas'ud grabbed him by the beard and said: Are you Abu Jahl? He replied: Is there a better person than the one whom you killed or who was killed by his people? Ibn Mas`ud said after the statement of Abu Miglez that Abu Jahl said: Alas to Allah! would a person other than a farmer have killed me!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3358]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Who can kill Ka'b Ibnal Ashraf? He has caused trouble to Allah and His Messenger. Then Muhammad Ibn Maslama said: O Messenger of Allah, do you want me to kill him? The Prophet replied: Yes. He said: Then allow me to use a trick on him! The Prophet said: I allow you. He (Muhammad Ibn Maslama) went to him (Ka'b Ibnal Ashraf), spoke to him, reminded him of their old friendship and told him: This man (the Prophet) wants to collect alms from us. But he overwhelmed us. Here Ka'b interrupted him and said: By Allah, he (the Prophet) will continue like this until he bores you! He (Muhammad Ibn Maslama) further said: But we have followed him and it is not befitting to leave him now before we know how it will end. He further said: But we would like to borrow money from you. Ka'b replied: What do you pledge with me in return? Muhammad Ibn Maslama said: Whatever you want! Ka'b said: Pledge your wives to me! Muhammad Ibn Maslama replied: You are the most beautiful Arab. How can we leave our women with you. Ka'b said: Then pledge your children to me! Muhammad Ibn Maslama replied: The child of one of us will certainly be blamed for being pawned against two wasaq (measurement) dates. But we can pawn our weapons with you. Ka'b said: Agreed! The Narrator further reported: Both agreed that he should bring Al-Harith, Abu 'Abs Ibn Gabr and 'Abbaad Ibn Bishr. These four men came to him (Ka'b Ibnal Ashraf) at night and called him. Sufyan (another narrator) said: All the narrators of this hadith except 'Amr reported the following role of his wife. His wife said to him: I hear a voice like this of one who wants to shed blood. Her husband (Ka'b Ibnal Ashraf) replied: These are only Muhammad Ibn Maslama, his milk brother and Abu Na'ela. The noble should answer the call, even if he is called to stab him at night. In between, Muhammad said to his companions: When he comes, I will stretch out my hands to hold his head. If I succeed, then your task is complete! He came down girding his sword. They said to him: Oh, you smell good! He replied: Of course! Since I have a slave with me who perfumes herself the most among the Arab women. He (Muhammad) said to him: May I approach you to smell you better? He replied: Yes, please! He (Muhammad) approached and smelled. Then he again asked permission to approach to smell. This time he was able to hold his head and he shouted to his companions: Complete your task! and they killed him.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3359]

The Hadith of Salama Ibnal Akwa` (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We set out towards Khaibar with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). At night we walked in groups. One of the group said to 'Amer Ibnal Akwa': Are you not letting us hear some of your poems?. 'Amer was a poet. He dismounted and began to recite the following verses to encourage the camels with singing: O Allah, be it Your will that we should be guided, give alms and perform prayer. We gladly sacrifice our lives in your way. So forgive what we have done! And let us stand firm when We meet the enemies! But give us peace and quiet! We rush when called for help And when we set out to fight the oppressed can rely on us when they come to us for help. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked: Who drives the camels? The people replied: 'Amer. The Prophet said: May Allah have mercy on him! Then one of the group said: Of course he deserves to be a martyr, but let's keep him amused! The narrator further reported: We arrived in Khaibar. We besieged the people of Khaibar until we became extremely hungry. Then the Prophet said: Allah has opened it to you. The evening before Khaibar was opened to them, the Muslims lit many fires. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Why this fire? What are you cooking? They replied: We cook meat. The Prophet said: What meat? They replied: We cook the meat of tame donkeys. Then the Prophet said: Throw it away and break the pot in which it is cooked. A man said to the Prophet: May we throw away the meat and wash the pots? The Prophet said: Yes, it works. Then the people lined up to fight. The sword of 'Amer was quite short. He wanted to use it to stab a Jew in the leg, but his sword recoiled and wounded him in the knee. He died from this wound. We returned. Salama took me by the hand and said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw me in silence, he asked me: What is wrong with you? I replied: May my father and mother be sacrificed for you. They (the people) claimed that 'Amer's good deed had come to nothing. The Prophet said: Who claimed it? I said: So-and-so and Usaid Ibn Hudair Al-Ansary. Then the Prophet said: Whoever said this lied. But for him (`Amer) there is double reward. (The Prophet put his two fingers together to show it). He tired himself in worshiping Allah and sacrificed himself in the way of Allah. It is hard to find an Arab who still possesses these characteristics.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3363]

Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: On the day of the Battle of Al-Ahzab (the Battle of the Trench), the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) carried away the sand with us, so that the whiteness of his belly was filled with dust was covered. He recited the following verses: O Allah, be it Your will that we should be guided, give alms and perform prayer. But give us peace and quiet. Our people refused to follow us! The narrator interrupted here and added: The Prophet may have said: The chiefs of the tribes refused to follow us. If they wanted to cause a riot, we refused. The Prophet raised his voice with these verses.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3365]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to us while we were digging the ditch (Al-Khandaq) and carrying the sand on our shoulders. (He) the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O Allah my God! Real life is life in the afterlife, so be merciful to the Muslim emigrants from Makkah (Muhajira or Muhajirun) and the Muslim helpers from Madina (Ansar).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3366]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O Allah! The real life is the life in the hereafter. So be merciful to Al-Ansar and Al-Muhajirun.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3367]

Salama Ibnal Akwa', may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I went out before the morning prayer was called. At that time, the dairy camels of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) were grazing at Zu-Qarad. A servant of 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn 'Auf met me and said: The milk camels of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) were stolen! I asked: Who stole her? He said: Ghatfan. I screamed for help three times so loudly that every person in Madina heard me. Then I rushed off until I caught up with them (the robbers) in Zu-Qarad. They were in the process of watering the stolen animals. I shot arrows at them and shouted: I am Al-Akwa'! Today is the day of your downfall, you villains! I continued singing until I was able to save the she-camels and also take thirty outer garments from them as booty. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came with the people. I said: O Prophet of Allah, the people were very thirsty! But I pressed her. Send people to pursue them! He said: O Ibnal Akwa', you have possessed everything. Then be merciful! We returned and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sat behind me on his camelin until we entered Madina.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3371]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went into battle, he took Umm Sulaim and some women from the Ansar with him. They watered the fighters and cared for the wounded.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3375]

Buraidah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went out to fight nineteen times. Fights only occurred eight times.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3384]

Salama, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I joined seven military campaigns under the leadership of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). I also took part in nine combat troops that he sent; once under the leadership of Abu Bakr, and another time under the leadership of Usama Ibn Zaid.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3386]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: We set out to fight with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). We were six men and only had one camel, which we took turns riding. We walked for so long that our feet became cracked. My feet had also become cracked and my nails were falling out. So we put cloths around our feet. So this battle was called Zater-Riqa' (that of cloths) because we bound our feet with cloths.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 32, Ḥadīṯ no. 3387]

Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The rule over the people (i.e. the Arabs) belongs to the Quraysh: the Muslims of Quraysh are subject to the Muslims of Quraysh, and the disbelievers of Quraysh are subject to the disbelievers of Quraysh.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ No. 3389]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Caliphhood will always belong to the Quraish, even if only two people remain on earth. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3392]

Gabir Ibn Samurah reported: 

My father and I went to see the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and I heard him say: "This matter (the caliphate) will not come to an end until it is under the rule of Allah There are twelve caliphs.” The Prophet continued to speak but I could not hear him. I asked my father about what the Prophet had said. He replied: “They will all be from Quraish.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3393]

It is narrated from (`Abdullah) Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he said: “I was present when my father was wounded. The people praised him and said: "May Allah bless you." He said: "I am hopeful (of Allah's mercy) and equally afraid (of His wrath)." The people said: "Appoint a successor." He said: " Should I bear the burden (of your leadership) both alive and dead? As far as leadership is concerned, I wish I could release myself (before the All-Merciful) from this obligation in such a way that I would not be repaid for it, for better or for worse. If I were to appoint a successor, I would do it, because someone better than me did it (he meant Abu Bakr). If I left you alone (without appointing a successor), I would do it, because someone better than me (the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him)) did it." 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar said: "As When he ('Umar) mentioned the Messenger (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), I understood that he would not appoint anyone as his successor."" [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ No. 3399]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; I went to see the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) with two of my cousins. One said: Set us over some areas over which Allah, the Exalted and Glorious, has made you Lord. The other said the same as the first. Then the Prophet said: By Allah, we do not give this leadership to the one who asks for it or to the one who desires it.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3402]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Verily, you are all shepherds, and each of you is responsible for his flock: the Amir (leader) who has been appointed over all the people is a shepherd, and he is responsible for his flock. And the man is a shepherd to his people in his household, and he is responsible for his flock. And the woman is a shepherdess to her husband's household and to her children, and she is responsible for them. And another's servant is a shepherd of his master's possessions, and he is responsible for those possessions. Verily, you are all shepherds, and each of you is responsible for his flock. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3408]

Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood in our midst and spoke about embezzlement of loot. He pointed out to us how serious this offense is and what punishment it entails. Then he said: I really do not want to meet any of you on the Day of Judgment with a roaring camel, a neighing horse, a bleating sheep, or a screaming person around his neck, or with valuable metals (gold or silver), or clothes that are move back and forth, and he then says to me: O Prophet, help me! Then I will only be able to say: I can't do anything for you! I told you before!
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3412]

Abu Humaid As-Sa`idiy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) assigned the task of collecting alms to a man named Ibnal Lutbiya 'Amr and Ibn Abi 'Umar, who belonged to the tribe of Al-Asad. When this man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he said: This is for you, and this was given to me! Then the Messenger of Allah stood on the pulpit, praising Allah and praising Him. Then he said: What is wrong with this person to whom I gave a commission, and then he said: This is for you, and this was given to me! Why didn't he stay at home with his father or mother to wait and see whether someone would give him something or not? By Him in Whose hand is the life of Muhammad! No one will be able to unjustly take anything unless they have to wear it around their neck on the Day of Judgment! And if it was a camel, it will roar, a cow will moo, and a sheep will bleat. Then he raised his hands so that we could see the fair skin of his armpits and cried: O Allah, have I spoken truth? He shouted that twice!
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3413]

Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported the Qur'anic verse: “O you who believe, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and the commanders among you! ..." was revealed regarding 'Abdullah Ibn Huzafa Ibn Qais Ibn 'Adiy As-Sahmiy, whom the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) sent in a fighting force.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3416]

Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever obeys me is actually obeying Allah; and whoever disobeys me is actually disobeying Allah. And whoever obeys the Emir (leader) whom I have appointed is actually obeying Me, and whoever disobeys the Emir whom I have appointed is actually disobeying Me. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3417]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Hearing and obeying is the duty of every Muslim person, whatever he likes or hates, as long as no sinful act is required of him. If he is asked to do a sinful act, he is not obliged to listen and obey. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3423]

'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent an army and appointed a man over it. He lit a fire and ordered the people to step into it. Some people wanted to step into it; but the others said, We fled from it. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was informed of this, he said to those who wanted to enter the Fire: If you had entered the Fire, you would have remained there until the Last Day. But he spoke kindly to the others and said: You must not obey anyone if it goes against the commandments and prohibitions of Allah. Obeying is only good. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3424]

Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The Imam is a protection, one fights under him and seeks protection from him. If he then calls for Taqwa (fear of Allah) and acts rightly, he will receive his reward. But if he acts differently, he will have to face the consequences. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3428]

Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The Children of Israel were usually led by prophets, and whenever one prophet passes away, another follows him. But after me there will be no more prophets. Rather, there will be successors (califs) who will continue to increase in number. The people said: What do you command us then? And the Prophet answered: Take the oath of allegiance one by one. Give them what is rightfully theirs; for Allah will ask them what duty of care He has imposed on them. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3429]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: After me there will be selfishness and things that you abhor. The people said to him: O Messenger of Allah, what do you command us then if one of us experiences it? The Prophet replied: You should fulfill your obligations and ask Allah for what is due to you.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3430]

Usaid Ibn Hudair, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; A man from the Ansar (the Helpers) took the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) aside and said: Will you not entrust me with a task as you entrusted so-and-so with one? Then the Prophet said: You will see after me that there will be certain privileges for some people, so be patient until you meet me again at the pool (on the Day of Judgment). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3432]

Huzaifa Ibnal Yaman, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; People used to ask the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about good things, and I used to ask him about evils because I was afraid that they would come to me. I said: O Messenger of Allah, we were in a Gahiliya (ignorance during the pre-Islamic period) and an evil at the same time, and Allah brought this good to us (through Islam). After this good, will there be evil again? And he replied: Yes! I said again: And will there be any good after this evil? He said: Yes! And it will have traces of ruin. I asked: And what are his traces of ruin? He said: There will be people who will guide others, but not with my Sunnah and not with my guidance; of them you will affirm things and detest others. I asked: After this good, will there be evil again? And he said: Yes! There will be people who will call others to the gates of hellfire, and whoever follows them they will lead into the fire. I said: O Messenger of Allah, describe them to us! And he said: Yes! They externally belong to us and speak our language. I said: What do you order me to do if I experience something like this? The Prophet said: Always remain connected to the Muslim community and its Imam (leader)! I asked: How if they have neither a community nor an imam? He said: Then leave all these groups, even if you hold on to the trunk of a tree with your teeth until death overtakes you while you are still in this state! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3434]

Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever experiences something from his amir (leader) that is distasteful to him, let him be patient; because whoever distances himself from the community (Muslims) by a hand's breadth dies with the customs of Gahiliya (the ignorance during the pre-Islamic period)! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3438]

Gabir, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; On the day of Hudaibiya there were 1,400 of us and we swore allegiance to the Prophet while 'Umar shook hands with it under the tree - and it was an acacia tree. We swore an oath of loyalty to him that we would not flee. But we did not swear allegiance to him until death. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3449]

The Hadith of Al-Musayyab Ibn Hazan, may Allah be pleased with both Sa`id Ibnal Musayyab, reported; My father was among those who swore allegiance to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) under the tree. The next year we set out on the pilgrimage and we could not recognize the location of the tree. If you can recognize the place, then you know best. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3459]

The Hadith of Salma, may Allah be pleased with him, Yazid Ibn Abi 'Ubaid reported; I asked Salama: Why did you swear allegiance to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) on the day of Hudaibiyah? He said: Death! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3462]

The Hadeeth of 'Abdullah Ibn Zaid, may Allah be pleased with him, 'Abbad Ibn Tamim reported that one came to 'Abdullah Ibn Zaid and said: This is Ibn Hanzala, who takes the oath of allegiance to the people. 'Abdullah asked: On what? He replied: To death. Then 'Abdullah said: I do not swear allegiance to anyone to die after the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3463]

The Hadith of Salma Ibnal Akwa', may Allah be pleased with him, Yazid Ibn Abi 'Ubaid reported that Salma Ibnal Akwa' said: When I entered Al-Haggag, he said to me: O Ibnal Akwa', have you made a U-turn made on your heels, returning to life in the desert? I replied: No! But the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) allowed me to live with the Bedouins. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3464]

Mugashe' Ibn Mas'ud As-Sulamiy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported; I came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) to swear allegiance to him for Hijra (emigration). The Prophet said: But the Hijra was before the conquest of Mecca (that is, there is no more Hijra). But you should swear allegiance to me for Islam, jihad (struggle in the way of Allah) and good deeds. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3465]

Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said on the Day of the Conquest (of Makkah): (From now on) there will be no more Hijra (emigration), but Jihad (fight on). the way of Allah) and Niyya (good intention). Then when you are asked to leave, leave! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3467]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asked about Hijrah (emigration). He said: After the conquest (of Makkah), there is no more Hijra, but Jihad (struggle in the way of Allah) and Niyya (good intentions). Then when you are asked to leave, leave.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3468]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A desert Arab asked the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) about Hijra (emigration). The Prophet replied: O woe to you! Are you talking about Hijra? But the matter of Hijra is difficult. Do you have camels? The man replied: Yes. The Prophet asked: Do you pay Zakah (poor tax) for them? The man replied: Yes. Then the Prophet said: Then continue with your good deeds, even across the lakes, for Allah will not let any of your deeds go to waste.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3469]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: 
The believing women who emigrated to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to swear allegiance to him in accordance with the following verse of the Quran: “ O Prophet, if believing women come to you to swear allegiance to you that they will not associate anything with Allah, will not steal, will not commit fornication, will not kill their children, will not utter any slander that they devise in their (own) hands and feet, and will join you do not oppose what is right, then accept their oath of allegiance and ask Allah's forgiveness for them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful." 
'A'ishah further reported: Those among the believing women who had committed themselves to it had taken the legitimate oath of allegiance. Whenever the women swore their allegiance to it, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) would tell them: Go ahead! I accept your oath of allegiance. By Allah, it never happened that the hand of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) touched the hand of a (foreign) woman when he took the oath of allegiance. But that only happened verbally. 'A'ishah further reported: By Allah, the Messenger of Allah, did not allow women to swear allegiance except to what Allah, the Exalted, commanded him, and by Allah, his palm did not touch the palm of a woman. When he accepted their oath of allegiance, he said to them: I have verbally accepted your oath of allegiance.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3470]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
We used to swear allegiance to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and listen to him and obey him. He used to instruct us that when taking the oath of allegiance, one should say: As far as I can do!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3472]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 
On the day of the Battle of Uhud, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw me during the battle. I was fourteen years old at the time, but he did not allow me to take part in the battle. However, on the day of the Khandaq battle, he allowed me to take part in the battle when he saw me. I was a fifteen year old then.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3473]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade one to enter the enemy's land with the book of the Quran.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3474]

Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) held a horse race. The trained racehorses ran from Al-Hafya' to Thaniyat Al-Wada', but the untrained racehorses ran from Ath-Thaniya to the mosque of Banu Zuraiq. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3477]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Good is associated with the forelocks of horses until the Last Day.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3478]

'Urwa Al-Bariqiy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Good is associated with the forelocks of horses until the Last Day, namely the reward (by Allah) and the Booty (in war).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3480]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The blessing is associated with the forelocks of horses. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3482]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah guarantees to the one who fights in the way of Allah, but only on the condition that he fights only for the cause of Allah faith in Him and in His messengers, that He will either let him enter paradise or that He will let him return to his house from which he left with a reward or with a spoil. By the One in Whose Hand is the life of Muhammad, everyone who comes into being in the way of Allah will be brought on the Last Day in the form from which it came into being, its color being like that of blood and its smell like the scent of musk . By the One in Whose Hand the life of Muhammad lies, it would not be difficult for the Muslims if I had not lagged behind any combat troops, but I cannot find anything with which to mount those who come to me so that I can give them the opportunity to ride . And they themselves cannot afford it, even though it is difficult for them. By the One in Whose Hand is the life of Muhammad, I desire so much that I fight in the way of Allah and perish, (then be brought back to life), then fight again in the way of Allah and perish, and again in the way of Allah fight and perish.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3484]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No person who has something good to look forward to from Allah and is looking forward to would wish to have it after his death world returns, even if the whole world and what is valuable in it were given to him. Excepted from this is the martyr (Shahid), who, due to the excellence of martyrdom (Shahada), would be happy if he returned and perished again (for Allah) in the world.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3488]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
Some asked the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): What is the act that is equivalent to fighting in the way of Allah (Jihad), the Almighty and Exalted? He replied: You cannot bear them! However, they repeated this question two or three times, and each time the Prophet said: You cannot bear it! The third time he said: The one who undertakes jihad in the way of Allah is equal to the one who continually fasts, prays and obeys the verses of Allah. The fighter in the way of Allah is equal to the one who either stops fasting or stops praying until the mujahid returns in the way of Allah.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3490]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Verily, setting out early in the morning or at the end of the day in the way of Allah is better than the whole world and than that, what is on it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3492]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd As-Sa'idiy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Verily, one departure made by the servant in the way of Allah is better than the whole world and what is on it.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3493]

Abu Ayyub (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Verily, setting out early in the morning or at the end of the day in the way of Allah is better than anything on which the sun rises and sets .  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3495]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudriy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
A man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, who is the best among all people? The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A man who undertakes jihad (fighting in the way of Allah) at the risk of his wealth and life. The man asked again: Who then but this? The Prophet said: A believer who resides somewhere in an uninhabited area among the mountains, worships Allah and spares people from his evils.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3501]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Allah will laugh at two men, one of whom had killed the other; and yet both of them will enter paradise. Then the companions said: O Messenger of Allah, how is this? The Prophet said: One fought in the cause of Allah, the Exalted and Almighty, and dies a martyr; After that, Allah will show mercy to the murderer because of his repentance. Accordingly, he professes Islam, fights in the way of Allah, and Allah lets him die as a martyr.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3504]

Zaid Ibn Khalid Al-Guhaniy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever has equipped a fighter in the way of Allah has fought (thereby with him), and whoever has fought for him relatives of this fighter who fought (thereby with him). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3511]

Al-Bara', may Allah be pleased with him, reported:  
As the verse of the Qur'an 
is not equal to those of the believers who remain seated... those who struggle with their possessions and their own persons in the way of Allah. ...  
was sent down, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered Zaid to bring a shoulder blade to write this verse. Then Ibn Umm Maktoum complained to the Prophet about his blindness. This is how the addition of the verse was revealed, namely: Not equal are those among the believers who remain seated - except those who have an injury -... [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ No. 3516]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with them) reported:  
(During a battle) a man said: O Messenger of Allah, if I die (today), where will I be? The Prophet replied: In paradise! Then the man threw away some dates that he was holding in his hand and fought until he died! 
(In the hadith narrated by Suwaid, this man said this to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) on the day of the battle of Uhud.) [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3518]

Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
A man from Banu An-Nabiet (a tribe of the Ansar) came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: I bear witness that there is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah and that you are His servant and messenger! He then went ahead, fought, and subsequently perished. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: He did little but received much reward.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3519]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:  
My paternal uncle, by whose name I was called, did not take part in the battle of Badr with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He was therefore very sad and said: I was not there when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) fought the first battle (against the idolaters). But if Allah were to give me the opportunity to take part in a battle with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, later, He would certainly know what I would do there! But he was afraid to say more. Later he took part in the Battle of Uhud with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He met Sa'd Ibn Mu'az and Anas said to him: O Abu 'Amr, where are you going? He replied: Oh, the smell of paradise; I smell it on Mount Uhud! He then fought against the enemies until he subsequently died. His body bore more than eighty wounds inflicted by the enemy's swords, lances and arrows. Al-Rubai` Bint An-Nadr, who was his sister and my paternal aunt, said: I could only identify my brother by his fingertips. Accordingly, the following verse of the Koran was revealed: 
Among the believers there are men who have fulfilled what they committed themselves to Allah. Among them there are some who have fulfilled their vows; and among them there are some who still (have to) wait. And they made no change; 
It was believed that this verse was revealed about him and his companions.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3523]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
A Bedouin came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah! There are people who fight for loot, others for reputation, while others fight with the intention of gaining reputation. Then which of them fights in the way of Allah? The Prophet said: Whoever fights with the intention of exalting the Word of Allah fights in the way of Allah!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3524]

'Umar Ibnal Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Verily, deeds are judged according to intention, and every person is entitled to what he intends. So whoever undertakes migration for the sake of Allah and His Messenger, his migration is for Allah and His Messenger; But whoever undertakes his emigration for the sake of earthly life, to obtain it, or for the sake of a woman to marry her, his emigration is for that for which he emigrated. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3530]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
Whenever the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) visited Umm Haraam bint Milhan, she gave him something to eat. Umm Haraam was previously the wife of 'Ubada Ibn-as-Samit. One day the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to her house. She served him a dish and rubbed his head. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) fell asleep. When he woke up again, he laughed. Then she asked him: Why are you laughing, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Some people from my community appeared to me in a dream. They were on a campaign for the cause of Allah, sitting on their thrones like kings in the middle of this mighty sea. She said: O Messenger of Allah, call on Allah for me to make me a participant in this campaign! So he called on Allah for her and fell asleep again. When he woke up, he laughed again. She asked: Why are you laughing, O Messenger of Allah? He replied: Some people from my community appeared to me in a dream as fighters for the cause of Allah. And he told the same thing as after his first dream. She said: O Messenger of Allah, please ask Allah to make me a participant in this campaign! He replied: You will be among the first fighters for the faith. At the time of Mu'awiya, Umm Haraam Bint Milhan took part in a campaign undertaken by ship. After she went back to land, she fell from her mount and died.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3535]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: While a man was walking along a path, he saw a thorn branch lying on the path; He removed him from the way and for this act Allah thanked him in such a way that He forgave him (his sins). The martyrs are five: one who dies of a plague; one who dies from an abdominal injury; one who drowns; one who perishes under the stone rubble and one who is killed in battle in the way of Allah. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3538]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Death by plague is a martyrdom for every Muslim!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3540]

Al-Mughira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: There will be a group of my followers who will remain victorious over the people until the command of Allah comes upon them. while still victorious.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3545]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Traveling is a torment! It robs you of sleep and your appetite for food and drink. Anyone who has achieved the purpose of their journey should return home as quickly as possible!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3554]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to not knock on his family's door at night. But he used to come to them early in the morning or in the evening.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 33, Ḥadīṯ no. 3555]

'Adiy Ibn Hatim (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I said: O Messenger of Allah, I (hunters) send the trained dogs to hunt and they seize (animals) for me, saying the name of Allah when I slaughter them. The Prophet replied: If you send your trained dogs to hunt and utter the name of Allah (while slaughtering the hunted animal), then you may eat from it. Then I said: Does this also apply if the dogs killed the animal? The Prophet replied: Even if they killed it, but on condition that there was no other dog with them. Then I said to him: I sometimes throw the animal with a bladeless arrow. Then the Prophet said: If you throw the bladeless arrow and pierce the animal with the point, then you may eat from that animal; but you may not eat the animal that is hit by the side (of the arrow). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3560]

Abu Tha'laba Al-Khusha'iy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
I came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: O Messenger of Allah, we live in an area belonging to the People of the Book . Are we (Muslims) allowed to eat from their dishes? And this area is also a hunting area where I hunt with my bow and my trained dog, as well as with my untrained dog. Tell me then, what are we allowed from this? The Prophet said: As for you living in the territory of the People of the Book and eating from their utensils, do this: If you (Muslims) find other utensils, do not eat from their utensils. And if you don't find anything, rinse it out and eat from it! But as far as the hunting area is concerned, it is as follows: Whatever you have hit with your bow or hunted with your trained dog and uttered the name of Allah, that you may eat. But what you have hunted with your untrained dog, you are only allowed to eat if the animal you hunted is still alive and you ritually slaughter it. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3567]

Abu Tha'laba (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: If you shoot at an animal but lose track of it and later find it, you may eat of it as long as it is not there smells bad. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3568]

Abu Tha`laba, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:  
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us to eat the flesh of all fanged predators
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Hadīṯ No. 3570]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent us to attack a caravan belonging to the Quraysh (in retaliation for our taking away property). He provided us with a knapsack full of dates as provisions for the trip, because this was the only thing he found for us. Abu 'Ubaida used to give us a date for a date. Then someone interrupted and asked the narrator: And what did you do with it? He continued: We sucked them like children and then we drank water. That was enough for us for the whole day until night. We also hit the trees with our sticks, moistened the falling leaves and ate them. In this way we headed towards the sea coast. There we saw something that looked like a mound of earth. As we approached it, we discovered that it was a fish called anbar (a type of whale). Abu 'Ubaida first said: This is a dead fish! But he remained silent and then said: No, we are the messengers of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and we are in the way of Allah. Furthermore, you are forced to eat it (since supplies were almost running out). So eat of it! We ate the fish for a whole month, and there were three hundred of us men until we gained weight. I once saw us scooping fat out of the fish's eye socket with jars and cutting pieces of meat the size of a bull out of the fish. Abu 'Ubaida had thirteen of our men look into the eye socket of the fish, raise a pair of the fish's ribs, load our largest camel, and it was able to pass under the pair of ribs. We took pieces of the fish meat that we didn't let fully cook with us as provisions for the trip. When we arrived in Madinah, we went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and told him about it. Then he said: It is a provision that Allah has brought forth for you. Do you still have any of this with you that you can give us as food? We sent some of the meat to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and he ate it. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3576]

Abu Tha'laba (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade eating the meat of tame donkeys.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3582]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade eating the meat of tame donkeys.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3583]

The Hadeeth of 'Abdullah Ibn Abi Aufa (may Allah be pleased with him)  
reported: I asked 'Abdullah Ibn Abi Aufa about the meat of the tame donkeys, and he said: While we were with the Messenger of Allah on the day of Khaibar battle , may Allah bless him and grant him peace, we were very hungry. We captured tame donkeys belonging to the enemy outside Medina and slaughtered them. While we were cooking their meat in our pots, the caller of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) called out: Spill the contents of the pots and do not eat them! Then I asked: So did the Prophet forbid it? He replied: We discussed it. Some said he finally banned it. The others believe that he forbade it because a fifth of the captured donkeys were not given to Allah and His Messenger.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3585]

Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them) reported:  
I do not know whether the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade eating the meat of tame donkeys because they are the riding animals of the people and he feared that they would increase in number decrease (or be eradicated), or whether he only banned it on the day of the Khaibar battle.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3591]

Salama Ibnal Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
We went to Khaibar with the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him). Allah gave us victory over the enemy, and on the evening of the conquest the people lit many fires. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: What is this fire? What did you light the fire for? The people replied: For the preparation of meat. The Prophet asked again: What kind of meat? They said: The meat of tame donkeys. Then the Messenger of Allah said: Throw away this meat and break the pots. A man among the people said: O Messenger of Allah, can we throw away the meat and then wash the pots? He said: You can do that too!
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3592]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) conquered Khaibar, we caught (tame) donkeys on the outskirts of the city. We cooked some of them; Then the caller of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) announced: Allah and His Messenger forbid you to eat them, because it is an abomination, the work of Satan. The cooking pots were knocked over with whatever was in them even though they were cooking with them!
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3593]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdillah (may Allah be pleased with them) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us to eat the meat of tame donkeys on the day of the Battle of Khaybar, but allowed us to eat horse meat.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3595]

Asma', may Allah be pleased with her, reported:  
We slaughtered a mare during the lifetime of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and ate her flesh.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3597]

Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asked about the lizard. He said: Of my own accord I will neither eat nor forbid them.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3598]

The Hadith of Khalid Ibnal Walid (may Allah be pleased with him)  
He once appeared with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) Maimuna, wife of the Prophet, who was his aunt and the maternal aunt of Ibn 'Abbas. She just had a fried lizard at home that her sister Hufaida Bintal Harith had brought from Nagd. She served this lizard to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Generally, the Prophet would not touch any food until he was told what it was. But that day he reached for the food without knowing what it actually was. Then one of the women present said: Tell the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) what this is! This is what they said: O Messenger of Allah, this is a lizard! Then the Prophet withdrew his hand. Here Khalid Ibnal Walid asked him: O Messenger of Allah, is eating lizard meat forbidden? The Prophet replied: No, but this animal does not exist in the land of my people. For this reason I don't want to eat it! Accordingly, Khalid dismembered the lizard and ate it. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) watched him but did not forbid him from eating.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3603]

Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported:  
My maternal aunt, Umm Hufaid, gave clarified butter, curds and lizards to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. The Prophet ate the clarified butter and curds, but not the lizards as he felt aversion to them. However, the lizards were eaten (by others) at the table of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). If eating lizards were forbidden, they would not have been eaten at the table of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3604]

'Abdullah Ibn Abi Aufa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
We went to seven battles with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and used to eat locusts.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3610]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
We followed the trail of a hare near Marri-z-Zahran, and the people (my companions) exerted themselves very hard until they were exhausted. But I continued searching for the rabbit until I caught him. I then took it to Abu Talha, who slaughtered it. He gave me the thigh and the two thighs to bring to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), who accepted them.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3611]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibnal Mughaffal (may Allah be pleased with him) 
Ibn Buraida reported that 'Abdullah Ibnal Mughaffal saw one of his friends throwing a slingshot. Then he said to him, “You must not throw a sling; for the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) abhorred throwing slings - or he forbade it. (The Prophet pointed out) that a sling cannot hunt an animal or kill an enemy, but only breaks the tooth and knocks out the eye. Later he (Ibn 'Umar) saw the man throwing the sling again. He said to him: I have already told you that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) abhorred throwing with slings, or he forbade it, and yet you continue to throw it. So I'll never talk to you again.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3612]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the animals to be tied up to be used as targets for arrows.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3616]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, 
Ibn 'Umar walked past some youths who were placing a tied chicken to aim at. When they saw Ibn 'Umar, they left the place. Ibn 'Umar said: Who did this? Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cursed the one who does such a thing.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 34, Ḥadīṯ no. 3618]

Gundab Ibn Sufyan (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
I attended the prayer of the Feast of Sacrifice with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Right after he finished the prayer, he saw the meat of some sacrificial animals that were slaughtered before he finished the prayer. Then he said: Whoever has already slaughtered a sacrificial animal before the prayer should slaughter another animal in addition to that animal. And whoever has not yet slaughtered, let him slaughter his animal in the name of Allah!
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3621]

Al-Bara', may Allah be pleased with him, reported:  
My uncle, Abu Burda, slaughtered the sacrificial animal before the festival prayer. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: This is not a sacrifice! My uncle said: O Messenger of Allah, I have another goat, between 6 months and a year. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Then slaughter it, but it will be slaughtered only for yourself. Then he said: Whoever slaughtered before the festival prayer slaughtered for himself. And whoever has slaughtered after the festival prayer has offered his sacrifice correctly and followed the Sunnah (procedure) of the Muslims.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3624]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said on the Day of Sacrifice: Whoever has slaughtered his sacrificial animals before the festival prayer should slaughter another animal in addition to that animal. A man stood up and said: O Messenger of Allah, this is a day when meat is highly desired. But he also pointed to the needs of his neighbors, and as if the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had approved this. The man continued: But I still have a goat, between 6 months and a year old, which I prefer to two fleshy goats. Should I butcher it? The narrator continued: He gave him permission for this? I don't know if this permission applied to others or just to this man. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to two rams and slaughtered them with his own hands. The people came to the sacrificial animals and distributed them among themselves.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3630]

'Uqba Ibn 'Amar, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:  
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, gave me sheep and goats to distribute among my companions as sacrificial animals. (After the distribution) one lamb remained. I mentioned this to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then he said, Offer it as a sacrifice. Qutaiba (a later narrator) added (that the Prophet further said): for my companions!
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3633]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sacrificed two white rams with black spots. He slaughtered them with his own hands, said Takbir (Allahu Akbar, i.e. Allah is Greater) and placed his foot on either side of their necks.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3635]

Rafi' Ibn Khadig (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
I said: O Messenger of Allah, tomorrow we will meet the enemy and we have no knives! Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Make the instruments of slaughter (knives) so that they cause blood to flow, and when the name of Allah has been said over them (animals of slaughter), then you may eat (of the meat). But not using the claws and the bone tips. I'll tell you why! The bone tips are nothing more than bones, and the claws are the knives of the Abyssinians. Later we captured camels and sheep. At that moment a camel ran away and a man stopped it by shooting an arrow. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: These camels have extraordinary characteristics like wild animals. If you are overwhelmed by such problems, deal with them in the same way!
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3638]

The Hadith of 'Ali Ibn Abu Talib (may Allah be pleased with him): 
Abu 'Ubaid reported: I experienced the Feast of Sacrifice with 'Ali Ibn Abu Talib. He performed the festival prayer before the sermon and said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us to eat the meat of our sacrificial animals for more than three days.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3639]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported:  
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: No one should eat the meat of his sacrificial animal for more than three days.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3641]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her): 
'Abdullah Ibn Waqed reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade eating the meat of the sacrificial animals for more than three days. 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Bakr reported: I mentioned the 'Amra and she said: He was telling the truth, for I heard 'A'ishah say: Some poor Bedouins came to Madinah on a festival of sacrifice during the lifetime of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). on him. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Save some of it for three days. Then give (the Bedouins) the rest of it as alms. Later some Muslims said: O Messenger of Allah, people make waterskins from their skins and collect their fat. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: And what is there to object to? They replied: You have forbidden eating the meat of the sacrificial animals for more than three days. Then he said: That was only because of the poor Bedouins who came to us. (Now they are gone) You can eat the meat of your sacrificial animals, save some of it and also give alms from it.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3643]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade eating the meat of sacrificial animals for more than three days. Later he said: Eat of it, provide yourself with it as food for your journey, and save some more.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3644]

Salama Ibn Al-Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever of you has sacrificed an animal for slaughter should not keep any of it in his house for more than three days. A year later, people asked him: O Messenger of Allah, should we do like last year this time? The Prophet said: No!; for last year the people were in need and I wanted the meat to be distributed among the people and the poor to benefit from it.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3648]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Islam forbade the pre-Islamic custom of sacrificing Fara'a and 'Atiera (an extra sheep in the month of Ragab) for idols sacrifice. Ibn Rafi' added in his tradition that Fara'a means the first young of a camel.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 35, Ḥadīṯ no. 3652]

'Ali Ibn Abu Talib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
While distributing the spoils of Badr Battle, an old camel met me, and the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) gave me another one. One day I made both of them kneel at the door of an Ansar man with the intention of carrying izkhar (plants with good fragrance) to them to sell. I was accompanied by a jeweler from the Qainuqa' tribe. I thought I could throw a banquet (on the occasion of my marriage) with the money I was to earn from selling these plants. In this house at that time, Hamza Ibn Abdel Mottalib was busy drinking, with a servant singing to him. She said: O Hamza, arise and slaughter the fat she-camels! Then Hamza took his sword, cut open the humps and legs of the camels, and took away their livers. Then I asked Ibn Shihab: Did he take from the humps? And Ibn Ash-Shihab replied: He cut off their humps and took them away. 'Ali further reported: I saw a sight that frightened me. So I went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and told him. Zaid Ibn Haritha was with him. The Prophet went out with Zaid and me until we reached Hamzah. And then he expressed his anger towards him. But Hamza raised his eyes and said: Are you not the servants of my ancestors? Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) withdrew until he went away from them.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3660]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
On the day when the intoxicant was forbidden, I served wine to the people in the house of Abu Talha, and their wine at that time was made from almost ripe and dried dates. Then we heard a crier announcing something. I was told: Go out and tell us what it's about! So I went out and found the crier proclaiming: everything intoxicating has been forbidden. Then I saw the wine in the streets of Madina. flow. Then Abu Talha said to me: Go out and pour it out! So I went out and poured it out. They said (or some of them said): So and so fell (in battles) while the wine was in his stomach. (The later narrator does not know whether the last sentence belongs to the tradition of Anas or not.) Then Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, revealed the following verse of the Qur'an: " There is no offense on those who believe and act righteously in what they do have consumed them if they fear God and believe and act righteously... « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3662]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah Al-Ansary, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade mixing dried dates and raisins, or almost ripe and dried dates, as nabith (date water). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3674]

Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Do not prepare Nabith (date water) either by mixing almost ripe dates and ripe dates, or by mixing raisins and dried dates, but prepare Nabith of each of these fruits separately from the others!” (One should be careful not to let the fruits ferment.)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3681]

'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the use of gourds as vessels or vessels coated with pitch for preparing Nabith (date water). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3693]

'A'ishah, the Mother of the Believers (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
Al-Aswad said to her: O Mother of the Believers, tell me what the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) has forbidden. Namely with regard to the vessels in which Nabith (date water) is prepared. She replied: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us, his family, to prepare nabith in gourd as a vessel or in vessels coated with pitch. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3694]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) 
Sa'eed Ibn Gubair said: I bear witness that Ibn 'Umar and Ibn 'Abbas testified that: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade putting Nabith (date water) in gourd as a vessel, in vessels made from blood, fur and clay together, also in vessels coated with pitch and in vessels made from tree trunks. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3705]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade preparing Nabith (date water) in the (mentioned) vessels, the people said: Not all people can use other vessels use. So he allowed Nabith to be prepared in vessels not coated with pitch. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3726]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asked about Bit' (a wine made from syrup) and he said: Any drink that intoxicates is haraam (forbidden). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3727]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Anything that has an intoxicating effect is considered wine. And anything intoxicating is haraam (forbidden). And whoever is in the habit of drinking wine in this world and dies while indulging in the drink and without repenting, he will be deprived of drinking wine in the Hereafter.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ No. 3733]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Abu Usaid As-Sa'idiy invited the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to his wedding. The bride herself served the wedding guests. Sahl asked those present: Do you know what she gave the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to drink? The night before she put dates in water in a clay vessel for him, and after he had finished eating, she gave him the date water to drink. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3746]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A woman from the Arabs was proposed as a wife to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). So he ordered Abu Usaid to send to her, and he sent to her. When the woman came, she was housed in the fortress of the Sa'ida tribe. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to her, and when he entered, he found her bowing her head. When he began to speak to her, she said: I take refuge in Allah from you! Then the Prophet said: I have decided to keep you away from me! The people then said to her: Do you know who this one is? She replied: No! They said: This is the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He came to get engaged to you. Then she said: Oh, this is an honor that I don't deserve! Sahl further reported: On that day the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came until he and his companions sat under the canopy of the tribe of Banu Sa'ida (a shaded meeting place) . Then he said: Bring us something to drink, Sahl! So I brought them this vessel and they drank from it. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3747]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
I offered honey, nabith (date water), water and milk in my cup to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3748]

Abu Bakr As-Siddiq (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
When we were migrating from Makkah to Madinah with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), we passed by a shepherd. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was thirsty, so I milked some milk for him. I brought him the milk and he drank until I was satisfied. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3749]

Abu Humaid As-Sa'idy (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: 
I brought to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) a cup of milk with dates soaked in it, but uncovered. He said: You should cover it, even if you only put a tree branch on it. Abu Humaid added: Verily he gave instructions that the water containers be tied up at night and the doors be locked at night. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3752]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
When we were with the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he wanted to drink something. Then a man said: O Messenger of Allah, may we not offer you nabith (date water)? Then he said: Yes. The man went out quickly and fetched a cup of Nabith. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: You should cover it, even if you only put a tree branch on it. Then he drank. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3753]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Cover the vessels, tie up the water containers, lock the doors and put out the oil lamps; for Satan cannot uncover a covered vessel, open a locked door, or untie a tied container of water. But if one of you can do nothing but put a branch on it and call on Allah's name, then let him do so. It may happen that a mouse (gets entangled in the oil lamp, drags the wick with it and) sets the house's inhabitants on fire. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3755]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Do not let fire burn in your houses when you go to sleep. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3759]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
One night a house in Madinah burned down with all its occupants. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) heard about this, he said: The fire is indeed an enemy to you. Therefore, erase it when you go to sleep. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3760]

'Umar Ibn Abu Salama (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I was in the care of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and I passed my hand around in the bowl (while eating) . Then Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: O boy, call on Allah's name, eat with your right hand and eat from what is in front of you . [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3767]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade drinking directly from the waterskin. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3769]

Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I gave Zamzam water to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him). Then he drank standing up. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3776]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to take breath (outside the drinking vessel) three times. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3781]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was given milk diluted with water while a desert Arab stood on his right and Abu Bakr on his left. The Prophet drank it and passed it to the desert Arabian and said: Pass it to the right! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3783]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd As-Sa'idy, may Allah be pleased with him, reported:
