The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was given something to drink, with a youth on his right and some older men on his left stood. The Prophet said to the youth: Do you allow me to pass it on to them? And the youth said: O No, by Allah, I will not give priority to any other over my portion of you. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) placed it in his hand. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3786]

Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: When one of you has eaten, he should not wipe his hand without first licking it or having it licked. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3787]

Abu Mas'ud Al-Ansary, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
A man from the Ansar (helpers) named Abu Shu'aib, who had a servant who was a butcher, saw the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. and noticed by his face that he was hungry. Then the man said to his servant, Woe to you! Prepare for me a meal enough for five people so that I can invite the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as one of the five. The servant prepared the meal for him, then went to the Prophet and invited him as one of the five. But it happened that another man followed them. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood at the door, he said: This man went after us. If you want, you allow him to come with us, and if you want, you let him go. Then the host said: No! O Messenger of Allah, I allow him. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3797]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
While Al-Khandaq (the ditch around Madinah) was being dug, I found the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) very hungry. I returned to my wife and said to her, “Do you have anything to eat?” I found the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) very hungry." She brought out a leather sack in which was found a Saa' (hollow measure = about 3 kg) of barley. We also had a sheep with us that I slaughtered. But my wife ground and finished her work at the same time as me. I chopped up the food in an earthenware pot. She told me: "Do not expose me to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and his companions!" I came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and whispered in his ear: "O Messenger of Allah, We slaughtered a sheep of ours and ground some of the barley we had. We therefore invite you and a group of your companions." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) shouted loudly and said: "O people of the Trench! Jabir prepared a banquet for you. So come here!” He said to me: “Do not take away your pot from the fire and do not bake your dough until I come!” I came with the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him), leading the way until I met my wife reached. She told me, "You will be exposed." I replied, "I have done what you told me." I brought our dough to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him be upon him) and he spat in it and blessed it. Then it was the earthenware pot in which he spat out and blessed him. He then said to my wife, “Call another woman to bake with you and take soup out of the pot but don’t take it away from the fire!”

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Abu Talha said to Umm Sulaim: “I heard the voice of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him); she is weak and you can tell he is hungry. Do you have something for him?" She replied: "Yes!" Then she brought some barley flatbreads, took a veil from her, wrapped the bread in it, put it under my outer garment, gave me a piece of it and sent me to the ambassador Allah's blessings and peace be upon him. I went to him with the bread. Then I found the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in the mosque with the other people. I stopped by them and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me, "Did Abu Talha send you?" I said, "Yes!" He said, "With food?" I said, "Yes !" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to those who were with him: "Get up!" Then he went and I went ahead of the people until I reached Abu Talha and told him. Then Abu Talha said: "You Umm Sulaim, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) has come to us with the people, and we have nothing to give them for food!" She said: "Allah and His Messengers know better!” Then Abu Talha went out to receive the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) entered with him, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Bring here, Umm Sulaim, what you have!" She then gave him the bread and he left it break into pieces. And Umm Sulaim added some butter until it was well soaked. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) uttered (supplication) whatever he was able to say according to the will of Allah. Then he said, “Let ten people come in!” So ​​they came in, ate until they were full, and went out. Then he said, “Let ten more people come in!” So ​​they came in, ate until they were full, and went out. Afterwards he said again: “Let ten more people enter!” So ​​they entered until all the people had eaten and were full. These were seventy or eighty men in all. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3801]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A tailor invited the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to the meal he had prepared. Anas Ibn Malik continued his report: I went to eat with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The tailor presented the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) with barley bread and soup with pumpkin and qadid (meat cut into strips and dried) . Anas further said: I saw that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) preferred pumpkin. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3803]

'Abdullah Ibn Ga'far (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I saw that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was eating the green cucumbers along with the ripe dates. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3806]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I saw the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) eating dates while he was squatting on the ground. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3807]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both 
Gabala, Ibn Suhaim reported: One day Ibn Az-Zubair gave us dates to eat. At that time, famine struck the people. And when 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar passed by us while we were eating, he said: “Do not eat the dates in pairs; because the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us to eat them in pairs. Unless the person asks his brother for permission in this regard.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3809]

Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever eats seven dried dates from Madinah every morning will not be harmed by poison until night falls. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3813]

Sa'id Ibn Zaid Ibn 'Amr Ibn Nufail (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) say: "Truffles are a kind of manna (a special food sent by Allah to the Children of Israel ) , and their juice is a remedy for the eyes.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3816]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
We were with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in Marri-z-Zahran to harvest Al-Kabath (a fruit in some desert patches) . The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to us: “Take away the dark ones!” Then we said: “O Messenger of Allah, it seems that you have been tending sheep.” The Prophet replied: “Of course! There was no Prophet who did not guard these.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3822]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A man came to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) and said: "I am very exhausted!" Then the Prophet sent to one of his wives. She said, "By Him who sent you with right faith, I have nothing but water." He then sent to another and she gave the same answer. So he sent to another until they all gave the same answer, namely: "No, by Him who sent you with the right faith, I have nothing other than water!" Then the Prophet said: "Who will receive this man for this night, may Allah have mercy on him?" There stood a man from the Ansar (the Helpers) and said: "I, O Messenger of Allah!" He then went home with the guest and said to his wife: "Do you have anything to eat?" She told him: "I have nothing else but food for the children!" Then he said to her: "Keep the children busy with something! And when our guest comes into the house, put out the oil lamp and act as if we were eating!" So they sat and the guest ate. The next morning the man came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) who said to him: "Allah has indeed looked favorably on your deeds towards the guest!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3829]

Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
We were one hundred and thirty people with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Do any of you have any food with you?" Then a man came forward who had a Saa` (a measure = about 3 kg) of flour. The Prophet had this kneaded (into bread) . At that moment a tall, unkempt-haired one of the fellow devotees passed by with some sheep, which he was driving before him. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: "Are these to be sold or given away?" The man said, "No! They are only for sale." The Prophet then bought a sheep from him, which was immediately prepared and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) caused the liver to be grilled. I swear by Allah that there was not one of the one hundred and thirty people for whom the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cut off a piece of the liver. The Prophet gave to whoever was present, and to whomever was absent the Prophet kept aside a piece of liver. He had two large pots made of it, and we all ate it until we were full. But there was so much left in the two pots that I had to load it onto the camel later. This is how 'Abdu-r-Rahman reported this event.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3832]

Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The people of As-Suffa were very poor. For this reason, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said one day: "Whoever has enough food for two people should feed a third, one of those needy people. And whoever has enough for four people, should feed a fifth and give food to a sixth." Abu Bakr, my father, brought three of these people to our home. And the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) even took ten of them with him. My father and my mother were present with us that evening (besides me) . (A narrator (Abu An-Nu'man) is not sure whether 'Abdu-r-Rahman said: In addition, my wife and the servant who looked after my house and my father's house were present.) 'Abdu-r- Rahman continued: Abu Bakr went to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) to have dinner with him. Then he (Abu Bakr) leftto the mosque to perform the night prayer with the Prophet, and then returned to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and stayed until the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) fell asleep. He didn't come home until late at night. His wife received him with the words: "What has kept you away from your guests for so long?" He asked, "Didn't you serve them dinner?" She replied, "They refused to eat until you got there! We offered it to them, but they didn't want to!" I overheard this conversation. I quickly moved away to hide! But Abu Bakr was already shouting at me: "Oh, you mean!" He complained and raged. Then he said: "Eat now, and may it not come to you! And I swear by Allah! I will never touch this food!" We started eating. And I swear by Allah! We didn't take a bite from the plates without a bigger bite coming from below! This happened until everyone was full. And there was more food than before! Abu Bakr looked at the bowls in amazement. Really, there was as much food as when we started eating, or even more! Abu Bakr turned to his wife and asked her: "O sister of Banu Firaas! What is happening here?" She replied, "Really, my darling, now it's three times as much as before!" Then Abu Bakr also ate some of the food. He said, "Surely it was the work of the devil!" He was referring to his vow not to touch the food. He ate some more and then took the food to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), where it was kept until morning. There was a contract between us and some people regarding the care of the needy, which had expired at that time. Twelve men were appointed, each of whom was assigned some of these people - Allah knows best how many needy people there were for each of these men. In any case, they all ate from the dishes that were left over that evening! This is how the narrator reported this event.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3833]

Abu Hurairah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "A meal for two people is enough for three, and a meal for three people is enough for four." (Satisfaction with a food depends not only on the quantity, but also on the inner attitude of the person and the blessing that Allah bestows on it.)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ No. 3835]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The disbeliever eats with seven stomachs and the believer eats with one stomach. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3839]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The believer eats with one stomach and the disbeliever eats with seven stomachs." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ No. 3842]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, never found fault with any food. If he liked them, he ate them, and if he didn't like them, he left them alone. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 36, Ḥadīṯ no. 3844]

Umm Salma, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: The Messenger of Allaah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "Whoever drinks from a silver vessel does nothing other than swallow the fire of hell into his stomach. [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ No. 3846]

Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commanded and forbade us each of seven (behaviors) : He ordered us to visit the sick person, to go with a funeral procession , to wish mercy on the one who sneezes (If he said Al-Hamdu-lillah) , to keep the oath or to help the one who swears, to support the oppressed, to obey the one who invites, and to spread the greeting of peace among the people. On the other hand, he forbade us to wear gold rings, drink from silver vessels, ride on saddles covered with silk, and wear clothes made of mixed silk, pure silk, brocade and silk brocade. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3848]

Huthaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Do not drink from vessels of gold or silver, and do not wear clothing made of silk brocade or silk. All these things are theirs ( to the disbelievers) in this world and to you in the Hereafter on the Day of Resurrection." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3849]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: (My father) 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab saw a skirt striped with silk threads in front of the entrance to the mosque. Then he said to the Prophet: "O Messenger of Allah, what do you think if you buy this and wear it on Friday or to receive the delegations when they come to you?" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, the one who puts on such a thing is he who has no share in the happiness of the Hereafter." Later, some of these skirts were brought to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and he gave one of them to 'Umar. 'Umar then said: "O Messenger of Allah, you have given me this and once you said what you thought about the coat of 'Utarid." The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: "I did not give it to you to wear!" 'Umar then gave this garment to his brother in Makkah, who was an idolater. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3851]

'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was given a coat striped with silk threads. He sent it to me. When I put it on, I saw the anger on his face. He said to me, "I did not send you this skirt to wear, but to make it into veils for women." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3862]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent 'Umar a shawl made of silk brocade. So 'Umar said, "You sent this to me even though you had already expressed your opinion about silk?" Then the Prophet said, "I did not send him to you to wear. But I sent him to you so that you might benefit from his price." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3865]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever wears silk in this world will not be allowed to wear it in the Hereafter." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3866]

'Uqba Ibn 'Amer, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was given a silk robe, which he put on and performed his prayers. After he had finished the prayer, he violently tore it off his body, demonstratively showing his discomfort, and said: "This is not suitable for the God-fearing!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3868]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) permitted Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn 'Auf and Az-Zubair Ibnal 'Awwam to wear silk when traveling because of itching which the two suffered. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3869]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) Qatada reported: We asked Anas Ibn Malik: "What clothes did the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) wear most? - or did he like it best?" He replied: "The Hibra (an ornate robe made of cotton or linen) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3877]

The hadeeth of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, Abu Burda reported: I visited 'A'ishah and she brought us a thick waistcloth of those made in Yemen; and with a robe called Al-Mulabbada (patched robe) . She swore by Allah that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) died while wearing these two items of clothing. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3879]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The pillow of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) on which he leaned was made of animal skin stuffed with palm fibers. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3882]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked me when I got married, "Have you bought carpets?" I replied: "How do I get it? (I'm so poor) ." Then the Prophet said: "You will get them (soon) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3884]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah does not look at the one who smugly lets his clothes drag on the ground behind him." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3887]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: He saw a man with his waistcloth dragging behind him on the ground, and walking on the ground in arrogance; This was the ruler of Bahrain, and said: "Here comes the ruler! Here comes the ruler!" (Then Abu Hurayrah said:) The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had said: "Allah does not look at the one who lets his waistcloth drag on the ground behind him in disrespect." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3893]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Once upon a time there was a man who strutted around in his two magnificent outer garments, smug and with his ( well-coiffed) shoulder-length hair. Suddenly Allah let him go sink into the ground, and now he rushes down into it until the hour (of judgment) arrives." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3894]
Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade us (men) to wear gold rings. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3896]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took a ring of gold for himself and turned its stone towards the palm of his hand when he wore it. Once, as he sat in the pulpit, he pulled the ring from his finger and said, "I wore this ring and turned its stone toward the palm of my hand." Then he threw the ring away from him and said: "I will never wear it." Then the people also threw away their rings. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3898]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took a silver signet ring and had it engraved with the following: Muhammad Rasulullah (Muhammad the Messenger of Allah) . He then told the people: "I took a silver signet ring and had Muhammad Rasulullah engraved on it. No one is allowed to have these words engraved on his own signet ring . " [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3901]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) wearing a silver ring for one day. People imitated him; made rings out of silver and wore them. Previously, the Prophet threw away his gold ring when he saw people wearing gold rings. Back then, people threw away their rings. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3905]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If one of you wants to put on his shoes, he should start with the right foot; and if he wants to take off his shoes, he should "He should start with his left foot. He should either walk barefoot or wear both shoes together." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3913]

'Abdullah Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) lying on the ground in the mosque. He had his legs crossed. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3921]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade men from dyeing themselves with saffron . [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3922]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Neither the Jews nor the Christians dye their hair. So be different from them." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3926]

Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The angels do not enter a dwelling in which there is a dog or an image (of a human or an animal) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3929]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
We had a curtain with the image of a bird. When you come in, you see him first. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: "Let this disappear from me; for every time I enter and see this, I remember this world." At that time we also had a fabric made of plush decorated with silk threads and it allowed us to wear it. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3934]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Those who make images will be punished on the Day of Resurrection. It will be said to them: Bring to life what you have you created!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3942]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The people who will be punished most severely on the Day of Resurrection are those who have images (of humans or from the animal) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3943]

Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Whoever makes images (of people or animals) will go to Hellfire. For every image he has made , will be a soul that torments him in hellfire." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3945]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, said: Who is more wicked than the one who tries to create creatures like Me? But let him try to create a speck of sun, a grain of wheat or a grain of barley." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3947]

Abu Bashier Al-Ansary (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I was once traveling with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He ordered one (crier) to make it known that no one should leave a ribbon on the neck of a camel. 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Bakr added: I believe he (Abu Bashier) further said: "This happened while the people were resting." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3951]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: After Umm Sulaim gave birth to a child, she said to me: "O Anas, take good care that nothing enters the baby's mouth until you take him to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). on him, go so that he does tahnik with him!" (Tahnik: You chew something sweet, usually a date, put the porridge in the baby's mouth and rub its oral cavity with it.) I went to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). He was in the garden wearing a hamisa (a striped robe) from Huwait (a place near Madina) . He was currently busy branding the mount he rode to conquer Makkah. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3955]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prohibited qaza'. (Qaza` = scattered clouds in the sky. Here it means shaving off some parts of the head while leaving others with the hair.)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3959]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Beware of sitting on the streets." The people said to him, "We can't help it; these are our meeting places where we talk to each other!" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: "Well, if you have to be there, make sure you maintain the right of way." They said, "And what is included in the right of way?" He said: "Lower your eyes, do not harass anyone, return the greeting, command what is right and forbid what is reprehensible." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3960]

Asma' Bint Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: A woman came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah, my daughter got married a short time ago. A little later she fell ill with measles, and many Her hair was falling out. Can I add someone else's hair to her hair?" Then he said: "Allah curses a woman who makes wigs and hairpieces and a woman who uses them." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3961]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: A girl from the Ansar (the Helpers) got married. A little later she became ill and lost a lot of her hair. Her relatives wanted to add someone else's hair to her hair. They asked the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and he said, "Allah curses a woman who makes wigs and hairpieces and a woman who uses them." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3963]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cursed a woman who makes or uses wigs and hairpieces, who tattoos or has herself tattooed. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3965]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Allah curses those women who tattoo other women, get tattooed, pluck hair from their own eyebrows or from the eyebrows of other women, file their teeth to make their spaces cosmetic to enlarge, and thereby change Allah's creation! This statement was heard by a woman from the Banu Assad tribe, known as Umm Ya'qub, who could read the Koran. She came to 'Abdullah and said, "I learned that you had cursed such and such." He replied: "And why should I not curse those whom the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had cursed, and this is in the Book of Allah?" The woman replied: "I read the entire Koran and I didn't find anything you said." He said to her: "If you had really read it, you would have found this! Didn't you read the following in it: " And what the Messenger gives you, take it, and what he forbids you, abstain." ?" The woman remonstrated with him: "I see your wife doing this!" He said to her, "Go in and see for yourself." Then the woman went into his house, looked and found nothing of what she said. He then continued: "If that had been the case, I would have had nothing in common with her!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3966]

The Hadith of Mu'awiyah Ibn Abu Sufyan (may Allah be pleased with him) Humaid Ibn Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn 'Auf reported: I heard Mu'awiyah Ibn Abu Sufyan one year when he was making the pilgrimage to Makkah. He stood on the pulpit, picked up a toupee that one of the guards was holding and said: "O people of Madinah! Where are the scholars among you? I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he forbade such things. And he said, The children of Israel perished when their wives began to use such things." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3968]

Asma' (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: A woman came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: "My husband is married to another woman. Is it a sin for me to pretend to be married? I get more money (than the other) from my husband?" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever pretends to have more than what is actually given to him is like the one who is clothed with hypocrisy." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 37, Ḥadīṯ no. 3973]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A man called out to another in Al-Baqi' (Abul-Qasim) , and the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) turned to him. The man said: "O Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, you are not meant. I mean so-and-so." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Call yourselves by my name, and do not use my epithet for this purpose." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 3974]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A child was born to a man and he named him Muhammad. His people told him: "We will not let you name your child after the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him)!" The man carried his child on his back and came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said to him: "O Messenger of Allah, a child was born to me and I named him Muhammad. But my people told me: We will not let you name your child after the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Call yourselves by my name, but not by my surname (Abul-Qasim) . Verily, I am Qasim (a distributor) who distributes the bounties of Allah among you." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 3976]

Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Abu-l-Qasim (the Prophet) , may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Call yourselves by my name, but not by my epithet!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 3981]

Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: Zaynab was first called Barra, that is, the one who often does good. It was said that she praised herself. Therefore, the Messenger of Allah called her Zainab. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 3990]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet ( peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The most outrageous name of all names in Allah's sight on the Day of Judgment is the name of a person who is king of kings called." Ibn Abu Shayba (another narrator) added in his tradition that the Prophet further said: "There is no king but Allah; Almighty and Exalted be He." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 3993]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A son was born to me and I brought him to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Prophet gave him the name Ibrahim and massaged his mouth with date pulp. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 3997]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Asma' Bint Abu Bakr migrated to Madinah when she was pregnant with 'Abdullah Ibn-az-Zubair. When she was in Quba', she was due for confinement. She gave birth there. After that, I brought the son to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to do tahnik with him. (Tahnik = You chew something sweet, usually a date, put the porridge in the baby's mouth and rub its oral cavity with it.) The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, placed him in his lap and had a date brought to him . 'A'isha further reported: It was only after an hour that we were able to get one. The Prophet chewed them (into a date pulp) and passed some of them from his mouth into the child's mouth. With that, the first thing that came into his stomach was the saliva of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Asma' further reported: Then the Prophet stroked him, said a prayer for him and gave him the name 'Abdullah. When 'Abdullah was seven or eight years old, he came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) at the command of his father Az-Zubair to swear allegiance to him. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw him coming, he smiled; then he accepted his oath of allegiance. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 3998]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Little boys were brought to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He used to say a prayer for blessings on her while caressing her and massaging her mouth with date pulp. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 4000]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When Al-Munthir Ibn Abu Usaid was born, he was brought to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Prophet took the child on his thigh while his father Abu Usaid was present. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) busied himself with something in front of him. So Abu Usaid demanded that his son be carried away from the lap of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). And so the child was carried away. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished, he asked, "Where is the child?" Abu Usaid replied: We carried it away." The Prophet further asked: "What is it called?" Then the child's father said: "It is called so-and-so, O Messenger of Allah." Then he said: "No, his name is Al-Munthir ." So the Prophet gave his name to the child Al-Munthir on that day. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ No. 4002]

Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: No one asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about the false Messiah more than I. He said to me, "O my son, why are you worried about this? It will not harm you." I said, "It was said that he had with him rivers of water and mountains of bread." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "He is much inferior in the sight of Allah than what he will have with him ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 4005]

The Hadith of Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him): Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry reported: I was once sitting with some Ansar (helpers) in the place in Madinah where they used to gather. Abu Musa came to us frightened or even horrified. Then we asked him: "What's wrong with you?" He said: "'Umar asked me to come to him. When I stood at his door, I asked to come in three times, but I was not allowed in. Then I left. When he ('Umar) found out about it, he asked me : "Why didn't you come in?" I replied: I asked for entry three times, but no one gave me permission to enter! That's why I left again! The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had said: " If you ask to be admitted three times and you are not invited in, then go your way again!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ No. 4006]

The Hadith of Abu Musa Al-Ash`ary, may Allah be pleased with him: Abu Musa came to 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab and greeted him saying: "As-Salamu 'alaikum (Peace be upon you!) Here is 'Abdullah Ibn Qais." But he didn't invite him in. He said again: "Peace be upon you! This is Abu Musa (his nickname) ." But again he didn't allow him entry. He said again: "Peace be upon you! This is Al-Ash'ary." Then he left. Then he (`Omar) shouted : "Bring Abu Musa back! Bring him back!" He came back and 'Umar said to him: "O Abu Musa, why did you go away? We were just busy." Then he said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah say: Entry is requested three times. If you are granted entry, then enter, otherwise turn back!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 4010]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I came to the house of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and called for him. The Prophet said: "Who is there?" Then I replied: "Me!" Then he came out and said, "Me, me?" (as if he didn't like such an answer from me.)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 4011]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd As-Sa'idy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man was looking through a hole in the door of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). him) had a sharp object in his hand with which he scratched his head. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw him, he said to him: "If I knew that you were watching me, I would have pierced your eye with it!" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) then continued: "Permitting entry has not been made compulsory for any reason other than to gain insight (into the privacy of a living area) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 4013]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man looked deep into one of the rooms of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), whereupon he (the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him)) stood up and approached him with one sharp object or objects. I remember as if I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) trying to prick him with it. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 4015]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If someone looks into other people's houses without their permission, they may knock out his eye." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 38, Ḥadīṯ no. 4016]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The one who rides greets the one who walks, the one who walks greets the one who sits, and the smaller group greets the larger one." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4019]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The Muslim has five duties towards his fellow believers. He is obliged to return the greeting of peace, to wish Allah's mercy on the one who sneezes To honor the invitation to visit the sick person and follow the funeral procession." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ No. 4022]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When one of the People of the Book greets you, you should answer: wa alaikum (i.e. and upon you!) " [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Hadīṯ No. 4024]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When the Jews greet you, one of them saying: As-Samu 'Alaikum ( i.e. Death be upon you! Instead of As-Salaamu 'Alaikum, ie Peace be upon you!) then say: 'Alaikum (to you too!) ' [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4026]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: A group of Jews asked to be admitted to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). As they entered, they said, "As-Samu 'alaikum (Death be upon you!). " 'A'ishah replied, "But As-Sam be upon you, and cursed are you!" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "O 'A'isha, Allah loves mercy in all things." She said, "Didn't you hear what they said?" Then the Prophet replied: "Yes, and I said to them: On you too!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4027]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: It happened that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) passed by some children and greeted them. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4031]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: After the women were ordered to veil, Sawda went out to relieve herself. But she was a stout woman who exceeded the other women in height. Therefore, it was easy for her acquaintances to recognize her. 'Umar Ibnal Khattab saw her and said to her: "O Sawda, by Allah, you cannot hide from us. So be careful how you go out." So she returned. At that time the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was with me having his dinner. He was holding a shoulder of mutton in his hand when she entered. She said: "O Messenger of Allah, I went out and 'Umar told me so and so." Something was revealed to him, and then the revelation was over. He still had the shoulder of mutton in his hand; but he didn't put them down. Finally he said: "But you were allowed to go out to relieve yourself." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4034]

'Uqba Ibn 'Amer (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Beware of entering into the presence of women." A man from the Ansar said: "O Messenger of Allah, what about the husband's relatives (except father and son) ?" Then the Prophet said, "The man's kinsman is death!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4037]

Safiyya Bint Huyay, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), reported: Once the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) retired to the mosque. I visited him at night, talked to him and then got up to go home. The Prophet stood up to accompany me. I was resident at Usamah Ibn Zaid at that time. Two Ansar men walked past us. When they saw the Prophet, they ran faster. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Slow down! This is Safiyya Bint Huyay (my wife) ." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, Praise be to Allah! (i.e. we have not thought of any evil) ." Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Satan is in the flesh of man. I feared that he would put an evil thought ( or something) in your hearts." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4041]

Abu Waqid Al-Laithy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: One day the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was sitting with the people in the mosque when three men entered. Two of them approached the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), while the third turned away. The two stood not far from the Messenger of Allah until one discovered a free space in the crowd and sat down there. The other sat down behind those gathered while the third man walked away again. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished speaking, he said: "Shall I tell you about the three men? One of them sought refuge in Allah, and Allah gave him refuge. The second was ashamed before Allah, but Allah took care of him. The third turned his back on Allah, and Allah also turned away from him." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4042]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade one of us to ask another to get up from his seat and sit there. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4043]

The Hadith of Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: A effeminate man was with her, while the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him) was also at home. He said to Umm Salama's brother: "O 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Umayya, if Allah grants you the conquest of At-Ta'if, then I will show you Bint Ghailan, for it has four folds in its belly and eight in its back." When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) heard him, he said: "Such people should not enter your presence." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4048]

Asma', may Allah be pleased with her, reported: At the time when Az-Zubair married me, he had neither money nor slaves, but only a horse. I fed the horse and looked after it. I also fed his camel, which was used to carry water. I also used to draw water, mend his bucket and knead the dough. I couldn't cope with baking bread. But my neighbors helped me. They were Ansar and very nice women. I used to carry home on my head the dates from Az-Zubair's plantation, which the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) had given to him as a fief*. The distance was about two-thirds of a farsach. One day, as I was returning home with the dates, I met the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and some of his companions. He called me to him and said: Ikh! Ikh! (He signaled his camel to kneel down) to let me sit up behind him. But I was ashamed and thought of Az-Zubair and his jealousy. When I later told my husband about this incident, he said: "By Allah, it is worse for me that you have to carry the dates on your head yourself than that you ride a camel with the Messenger of Allah! After this incident Abu Bakr sent me a slave who relieved me of the care of the horse. I felt as if they had given me freedom (like a slave) .

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When three people are together, two of them should not have a confidential conversation to the exclusion of the third." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4052]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "As long as there are three of you (people) , two of you should not have a confidential conversation to the exclusion of the third "Until you get together with other people again, because this will make him sad!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4053]
Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "The evil eye is a reality." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4057]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: Once the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was under the influence of the magic of a Jew from the tribe of Banu Zuraiq, whose name was Labied Ibnal A'sam. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) imagined that he was doing something when he really was not doing it. One day or one night later, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) made several supplications and then said to me: "O 'A'ishah, do you know that Allah has revealed to me my condition when I... Asked him about it? Two men came to me. One sat next to my head, the other next to my feet. One asked the other: "What's wrong with the man?" The other replied: "He's under the influence of Magic!" The first asked again: "Who enchanted him?" The other replied: "How did the magician gain power over him?" The other replied: "Through a comb that he stole from him and in which there were some hairs, and through a palm frond." The first asked: "And where are these things now?" The other said: "In the well of Dhi Arwan!"" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went there with some of his companions, to bring the said things back into his possession. Then he told me: "O 'A'isha, the water of the well looked as if it had been mixed with henna. And the palm trees there were like the heads of devils." Then I said: "O Messenger of Allah, why did you not burn him?" He replied: "No! Allah has already healed me. And I didn't want to be a bad example to people! But I had this well filled up." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4059]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A Jewish woman offered poisoned mutton to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He began to eat, then the betrayal was revealed to him. The woman then had to be taken to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He asked her the reason for her action. She said, "I actually wanted to kill you with poison." Then he said: "It is not for Allah to give you power over this (or he said: over me) ." Then the Muslims present said: "Let us kill them." He (the Prophet) said: "No." Anas continued his report: I could always detect the trace of this poison on the uvula of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4060]

'A'ishah narrated: When one of us fell ill, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to stroke him with his right hand and say: "Take away the pain, O Lord of Allah People! Heal, because you are the one who really heals! There is no healing except your healing, because there can be no suffering left." When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) himself fell ill and his health deteriorated, I held his hand to do the same to him. But he took his hand away from mine and said: "O Allah, forgive me, have mercy on me and let me go to Your Most High Presence!" Then I looked at him and found he was dying! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4061]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: When a member of the family of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was ill, the Prophet used to blow on his two palms while reciting the two surahs of protection and along with them to caress the sick person with both palms. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) suffered from his illness and died, I did the same for him. But I ran his palms on himself as they were much more blessed than mine! [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4065]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) allowed the members of a family of the Ansar to obtain healing properties against poisonous creatures through appropriate supplication (ruqya) . [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4067]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: When one fell ill, had an ulcer or a wound, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) would place his index finger on the ground (Sufyan would place his index finger on the ground). Explaining A'ishah's words) . Then the Prophet raised his finger and said: "In the name of Allah, the dust of our soil mixed with our saliva can heal our sick person by Allah's will." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4069]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to order her to obtain the cure for the evil eye through appropriate supplication (ruqya) . [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4070]

Umm Salama, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saw a young girl in the home of Umm Salama, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), with a stain on her face . He said: "Seek healing for her through appropriate supplication (ruqya) , for she has been struck with an evil eye." (By color spot he meant that her face was pale.)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4074]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Some of the companions of the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) were traveling. They came to a Bedouin tribe who refused them hospitality. But the Bedouins asked the companions: Can one of you make a supplication for the healing of the sick, because our chief has been bitten by a scorpion ( or they said: Because our chief is injured.) Then one of them said: "Yes!" He came to the chief and began to recite Al-Fatiha (the first Surah in the Koran) . A little later the chief recovered and the companion was given sheep in return, but he said: "I cannot accept them until I ask the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about it!" Then he came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and informed him of this, saying: "O Messenger of Allah, by Allah I have only recited Al-Fatihah as a remedy!" Then the Messenger of Allah smiled and said: "How did you know that Al-Fatihah has a beneficial effect? ​​So, take the sheep and give me a share of them!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4080]

The Hadith of Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both: 'Asim Ibn 'Umar Ibn Qatada reported that Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah visited Al-Muqanna' when he was ill. He said to him: "I will not leave you until you undergo bloodletting. For I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Bloodletting is a cure." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4085]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The fever is a breath of Hellfire, so cool it down with water." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4093]

The Hadith of Asma', may Allah be pleased with her: The women who had a high fever were brought to Asma'. She ordered water to be brought and poured it into the neckline of the sick woman's dress. She said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Cool it (the fever) with water; indeed it (the fever) is a breath of Hellfire." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4098]

Rafi' Ibn Khadig (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Verily, the fever is a breath of Hellfire, so cool it down with water." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4099]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was ill, and we put medicine in his mouth. He indicated that we should stop, but we thought it was just the usual aversion of a sick person to the medicine and paid him no attention. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to his senses, he said: "Medicine will be put into the mouths of all of you at some point. Only Al-Abbas is exempt from this because he was not there." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4101]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
He heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "In black cumin there is a cure for every disease except death." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4104]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: If someone from her family died, and the women gathered at her house on the occasion and then went home, and then only their own family members and the closest relatives remained - She had a pot full of a liquid dish made from honey and bran (Talbina) prepared. At the same time she soaked bread and meat (Tharid) to which she added the Talbina. Then she said to the women present: "Eat from it; for I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Talbina is both a rest for the heart of a sufferer and a relief for sadness!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4106]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said, "My brother has diarrhea!" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: "Give him honey to drink." The man gave this drink to his brother, came back to the Prophet and said: "I gave him honey. However, his condition became worse." Then the Prophet said, “Give him honey to drink!” The man came to the Prophet three times about the same matter and the Prophet always gave him the same answer. Then the man came again and reported to the Prophet that he had done so and that his brother still had diarrhea. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: "Allah is telling the truth, and your brother's belly has lied. Give him honey to drink." The man finally gave this drink to his brother and he was healed by it. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4107]

Usama Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with both of them) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The plague is a punishment that struck the Children of Israel or those before you. When you receive news of it "If it has broken out in an area, do not go there; and if it has broken out in an area where you are, do not leave it to escape from it." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4108]

'Abdullah Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab left for Ash-Sham (Syria) . In Sargh he met Abu Ubaida Ibn Al-Garrah and his colleagues, the commanders-in-chief of the army. These men said that the plague had broken out in Ash-Sham. Ibn Abbas further reported: 'Umar ordered the first Muhagirun (Muslim emigrants from Makkah) to be brought to him. While they were with him, he told them about the plague in Ash-Sham and asked their opinion whether they should ride there or not. The Muhagirun had different opinions. Some said: We set out with a purpose and don't think we should turn back (because of the plague) . Others said, "Many people are with you, including some of the Companions of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). We believe you should not lead them to this plague-ridden land!" 'Umar dismissed the Muhagirun and ordered the Ansar to be brought. He also asked her for her opinion. The Ansar, like the Muhagirin, had different opinions. 'Umar sent them away again and ordered: "Bring me the ancient Quraish who emigrated before the conquest of Makkah and embraced Islam." These men all agreed. They said, "We think you should turn back with the people and not ride into this plague area!" 'Umar then announced his decision to the people. He said, "Tomorrow morning we will turn around and ride back to Madina!" Then Abu 'Ubaida Ibnal Garrah said to him: "Does not this decision mean an escape from divine predestination?" 'Umar replied: That you of all people have to say this, O Abu Ubaida! (`Umar particularly hated to argue with him) Yes, we flee from divine predestination towards divine predestination! Imagine resting with your camels in a valley with two sides. One is fertile and the others are not. If you let your camels graze on the fertile side, isn't that just as much in line with divine predestination as if you let them graze on the barren side?" Later, 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn 'Auf, who was not present in the past discussions, came up had been there. He said: "I can say something about your problem! I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: If you hear that the plague has broken out in a country, do not go to that country. And if it breaks out in a country where you are staying, then stay there and do not flee from the plague! Then 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab praised Allah and rode back with the people." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ No. 4114]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "There is no infection of oneself without the will of Allah, no Safar (death due to infection of intestinal worms) and no Hama ( no transformation from dead bones into an owl) ." Then a Bedouin replied: "And what about the camels in the desert that look like gazelles? But if there was a mangy camel with them, then they would all soon be mangy!" Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "And how did the first camel get infected?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4116]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "There is no disease that infects by itself and without the will of Allah, and there is no evil omen ( in the flight of birds) . But I like the good sign, that is, the really good word." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4123]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A bad omen (omen) can only occur in connection with a woman, with a house and with a horse ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4127]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If there was any such thing (of bad omen) in a matter, it would only be in connection with a woman, with a house and a horse." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4131]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: I said: "O Messenger of Allah, the soothsayers used to tell us about something that we find true." Then the Prophet said: "This is the word of truth that a Jinn (Ginn) grabs. But he throws it into the ear of his friend (the soothsayer) , adding to it a hundred lies." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4134]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered that Zu-Tufjatain (a special snake with two white stripes on its back) be killed because it always kills with its poison Attempted to hit eyes and caused miscarriages. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4139]

Ibn 'Umar narrated: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Kill the snakes especially Zut-Tufjatain (A snake with two white stripes on its back) and Al-Abtar (A snake with short tail) because they cause miscarriage and always try to hit the eyes with their poison. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ-No. 4140]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reported: We were with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) in a cave when the surah of the gusts of wind (Surah 77 Al-Mursalat) was revealed to him. We were hearing the verses fresh from his lips when suddenly a snake appeared in front of us. Then the Prophet said, "Kill them!" We rushed to kill her, but she slipped and disappeared. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah has saved them from your danger and Allah has saved you from their danger!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4148]

Umm Sharik (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered her to kill (poisonous) wall geckos. (This hadith was also narrated by Ibn Abu Shaiba without the word "you".)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4152]
'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) named the wall gecko Al-Fawaiseq. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4155]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "An ant bit one of the Prophets, who then gave an order to burn the entire ant village. And Allah gave him the following advice: Just because a single ant bit you, did you cause the destruction of one of the nations that glorifies Allah?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4157]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A woman was punished because of a cat because she locked it up until it starved to death. She went to Hellfire for it . She gave her neither food nor anything to drink when she locked her up, nor did she let her go to feed on the creatures of the earth." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4160]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A woman was punished because of a cat because she did not give it food or water to drink, nor did she let it run free "So that she could have eaten from the animals of the earth." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4161]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "While a man was traveling, he felt intense thirst. He found a well of water, climbed down into it and drank from it. When he When he was outside again, he saw a dog with its tongue sticking out and eating the sand because it was very thirsty. The man said to himself: "The dog was just as overcome with thirst as I was." So he climbed down into the well again and filled it his shoe with water, held it with his mouth, climbed up and watered the dog; then Allah thanked him for it and forgave him (his sins) ." The people said: "O Messenger of Allah, do we also receive a reward (from Allah) because of the animals?" The Prophet replied: "There is reward for every living creature!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ no. 4162]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A prostitute saw a dog on a hot day walking around a water well with its tongue hanging out because of thirst. So she pulled for him the water with her shoe out. For this her (sins) were forgiven." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 39, Ḥadīṯ No. 4163]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, said: The children of Adam insult eternity, and I am eternity. In My grasp is the (time) change of night and day." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 40, Ḥadīṯ no. 4165]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "None of you may say: my slave or my slave; for you are all slaves of Allah and all your wives are slaves of Allah. But you can say: My boy, my girl or my boy and my maid." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 40, Ḥadīṯ No. 4177]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "None of you should say, 'My soul has become black'; but you should say, 'My soul has become dull'." (If one wants to express dissatisfaction with oneself.)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 40, Ḥadīṯ no. 4180]

Sahl Ibn Hunaif (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "None of you should say, 'My soul has become black'; but one should say, 'My soul has become dull'." (If one wants to express dissatisfaction with oneself.)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 40, Ḥadīṯ no. 4181]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The most expressive verse that the Arabs have ever said is the verse of Labied, namely: It is true that everything that which is apart from Allah is nothing other than nothing!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 41, Ḥadīṯ no. 4186]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "It is better that the stomach of one of you should be filled with pus and hollowed out by it than with verses of poetry." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 41, Ḥadīṯ no. 4191]

Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "The true vision of a dream is from Allah, and the mere dreaming is from Satan. Whoever of you dreams of something, he If he does not like this, he should then blow on his left side three times and seek refuge in Allah from the evil of this dream; no harm will come to him from it." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 42, Ḥadīṯ No. 4195]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When the Hour draws near, the dream of the Muslim can hardly be false. The truest dream will be the dream of the one among you who speaks most truthfully. The dream of the Muslim is also one of the forty-five parts of prophethood. The dreams are divided into three types:

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The dream vision of a believer is one part of forty-six parts of Prophethood." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 42, Ḥadīṯ no. 4201]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever has seen me in a dream has seen me in reality; for Satan does not take my form." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 42, Ḥadīṯ no. 4206]

Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever saw me in a dream has seen the truth." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 42, Ḥadīṯ no. 4208]

Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: It was said that a man came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah! That night I saw in a dream that from a shadowy cloud Ghee and honey were dripping, and I saw that people were catching it with their bare palms. Some got a lot of it and others only a little. Then I saw that there was a rope stretched between the earth and the sky. I saw you holding on to it and then climb up. Then another man held on to him and climbed up. Yet another man held on to him and climbed up. Then another man held on to him, but the rope was torn off, then it was reconnected and he rose." Abu Bakr then said: "O Messenger of Allah, may my father be a sacrifice for you, let me interpret this dream by Allah!" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Interpret him!" Then Abu Bakr said: "As for the cloud of shade, it is Islam. But that which dripped in ghee and honey is the Koran, which gives its sweetness, from which everyone can take, whether much or little. As for the rope , which was stretched between the heavens and the earth, it is the truth on which you are, which you hold on to, and with which Allah exalts you. Another will hold on to it and then be exalted by it. Yet another will hold on to it and Then it will be increased by it. Another will hold on to it and then it will be torn off, then it will be connected again and he will be increased by it. Let me know, O Messenger of Allah - may my father be a sacrifice for you - whether I have interpreted correctly or incorrectly have!" The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "You got some things right and some things you got wrong." Abu Bakr said: "By Allah, O Messenger of Allah, tell me what I have misinterpreted!" Then the Prophet said to him: “Do not swear!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 42, Ḥadīṯ No. 4214]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "I saw in a dream that I was migrating from Makkah to another land where there are palm trees. And it seemed to me that it is Al-Yamama or Hajar, but then it was Al-Madina (Yathrib) . There I saw in a dream that I was shaking a sword, the top of which was broken; this was interpreted as the believers who were injured at the Battle of Uhud were. I shook the sword again, this time it was quite good. But that was the conquest and the solidarity of the believers that Allah gave us. I also saw cows there - and Allah is the origin of good. These were the group of the believers on the day of Uhud. It was indeed the good that Allah bestowed on us in terms of blessings and reward for truthfulness that Allah bestowed after the day of the battle of Badr." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 42, Ḥadīṯ No. 4217]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: During the lifetime of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), Musailima the liar went to Madina. He used to say: "If Muhammad appointed me as his successor, I would follow him." He arrived in Madina accompanied by a crowd of his clan. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to him and took Thabit Ibn Qais Ibn Shammas with him. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was standing opposite Musailima with a piece of palm branch in his hand while he was surrounded by his people. The Prophet said to him: "If you asked only this piece from me, I would not give it to you. But as for you, I will not transgress the command of Allah for your sake. And if you refuse to obey, then Allah will "I will certainly destroy you. And I see that you are exactly what was shown to me in the dream. And that is Thabit. He will answer your questions in my place." Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) left. I inquired about the words of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him): "...that you are exactly what was shown to me in a dream." Abu Hurairah told me that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "While I was sleeping, I saw that two bracelets of gold, which I abhorred, were placed in my hands. I was then instructed to blow them both away. So I blew them away and they flew away. I interpreted that two liars would appear after me. One of the two was Al-'Ansy from San'a and the other was Musailima from Al-Yamama." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 42, Ḥadīṯ No. 4218]

Samura Ibn Gundab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to turn to us after the morning prayer and ask: "Did any of you have a dream yesterday?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 42, Ḥadīṯ no. 4220]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
One day the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered a vessel of water to be brought to him. When a wide-mouthed vessel containing only a little water was brought to him, he had the people perform ablution from it. I estimated the number of people who got away was between sixty and eighty. And I watched for a long time as the water bubbled up between his fingers. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No. 4224]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "The parable of guidance and knowledge with which Allah Almighty and Exalted has sent me is like an abundant rain falling on an area fell: most of the ground absorbed the water and produced a lot of plants and grass. But there were also rocky parts of it, which preserved the water with which Allah had given much benefit to the people: of which they themselves drank, watered their cattle and grazed their animals ( there) . But the rain also fell on sandy soil, which allowed the water to seep and produced no plants. This is the parable of a person who trained himself in the religion of Allah with the knowledge with which Allah sent me; because he thereby acquires the knowledge for himself and teaches it to others. The opposite is the one who neither raises his dignity nor accepts the guidance of Allah with which I was sent." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4232]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The parable of me and what Allah has sent with me is like a man who came to his people and told them said: “O my people, I have seen the host (of the enemy) with my own eyes. But I am to them the mere warner (an Arabic proverb that denotes the absolute truthfulness of the warner) , after whose warning you should acquire means of escape." A group of his people believed him and left at the beginning of the night. But another group didn't believe him and stayed in their houses. But at daybreak the army attacked them and destroyed them. The parable of these people is like the parable of those who obeyed me and followed that with which I was sent, and like the parable of those who disobeyed me and rejected the truth with which I was sent.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Hadīṯ no. 4233]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "My parable of myself and of my community is like the parable of a man who lit a fire in which the people fell Moths and the critters fall. So I am the one who holds you back from the fire, and you insist on throwing yourself into it. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4234]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “My parable with the Prophets is that of a man who had built a building to its completeness and beauty. The people who walked around the house said: “We have not seen a better building. But it would have been nicer if this stone hadn't been missing at this point!" And I am this stone." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ-No. 4237]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "My parable with the Prophets is that of a man who built a house to its completeness and beauty, and placed a place in it a corner where a brick was missing. The people who entered the house and began to admire it said: "It would have been nicer if the brick had not been missing in this place!" I am that brick, since I am the last of all the prophets." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim   , Chapter 43, Hadīṯ No. 4240]
