Ğundab, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saying: “ (On the Day of Judgment) I will stand before you at the pool of water.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No . 4242]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: " I will stand before you at the pool of water (on the Day of Judgment) . Whoever passes by the pool there will drink from it; Whoever drinks from it will never be thirsty again. People will certainly pass me by who I know and who know me. Then a separation will be made between me and them.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4243]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr Ibn Al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "My pool is so wide and large that its length is equal to a month's journey. Its sides are the same. Its water is whiter than silver. Its scent is more beautiful than musk. The cups placed around the water basin are like the stars in the sky. Whoever drinks from my basin will never be thirsty." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4244]

Asma' bint Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: " (On the Day of Judgment) I will stand by the pool of water to see the one of you who is following me comes over. Some people will be removed from me, whereupon I will say, “O Lord! These people belong to me and to my community!” I will be told: “Have you no knowledge of what they have committed after you? By Allah, they turned back on their heels after you." Thus Ibn Abu Mulaikah used to say: "O Allah, we truly seek refuge in You from turning back on our heels or from being tempted regarding religion .”“   [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4245]

'Uqba Ibn 'Amer, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out one day and offered the funeral prayer for the martyrs of the Battle of Uhud, as he did the prayer for the dead in general used to do. Then he climbed into the pulpit and said, “I will stand before you at the pool and I will be your witness. But I can now imagine seeing my pelvis in this state. I have been given the keys of the treasures of the earth (or he said the keys of the earth) . By Allah, I do not fear that you will associate other gods with Allah after me, but I fear that you will compete with one another for the treasures of the earth." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No. 4248]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: (On the Day of Judgment) I will stand before you at the pool. I will lobby many people to come to me, but I will not be given success. Then I will say: “O Lord! These are my followers!” And I am told: “You don’t know what they changed (in religion) after you !” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4250]

Haritha, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "My pelvis extends to a distance like that between Sana and Madinah." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43 , Hadīṯ no. 4251]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “There will be a pool in front of you. The stretch between its two sides is like the stretch between Garba' and Azruh." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No. 4252]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "I will drive away men from my tank as stray camels are driven away." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No. 4257]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The length of my water basin is like the distance between Aila and Sana of Yemen. There are numerous cups like the stars in the sky." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4258]

Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
On the day of the battle of Uhud, I saw two men wearing white clothes on the right and left sides of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him). I have never seen these two men before or since. This refers to the angels Gabriel (Jibril) and Michael (Mikail), may Allah be pleased with both of them.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4264]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was the best of all people, the most generous of all people and the bravest of all people. One night it happened that the people of Madina were frightened by a strong sound. Some people ran in the direction of the sound. Then they met the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) on his way back, for he had preceded us all (in the direction of the sound) . He rode on one of Abu Talha's horses, bareback, and hung his sword around his neck. He said, “There is nothing to fear! There is nothing to fear!" Then he said: "I found it (the horse) to be a fast-running horse (or he said: It is a fast-running horse) , although before it used to walk slowly." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43 , Ḥadīṯ number. 4266]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was the most generous of all people, and he reached the height of his generosity in Ramadan. Jibril (Gabriel) used to meet him every year in Ramadan until the end of the month. During these encounters, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) read the Qur'an (Quran) to him . And when Jibril (Gabriel) met him, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was more generous than the wind that carries the rain clouds. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4268]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I was in the service of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) for ten years, during which he - by Allah - said neither "ugh" nor "why do you do that" to me did it?”, nor “would you rather have done it that way!”. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4269]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was never asked for anything and to which he said "no"!  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4274]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If I get the money from Bahrain, I will give you so much." He extended both hands as if he were would create with it. But before the money from Bahrain reached him, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) died. When the money arrived, (the Caliph) Abu Bakr announced that anyone to whom the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) had promised to pay something or to whom he owed something should come. So I went to him and said that the Prophet told me: "If I get the money from Bahrain, I will give you so much." Abu Bakr then took some of the money with both hands and gave it to me and ordered me to take the money to count. When I counted it, there were 500. Then he said to me: “Take twice as much.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4278]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: “This night a boy was born to me, and I named him Ibrahim after my father's name.” He sent the child to his foster mother Umm-Saif, the wife of a blacksmith named Abu-Saif. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) later went to the blacksmith and I followed him until we reached Abu-Saif's house. He fanned the fire with the bellows and the house was full of smoke. So I hurried a little in front of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said to Abu-Saif: "Stop fanning, for the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) is coming soon." So he stopped. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) brought the child to him, embraced him and said what he could say according to the will of Allah. Anas further reported: I saw the child on the arm of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) breathing his last. Then the tears of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) began to flow and he said: "Indeed, the eyes water, the heart mourns, and we only speak words that are pleasing to our Lord. O Ibrahim, we are truly filled with sadness at your departure.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4279]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
Some desert Arabs came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). They asked: "Do you (Muslims) kiss your boys?" The Muslims replied: "Yes!" The desert Arabs said: "But we do not kiss ours!" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "I can you not help when Allah has taken away your mercy." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4281]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Al-Aqra' Ibn Habis saw the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) kissing Al-Hasan (his grandchild) . Then he said: "I have ten children but I have never kissed any of them!" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever is not merciful will not find mercy." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Hadīṯ no. 4282]

Jarir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever does not have mercy on others will not find mercy from Allah, the Almighty and Exalted!" [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Hadīṯ No. 4283]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was usually more modest than a young woman in her room. And if he was offended by something, we could see it on his face. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4284]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was traveling, he had with him a black servant named Angasha, who sang melodious poems in his beautiful voice to speed up the march. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: “Angasha, be gentle so that you do not break the glass vessels!” The Prophet was referring to the weakness of women.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4287]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: 
It never happened that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) had a choice between two options without choosing the easier side she wasn't sinful. If it was a sinful matter, he was the furthest thing from it of all people. And the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) never took revenge for personal motives unless it was the rights of Allah, the Almighty and Exalted. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4294]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Umm Sulaim used to spread out a leather carpet so that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) could take his afternoon nap. He was sweating profusely. But she used to draw his sweat onto her perfume bottles. Once the Prophet asked her: “O Umm Sulaim, what is this?” She replied: “This is your sweat with which I mix my perfume.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No. 4302]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Sometimes the revelation about the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came on a cold morning. Nevertheless, sweat ran from his forehead. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4303]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The People of the Book let their hair down, while the idolaters wore their hair parted. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) liked to agree with the People of the Book in matters in which he was not given instructions (from Allah) . Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) let his hair hang down, but later he parted it. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4307]

Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was of average height and broad-shouldered. He wore his hair down to his earlobes. I saw him in a red skirt. I have not seen anyone better than the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4308]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): 
Qatada reported: "I asked Anas Ibn Malik: What did the hair of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) look like?" He replied: "His hair was neither frizzy, still falling smoothly. It hung down between his ears and his shoulders.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4311]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): 
Ibn Sirin reported: Anas Ibn Malik was asked whether the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) dyed his hair. He replied: "The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) died when he had little white hair." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No. 4317]

Abu Juhaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I saw that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had white hair in this place. As he did so, Zuhair (the narrator) pointed with some of his fingers to the upper part of the chin. He (Abu Ğuhaifa) was then asked, “How old were you then?” He replied, “I could make arrows then.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No. 4323]

As-Sa'ib Ibn Yazid (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
My maternal aunt went with me to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). She said to him: "O Messenger of Allah, my nephew is in severe pain." Then the Prophet stroked my hair with his hand and called on Allah to bless me. Then he performed the small ablution and I drank the remaining water. I stood behind him and saw the seal of prophethood between his shoulder blades. It looked like a partridge's egg. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4328]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) described the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as follows: 
He was neither exceptionally tall nor short, neither strikingly bright white nor dark. His hair was neither short and frizzy nor straight. The message was sent down to him when he was forty years old. He spent ten years in Makkah and ten years in Madina; and when he died he was sixty years old. At that time there were not even twenty white hairs on his head and in his beard. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4330]
'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) died at the age of sixty-three. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4332]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stayed in Makkah for thirteen years and died at the age of sixty-three. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4333]

Jubair Ibn Mut'im (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I am Muhammad, I am Ahmad, I am Al-Mahy (the Eraser) , who erases disbelief, I am Al-Hashar (the Collector) , after whom the people will be gathered, and I am Al-`Aqib (the Last) , after whom (Al-`Aqib) no prophet will come." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ -No. 4342]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did a deed and considered it lawful. Some of his companions heard of this, but they abhorred the act and avoided it. This was conveyed to the Prophet. Then he gave a sermon and said: “What is wrong with those who heard about an act that I thought was permissible? However, they abhorred this act and avoided it. By Allah, I am more pious than them and I fear Allah more than they do." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4345]

The hadeeth of 'Abdullah Ibn Az-Zubair (may Allah be pleased with him): 
A man from the Ansar had a dispute with Az-Zubair before the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) over the rights to an irrigation canal in Al-Harra. which they used to irrigate the palm plantation. The man said to his opponent: “Let the water flow!” But he refused. Then they turned to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) with their request. Then he said to Az-Zubair: “O Zubair, irrigate your land (appropriately) and then let your neighbors use the water!” Then the Ansary was angry and shouted: “You only say that because he is your cousin! Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) became angry, his face changed color and he shouted: "O Az-Zubair, irrigate your land and dam up the water up to the height of the walls! " that the water may reach up to the ankles.) Az-Zubair later said: “By Allah, I will dam the water! It was because of this matter that the following verse was revealed: “ But no, by your Lord! They will not believe until they make you the judge of things that are disputed between them! « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4347]

Sa'd Ibn Abu Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The most wicked among the Muslims is the one who so often asked about something that is not forbidden to Muslims , until it was forbidden to Muslims because of his persistent questions." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4349]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once learned something about his companions that he abhorred. So he gave a sermon and said: “Today paradise and hell were presented before me; I have never seen so much good and so much evil as today. If you only knew what I know, you would laugh little and cry a lot!” Accordingly, the companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, never experienced a difficult day like this. They covered their heads and the voice of their crying was audible. Then 'Umar stood up and said, "We have chosen Allah as our God, Islam as our faith, and Muhammad as our Prophet." Then a person stood up and asked, "Who is my father?" The Prophet replied, "Your father is so-and-so !" Therefore, the following verse of the Quran was revealed: " O you believers! Do not ask about things that, if revealed to you, would be unpleasant to you... « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4351]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
One day the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) was asked about things that he abhorred. Finally he became angry and shouted: “Ask me what you want!” Then a man asked: “Who is my father?” The Prophet replied: “Your father is Huthafa!” Then another man stood up and asked: “ And who is my father, O Messenger of Allah?" The Prophet replied: "Salim, the servant of Shaiba!" Then 'Umar realized that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was very angry and said: "O Messenger of Allah, we want to turn back to Allah in repentance!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4355]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: “I am the closest to the son of Mary above all people. The prophets are paternal half-brothers. There are no prophets between me and him.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4360]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "There is no newborn child who is not touched by Shaitan (Satan) 
at birth , and because of his touch Shaitan starts screaming. Only the son of Maryam (Maria) and his mother are the exception to this.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4363]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Isa (Jesus) , son of Maryam (Maria) , saw a man stealing, and he said to him, 'You have stolen? The man replied: No, by Allah, apart from whom there is no god! 'Isa then said: I believe in Allah, but it is my eyes that have lied to me!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4366]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "The Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) performed circumcision for himself when he was eighty years of age , and used the ax to do this.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4368]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah be pleased with him, said: Prophet Ibrahim, may Allah be pleased with him, lied only three times. Two of them were in favor of Allah. That's when he said, " I feel sick." and " No, this one, the biggest of them, did it. Ask them when they can talk." The third lie was to his wife Sarah in favor. With Sarah, who was very beautiful, he wanted to enter a country over which a cruel ruler ruled. He told her: “If this cruel ruler knows that you are my wife, he will take you away from me. But tell him , that you are my sister, because you are really my sister in Islam, because - as far as I know - there is no other Muslim in this country except the two of us. When they entered this country, one of the men of the cruel ruler saw them . He came to him and said: "A woman has entered your land, whom you alone deserve." The cruel ruler sent to her and she was brought. At this Ibrahim, may Allah be upon him, began to pray (that Allah saves his wife.) When she (Sarah) entered the cruel ruler, he could not bring himself to stretch out his hand in her direction. Then his hand was tightly bound. He then said to her, "Ask Allah to release my hand, and I will not harm you." She did so, but the man repeated his behavior. So his hand was tied more tightly than the first time. He told her the same thing. So she asked Allah, but he repeated his behavior for the third time. This time his hand was tied more violently than the first two times. Then he said to her, “Ask your Lord to release my hand, and I will not harm you.” She did, and then his hand was released. Then he said to the one who brought her, “You have not brought me man, but the devil in man!” He drove her out of his land and gave her Hagar (as a servant) . So she returned. When she saw Ibrahim (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), he finished his prayer and asked her: “What happened?” She replied: “Something good! Allah bound the libertine's hand and sent us a servant."" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4371]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The angel of death was sent to Musa (Moses) , may Allah be pleased with him. When he came to him, Musa gave him a strong blow and destroyed one of his eyes. The angel returned to his Lord and said: “You have sent me to one of Your servants, but he does not want to die!” Then Allah gave the angel back his eye and said: “Go back to him and tell him to have his Put your hand on the back of a bull, and for every hair that covers his hand, he shall have another year to live!" When he ( Musa) heard this, he said: "O Allah! And what will happen then?" The angel replied: "Then you will die!" Then he exclaimed: "Oh, then I would rather die now!" He asked Allah to take him to a place a stone's throw from the sacred place country was away. After that, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “If we were there, I would show you his grave! It is next to the road under the red sand dune!"" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4374]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
Once a Jew offered a product for sale. He was offered a price he wasn't happy with, or he didn't like the price. Abdul 'Aziz (one of the narrators of this hadith) was in doubt about this. Then the Jew said: "No to Him Who exalted Moses (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) above all people ! " Moses (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) has exalted himself above all people, while the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) is among us!" The Jew went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: "O Abu-l-Qasim, for me there is a promise with you. So-and-so slapped me!" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked the man from the Ansar: "Why did you slap him?" The man replied: "O Messenger of Allah, he said: By the one who Moses, The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) became so angry that the anger was visible on his face. He then said: “Do not compare the Prophets of Allah with each other to determine which one is superior to the others. The horn will be blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth will be crushed, except those whom Allah wishes to exclude . Then the horn will be blown again, and I will be the first to be awakened or among the first to be awakened. And look! Then I will see Moses clinging to the throne. I will not then be able to know whether he was already accounted for when he was struck down on the day of At-Tur (the day of blowing the horn) or whether he was raised up before me. And I do not say that there is one who is better than Yunus Ibn Matta." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4376]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "It is not befitting of a servant (of Allah) to say, 'I am better than Jonas (Yunus) son of Matthew ( Matta) .” The Prophet mentioned his father’s name.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ no. 4382]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asked: "Who is the noblest of all the people?" And he replied: "The one who fears Allah the most." The people said : "This is not what we asked you about." He said, "Then the noblest among men is Yusuf (Joseph) , the Prophet of Allah, son of the Prophet Allah, son of the Prophet Allah, son of the Friend of Allah." The people said: "That's not what we asked you about." He said, "So you're asking about the characteristics of the Arabs?" People have different character traits. The best of them in the period before Islam (Ğahiliyya) are also the best of them in Islam, if only they are instructed (in matters of faith) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No. 4383]

The Hadith of Ubayy Ibn Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him): 
Sa'id Ibn Jubair reported: I said to Ibn 'Abbas: "Nauf Al-Bikaaliy claims that Musa (Moses) , may Allah be pleased with him, is the Messenger of Allah for the children Israil and Musa (Moses) , who accompanied Al-Khidr (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), were not the same person." He replied: "O the enemy of Allah is lying! I heard Ubayy Ibn Ka'b saying: “I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Musa (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) delivered a sermon to the Children of Israil. He was asked, "Who among men has the most knowledge?" He replied, "I am the one who has the most knowledge." Allah wanted to rebuke Musa because he did not attribute the knowledge to Allah. Then Allah revealed to him: " One of My servants at the meeting place of the two seas knows better than you." Musa said: "O Allah, how can I reach him?" He was told: "Carry a fish in one Basket. In that place where you lose the fish, he (the righteous servant) is there.” Musa (Moses) departed, carrying a fish in a basket. He was accompanied by his boy, Yuscha' (Joshua) Ibn Nun. They walked away until they reached a rock. Musa (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and his boy rested next to the rock. The fish moved so violently in the basket that it finally went into the sea and swam away. But Allah keeps the river in the form of a vault that served as a path for the fish, which surprises Musa and his boy. But they continued all day and all night. However, the young servant forgot to tell Musa that the fish escaped. When morning broke, Musa said to his young servant: » “Bring us our lunch. We have suffered (much) hardship through this journey of ours." « He did not feel tired before he left the place where he was ordered to stay; » He said: "You see! When we rested at the rock "Surely, I forgot the fish. And it was only Satan who made me forget it (the fish) and remind me of it (the fish) . And it made its way through the sea in a wondrous way." " Musa said, "This is what we were looking for." " Then they both returned, following their own tracks, until they reached the rock. There he saw a man lying. He was covered with a robe. Musa greeted him with the greeting of peace. Then Al-Khidr said: "But where is peace in your land?" He replied: "I am Musa!" He (Al-Khidr) said: "Musa, who is one of the children of Israil ? " He (Musa) said: “Yes!” He (Al-Khidr)said: “But you have a little of the knowledge of Allah, what Allah taught you and I do not know. On the other hand, I have a little of the knowledge of Allah, which Allah taught me and you do not know." Then Moses (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said to him: " May I follow you so that you may teach me what you have of prudence ( " He (Al-Khidr) said : 'You will not be able to endure (it) with me. ' ' How will you endure that which you do not have complete knowledge of ?" " " He (Musa) said: "You will find me, if Allah wills, steadfast, and I will not disobey any order from you." " " He ( Al-Khidr) said: "If you want to follow me )st, then don't ask me about anything until I myself mention it to you first." « Musa said: “Agreed!” So ​​he and Musa went to the seashore. A ship passed them. They (Musa and Al-Khidr) asked the owners of the ship to be allowed to ride on board the ship. The ship's owners recognized Al-Khidr, and so they let them ride for free. » Then they both set off until, as they were boarding a ship, he made a hole in it. He (Musa) said: "Did you make a hole in it to drown its crew (or: its owners) ?" You have committed a terrible thing." " He (Al-Khidr) said: "Didn't I say that you won't be able to endure it with me?" " " He (Musa) said: "Do not blame me for forgetting and do not burden me with any difficulty in my matter." " They then left the ship. While they were walking along the shore, they saw a boy with others Boys play. But Al-Khidr cut off his head and killed the boy. So Musa said: " Have you killed an innocent soul (and not in retaliation ) for (another) soul? You have there yes, a reprehensible thing has been committed." " " He (Al-Khidr) said: "Didn't I tell you that you will not be able to endure (it) with me?" " But this time He (Musa) said more emphatically: "If I ask you again (again) "If you ask me about anything, then don't let me accompany you anymore. You won't be blamed when it comes to me." « »Then they both moved on until, when they came to the inhabitants of a city, they asked the inhabitants for something to eat; but they refused to accept them as guests. Then they found a wall in her that was threatening to collapse, and so he raised it up. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) explained: (The wall was) so crooked and Al-Khidr raised it with his own hand. Then Musa said to him: We came to these people, but they did not entertain us. » "If you wanted, you could certainly have taken reward for it." " » He (Al-Khidr) said: "This is the separation between me and you. I will now make known to you the interpretation of what you could not endure. " Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "May Allah have mercy on Musa. I hoped he could show a little patience so that their story would have been narrated to us in full. The first thing Musa said was over Oblivion." The Prophet further said: "Then came a sparrow that landed on the edge of the ship and drank from the sea. Then Al-Khidr said to Musa: In proportion to the size of the sea to the knowledge of Allah, mine and your knowledge are even less than the water that the sparrow drank from the sea in view of the size of the sea.""[Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 43, Ḥadīṯ No. 4385]

Abu Bakr As-Siddiq (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I looked at the feet of the idol worshipers who were standing very close to us when we were in the mountain cave and I said: "O Messenger of Allah, if one of them stands on his If he were to look at his feet, he would see us among them." Then the Prophet replied: "What do you think, O Abu Bakr, of two (people) in whom Allah is a third?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no . 4389]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once sat on the pulpit and said: "Allah has given one of His servants the choice between the adornment of earthly life and that "That which is with Him, and this servant chose that which is with Allah." Then Abu Bakr wept and wept. He then said: "May our fathers and our mothers be sacrificed to you for this!" Behold, it was the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who was given the choice, and behold, Abu Bakr was the one among us who understood him the most. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) continued: “The one among the people who gave me faithful service with his wealth and with his person was Abu Bakr. If I were to take a best friend (other than Allah) , I would take Abu Bakr. It's about brotherhood in Islam. There will be no door in this mosque that will not be bricked up, except the door of Abu Bakr." (These were the doors of some houses that were attached to the mosque and opened into the mosque hall.)  [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4390]

'Amr Ibnal 'As (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent me with the army to 'Tah As-Salasil and gave me command of the troops. I came to him and said, "Who do you love most?" He said, "A'ishah!" I said, "Who among men?" He said, "Your father!" I said, "Who else? He said, “Umar Ibnal Khattab!” Then he named other men. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4396]

The hadeeth of Jubair Ibn Mut'im (may Allah be pleased with him): Muhammad Ibn Dubayr Ibn Mut'im reported from his father that he said: A woman came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) (with a request from her). him, and he demanded that she come again. She said to him: “What will I do if I come and don’t find you anymore?” The narrator continued: She spoke as if she meant death! He (the Prophet) said to her: “If you do not find me, then go to Abu Bakr!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4398]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me during his illness from which he died: "Call Abu Bakr, your father, and also your brother. I would like to dictate a letter to them, because I am afraid that one will desire the things (the caliphate) and the other will claim them, while Allah and the (true) believers will only (happily) accept the claim of Abu Bakr ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Hadīṯ No. 4399]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "While a man was driving a cow that he had loaded, the cow turned to him and said: 'I am not for that created! I was created to plow the field!” The people said in admiration and fright: “Praise be to Allah! Does a cow speak?" Then the Messenger of Allah said: "I myself believe in it, and so do Abu Bakr and 'Umar!" Abu Hurairah further reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "While a While a shepherd was with his flock, a wolf tore away one of the sheep. The shepherd pursued the wolf until he caught up with him and was able to save the sheep. Then the wolf said: "Who will look after the sheep on the day when the wild animals come, on a day when they have no shepherd but me?" The people shouted: "Praise be to Allah!" Then he said Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): "I myself believe in it, and so do Abu Bakr and 'Umar!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4401]

The Hadeeth of 'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: 
Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: When 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab was laid on the bier, the people gathered around him to supplicate him and praise him and were able to say the funeral prayer for him before the bier was carried away. I've been there as well. What had caught my attention, however, was a man grabbing my shoulder from behind. I turned to him. It was 'Ali. He asked Allah to have mercy on 'Umar. He then said (directing his words to 'Umar) : "You have not left any other person whose deeds I would rather meet Allah with than your deeds. By Allah, I hope that Allah will accompany you with your two companions, as I often heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: “Abu Bakr, 'Umar and I came. Abu Bakr, 'Umar and I entered. Abu Bakr, 'Umar and I went." Therefore I hope or (even) believe that Allah will let you accompany them." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4402]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "While I was sleeping, people dressed in shirts were brought before me. Some wore them up to the chest, others shorter, and I was also shown 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab in a shirt with the end dragging behind him." The people asked: "And how did you interpret this, O Messenger of Allah?" He said, “It is religion!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4403]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "While I was sleeping, I saw a glass of milk offered to me. I drank it and could see the liquid seeping into my fingernails. Then I gave 'Umar (to drink) . The people asked: "How do you interpret this, O Messenger of Allah?" He replied: "Knowledge!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4404]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "While I was sleeping, I saw myself standing near a well with a bucket. I pulled up the water as Allah wanted. Then Ibn Abu Quhafa came to me, took the bucket of water from my hand and pulled it up once or twice. His pull up was associated with weakness. Allah will forgive him. Then the bucket transformed and became very large. Then Ibn Al-Khattab took him . I did not see anyone else pulling up the water as strong and powerful as 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab. He drew water from the well until all the people drank enough and watered their camels, so that the people with their animals sat down around the well." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4405]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "In a dream I saw that I was drawing water from an old well with a bucket. Then Abu Bakr came and lifted the bucket once or twice, and his lifting was accompanied by weakness. May Allah, the Most Blessed and the Most Exalted, forgive him. Then 'Umar came and took the bucket to draw water from the well. The bucket then turned into a huge big bucket. I have never seen anyone draw water with such energy and endurance as 'Umar. He turned away only when all the people had quenched their thirst, watered their mounts and sat down around the well.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4407]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “When I entered Paradise, I found a house or a palace there. Then I asked, "Whose does this palace belong to?" They (the inhabitants of Paradise) said, "It belongs to 'Umar Ibnal Khattab." As I was about to enter it, I remembered his jealousy (and left the area) ." There 'Umar cried and said: "O Messenger of Allah, should I be jealous of you?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4408]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
While we were with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), he said: "While I was sleeping, I saw myself in Paradise and found a woman there To perform ablution next to a palace. I asked, "Who owns this palace?" They ( the inhabitants of Paradise) said, "It belongs to ' Umar Ibnal Khattab!" Umar, while we were all in this session with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then 'Umar said: 'May my father be a sacrifice for you. O Messenger of Allah, should I be jealous of you?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4409]

Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
Once 'Umar asked to be admitted to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), while there were women from the tribe of Quraish with him who were talking to him and peppering him with questions. Their voices were loud. When 'Umar asked to be let in, the women got up and hurriedly went behind a curtain. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then allowed him to enter. When he was inside, he found the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) laughing. Then 'Umar said: "May Allah grant you joy always, O Messenger of Allah." The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "I was amazed at these women who were before me! When they heard your voice, they quickly went behind a curtain!" 'Umar said: "It is more your right that they should fear you, O Messenger of Allah!" Then 'Umar addressed the women and said : “You are your own enemy! Do you feel awe towards me, and do you not feel any respect towards the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him)?" The women replied: "Yes, you are - unlike the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) - rough and rude!” Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “By the One in whose hand my life is, Satan will never see you walking on a path without taking a path other than yours!” [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4410]

'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Three times my thoughts corresponded to Allah's later revelations regarding the place of Ibrahim (Abraham) , the instruction of women to veil themselves, and the prisoners of battle by Badr. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4412]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
When 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy Ibn Salul died, his son 'Abdullah Ibn 'Abdullah came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and asked if the Prophet would give him his shirt , in which he could wrap his father's corpse. And he gave him a shirt. Then the son asked if the Prophet would perform the funeral prayer for his father. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood up to pray for him. Immediately 'Umar stood up, grabbed the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) by his clothes and said: "Are you praying for him when your Lord forbade you to perform the funeral prayer for him?" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Blessings and peace be upon him, said: Verily Allah gave me a choice, saying: Ask forgiveness for them, or do not ask forgiveness for them; even if you ask forgiveness for them seventy times, Allah will not forgive them. « And I will exceed these seventy times for them. 'Umar said: "He is a hypocrite!" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) performed the funeral prayer for him, whereupon Allah, the Almighty and Exalted , revealed the following verse of the Koran: " And never pray over one of them who has died, nor stand at his grave." They denied Allah and His Messenger and died as wrongdoers. « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4413]

Abu Musa Al-Ash`ary, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, was once sitting leaning in a garden in Madinah. As he stuck a branch once in the water and once in the ground, a man asked to be let in. He (the Prophet) said to me: “Open the gate for him and promise him paradise!” I opened the gate. Then I saw Abu Bakr and I told him the good news. Then another asked permission to enter. Then he (the Prophet) said to me: “Open the gate for him and promise him paradise!” It was 'Umar. I opened the gate for him and promised him paradise. Another man asked to be let in. Then he (the Prophet) said to me: “Open the gate for him and promise him paradise. However, this only happens after he has been put to the test!” It was 'Uthman Ibn 'Affan. I opened the gate for him, promised him paradise and told him what he (the Prophet) said. Then he said: “O Allah, give me patience! Or Allah may be asked for help.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4416]

Sa'd Ibn Abu Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said to 'Ali: "You are taking the position towards me that Harun (Aaron) once did towards Musa (Moses) took. However, there is no other Prophet after me.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4418]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said on the day of the Battle of Khaybar: "I will give this flag to a man to whom Allah will grant victory over the enemies . This man loves Allah and His Messenger, and Allah and His Messenger love him!” During the night, people continued to wonder who he (the Prophet) had in mind. The next morning they went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), all hoping that they themselves were mentioned. Then he asked: "Where is 'Ali Ibn Abu Talib?" They answered him: "O Messenger of Allah, he has an eye problem!" Then he said: "Send for him!" Then he was fetched. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) spat in his eyes and called upon Allah for him. Then 'Ali's eyes became healthy again - it was as if they had never been missing anything! The Prophet then gave him the flag. 'Ali asked: "O Messenger of Allah, should I fight against the enemies until they accept Islam?" The Prophet replied: "Go towards them slowly until you reach their territory! Urge them to convert to Islam and tell them what a Muslim's duties are to Allah! By Allah, if through you Allah guides even one man to the right path, it is better for you than owning red camels!”

Salama Ibn Al Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to fight in Khaibar, 'Ali did not go because he was suffering from an eye infection. He said: "It is not like me not to take part in the battle with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Then he set out and caught up with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). On the last evening, before Allah opened it to us in the morning, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Tomorrow I will give the flag to a man, or (he said) tomorrow a man will take the flag . This man loves Allah and His Messenger, or (he said:) This man loves Allah and His Messenger. Allah will grant him victory over the enemies." To our surprise, 'Ali came. Those present said: “O, this is ‘Ali! So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave him the flag, and Allah granted him victory over the enemies. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4424]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, went to the house of Fatima (the Prophet's daughter) , but did not find 'Ali. He asked her: “Where is my cousin?” She replied: “We had a marital dispute.” He was angry with me and left without taking his afternoon nap here as he usually did. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) assigned a man to look for 'Ali. A little later this man came back and said: "O Messenger of Allah, 'Ali is lying in the mosque." The Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went into the mosque and found 'Ali lying there. His outer garment had fallen open, part of his side was exposed and covered with the dust of the mosque. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) began to wipe the dust from him and kindly said to him: “Arise, Abu Turaab (Father of Dust)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4426]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was unable to sleep one night. Then he said, “I hope I can find a righteous man among my companions to keep watch for me this night.” Then we heard the clanging of a weapon. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) shouted: "Who is there?" Sa'd Ibn Abu Waqqas said: "O Messenger of Allah, I came to keep watch for you." 'A'ishah further reported : Here then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) slept until I could hear his snoring. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4427]

'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said to no one except Sa'd Ibn Malik (He is also called Sa'd Ibn Abu Waqqas) : May my father and my mother It was on the day of the battle of Uhud that he said to him: "Shoot an arrow, my father and my mother may fall victim for you!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ- No. 4429]

Sa'd Ibn Abu Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
On the day of the Battle of Uhud, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said to me: "May my father and mother be sacrificed for you!" [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4430]

The Hadith of Talha and Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) said: 
Abu 'Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: It happened that in some battles in which Allah's Messenger (may Allah be pleased with him) himself took part, no one was present the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) remained so steadfast, except for Sa'd and Talha. That's what they both told me. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4435]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
On the day of the Battle of Al-Khandaq (Trench Battle), the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) called the people. Then Az-Zubair answered the call. The Prophet called for the second time, and again it was Az-Zubair who answered the call. But the Prophet called for the third time, and it was again Az-Zubair who answered the call. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “For every Prophet there are apostles, mine is Az-Zubair.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4436]

'Abdullah Ibn Az-Zubair (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
On the day of the Battle of Al-Khandaq (Trench Battle), I and 'Umar Ibn Abu Salama stayed with the women in the fortress of Hassan. Once he (`Umar) bent down (to carry me) so that I could take a quick look. Once I did the same for him. I could see my father, fully equipped, riding his horse to Banu Kuraitha. I told him about it later. Then he said: "O my son, have you really seen me?" I said: "Yes!" Then he said: "By Allah, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me that day: " May my father and mother fall victim for you.”” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4437]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: 
'Urwa Ibn Az-Zubair reported that 'A'ishah said to him: "By Allah, your parents are among those who listened to Allah and the Messenger , after a wound was inflicted upon them - for those of them who do good and fear God, there will be a great reward. «“ [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4440]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: “For every people there is a trustee and our trustee - for you, my Ummah (community) - is Abu 'Ubaida Ibn Al -Garrah.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4442]

Huthaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A delegation from the people of Nagran came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: “O Messenger of Allah, send us a trustworthy man to instruct us in the religion! Then he said: “Truly, I will send you a very faithful man, very faithful, very faithful!” This is what everyone present hoped that he meant. But he sent them Abu 'Ubaida Ibn Al-Garrah. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4444]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to Hasan: "O Allah, I love him, so love him and love those who love him!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Hadīṯ No. 4445]

Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I once saw Al-Hassan Ibn 'Ali sitting on the shoulders of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) while he (the Prophet) said: “O Allah , I love him, so love him!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4447]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
We used to call Zaid Ibn Haritha no other than Zaid Ibn Muhammad until this Qur'anic verse came: " Call them (your adopted sons) after their fathers; that is fairer before Allah. « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4451]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent a fighting force and appointed Usama Ibn Zaid as its commander. Such leadership was objected to by the people. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood up and said: "If you object to his leadership, then you also objected to his father's leadership. I assure you by Allah that he was once fit for leadership and that he was one of the most beloved people to me, and that this ( his son) is one of the most beloved people to me after him." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Hadīṯ no. 4452]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Ja'far, may Allah be pleased with them both: 
'Abdullah Ibn Abu Mulaika reported that 'Abdullah Ibn Ja'far said to Ibn Az-Zubair: "Do you remember when I, you, and Ibn ' Abbas the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)?" He (Ibn Az-Zubair) replied: "Yes, when he put us (behind him) on the camel and left you standing." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44 , Ḥadīṯ number. 4454]

'Abdullah Ibn Ja'far (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:  
When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) returned from a journey, the boys of his family were brought to him. Once he came back from a trip and I was the first to be brought to him. Then he carried me in his hands. Afterwards one of Fatima's sons was brought to him. He put him on the camel behind him and we three people entered Madina on a camel. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4455]

'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: Maryam Bint 'Imran was the best woman in her time, and Khadija Bint Khuwailid was the best woman in her time. ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4458]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Jibril (Gabriel) once came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: “O Messenger of Allah, there is Khadija, she will come to you with a pot in which to eat , food or drink - the narrator is not sure - can be found. When she comes to you, greet her with the greetings of peace from her Lord, the Almighty and Exalted, and from me, and tell her the good news that she will have a house of pearls in Paradise. In this house there is no noise to be heard and no effort to be suffered.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4460]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa (may Allah be pleased with him): 
Isma'il reported that he asked 'Abdullah Ibn Abu Aufa: "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) announced to Khadija the good news that she had a house in Paradise?" He said, "Yes, he promised her a house of pearls in Paradise, where no noise will be heard and no effort will be suffered." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4461]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah announced to Khadija Bint Khuwailid the good news that she would be given a house in Paradise. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4462]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
Hala Bint Khuwailid, the sister of Khadija, once asked for permission to approach the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then he remembered the way Khadija did this. He was overcome by memories, and it showed on his face. Then he said: "O Allah, she is Hala Bint Khuwailid." I became jealous and said: "Why do you remember a toothless old woman from the Quraish who had already died while Allah gave you a better wife?" [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4467]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I saw you in a dream for three nights. I saw that the angel was carrying you in a silk cloth. He said to me, “This is your wife!” When I uncovered your face, I saw that it was you. I said to myself: "If this is a command from Allah, then He will certainly complete it." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4468]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: "I know exactly when you are satisfied with me and when you are dissatisfied with me!" I replied, "And how can you determine this?" Then he replied, "If you are pleased with me, you say, 'No, by the Lord of Muhammad!' And if you are angry with me, you say, 'No, by Lord of Ibrahim (Abraham) ."" I said to him: "That's right! By Allah, O Messenger of Allah, I avoided nothing other than your name!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4469]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
I used to play with dolls when I was married to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and I had some friends who also played with me. They behaved in such a way that when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came, they left the house out of fear. But he spoke to them so sweetly and quietly that they came back and continued playing with me. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4470]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Muslims used to wait for the time when he was with 'A'ishah when they wanted to send something to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and then send it to him the gift there, because they sought the satisfaction of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4471]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), reported: 
The Prophet's wives sent Fatima, daughter of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Fatima asked him to come in as he lay with me on my woolen robe. He allowed her to enter. Then she said: O Messenger of Allah, your wives sent me to you. They claim from you that you love them and the daughter of Abu Quhafa ('A'ishah) equally." Meanwhile I was silent. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to her: "O daughter, do you not love who I love?" Fatima replied: "Yes, certainly." He said: "Then love these!" When she did heard, she got up, returned to the wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and reported to them what she had said and what the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) had said to her. They said, “You have done us no good. Go to him again and tell him: "Your wives demand that you love them and the daughter of Abu Quhafa equally." But Fatima refused and said: "By Allah, I will never do that." 'A ' Isha further reported: Then the wives of the Prophet sent to him Zaynab Bint Gahsh, wife of the Prophet, who has almost the same high rank as mine in the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). I have never seen such a pious woman, so pious, so truthful in her speech, so generous, preserving the ties of family, and working so hard to do good and to be close to Allah, the Exalted, as Zaynab. The only thing I have against her is that she gets excited easily, but she also calms down quickly. She asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to let her in as he lay with me on a woolen robe, in the same state as he was when Fatima came to him. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) allowed Zainab to enter. She said: "O Messenger of Allah, your wives sent me to ask you to love her as the daughter of Abu Quhafa." She spoke ill of me and she went beyond measure. Meanwhile, I watched the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and his eyes to see whether he would allow me to refute their arguments or not. Zaynab was still there when I knew that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not mind if I spoke to her. So I spoke up and talked to Zainab until I refuted her arguments. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said with a smile: “She is the daughter of Abu Bakr!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4472]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to often ask the following question during his recent illness and subsequent death: "Where am I today?" Where will I be tomorrow?" he meant (and expected) his day together with 'A'isha. 'A'ishah himself recounted this: “So he died on the day he was with me. Allah then took him back the moment his head was on my chest under my chin." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4473]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her): 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to decide by lot when he wanted to go on a journey and take one or more of his wives with him. Once it happened that the decision for 'A'ishah and Hafsa coincided. So the two women traveled with him. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to walk next to 'A'ishah (with his mount) when he traveled at night to converse with her. Then Hafsa said to her, "Don't you want to ride on my camel and let me ride on your camel so that each of us can look here and there?" She replied, "Yes!" Then 'A'ishah rode on the camel of Hafsa and Hafsa rode on the camel of 'A'ishah. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to the camel of 'A'ishah on which Hafsa was riding, greeted her and continued his march until he was ready for a rest. Then 'A'ishah missed him (the Prophet) and became jealous. During the stay, she ('A'ishah) stuck her legs into the bushes where animals usually crawl and said: "O Lord, send me a scorpion or a snake to sting me because I cannot justify it !” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4477]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "The excellence of 'A'ishah over all other women is like the excellence of a meat dish over all other types of food." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4478]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: "Here is Jibril (Gabriel) ; he greets you with the greeting of peace (Salaam). I replied: "Wa-`alaihi-s-Salaam, wa-rahmatu-llah ( And also, upon him be the peace and mercy of Allah) !" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Hadīṯ No. 4479]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
Eleven women were sitting together. They had promised each other not to keep anything secret about their husbands. The first wife said: “My husband is like the flesh of an emaciated camel that lives on a mountaintop that is difficult to reach - an animal that does not live in an accessible place that one can reach, nor has it gained fat that it can It would be worthwhile to take it to another place." The second wife said, "I had better not talk about my husband, because I'm afraid I won't get anywhere. If I were to describe him, I would have to list all his visible and hidden defects, and there are an infinite number of them!” The third woman reported: “Mine is a tall man. If I tell about him and he finds out about it, he will give me a divorce. And if I don't say anything, he doesn't cast me out, but he doesn't treat me as his wife either!" The fourth woman said: "My husband is like a night in the Tihama (a landscape in southern Arabia), neither hot nor cold . He neither excites me nor bores me." The fifth woman reported, "When my husband comes home, he is like a cheetah by sleeping too much. But if he leaves home, then he is a lion. He never asked what happened in my house." The sixth wife said: "When my husband eats, he eats everything. When he drinks, he drinks everything empty. And when he sleeps, he wraps himself completely. He never stretched out his hand to take care of me." The seventh wife said, "My husband is ponderous, impotent and a fool. All the shortcomings and vices of this world are united in him. He hits me in the face so hard that he hurts it, breaks my bones, or even both at the same time." The eighth woman said: "My husband smells like fragrant grass and feels soft and fluffy like a rabbit." The ninth Woman said: “Mine is a respected and tall man. He eats well and in abundance. And his house is a center of social life.” The tenth wife reported: “My husband is very rich and respected. I don't know any other rich man who has anything better. He owns many camels, which are kept in stables; only a few of them are taken out to pasture. When the camels in the stable hear the sound of the people, they know that their slaughter is imminent." The eleventh woman said: "My husband is Abu Zar'! What a wonderful man he is! He made sure my ears were adorned with heavy jewelry and my upper arms gained fat. He made me so happy that I could be happy with myself. I come from a rural family that keeps sheep and goats (i.e. my family was poor). But he led me into a house where the horses neighed and the camels groaned under the burden they had to carry. The sound of the threshing and cleaning of the grain can always be heard (there is wealth and abundance in Abu Zar's house). And whatever I say to Abu Zar`, he does not blame me. I sleep late into the day and drink until I've had enough. And Abu Zar's mother! What a wonderful woman Abu Zar's mother is! Her storage bags are full to the brim and her house is very spacious! The son of Abu Zar`! What a wonderful son the son of Abu Zar` is! His sleeping place is as narrow as the blade of a sword (that is, a very slim man, which corresponds to the ideal of beauty.) He is already full after eating the forefoot of a four-month-old sheep. The daughter of Abu Zar`! What a wonderful daughter the daughter of Abu Zar` is. She obeys her father and mother. She fills out her dress beautifully and her neighbor envies her for it. And Abu Zar's servant! What a wonderful servant the servant of Abu Zar` is! She doesn't spread stories about our home, she doesn't waste supplies, or make a mess. One day Abu Zar` left our house. It was at the time when the milk hoses were churned to make butter. He met a woman with two boys who resembled cheetahs and were playing with pomegranates. Then he divorced me and married this woman. I then married a respected and generous man who rode an excellent horse and always carried a lance. He gave me many gifts, he gave me a pair of all the grazing animals and said: Eat, O Umm Zar', and take care of your own! But even if I add up everything he gave me, it still does not equal the most insignificant utensil that Abu Zar' gave me." 'A'ishah added to her report: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). him, said to me: "O 'A'isha, I am to you as Abu Zar was to Umm Zar!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4481]

Al-Miswar Ibn Makhrama, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as he stood on the pulpit saying: "Banu Hisham Ibn Al-Mughira have asked me for my consent to this they marry their daughter to 'Ali Ibn Abu Talib. No, I don't allow that! I don't allow that! I don't allow that! Unless Ibn Abu Talib wants to give my daughter a divorce and marry her daughter. Because my daughter is a piece of me! It worries me what worries her! It pains me what hurts her!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4482]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked Fatima to come closer to him. When she came to him, he secretly whispered in her ear; then she cried. He continued to whisper secretly in her ear again; so she smiled. 'A'ishah further reported: "I asked Fatima about what the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) whispered to her, which made her cry and then smile." She said: "He whispered (to me ) , his death is approaching, that's why I cried. Then he whispered, I will be the first of his family to follow him there, so I smiled." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4486]

Usama Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I was informed that Jibril (Gabriel) came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) when Umm Salama was with him. He began to speak, then walked away. Then the Prophet of Allah asked Umm Salama: "Who was this man?" (He said something like that). She replied: "That is Dihya!" After that she said: "I swear by Allah that I still thought that it was no one else than he was until I heard the sermon of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) in which he told our story." (He said something like this)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4489]

'A'ishah, Mother of the Believers, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said (to his wives) : "The first of you to follow me to the grave after my death is the ones with the longest hands!” Then they competed with each other to see who could give more alms. Zainab had the longest hands because she did the housework herself and was very fond of giving alms often. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4490]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not intercede with any woman except his wives and Umm Sulaim; he used to visit her. He was asked why he did such a thing. He replied, "I feel (great)<(i>pity for her. Her brother was killed while he was with me." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4493]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “I was shown Paradise. There I saw Abu Talha's wife and heard something rustling in front of me. There I found Bilal.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4495]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to Bilal at the morning prayer: "O Bilal, tell me about an act that you did in Islam and for which you received the greatest reward hope! That night I heard your footsteps before me in Paradise." Then Bilal said: "I have not committed any deed in Islam for which I most hope to be rewarded, except that I do not undertake a complete great ritual ablution, day or night, without that I pray with this purity as long as Allah willed it." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4497]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
My brother and I came from Yemen (to Madinah). We stayed there for some time, thinking that Ibn Mas'ud and his mother belonged to the family of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). and peace be upon him, because they visited him very often and always stayed with him. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4499]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I once asked, "According to whose reading do you order me to recite the Quran ? " I read more than seventy surahs to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) already know that I am one of them who has the most knowledge of the Book of Allah. If I knew that someone had more knowledge about this book than me, I would go to him." Shaqiq (a narrator) said: "Then I went to the various discussion circles of the companions of Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), and I had not heard anyone refuting or censuring such (a claim) .” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4502]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr, may Allah be pleased with them both: 
Masruq reported: We used to come to 'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr and talk to him. - Ibn Numair (another narrator) said: “By him. -One day we mentioned 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud.' Qur'an (Quran) by four (men): From Ibn Umm 'Abd (he began with him) , from Mu'adh Ibn Jabal, from Ubayy Ibn Ka'b and from Salim, servant of Abu Huthaifa."" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Hadīṯ No. 4504]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Those who collected the Qur'an (Quran) at the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) were four (men) from the Ansar (the Muslim helpers). Madina) : Mu'adh Ibn Jabal, Ubayy Ibn Ka'b, Zaid Ibn Thabit and Abu Zaid. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4507]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said when they (the Companions) were carrying the bier of Sa'd Ibn Mu'adh: "The throne of the Most Merciful shook , when he (Sa`d) died." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4511]

Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A silk garment was given to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). His companions touched it and were amazed at the fine material. Then he said, “Do you wonder about this fine material? Even the handkerchiefs of Sa`d Ibn Mu`adh in Paradise are finer and of better quality than this dress!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4514]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was given a long robe made of fine silk. But he forbade the wearing of silk clothes (for men) . People were amazed at the wonderful material. Then he said: “I swear by the One in Whose Hand is the life of Muhammad that even the handkerchiefs of Sa`d Ibn Mu`adh in Paradise are of a better quality than this!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ -No. 4515]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
On the day of the battle of Uhud, my father's body was brought covered. He was completely mutilated. I wanted to pull the blanket away from him. But my people prevented me from doing so. I tried to pull the blanket away from him again. But my people prevented me from doing so. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took them away; or as he caused them to go away, he heard the wailing cry or cry of a woman. Then he asked, "Who is she?" They said, "It must be the daughter or sister of 'Amr." He asked them, "Why is she crying? The angels did not stop shading him with their wings until he was lifted up." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4517]

Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
My brother Unais, our mother, and I set out from Ghifar (an Arab tribe) , which used to declare fighting permissible during the holy months. We lived with an uncle of ours who was generous and kind to us, and so his people envied us and said to him, "If you go away and leave your wife alone, Unais will commit fornication with her." That's how our uncle came us and said what was said to him. Then I said, “You have spoiled your previous good deeds to us. What you said caused the separation between us and you from now on.” We then began to prepare our camels. As we rode on it, my uncle covered himself with his robe (out of shame) and wept profusely. We left and stayed near Makkah. Then Unais made a bet with a man for our camels and an equal number of camels, and the two of them went to a fortune teller. The fortune teller let the lot decide between the two, and the lot fell on Unais. Later he came to us with our camels and an equal number of camels from the bet he won. Abu Dharr further narrated: "I said to my nephew, 'I had been praying for three years before I met the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).' He asked me, 'Who did you pray to?' I said, "To Allah." He said, "Which direction did you turn when you prayed?" I said, "In the direction that Allah made me turn." The last part of the night was so managed that I fell like a robe, and I slept until the sun was in the sky. Unais said, “I have business to attend to in Makkah. Stay here and wait for me.” Unais walked until he reached Makkah. Then he came to me late. I said, “What were you doing there?” He replied, “In Makkah I met a man who belonged to your religion. He claimed that Allah had sent him." I said, "What did people say about him?" He said, "They say that he was a poet, a soothsayer, or a sorcerer." Unais further said (Unais himself was a poet): “I know the words of the fortune tellers, but his words are different.” I also made a comparison between his words and the verses. I found that there was no way anyone could do something similar. I swear by Allah that he spoke the truth and they are the real liars. Then I said, "Stay here and wait for me until I go there to take a closer look at the matter." So I arrived at Makkah and asked a man whom I considered weak, "Where is this man? whom they call the Sabean.” Then he pointed at me and said, “The Sabean!” All the people present attacked me. They beat me with dried earth and bones until I fainted. Later I stood up like an idol stained with blood. Then I came to the fountain of Zamzam and cleansed myself of the blood and drank its water.
