There I remained, O my nephew, thirty days. My food was none other than the water of Zamzam. I became so obese that wrinkles appeared on my stomach and I felt no hunger. When the people of Makkah were sleeping soundly on a moonlit night, so that no one walked around the Ka'bah. But there were two women of them who prayed for Isaf and Na'ilah. As they walked around the Ka'bah, they passed me. Then I said, “Why don’t you marry the two of them?” When they had finished praying, they passed me again. Then I said: “You are like a piece of wood. I say this openly." They left, raising howls of lamentation and saying, "If only one of our people were here. They met the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and Abu Bakr when they went there. He (the Messenger) said, "What is the matter with you?" They said, "The Sabean is hiding between the Ka'bah and its curtains." He said, "What did he say to you?" They said, "He has told us a word that we cannot utter because of its evil.” The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to the Black Stone, which he kissed. Then he walked around the Ka'bah with his companion and then performed the prayer. When he finished the prayer, I paid him the greeting of Islam (I was the first to do this.) I said: "Peace be upon you, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "Peace be upon you also and mercy from Allah." Then he said, "Who are you?" I said, "A man from the tribe of Ghifar." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) leaned his fingers on his forehead. I said to myself, "Maybe he doesn't like that I'm from Ghifar." I tried to grab his hand, but his friend, who understood him more than I, stopped me. He (the Messenger)raised his head and said, "How long did you stay there?" I said, "Thirty days." He said, "Who gave you your food?" I said, "My food was nothing other than the water of Zamzam. However, I have become so obese that wrinkles appear on my stomach and I do not feel hungry." He said, "This water is blessed and is sufficient for sustenance." Abu Bakr said, "O Messenger of Allah, grant me permission to give him food that night!” Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and Abu Bakr left, and I accompanied them. Abu Bakr opened a door and offered us raisins from the city of Ta'if, and that was my first dish there. I stayed there for some time and then went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then he said, “It was revealed to me that I must emigrate to a city where there are many palm trees. I believe that this city is none other than Yathrib. Can you deliver the message to your people. Perhaps Allah will help them through you and give you reward for it." Then I went to Unais. He said, "What have you done?" I said, "I professed Islam and I believe in it now." Then he said, "I have nothing against your religion. So I also profess Islam and I believe in it.” We then went to our mother. Then she said: “I have nothing against your religion. I profess Islam and I believe in it now.” We rode until we reached our tribe. Half of them professed Islam. Aima' Ibn Rahda Al-Ghifariy was its leader. The other half said: "When the Messenger of Allah comes to Madina, we will profess Islam." Later the Messenger of Allah came to Madina. Then the remaining half professed Islam. Then came the tribe of Aslam. They said: “We profess Islam as our brothers from Ghifar did. And they already professed Islam. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "The tribe of Ghifar will be forgiven by Allah, and the tribe of Aslam will be assured of safety by Allah." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4520]

Jarir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) never refused to allow me to enter his room and never looked at me without smiling since I converted to Islam acquaintance. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4522]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out to relieve himself. So I took care of the Wudu' water and placed the vessel at his disposal. When he came out, he asked who had done the deed. Zuhair (a narrator) said: "When they informed him, Abu Bakr (a narrator) said: When Ibn 'Abbas informed him, he said: "O Allah, grant him knowledge in religion." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Hadīṯ no. 4526]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 
I saw in a dream that I was carrying a brocade cloth in my hand, with which I did not wish to go to any place in Paradise without it taking me there by flying. I told Hafsa. Hafsa, in turn, narrated this to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), whereupon he said: "I believe that 'Abdullah is a righteous man." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4527]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
Umm Sulaim said: “O Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, Anas is your servant! So call on Allah for him!" He said: "O Allah my God, increase his goods and his children and bless what You have given him!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4529]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came to me when I was playing with the children. He greeted us and sent me to attend to a matter. That's why I came to my mother late. Then she said to me, "What has kept you away?" I said, "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent me to deal with a matter." She said, "And what is this?" I said : "This is a secret." She said: "Then you must not tell anyone about the secret of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4533]

Sa'd Ibn Abu Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I have never heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) promising paradise to any living person except 'Abdullah Ibn Salaam. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4535]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Salaam (may Allah be pleased with him): 
Qais Ibn 'Ubaad reported: Once I was in Madinah with people among whom there were some companions of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). There came a man whose face showed humility (before Allah) . Some people said, “This man is one of the inhabitants of Paradise. This man is one of the inhabitants of Paradise." He performed the prayer in two rak'a (prayer sections) , making it shorter, then he went out and I followed him. He entered his house and I was with him and we talked together. When I became intimate with him, I said to him: "When you entered (the mosque) , a man said this and that." He said: "Allah be praised. It behooves no one to say what he has no knowledge of. I'll tell you the reason for all this. During the lifetime of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), I dreamed and told him my dream: I saw as if I were in a garden (and he described its expanse, its meadows and its greenery.) In the middle of the garden was a iron pillar. Its base was in the ground and at the top of the pillar there was a handle and I was told, "Climb it!" I said, "I can't." There came a cafeteria. Ibn 'Aun said: The mensaf is the servant. He lifted my garments and I ascended. (He made a sign with his hand to indicate the way) I reached the top and held the handle. I was told: Hold on to him. I woke up and held on to it and told the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about this dream. Then he said: "This garden is Islam and this pillar is the pillar of Islam, and this handle is the firm handle and you will remain a Muslim until you die." This man was 'Abdullah Ibn Salaam. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4536]

The Hadith of Hassaan Ibn Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him): 
Sa'id Ibn Al-Musayyib reported: 'Umar passed by Hassan when he was reciting some poems in the mosque. He (`Umar) looked at him disapprovingly. Then he (Hassan) said : "I used to recite poems in the mosque when there was someone better than you in it." Then he turned to Abu Hurairah and said: "I beseech you by Allah to say whether you are the Messenger You heard Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: “Answer for me.” O Allah, support him with holy inspiration (Jibril) or not. He (Abu Huraira) replied: “Yes, by Allah!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4539]

Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying to Hassan Ibn Thabit: "Make mockery of them, and Jibril will assist you." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim , Chapter 44, Hadīṯ No. 4541]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah: 
'Urwa reported that Hassan Ibn Thabit was one of those who spoke about the alleged allegations against 'A'ishah, so I insulted him. Then she said, “O my nephew, leave him alone; he defended the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) (by making mockery of the disbelievers.)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4542]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported that Hassan said: 
O Messenger of Allah, grant me permission to make mockery of Abu Sufyan. He (the Messenger of Allah) said: "How would you do this while I and he belong to the same clan?" He said: "By the One who has honored you, I will exclude you from it just as a hair is pulled out of the dough Hassan said in his poem: (And among the clan of Hashim, the highest glory belongs to Banu Bint Makhzum and your father, Al-`Abd)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4544]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
You say that Abu Huraira narrates too many hadiths from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). By Allah, by Whom we all have the appointed appointment, I was just a needy man who served the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and was content with whatever filled my stomach. The Muhağirun (the Muslim emigrants from Makkah) were active in the markets and carried out commercial transactions. And the Ansar (the Muslim helpers from Madina) were busy managing their property. Once the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Whoever spreads his garment will not forget what I say.” I prepared my garment. And when he finished speaking, I folded it in front of my chest. Since that time, I have not forgotten any of the words of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4547]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
I said to 'Urwa Ibn Az-Zubayr: Does not Abu Hurayrah arouse your admiration? He came and sat near my room to tell about the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). At the same time he intended to let me hear this. At that time I was about to say the praises of Allah (Tasbih) and he got up and left before I finished my praises. If I had managed to talk to him, I would have told him that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not use to make his sayings in the (quick) manner that you do . [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4548]

'Ali (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) summoned me, Az-Zubair and Al-Miqdad and said: “Ride to the Garden of Khakh! There you will meet a traveling woman who has a letter with her. Take this letter and bring it to me!” We rode off and let our horses reach out wide until we found that woman. We said to her: "Give us the letter." She replied: "I don't have a letter!" We said: "Give us the letter or we will have to search you from head to toe!" Then she got the letter that she had hidden in her braided hair and gave it to us. Then we returned to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The letter was a letter from Hatib Ibn Abu Balta'a to some idolaters in Makkah, informing them of some of the plans of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) (called Hatib to him and) said to him: "O Hatib, what about this letter?" He said: "O Messenger of Allah, do not judge me hastily! I was attached to Quraish. Sufyan (a narrator) said: “He was associated with some Quraish, but not related to them. All the Muhağirun who are with you have relatives in Makkah who protect their wives and children there. But I have no relatives there and wanted to use this letter to gain the goodwill of some Quraish so that they would take care of my relatives. I did it not because I am an unbeliever or because I have apostatized from Islam and prefer disbelief to Islam!" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to his companions: "He has spoken the truth ." 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, cried out: "O Messenger of Allah, let me cut off the head of this hypocrite." But the Prophet replied: "He took part in the battle of Badr and - who knows - perhaps Allah has taken care of him Fighters of Badr were accepted in a special way and said: “Do what you want! I have already forgiven you!" Then Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, revealed the verse of the Koran: " O you who believe, do not take My enemies and your enemies as your protectors, ... " [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4550]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
I was with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) during his stay in Ge'rana (a place between Makkah and Madinah) . Bilal was there too. A Bedouin came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said to him: "O Muhammad, are you not fulfilling what you promised me?" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) replied: "Rejoice ( The Bedouin replied: “You have already told me that several times!” Then the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) turned to Abu Musa and Bilal. He looked angry. He said, “This man has rejected the good news. But both of you should accept it." They immediately replied: "O Messenger of Allah, we accept it." So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had water brought to him in a vessel in which he placed his hands and his Washed his face, then spit the water he had in his mouth into the water vessel. He then said to them: "Drink this water and pour it over your faces and chests, and look forward to good news." They took the vessel and did what the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commanded them. Umm Salama (the Prophet's wife) called her from behind a curtain and said, "Leave some of it in the vessel for your mother!" So they left some water for her. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4553]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished the battle of Hunain, he appointed Abu 'Amer to lead the army that was to go to Autaas. He (Abu 'Amer) fought with Duraid Ibn As-Simma. In the battle (Duraid) was killed and Allah granted us victory over his people. Abu Musa continued: “I was with Abu 'Amer in that battle. It happened that a man from Banu Gusham shot an arrow at Abu 'Amer. The arrow hit him in the knee. So I rushed to him and said, "O my uncle, who shot this arrow at you?" Abu 'Amer pointed to a man and said, "O Abu Musa, this man you see shot this arrow at me , and I believe he killed me by doing so." Abu Musa said: "I rode after him with all determination until I reached him. When he saw me, he tried to run away, and I continued to ride after him, saying, “Aren’t you ashamed? Aren't you Arab? Can’t you stand?” So he stopped running. So a duel began. After two blows with the swords, I struck him with my sword and killed him, then I returned to Abu 'Amer and said: "Allah killed the one who shot an arrow at you." Then he said: "Take this from me Arrow out!” I took it out and the blood flowed from the wound. Then he said: "O my nephew, go to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), give him my greetings of peace and say to him: Abu 'Amer says to you: Ask for forgiveness for me!" Abu 'Amer then appointed me as leader, and a little later he died. When I returned to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), I entered his house. He was lying in a bed with a mattress made from palm leaves. The palm leaves had left bruises on the back and both sides of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). I told him about what happened to us and about the death of Abu 'Amer. I said to him that he (Abu 'Amer) ordered me to ask him (the Prophet) to ask for forgiveness on his behalf. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had water fetched for him and performed the small ablution, then he raised his hands and said: "O Allah, forgive 'Ubaid Abu 'Amer!" Armpits visible. Then he said: "O Allah, give him priority over many of your creatures or people!" Then I said: "O Messenger of Allah, ask forgiveness for me too!" Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "O Allah, forgive 'Abdullah Ibn Qais his sin and lead him to a place of honor on the Day of Resurrection!"" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4554]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "I can recognize the voices of the people of Ash'ar (a tribe) when they read the Qur'an (Quran) at night recite, and thereby I can easily determine where they have settled, even if I had not seen that place in broad daylight before. Among them is Hakim, who, when he meets the horses (another narrator said: the enemies), says : My people order you to wait for them. (i.e. they are very courageous.) ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4555]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Do the people of Ash'ar (a tribe) lack food during the wars, or is there not enough food for them? Children in Madina, then they gather everything they have in a robe, put it in a single plate and eat from it, each of them having an equal share. Therefore, they belong to me and I belong to them.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4556]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
We heard about the migration of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when we were in Yemen. So we set out to emigrate to him. We were a large group consisting of about fifty-two or fifty-three of my people. Two of my older brothers also accompanied me, namely Abu Burda and Abu Ruhm. We boarded a ship that set sail until it arrived at the Negus in Abyssinia. There we met Ga'far Ibn Abu Talib and his companions. Ga'far told us: "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent us here and ordered us to stay here. So stay with us!” We stayed there with him until we all emigrated (to Madina) . When we arrived there, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had just conquered Khaibar. The Prophet allocated us from the spoils of Khaibar, although he did not allocate from the spoils anyone who was absent from the conquest of Khaibar, except Ga'far, his companions and the people who were on board the ship with us. This is what some people said to us (the ship guests): “We beat you to the emigration.” Asma' Bint 'Umais once visited Hafsa, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). She was also one of those who emigrated to the Negus. 'Umar went to see his daughter Hafsa when Asma was with her. When 'Umar saw Asma, he asked his daughter: "Who is she?" She replied: "This is Asma' Bint 'Umais." Then 'Umar said: "The ship's guest who emigrated to Abyssinia?" Asma said: “Yes, I am.” `Umar said to her: “We preceded you in emigrating. Therefore, we have more right to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) than you." She became angry and said, "That is simply not true, O 'Umar. No, by Allah, you were with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), feeding the hungry among you and guiding the ignorant among you, while we were in a far-off land among the enemies of Allah and His Messenger in Abyssinia were. By Allah, I will not eat or drink anything until I report what you have said to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). We had constant difficulties and fear there. I will also mention this to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and ask him about it. By Allah, I will not lie, deviate from the truth, or add anything else." When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came, she said: "O Messenger of Allah, 'Umar said this and that. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “He has no greater right over me than you. He and his companions emigrated only once, but you, the ship's guests, emigrated twice." She reported: Abu Musa and the other ship guests then came to me in groups to ask me about this hadith. For them, there was nothing else that greatly pleased them and was more valuable to them than what the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said regarding them. Abu Burda reported that Asma' said: "Abu Musa asked me to repeat this hadith to him several times." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4558]

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Qur'anic verse " When two groups of you planned to give up, when Allah is their protector (both of them) . ' was revealed because of the two tribes of Banu Salama and Banu Haritha. We would not have liked the fact that this Qur'anic verse was revealed for our sake had Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, not said: "... since Allah is their (both) Protector." « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4560]

Zaid Ibn Arqam (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "O Allah, forgive the Ansar (the Muslim helpers of Madinah) , the children of the Ansar, and the grandchildren of the Ansar! ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4561]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw children and women returning from a wedding, he stood up and said: “O Allah, You know that these are among the dearest People belong to me! O Allah, you know that these are among the dearest people to me!” meaning the Ansar.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4563]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Once a woman from the Ansar (the Muslim helpers from Madinah) came to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah be pleased with him). He took her aside and said to her: "By the One in whose hand my life is, you (Ansar) are among the most dear people to me." He repeated this sentence three times. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4564]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The Ansar (Muslim helpers from Madinah) are my family and my trusted friends. The people are becoming more and more numerous, and the Ansar among the inhabitants of Madina are becoming fewer and fewer. So approach the good people of them and forgive the evildoers!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4565]

Abu Usaid (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The best Ansar (Muslim helpers of Madinah) are Banu An-Nağgar, then Banu 'Abdel Ashhal, then Banu Alharith Ibn Al-Khazrağ, then Banu Sa`ida. And all Ansar are good." Sa`d said: "In my opinion, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) preferred the rest of us." Someone said to him: "However, he preferred you to many." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Hadīṯ No. 4566]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I was once traveling with Jarir Ibn 'Abdullah Al-Bajaliy. He waited on me during the trip. Then I said, "Please don't do it!" He said, "I saw the Ansar doing the same thing to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). So I swore that I would never travel with one of them without serving him." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4570]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The tribe of Aslam will be assured of security by Allah, and the tribe of Ghifar will be forgiven by Allah. It is not I who said this, but Allah, the Almighty and Exalted." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4574]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "The tribe of Ghifar will be forgiven by Allah, and the tribe of Aslam will be assured of security by Allah, and the tribe of 'Usayya has Disobeying Allah and His Messenger.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4576]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The tribe of Quraish, the Ansar, Muzainah, Juhainah, Aslam, Ghifar, and Ashha' are my helpers. They have no protector except Allah and His Messenger.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4578]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The tribe of Aslam, Ghifar, Muzaina, and those from Juhaina or Juhaina itself are better than Banu Tamiem, Banu 'Amer, and the two allies, Assad and Ghatafan.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4579]

Abu Bakra (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Al-Aqra' Ibn Habis came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: “Those from the tribe of Aslam, Ghifar, Muzaina, and I believe that he also Juhainah said - In this the narrator, Muhammad is uncertain - those who swore allegiance to you are nothing other than those who plunder the pilgrims." The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "What do you mean if the tribe of Aslam, Ghifar, Muzaina, and I believe he also said Juhaina. Better than Banu Tamiem, Banu 'Amer, Assad and Ghatafan, did they fail and suffer a loss?" He said: "Yes!" Then he (the Prophet) said: "By the one in whose hand my life is , the The first mentioned people are better than the others.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4582]

'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The first sadaqa (donation or alms) that filled the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and his companions with joy was the sadaqa ( donation or alms) . . Alms) from Tai'. I personally brought them to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4585]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Tufail and his people came to the Prophet and said: "O Messenger of Allah, the tribe of Dau has indeed fallen into disobedience and is only hostile, so make a supplication to Allah against it (the tribe) . ) !" Someone said: "Down with the dhows!" But the Prophet said: "O Allah, guide the dhows to the right path and bring them back to us." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4586]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I will love Banu Tamiem forever because of three things that I heard from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him):

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The best Arab women are: - ( A narrator said:) the righteous women of Quraish. - (Another narrator said:) the women of Quraish who feel the most pity for the orphans and who care most for the property of their husbands." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4589]

The Hadith of Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him): 
'Asim reported that he said to Anas (may Allah be pleased with him): "Have you heard that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "There is no alliance in Islam?"" Anas said: "But the Messenger of Allah made an alliance between Quraish and the Ansar in his house." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4593]

Abu Sa`id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “A time will come to the people when a group will go to battle. It will be said to them: “Is there anyone among you who has seen the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him?”) They will say: “Yes!” Then Allah will give them victory in return. Afterwards a group goes into battle. It will be said to them: "Is there anyone among you who has seen the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)?" They will say: "Yes!" Allah will give them victory in return. Afterwards a group goes into battle. It will be said to them: "Is there anyone among you who has seen the Companions of the Companions of Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)?" They will say: "Yes!" Allah will give them victory in return. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4597]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The best in my Ummah (community) are those in the following era. Then those who follow after them, then those who follow after them. After that will come people whose testimonies precede their oaths, and whose oaths precede their testimonies." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4599]

'Imran Ibn Hussain (may Allah be pleased with them) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The best of you are those in my era, then those who follow them, then those who follow them follow, then those who follow after them." 'Imran (the narrator) said: "I do not know whether he named two or three eras after his era." Then he continued: "After them will come people, who live as spectators and do not act as martyrs, and who behave unfaithfully and are not trustworthy, and who take vows and then do not fulfill them. The excess weight will be visible on their bodies.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4603]

Abdullah Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Once the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) led us in the night prayer. That was in the last phase of his life. When he said the Taslim (formula that one says at the end of the prayer.) , he stood up and said: “Do you see this night? A hundred years later, no one will be left on the surface of the earth." Ibn 'Umar said: "The people did not understand this saying of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), especially what is meant by a hundred years. In reality, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) meant that none of us will live a hundred years after this night, that is, that will be the end of this generation." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4605]

Abu Sa'eed (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Khalid Ibn Al-Walid and 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn 'Auf once had a quarrel. Then Khalid insulted him. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Do not insult any of my companions. For if one of you were to donate as much money as the mountain of Uhud, he would never equal the least part of the achievement of one of you; not even half of it!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ no. 4611]

The Hadith of Asma' Bint Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with them both: 
Abu Naufal reported: Al-Hajğağ Ibn Yusuf Ath-Thaqafy said to Asma' Bint Abu Bakr: "What do you think about what I said to the enemy of Allah (your son) She said, "You have spoiled his life in this world, but he has spoiled your life in the Hereafter." He ( Al-Hağğağ) replied: "I heard that you called him the son of the two belts ." She (Asma' Bint Abu Bakr) said: "By Allah, I am the one of the two belts. With the help of a belt, I carried the food of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and that of Abu Bakr with me on the mounts. The other is the essential belt for women. Verily, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) told us that there would be a great liar and a great murderer belonging to the tribe of Thaqief. We've already seen the liar. But I believe that you are the intended murderer.” Then he walked out without saying a word. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4617]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If the knowledge of religion were in the Pleiades, a man from Persia or (he said:) a Persian would go there, to acquire it.”

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The people will be as many as a hundred camels. Nevertheless, one looks for a suitable mount among them, but does not find one!” (i.e., although the people become so many, a reliable person is difficult to find.)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 44, Ḥadīṯ No. 4620]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A man came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah, who is most entitled to my kind companionship?" The Prophet said: "Your mother !" The man further asked, "Who else?" The Prophet said, "Your mother!" The man further asked, "Who else?" The Prophet said, "Your mother!" The man further asked, "Who else?" The Prophet said: “Then your father.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4621]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
A man came to the Prophet. He asked him for permission to undertake jihad. The Prophet asked him: "Are your parents still alive?" The man said: "Yes!" Then the Prophet said: "You should undertake jihad by taking care of them." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ No. 4623]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
Jurayg devoted himself to the service of Allah in a hermitage. Once his mother came to him. - Humaid (a later narrator) said: Abu Rafi' (a later narrator) described to us how his mother called him, according to Abu Hurairah, who in turn according to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). - She put her palm on her eyebrow and raised her head to call him. She said: “O Juraiğ, this is your mother. Speak to me!” At that time he was busy in prayer. He said (to himself) : “O my Lord, this is my mother. She calls me while I am doing the prayer. What should I do?” But he decided to pray. She went away, but came later and called him for the second time: “O Ğuraiğ, this is your mother. Speak to me!” He said (to himself) : “O my Lord, this is my mother. She calls me during my prayer. What should I do?” But he decided to pray again. Then his mother said: “O my Lord, this is Juraiğ, my son. I wanted to talk to him but he refused to talk back. O Allah, do not let him die before he sees the whores!" The Prophet further said: "If his mother had asked for him to be seduced, then he would have been seduced. But a shepherd used to spend the night in this hermitage. It happened that a woman from that village went there and the shepherd committed fornication with her. The woman became pregnant and later gave birth to a child. The people of the village said to her, “Who is the father of this child?” She replied, “His father is the one who lives in this hermitage.” But they went to him with their picks and shovels. When they called him, he was busy praying. Therefore he did not speak to them. So they began to tear down his hermitage. When he saw this, he went to them (astonished) . But they said: “Ask this woman!” But he smiled, stroked the baby’s hair and asked him: “Who is your father?” The infant replied, "My father is the shepherd." When the people (astonished) heard this answer from the infant, they said to him (Juraiğ) : "We are ready to reward the part of your hermitage that we tore down with gold and silver." But he said, "No, only rebuild it with clay as it was." Finally he went up again." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4625]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Indeed, Allah is the One Who created everything. And when he had completed his creation, the bond of kinship stood up and said, "This is the rank of those who take refuge in You from the destruction of the bond of kinship!" Allah said to her, "Yes!" Aren't you satisfied with that? be that I maintain My bond with the one who associates with you and that I break My bond with the one who breaks his bond with you?" She said: "Yes, O my Lord!" Allah then said to her: "This is what I have ordained for you." The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) continued: "Read if you wish." If you turn away, will you cause mischief on earth and sever your ties of kinship ? « » These are those whom Allah curses; so He makes them deaf and blinds their eyesight. " " Don't you think carefully about the Qur'an? Or are their locks (attached) to (these) hearts? «“ [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4634]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "The bond of relatives is attached to the throne (of Allah) . She says: "Whoever joins me, Allah joins him, and whoever separates from me, Allah separates from him too." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4635]

Dubair Ibn Mut`im (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “No destroyer of the ties of kinship (Qati`) will enter Paradise!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Hadee No . 4636]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "He who delights in Allah's bounty to him being abundantly (forgiven) and according to his If death still has a good reputation among the people, he should maintain his ties to his relatives." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ-No. 4638]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Do not stir up mutual hatred between you. Don't be jealous of each other. Do not turn away from one another and be servants of Allah, brotherly to one another. It is not permissible for a Muslim to avoid his brother for more than three days.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4641]

Abu Ayyub Al-Ansary (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: “It is not permissible for any Muslim to avoid his brother for more than three days by meeting each other while they are together one turns away from the other. But the best of the two is the one who first speaks the greeting of peace (Salaam) to the other." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4643]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Beware of suspicions; for suspicion is the greatest of all lies; do not premeditatedly look for your own faults and do not spy on one another. Do not compete with one another unjustly, do not be envious and resentful of one another, do not turn away from one another and be servants of Allah, brotherly to one another.” [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ No. 4646]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
I never saw a person who suffered greatly from suffering like the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ No. 4662]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I approached the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) when he was in severe pain. I touched him with my hand and said: “O Messenger of Allah, you are suffering from severe pain!” The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “That is true! I am in as much pain as two of you men put together." I said, "Is this because you will have twice the reward ( from Allah) ?" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, " That is true." Then he said: "Never will a Muslim be struck by any evil, by any disease, or by anything lighter, unless Allah causes his sins to fall away from him as the tree loses its leaves." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim , Chapter 45, Hadīṯ No. 4663]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saying: "No Muslim will be pricked with a thorn upwards unless Allah bestows upon him this as a good thing and rewards him with it atonement (for his sins) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4664]

Abu Sa'id (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Never will the believer suffer constant pain, strain, illness or sorrow, even if it is only worry, without that Allah may impute this to him as atonement for his misdeeds.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4670]

Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
When the Qur'anic verse " ...Whoever does evil will be repaid... " was revealed, it touched the Muslims so deeply that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace and blessings of Allah be upon him All hail him, said: “Act accordingly and seek the right means! For whatever befalls the Muslim, even the evil that befalls the Muslim, or even the thorn that pricks him, will be imputed to him ( by Allah) as atonement for his sins." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ No . 4671]

The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them: 
'Ata' Ibn Abu Rabah reported: Ibn Abbas said to me: "Wouldn't you like to see a woman who belongs to the people of Paradise?" I replied: "Yes!" He said: "This dark-skinned woman came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: 'I suffer from epilepsy and it exposes me. So call upon Allah for me!" The Prophet said to her, "Do you want to endure it patiently and be rewarded with Paradise, or do you want me to ask Allah to heal you?" She replied, "I will endure it patiently . However, I am exposed. So ask Allah that I not be exposed!” So ​​the Prophet asked for it on their behalf.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4673]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever commits injustice, darkness upon darkness will come upon him on the Day of Resurrection." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ- No. 4676]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The Muslim is the Muslim's brother. He must neither suppress it nor allow it to perish. Whoever supports his brother in trouble, Allah supports him in his own trouble. And whoever takes away a worry from a Muslim, Allah will take away a worry from his worries on the Day of Resurrection. And whoever does not expose a Muslim, Allah will not expose him on the Day of Resurrection." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ No. 4677]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Indeed, Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, grants respite to the wrongdoer. But if He grabs him, he can no longer escape. Then he recited: “ Such is the grip of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are doing wrong. Indeed, His grip is painful and hard. «“ [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4680]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Two boys, one from the Muhagirun (the Muslim emigrants from Makkah) and the other from the Ansar (the Muslim helpers from Madinah) were arguing with each other. The Muhagir (the emigrant) called out or the Muhagirun (called) to help: "O ye Muhagirun!" and the Ansari (the helper) called to help: "O ye Ansar!" Meanwhile the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) arose him, out and said, “What is that? The customs of the pre-Islamic period?" The people replied: "No, Messenger of Allah! It's just that two boys were arguing with each other and one kicked the other." Then the Prophet said: "As far as I'm concerned! But you should help your brother, whether he commits injustice or suffers from injustice! If he commits injustice, one should stop him from doing injustice, because that is help for him. And if he suffers injustice, one should help him.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4681]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The believer is like a wall to the believer: one part of it holds the other." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ -No. 4684]

An-Nu'man Ibn Basheer (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: “The believers in their affection, mercy and compassion for one another are like one body: if a part of it suffers , the whole body reacts with insomnia and fever!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4685]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A man asked for permission to go to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "Yes, let him come in, but what an evil son of his tribe - or he said: What an evil man of his tribe - he is!" When the man came in, the Prophet was talking friendly with him. Later I said to him: "O Messenger of Allah, you spoke so disparagingly about this man, but then you spoke kindly to him!" He said: "Ah 'A'ishah, the worst person before Allah on the Day of Resurrection is the one from whom others retreat because of his shameless speech.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4693]

'A'ishah, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "O 'A'isha, verily, Allah is gentle and loves gentleness. He bestows for clemency what He does not bestow for severity, or for anything other than clemency.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ No. 4697]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “O Allah, I am a human being. So for every Muslim whom I insulted, cursed or whipped, do this to him for purity (from sins) and mercy!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4706]

Umm Kulthum Bint 'Uqba (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "A liar is not the one who mediates between people while saying something good and doing something good .” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4717]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Shall I tell you what 'adah means?" It is called slander, spreading untruths about others with the intention of damaging their reputation." The Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) further said: "The man is in the habit of persistently speaking the truth until he is with Allah is enrolled as a truthful person. And man is wont to lie perseveringly until he is registered with Allah as a liar.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4718]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The true strongman is not the one who wins in a wrestling match, but the true strongman is the one who controls himself in anger .” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4723]

Sulaiman Ibn Surd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Two men insulted each other in the presence of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). One of the two had a red face from anger and his neck veins were swollen. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “I know a sentence by which, if he utters it, his anger disappears! He should say: A'uudhu bill-llahi mina-Shaitani-r-rağim (I take refuge in Allah from the accursed Satan). " Then the man said: "Do you think that I am a madman!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Hadīṯ No. 4725]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever argues with his brother (in Islam) should avoid hitting his face." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Hadīṯ no. 4728]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A man was walking through the mosque carrying arrows. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: “Hold them by their edges!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ No. 4736]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If one of you passes through a place where people are sitting together or through a market with arrows in his hand, he shall use them Cover the tips with your palm. He should cover their tips with his palm. He shall cover their tops with his palm.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4739]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
Abu Al-Qasim (the Prophet) , may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever points a weapon at his brother (in Islam) , the angels curse him until he uses that weapon even if he aims it at his paternal and maternal brother just for fun." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ No. 4741]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Jibril (Gabriel) did not stop urging me to show kindness to my neighbor until I thought , he would declare him entitled to inherit!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4756]

Ibn 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Jibril (Gabriel) did not stop exhorting me to show kindness to my neighbor until I thought he would declare him entitled to inherit!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4757]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to, when someone came to him asking for something, he would turn his face to his companions and say, “Practice Intercede for him so that you may be rewarded (by Allah) . May Allah grant this through the tongue of His Prophet!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4761]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "The parable of a good person and a bad person in a social gathering is like the musk dealer and the worker at the bellows (of a blacksmith ) : From the musk dealer you can either get a scent sample, buy something, or find a pleasant smell. But what you experience from the worker at the bellows is that he either burns your clothes or you find a foul smell from him." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4762]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
A woman came to me with her two daughters to beg; All she found with me was a date, which I also gave her. She shared the date between her two daughters and didn't eat it herself. Then she got up and went out. Later the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) came to me and I told him this story: He then said: “Whoever is tested with anything because of the girls and does good to them, they are one for him Protection from Hellfire.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4763]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If three of a Muslim's children die (and he perseveres patiently, hoping for Allah's reward), then he will never go to Hellfire be touched. He will pass by the Hellfire so that Allah may fulfill his oath in the following verse of the Qur'an: " And there is not one of you who would not pass by it." This is your Lord's responsibility to make unchangeable. «“ [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4766]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A woman came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said to him: "O Messenger of Allah, the men are receiving your instruction, so give us a day , in which we share in you! On this day we shall come to you to teach you what Allah has taught you." Then the Prophet said: "Gather on the day of so-and-so!" The women gathered together and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to them. He taught them what Allah had taught him. Sometimes he said to them: “No woman of you will lose three of her children without them being a barrier against the fire of hell!” Then a woman said: “Does this also apply to two and two and two children? He replied: Even for two and two and two!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4768]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When Allah loves a servant, He invites Jibril (Gabriel) to come to Him and says to him: 'I love so-and-so.' Love him too!” Ğibril will then love him. He calls out in heaven and says: “Allah loves so-and-so. Love him too!” The inhabitants of heaven will then love him. He is destined to be dear to the inhabitants of the earth. But when Allah hates a servant, He brings Jibril to Him and says to him: “I hate so-and-so. Hate him too!” Jibril will then hate him. He calls the inhabitants of heaven and says: “Allah hates so-and-so. Hate him too!” They will then hate him. It will then be decreed for him that the inhabitants of the earth will hate him.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ no. 4772]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A Bedouin said to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him): "When will the Hour arrive?" prepared for it?" He said: "Love for Allah and His Messenger." Then he (the Messenger) said : You will be (in the Hereafter) with those you love." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ No . 4775]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A man came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah, what is your opinion about a man who loves some people, but "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him ) said: One will be with those whom one loves (in the Hereafter) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 45, Ḥadīṯ- No. 4779]

Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to us - and he is the True, the Trustworthy - : "Indeed, the creation of each of you will be in the body brought together from his mother in forty days (as semen drops) ; after that it becomes a clot of blood for just as long; After that, it remains a small lump of flesh for just as long. Then Allah sends the angel to breathe into him. Then the angel is charged with four things: determining his livelihood, his lifespan, his deeds, and whether he will be miserable or blissful. I swear by Him, besides Whom there is no other God, that there are some among you who truly perform such works of the inhabitants of Paradise until they are only a cubit's length away from it, then the predetermined thing overtakes them, and thus accomplishes it they destroy the works of the inhabitants of hell and enter into them. And there are some among you who truly perform such works as those of the inhabitants of Hell, until they are within a cubit's length of it, then the predetermined thing overtakes them, and thus they perform the works of the inhabitants of Paradise, and enter it .” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 46, Ḥadīṯ no. 4781]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet said: “Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, entrusts an angel with the supervision of the womb. This angel says, “O Lord, a drop of semen! O Lord, a clot of blood! O Lord, a lump of flesh!" And when Allah wants to complete His creation, the angel asked: "O Lord, shall it be a man or a woman? Will it be unhappy or happy? How will it make a living? When will it die?" All of this is already determined in the mother's womb." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 46, Ḥadīṯ no. 4785]

'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
Once we attended a funeral procession in Baqi' Al-Gharqad. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to us. He sat and we sat around him. He had a stick in his hand. He silently lowered his head and began to scratch the earth (in front of him) with the stick. Then he said: "There is not one of you or any living soul without Allah having already determined his or her place either in Paradise or in Hell, and without having predetermined their happiness or unhappiness." Then a man said : "O Messenger of Allah, why do we not surrender to our destiny prescribed in the well-preserved tablet and pay no attention to works?" He replied: "He who is among the happy people will do good. But whoever is among the unfortunate people will do evil. (You people!) Work! The way is made easy for everyone: for the happy people the way to good work is made easier, and for the unhappy people the way to evil work is made easier." Then he recited: "Now as for one who gives and is God-fearing," " and this If he believes the best to be true, "" then We will make the path to the easier path easy for him. " " But as for someone who is stingy and considers himself needless " " and declares the best to be a lie, " " We will make it easy for him to go to what is more difficult; « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 46, Ḥadīṯ no. 4786]

'Imran Ibn Hussain, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 
It was said: "O Messenger of Allah, are the inhabitants of Paradise distinguished from those of Hell?" He said: "Yes! " what is the benefit of doing something (good) ?" Then he said: "The path is made easier for everyone to do what they were created to do." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 46, Ḥadīṯ No. 4789]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Adam and Musa (Moses) were arguing with each other. Musa (Moses) said: “O Adam, you are our father. You caused us loss and damage when you brought us out of Paradise." Then Adam said to him: "You are Musa (Moses) . Allah has chosen you (from among men) by His Word and has written for you on the tablets with His hand. Why do you blame me for what Allah had prescribed for me forty years before He created me?" The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "With this Adam convinced Musa, with this Adam convinced Musa."" [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 46, Hadīṯ No. 4793]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, Allah has ordained for the son of Adam his share of fornication, which he will inevitably commit: for the fornication of the eyes is the look , the fornication of the tongue is its pronunciation. Man wants and desires. What is decisive, however, is whether the genitals are used with appropriate perception or not." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 46, Ḥadīṯ no. 4801]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “There is no child who is not born with a natural disposition (fitra) and devotion (as a Muslim) . His parents then make him either a Jew, a Christian or a magician. Just like the animal that gives birth to an animal similar to it: “Do you see that the ears of the newborn animal are slit?”” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 46, Ḥadīṯ no. 4803]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asked about (the fate of) the children of disbelieving parents who die in infancy, and he (the Messenger) said: "Allah knows best what they would commit.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 46, Ḥadīṯ no. 4808]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited: " It is He who revealed the Book to you. These include unambiguous verses - they are the core of the book - and others that are ambiguous. But as for those in whose hearts there is a tendency to wander, they follow what is ambiguous, seeking to mislead and to misinterpret. But no one knows their interpretation except Allah. And those who are firmly established in knowledge say, “We believe in this; everything is from our Lord." But only those who have understanding should consider (or: be admonished.) . " The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When you see those who follow what is in it is to be interpreted differently, then beware of them, for these are the ones to whom Allah (in the above-mentioned verse) indicated." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 47, Ḥadīṯ No. 4817]

Jundab Ibn 'Abdullah Albagaly (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Read (together) the Qur'an (Quran) as long as your hearts agree with one another in its meanings. But if you differ about this, stand up and desist from it." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 47, Ḥadīṯ no. 4819]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: There are those among people who are least loved by Allah, and these are the ones who quarrel and quarrel are quarrelsome.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 47, Ḥadīṯ no. 4821]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "You will certainly follow the customs of those before you, hand span for hand span and cubit for cubit, until you follow them too then follow if they were to pass through the hole of a dabb (a stinking animal in the desert) !" We said: "O Messenger of Allah, (do you mean) the Jews and the Christians?" And he replied: "Who else?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 47, Ḥadīṯ No. 4822]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Among the omens of the Hour are the disappearance of (divine) knowledge, ignorance prevailing, habitual drinking of alcohol, and the Fornication (Zina) becomes evident.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 47, Ḥadīṯ no. 4824]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "There are indeed times before the coming of the Hour when knowledge is abolished, ignorance descends and haraj often occurs. And the harağ is murder.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 47, Ḥadīṯ no. 4826]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The time is drawing near, knowledge will be taken away, confusion will be evident, miserliness will be everywhere , and the Harağ will multiply." The people asked, "What is a Harağ?" The Prophet said, "Murder!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 47, Ḥadīṯ no. 4827]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr Ibn Al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Indeed, Allah does not take away knowledge by putting it out of memory who tears people away, but takes away knowledge by causing the learned to die; and when none of them remain, then men employ ignorant minds, which, when asked, give a judgment which lacks any foundation of knowledge. Thus they themselves will go astray and also lead people astray.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 47, Ḥadīṯ-No. 4828]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, says: I fulfill the good expectations that My servant has for Me; and I am with him when he remembers Me: when he remembers Me in his heart, then I also remember him in Myself. And if he remembers Me in an assembly, I also will remember him in an assembly better than that. And if he comes within an arm's length of Me, then I come within an arm's length of him. And if he comes an arm's length toward Me, then I come toward him at two arm's length. And if he comes striding towards Me, then I will come to him in haste."
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4832]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Allah has ninety-nine names. Whoever learns them by heart will enter paradise. Allah is one and loves that one does odd numbers in every action.” (e.g. drinking from something three times, eating three dates, etc.) 
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4835]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "If any of you wants to make a supplication, he should ask for his matter with determination, and he should not say: 'O Allah my God, if you want, give me; for there is no one who can compel Allah to do so.""
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4837]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If any of you wants to make a supplication, he should not say, 'O Allah my God, forgive me if you will.' !” But he should ask for his matter with determination, and ask for wishes of great importance (e.g. paradise, forgiveness) ; for there is nothing that is too much for Allah.”
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4838]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “No one should long for death because of a misfortune that has befallen him. If any of you is so tired of life, he should say: "O Allah, keep me alive while life is better for me, and take me when death is better for me."

The Hadith of Khabbab, may Allah be pleased with him: 
Qais Ibn Abu Hazim reported: I visited Khabbab when he was undergoing treatment in which he acquired seven burns; he said to me: "If the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) had not forbidden us from asking (Allah) for death, I would have asked for it!"
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ No. 4842]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "None of you should wish for death or ask for it before coming to him, for when one dies, his hearse." actions. And as long as the believer lives, it is good for him." (For he has time to increase his good deeds or to atone for his sins.)
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4843]

'Ubada Ibn As-Samit (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever loves meeting Allah, Allah also loves meeting him. And whoever abhors the encounter with Allah, Allah also abhors the encounter with him."
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ-No. 4844]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever loves meeting Allah, Allah also loves meeting him. And whoever abhors the encounter with Allah, Allah also abhors the encounter with him." 'A'ishah said: "O Prophet of Allah, do you mean the abhorrence of death. We all curse death!" The Prophet said: "It is not that. But it is when the good news about the mercy, benevolence and paradise of Allah is announced to a believer. So he then loves the encounter with Allah and Allah loves the encounter with him. But as for the disbeliever, the wrath and punishment of Allah will be announced to him. So he abhors meeting Allah and Allah also abhors meeting him!”
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4845]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Whoever loves meeting Allah, Allah also loves meeting him. And whoever abhors the encounter with Allah, Allah also abhors the encounter with him." 
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ-No. 4848]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, visited a (sick) Muslim who became so weak that he looked like a baby bird. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: “Are you calling on Allah for something or asking Him for something?” The man said: “Yes!” I used to say: “O Allah my God prepare for me The punishment that You have already prepared for me in the Hereafter will quickly come to pass in this world!” Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Praise be to Allah! You don't bear it (the punishment) or you can't bear it. Better you say: » “Our Lord, give us good things in this world and good things in the hereafter, and protect us from the punishment of (hell) fire! "He (the Messenger) called upon Allah for him, and Allah healed him.
 [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4853]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah, the Exalted and the Most Blessed, has angels who have no other duty than to go about the streets in search of those who are gather to remember Allah. But when they find a gathering where people are remembering Allah, they sit with them. The angels surround them with their wings in such a way that they are directly connected to the first heaven. When they disperse, the angels ascend to heaven. Here then Allah, the Almighty and Exalted - and He is more knowledgeable than them - asks them: "Where did you come from?" They answer: "We came from Your servants on earth, who praise You, saying: "Subhana Allah” (Glorified be Allah) , extolling your greatness by saying: “Allahu Akbar” (Allah is the Greatest) , speaking the formula laa Ilaaha Illa Allah (there is no god but Allah or There is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah). , praising You by saying: "Al-hamdu lillah" (All praise be to Allah) and asking You." He says: "What are they asking Me for?" They say: "They are asking You for Your Paradise." He says: “Have you seen My Paradise?” They say: “No! our Lord." He says: "And how if they had seen it?" They further say: "And they seek refuge in You." He says: "And from what do they seek refuge in Me?" They say: "Ahead Your Hellfire, our Lord!" He says: "Have they seen My Hellfire?" They say: "No!" He says: "And what if they had seen it?" They say: "And they ask You for that Forgiveness of their sins." He says, "I have forgiven their sins, I have given them whatever they ask for, and I have given them refuge in Me from what they sought refuge in Me from." They say, "O Allah , among them is so-and-so, and he is a sinful servant. And it came to pass that he passed by them and sat with them." He said, "I have forgiven him also. They are the ones he sat with; and he who sits with them shall not be unhappy.""
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4854]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever says (There is no god but Allah) or There is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah, the One Who has no partner. To Him belongs the kingdom, and to Him is due all praise, and He is powerful over all things) * a hundred times in one day, this will be as much reward as for the freeing of ten slaves. In return, one hundred good deeds will be credited to him, and one hundred bad deeds will be canceled from him; In addition, these words act as a protection for him from Satan throughout the day until he goes to sleep for the night. No man will say anything better except the one who spoke these words, unless one speaks of them more than the other. And whoever says (Praise be to Allah and all praise be to Him) ** a hundred times in one day, all his sins will be wiped away from him, even if they are as many as the sea foam."

Abu Ayyub Al-Ansary (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Whoever says: There is no god but Allah, or there is nothing more worthy of worship than Allah, the One Who has no partner has. To Him belongs the kingdom, and to Him all praise is due, and He is Mighty over all things - ten times, this will be as much reward to him as for the release of four slaves from the offspring of Isma'il." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim,
  Chapter 48, Hadīṯ no. 4859]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There are only two words that are light on the tongue, heavy on the scales, and are favored by the Most Merciful; they are: (Praise be to Allah, and all praise be to Him; Praise be to Allah, The Almighty) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4860]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
We were on a journey with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). When the people said takbir in a loud voice, the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: “Make it easy for yourselves! Truly you are not calling a deaf person or an absent one, but the All-Hearing One and the Near One who is with you." I said when I was behind him: "La haula wa-la Quwata illa bill-llah " (There is no power and no power except through Allah!) Then he said to me: "O 'Abdullah Ibn Qais, shall I not point out to you a treasure from the treasures of Paradise?" I said: "Yes, Messenger of Allah!" He said: " Say ( La haula wa-la quwwata illa bill-llah ) (There is no might and no power except through Allah!) ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4873]

Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I said to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): "Teach me a supplication that I will make in my prayers!" The Prophet said: "Say: (O Allah my God ! Verily, I have done great injustice to myself, and there is no one to forgive sins except You; so forgive me and make this a pardon granted by You, and have mercy on me; for You are truly the Most Forgiving, The One All-Merciful.) ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4876]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to say: "O Allah my God, I take refuge in You from incompetence and laziness, from cowardice, who old age, and stinginess; and I take refuge in You from the punishment of the grave; and I take refuge in You from temptation in life and in death." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4878]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took refuge in Allah from evil, from the encroachment of misery, from the gloating of enemies, and from the affliction of the visitation. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ No. 4880]

Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: When you go to bed, wash yourself as you usually wash for prayer ; then lie on your right side and say: “O Allah my God, to You I surrender my face, and into Your hand I commit all my affairs. With you I seek my protection in desire for you and in fear of you; for there is no safety or salvation from You except in You. I believe in Your Book which You have revealed and in Your Prophet whom You have sent." So make these the last words you speak. If you are to die that night, you will die with the faith of Fitra (natural predisposition to Islam) . (Al-Bara') then said: "I repeated them to practice them: (and to Your Messenger whom You have sent!) " The Prophet said: " (Say! ... and to Your Prophet whom You have sent.) have!) ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4884]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If any of you wants to go to bed, he should first clear his bed ( of foreign objects) with his loincloth and mention the name of Allah speak; for he does not know what has settled on it in his absence; and if he wishes to lie down, he shall lie down on his right side; then he shall say afterwards: Blessed are You, O my Lord, through You I lay down the side of my body, and through You I lift it up again. If You keep my soul back, have mercy on it, and if You send it back, protect it (from every evil) as You protect Your righteous servants from it." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4889]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to utter the following supplication: "O Allah my God, I surrender to You, I believe in You, I trust in You To you I return repentant, because of you I fight with others. O Allah my God, I seek refuge in Your Majesty from making me go astray - there is no god but You. You are the Living One Who does not die, and the Jinn and people die." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ No. 4894]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to utter the following supplication: "O Allah my God, forgive me for my transgression and my ignorance, and my transgression in all my affairs and also what you know better than me. O Allah my God, forgive me for all my (misdeeds) that I committed intentionally, for fun, ignorantly and seriously; and I admit that these are all with me. O Allah my God, forgive me for all my (misdeeds) that I have committed in the past and will commit in the future, what I do secretly and openly, and what You know better than I. You are accommodating with Your mercy and granting respite to everything, and You are Powerful over all things.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4896]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to say: There is no god except Allah alone, who supported his hosts, who helped his servant to win, and who made allies defeated alone. So there is nothing after Him.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4903]

'Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
Fatima complained of pain in her hand because of the use of the millstone. When women and children from captivity came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), Fatima hurriedly went to him (to ask him for a servant) . But she didn't find him. She met 'A'isha and told her her wish. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came, 'A'ishah told him about it. When the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to us, just as we were going to sleep, we were about to get up (because of him) . But the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Stay where you are!” He then sat between the two of us until I felt the coolness of his feet on my chest.
