He said to us, “Shall I not point out to you something that is better for you than what you asked me to do?” When you go to bed, say: "Allahu Akbar (Allah is Greater) thirty-four times, Subhana-llah (Allah be praised) thirty-three times, and Al-hamduli-llah (All praise be to Allah) also thirty-three times." This is better for you than a servant!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4906]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “When you hear the crowing of cocks, ask Allah for His grace; for they perceived an angel. And when you hear the sound of donkeys, take refuge in Allah from Satan; for these have perceived a Satan.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4908]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to say in times of distress: There is no god but Allah, the Almighty, the Forgiving. There is no god but Allah, the Lord of the Worthy Throne. There is no god but Allah, the Lord of the heavens and the earth and the Lord of the mighty throne.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4909]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The supplication of each of you will be heard if he does not abandon it hastily by saying: "I have already uttered the supplication , and no fulfillment will be given to me for it, or no fulfillment has been given to me for it." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no. 4916]

Usama Ibn Zaid, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "I stood at the gate of Paradise and found that most of those who entered there were the poor, while the rich were were excluded from it; Only the people of Hellfire were given an order to be taken away to Hellfire. Then I stood at the gate of Hellfire and noticed that most of those who entered there were women." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ No. 4919]

'Imran Ibn Hussain, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The least of the inhabitants of Paradise are women." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Hadee No. 4921]

Usama Ibn Zaid, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "I have not left behind me any temptation that is more harmful to men than to women!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Hadīṯ no. 4923]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: A group of three men were traveling across the country when suddenly it began to rain. They sought shelter from the rain in a cave in the mountain. Then a large boulder fell from the mountain and blocked their exit from the cave. One of them said to the others: "Let us invoke Allah, the Exalted, by telling the good deeds we have ever done for the sake of Allah, for may Allah open the way out of this cave for us!" One of them Narrated: “O Allah, I had very old parents, and a wife and small children. I worked as a shepherd and made a living. When I brought the animals back, I milked them and brought the milk to my parents first. They drank until they had enough. Only then did I give my children some of the milk. One day I had to go to a far away place to find a pasture. That's why I didn't return until the evening. When I got home, my parents were already asleep. I milked the animals as I did every day and stood in front of them with the milk container. I was reluctant to wake her up. But I was also reluctant to give the children milk in front of them. My children complained about being hungry, but I didn't give them anything. We stayed like that until dawn broke. O Allah, if you know that I have done this only in pursuit of your favor, then open the way for us out of this cave so that we can see the sky again!” Then the boulder moved a little to the side so that they could see it could see sky. The other said: “O Allah my God, you know that I had a cousin on my father's side whom I loved as a man can only love a woman. I desired her and she said she would only comply with my desire if I gave her a hundred gold pieces. I had to work a lot until I got the money together. And then I was about to sleep with her, but she shouted: “O servant of Allah, fear Allah and stop! Don’t take away my innocence in an unjust way!” Then I got up and left. O Allah, if you know that I only did this in pursuit of your favor, then give us the way out of this cave!” Then the rock moved a little more. The third man narrated: "O Allah, you know, I once employed a hired hand and his wages were one faraq (a measure of weight)Rice. When he finished his work, he asked me for his wages. When I wanted to give him his wages, he didn't want to accept it. So I took this rice, sowed it and harvested it until I was finally able to buy some cows and some shepherds from the produce. One day this hired hand came back and said: "Fear Allah and give me my wages!" I said: "These cows and the shepherds there are yours!" He said: "Fear Allah and do not make fun of me!" I said : “No, I’m talking seriously. You can take it now.” The man took it and walked away. O Allah, if you know that I did this only in pursuit of your favor, then give us the way out of this cave!" Then the rock rolled completely aside." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 48, Ḥadīṯ no . 4926]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Allah is very pleased with the repentance of his believing servant. The joy of Allah in this is greater than the joy of a man who rode through a desolate and dangerous area with his riding camel loaded with food and drink. He slept and then got up, but could no longer find his riding camel. He went looking for his riding camel until he felt thirsty. Then he said to himself, "I had better go back to the same place where I was and sleep there until death overtakes me." He laid his head on his arm and waited for death. When he got up, he found his riding camel, and on it were still his travel supplies, food and drink. Allah is more pleased with the repentance of His servant than any of you would be if he suddenly found his riding camel and his traveling provisions lost in a vast desert." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ No. 4929]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah is more pleased with the repentance of His servant than one of you would be if he had his mount with all his provisions in one desert, and who, after giving up hope of finding it again and lying down in the shade of a tree, suddenly finds his animal standing right in front of him with the reins dangling while he is lying there, and he is overjoyed says: “O Allah, you are my servant and I am your Lord!”, promising himself this way out of sheer joy.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ no. 4932]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "After Allah had created, He wrote in His Book - which is on the throne with Him -: ( Verily , My mercy outweighs My wrath.) ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ no. 4939]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Allah made mercy from one hundred parts, kept with Him ninety-nine parts, and sent only a part of it to the people earth down. From this part, the creatures show mercy to one another, so that a mare lifts her hoof from her baby animal so that she does not hurt it!" [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ no. 4942]

'Umar Ibnal Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Women and children from captivity came to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him). One woman made it her mission to squeeze milk from her breast to give to the children. When she saw a child, she took it, held it close to her womb and nursed it. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to us: "Do you think it is possible that this woman would throw her child into the fire?" We said: "No, she will never be able to do it!" The Messenger of Allah , may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "I swear by Allah that Allah is more merciful to His servants than this woman was to her child." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ No. 4947]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A man who had never done anything good told his family that if he died, they would burn his body and half of the ashes should be scattered on the ground and the other half in the sea, because by Allah, if Allah has decreed something against him, He will punish him as He has never punished anyone else before! When he died, he was dealt with in the same way as he commanded and Allah gave His command to the earth to bring forth whatever it had hidden from him (the man) . But he also commanded the sea to bring forth everything that it (the man) had hidden within itself. Then He said to the man, “What made you do what you did?” The man said, “The fear of you, O Lord! And you know best.” Then Allah forgave him his sins.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ-No. 4949]

Abu Sa`id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Allah has given property and offspring to a man from among the people who have lived before you. He said to his children: “Do what I command you, otherwise I will give my inheritance to others.” So when I die, burn my body!” The Prophet continued: As far as I know, the man also said: “Then grind it up and then scatter the ashes into the wind, for I have never done anything good. Verily Allah is able to punish me.” He made their promise and they did it by Allah. Then Allah said to him: "What made you do what you did?" The man replied: "The fear of you." Only because of this word was he forgiven." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ no . 4952]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) said: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) reported from his Lord, the Almighty and Exalted: A servant of Allah committed a sin and said: “O Allah my God, forgive me my sin! Allah, the Most Blessed and Exalted, said: My servant committed a sin. But he knew that he had a Lord Who forgives sins and punishes them for them." Then he committed another sin and said: "O Lord, forgive me my sin!" The Most Blessed and Exalted One said: "My servant committed a sin. But he knew that he had a Lord Who forgives sins and punishes them for them." Then he committed another sin and said: "O Lord, forgive me my sin!" The Most Blessed and Exalted One said: "My servant committed a sin. But he knew that he has a Lord who forgives sins and punishes them for them. Do what you want! I have already forgiven you." 'Abdul A'la (a narrator) added: I am not sure whether Allah said this the third time or the fourth time. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ No. 4953]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "No one loves to be praised more than Allah, so He praised Himself. And none responds with more vigilance Worry than Allah. Therefore He forbade the iniquities.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ no. 4955]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Allah sometimes reacts with watchful concern, and the believer also sometimes reacts with watchful concern. But what causes this reaction from Allah is that the believer violates what is forbidden." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ no. 4959]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
When a man kissed a woman (illegally) and then reported it to the Prophet, Allah then revealed the following verse from the Quran: " And perform prayer at both ends of the day and in hours of the night. The good deeds make the evil deeds go away. This is an admonition for those who remember (Allah). « Then the man said: "O Messenger of Allah, does this also apply to me?" The Prophet replied: "For those of my Ummah who do this." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ No. 4963]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah, I have committed an offense, so execute the punishment on me!" And as the time of prayer When it was due, the man prayed with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). When the Prophet finished the prayer, the man said to him again: "O Messenger of Allah, I have committed an offense, so carry out the decree of the Book of Allah against me!" The Prophet said: "Did you not pray with us?" The man said: “Yes!” The Prophet said: “Allah has already forgiven you for your sin.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ-No. 4965]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Of the people who lived before you, there was a man who killed 99 people. He asked about the most learned person in the world. He was called a monk, and he went to him and said, “I have killed ninety-nine people. Is there any kind of penance for me?" He replied, "No!" He then killed the hermit as well, thus completing the number of his victims to one hundred. The murderer now asked again: “Who is the most learned person in the world?” He was referred to a learned person. So he went to him and said, “I have killed a hundred people. Is there any kind of repentance for me?" The learned man said, "Yes!" Nothing can stand between you and your repentance: go to such and such a country. In this land there are (pious) people who worship Allah, the Exalted. Join them, serve Allah and do not return to your homeland, for it is a bad place.” The man set out for that land. He was only halfway there when he died. Now a dispute arose between the angel of grace and the angel of plague as to who should take care of his soul. The angel of mercy said: “He has turned to Allah in repentance.” The angel of plague replied: “He has never done any good.” Then an angel in human form came and they appointed him as an arbitrator between them. He instructed them to measure the distance between the two countries. Whichever country he is closer to, he should belong to. So they took the measurement and found that he was closer to the land he wanted to go to. So the angels of grace took him over.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ no. 4967]

'A'ishah, wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon her), reported: 
When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) was preparing for a journey, he would always draw lots between his wives and the woman who would Lot was investigated and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took him on the journey. 'A'ishah further reported: One day he again drew lots between us because he wanted to go on a campaign, and the lot fell on me. Shortly afterwards we set out and I was with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The verse about the veil had already been revealed then. I was carried in a camel litter, and when we stopped, I was lifted off the camel in this litter. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished the campaign, we headed home. We were not far from Madina when he ordered that we should ride at night. The order to leave was given and I left the camp to relieve myself. I was almost back when I realized that my Yemeni agate necklace had come undone and I had lost it. I went back to look for her. That's why I was stopped back then. Meanwhile, the people who were preparing my camel for departure went to my sedan chair and secured it to the camel. They thought I was sitting in the sedan chair. Back then, women were generally very slim, not as heavy or full (as they are today), because they only eat a little! Therefore, when they lifted the palanquin, they did not notice that I was not sitting in it because of the weight of the palanquin. I was also still a very young woman back then! The camel was driven and the people left. By the time I found my necklace, the caravan had already moved away. I returned to the campsite and no one was there. I went to the place where my palanquin was and sat there, thinking that they would soon notice my absence and turn back. As I sat there waiting, my eyes closed and I fell asleep. Safwaan Ibn Al-Mu'attal As-Sulamy Az-Zakwany had stayed behind the caravan to get some sleep. In the morning he reached the campsite where I had stayed. He saw that a person dressed in black was lying there and came up. He had seen me many times before the revelation of the verse about the veil, so he could easily recognize me. I woke up when he shouted: “We live for Allah and to Him we will return!” I immediately covered my face with my outer garment. By Allah, he said nothing other than the formula: “We live for Allah and to Him we will return!” He dismounted and held his camel so that I could mount it. Then he went forward and led the camel by the reins. We reached the Prophet's caravan as it was resting at the height of the midday heat. Some of the people speculated about my reasons for staying back and made slanderous accusations. 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy Ibn Salul particularly stood out for his lying talk. A little later we returned to Madina. I fell ill and was confined to bed for a month. At that time, those slanderous accusations were widespread, but I had no idea about them. However, during my illness, I felt that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not show me the same kindness as he did when I was sick. He (the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him))visited me, said the greeting and asked how I was, saying: “How are you?” And that worried me. I didn't know about all the terrible rumors until I felt better and went with Umm Mistah to Al-Manase' to relieve myself. We always did this at night. At that time there were no toilets near our houses and we followed the custom of the ancient Arabs, that is, we moved away from the built-up and cultivated area to relieve ourselves. The Arabs at that time detested having toilets in their houses. Umm Mistah was the daughter of Abu Glory Ibnal Mottalib Ibn 'Abd Manaf. Her mother was the daughter of Sakhr Ibn 'Amer and the maternal aunt of Abu Bakr As-Siddiq. Their son was Mistah Ibn Uthatha Ibn 'Abbad Ibnal Mottalib. I walked there with the daughter of Abu Glory. When we had finished and were heading back, Umm Mistah stumbled over her dress and exclaimed angrily: "Mistah may perish!" I said: "That's not right what you're saying! Are you insulting a man who took part in the Battle of Badr?" She said, "Oh, don't you know what he is saying?" And she told me about the slanderous accusations that were made against me. I fell ill again. After I returned home, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to see me. He greeted me and said, “How are you?” I said to him, “Allow me to go to my parents!” I wanted to check with them about the rumors. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave me his permission. I went to my parents and asked my mother, “What is it that people are talking about?” She replied, “Oh, dear daughter, don’t worry about it! By Allah, it has never happened before that an attractive woman who is loved by her husband is not showered with resentment and jealousy by his concubines!" I shouted: "Praise be to Allah! And people just talk about it!” But the following night I cried constantly and couldn’t sleep. When morning came, I was still crying. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) summoned 'Ali Ibn Abu Talib and Usama Ibn Zaid. He wanted to ask her opinion as to whether he should divorce his wife or not, since no revelation had been made on the matter. Usama pointed out to the Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) that he had great affection for the Prophet's family, expressed his opinion about her innocence, and said: "O Messenger of Allah, she is your wife and we know only good things about them!" 'Ali Ibn Abu Talib said: "O Messenger of Allah! Allah has given you a free hand and there are many other women. But ask her servant. She will tell you the truth." The Messenger of Allah, Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, sent to Barira, her servant, and said to her: "O Barira, did you notice anything in 'A'ishah that seemed suspicious to you?" She replied: "No, by the one who sent you sent with the truth. I have never observed anything that I could blame her for. The most I could say is that she is still very young and sometimes she leaves the dough and sleeps - and then the goat comes and eats it." On the same day, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) mounted the pulpit and asked those gathered asked whether anyone would assist him if he wanted to punish 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy Ibn Salul. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said while standing on the pulpit: “O Muslims, who will help me when I punish a man who expressed serious suspicions against my family? By Allah, I only know good things about my wife. And a man is being blamed who I can only say good things about. He never entered my house without me being there." Sa'd Ibn Mu'az Al-Ansary stood up and said: "O Messenger of Allah, by Allah, I assist you. When this 'Abdullah is out of the tribe, we will cut off his head. But if he is one of our brothers from the tribe of Khazrağ, then tell us what we should do and we will obey your command.” Then Sa'd Ibn 'Ubada, the head of the tribe of Khazrağ, jumped up. He was a righteous man, but at that moment anger seized him and he shouted at Sa`d Ibn Mu`az: “You are lying, by Allah, the Eternal. You won't kill him. You will not succeed." Then Usaid Ibn Hudair, cousin of Sa'd Ibn Mu'az, also jumped up and shouted: "By Allah, you are a liar. By Allah, the Eternal, we will definitely kill him. You are a hypocrite who defends the hypocrites.” Then the Aus and Khazrağ became so angry that they started to fight with each other. Meanwhile, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood on the pulpit. He continued to talk to both parties until they finally calmed down again. And he didn't talk to them about it anymore. I cried all day long. My tears continued to flow, and the following night I couldn't sleep again. My parents thought it would break my heart. While my parents sat with me and I cried, a woman from the Ansar asked to be let in. I let her enter. She sat down and cried with me. Such were the circumstances when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) entered and settled down. He hadn't sat down with me since the day the allegations against me were first made. A whole month had passed in which he had had no revelations that could have given him clarity on this matter. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) spoke the creed and then said to me: “O 'A'isha, I have been told this and that about you. If you are innocent, Allah will absolve you of all guilt. But if you are guilty, ask Allah for forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance. For if a servant of Allah confesses his wrongdoings and repents of them, Allah will turn to him again." After the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said this, my eyes stopped watering. I didn't feel a single tear anymore. I said to my father: "Answer the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) on my behalf." But he replied: "By Allah, I do not know what to say to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Then I turned to my mother with the same request, but she also said: "By Allah, I don't know what I could say to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace." I was a very young one then woman and didn't know the Koran very well. I said: “By Allah, I know that you listen to the slanderous talk of the people. It's stuck in your mind and you believe it. And when I say that I am innocent and Allah knows that I am innocent, you do not believe me. But if I admitted guilt when Allah knows that I am innocent, then you would believe me. By Allah, I can only compare my situation with that of Joseph(Yusuf) father compared when he said: " (I must be patient and call upon Allah for help against what you say.) " "After these words, I turned away from them and lay down in bed. At that time I hoped that Allah would confirm my innocence. By Allah, I never imagined that a revelation would come because of me. I'm far too unimportant for anything to be said in the Koran because of me. But I hoped that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) would have a dream in his sleep in which Allah would confirm my innocence. But, by Allah, while the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) was still sitting with us and no one had moved away, a revelation came from Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, about His Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). She seized him with such strength as comes to him in such cases, that the sweat from his brow dripped down like pearls on a severely cold day. That was because of the meaning of Revelation. When the revelation was over, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) smiled. And the first thing he said to me afterwards was: “O 'A'isha, rejoice in the good news! Allah has confirmed your innocence." My mother said: "A'ishah, get up and thank the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)!" I replied: "No, by Allah. I will not do that. Only Allah will I praise, who has confirmed my innocence by a revelation." Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, had revealed the following ten verses: "Those who have uttered the monstrous lie are a (certain) group of you. Don't think it's bad for you; no! Rather, it is good for you. Each of them will receive what he has acquired through sin. And for the one among them who took the brunt of it, there will be tremendous punishment. ... " " If only, when you heard it, the believing men and women had had a good opinion of each other and said: "This is clearly a monstrous lie!" " " If only they had brought four witnesses about it! But since they did not bring the witnesses have, then they are liars with Allah. " " And were it not for Allah's grace towards you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, you would suffer a tremendous punishment for what you indulged in (extensively)" " as you did with yours You have taken up tongues and said with your mouths what you had no knowledge of, and considered it a light thing, whereas with Allah it is a tremendous thing." "And if you had said, when you heard it, " It It is not our place to speak about it. Praise be to You! This is a tremendous slander"! « »Allah warns you never to do such things again if you are believers. « » And Allah makes the signs clear to you, and Allah is All-Knowing and All-Wise. « » Those who love the abomination to spread among those who believe, for them there will be a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know. " " And without the grace of Allah towards you and His mercy, and that Allah would not be Gracious and Merciful... " After Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, had proven my innocence with these ten verses, Abu Bakr said As-Siddiq, Allah Happy is he who provided a living for Mistah Ibn Uthatha, one of the slanderers, because he was related to him. Thereupon he was poor: "By Allah, I will never again give anything to Mistah after what he did to 'A'ishah." Then Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, revealed: "And those of you who have abundance and wealth shall , not swearing that they will no longer give to relatives, the poor, and those who have emigrated in the way of Allah, but rather they should forgive and be lenient. Don't you love that Allah forgives you? Allah is Forgiving and Merciful. " Hebban Ibn Musa said, 'Abdullah Ibnal Mubarak said: "This is the most hopeful verse in the Book of Allah." When Abu Bakr heard this revelation, he said: "Yes, by Allah, I want Allah to forgive me ." And he continued to support Mistah and said: "I will never stop giving him alms." 'A'ishah further reported: Before the revelation of my innocence was made, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) also had Zainab Bint Gahsh, the wife of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), was asked about me. She replied then: “O Messenger of Allah, I have always kept my ears and eyes open. But, by Allah, I only know good things about 'A'ishah." It was Zainab from the wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) who vied with me for the favor of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). But she was a righteous and God-fearing woman. But her sister Hamna bint Gahsh took action on her behalf, so she told this big lie. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 49, Ḥadīṯ No. 4974]

Zaid Ibn Arqam (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
We went on a journey with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Meanwhile we were in great distress. 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy said to his companions: " Do not spend on those who are with Allah's Messenger until they disperse (and away from him)." Zuhair , one of the narrators of this hadeeth, said: This is the reading of those who pronounce the final consonant of the word haulahu with i (i.e. haulihi) . He further said: "When we return to al-Madina, the more powerful will certainly drive out the inferior from it." «* So I went to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and told him this. He summoned 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy and asked him about it. But the man swore most solemnly that he had said no such thing. He added: "Zaid lied to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). What he and his comrades claimed made me very worried until Allah sent down to me (the following verses) as confirmation of my words : » When the hypocrites come to you, they say: "We bear witness that you are truly Allah's Messenger." Allah knows that you are truly His Messenger; but Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are truly lying...." As the Prophet, may Allah bless him and peace be upon him, then called on them to ask forgiveness for them, they turned their heads away " ... like ajar sticks. ... "** He (the narrator went on to say): they actually had the most pleasant appearance.

Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to the grave of 'Abdullah Ibn Ubayy. He took the body out again, put it on his knees, spat his saliva on it and dressed it in his own shirt. And Allah knows best. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 50, Ḥadīṯ No. 4977]

Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Three men gathered near the Ka'bah. Two of them were from the tribe of Quraish and one was from the tribe of Thaqief, or two were from Thaqief and one was from Quraish. They had hearts with which they understood little and they had big bellies. One of them said: “Do you believe that Allah hears what we say?” The other said: “He hears us when we speak loudly; and he does not hear us when we speak in secret." The third said: "Since he hears us when we speak aloud, then he hears us even when we speak in secret." Then Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, revealed: the following verse of the Koran: " And you did not hide yourselves so that your hearing, your eyes, and your skin did not bear witness against you. But you said that Allah does not know much about what you do. « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 50, Ḥadīṯ no. 4979]

Zaid Ibn Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) set out for Uhud. Some of those who were with him returned. The Companions of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) formed two parties in this regard. Some of them said: "We must kill them who returned from the war." The others said: "No!" Then the following verse of the Qur'an was revealed: "What is the matter with you, that you are divided into two companies as regards the hypocrites ? divided) when Allah has turned them (or brought them down) because of what they have earned ? « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 50, Ḥadīṯ no. 4980]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
In the time of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him), some hypocrites used to stay behind when the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) went to battle. They rejoiced in staying at home behind the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). And when the Prophet came, they apologized to him and swore that they really could not take part in the battle and wanted to be praised for what they had not done. Then the following verse of the Koran was revealed: " And do not mean that those who are happy about what they have done and who like to be praised for what they have not done - do not mean they had escaped punishment! « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 50, Ḥadīṯ no. 4981]

The hadeeth of Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with both of them): 
Humaid Ibn 'Abdu-r-Rahman Ibn 'Auf reported: Marwan commanded his gatekeeper Rafi to go to Ibn 'Abbas and say to him: "If each of us, who rejoices in his deed and desires to be praised for what he has not done, if he were punished, we would all be punished." Ibn 'Abbas replied: "And what have you to do with this verse? This verse was sent down because of the People of the Book." Then he (Ibn 'Abbas) recited : " And (remember) when Allah made a covenant with those to whom the Book was given: 'You shall certainly give it to the people make it clear and do not keep it hidden!" ... "Then he (Ibn 'Abbas) recited : " And do not think that those who are happy about what they have committed and who are fond of it are for something to be praised for what they did not do - do not think that they have escaped punishment! " Ibn 'Abbas (then explained the meaning of the verse by saying) : "The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) asked the people of the Book after one thing. But they hid that thing from him, and told him another thing. Then they went away, saying that they had made him believe that they had answered his question, and that he himself " [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 50, Ḥadīṯ No. 4982]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
There was among us a man from the tribe of Banu An-Najgar who had memorized the Surah of Al-Baqara (the Cow) and Al-i-'Imran (the clan of 'Imran). and was one of the scribes of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Later (he apostatized from Islam and) went over to the People of the Book. These raised him to a high rank. They used to say, "He was one of the scribes of Muhammad, and they admired him greatly." It was not too long before Allah caused his neck to be broken while he was living among them. So they dug a grave for him and hid his body. The next morning they found the earth throwing out his body. They dug a grave for him again and hid his body. But the next morning they found the earth throwing out his body (for the second time) . So they dug a grave for him and hid his body. In the morning they again found the earth throwing out his body (for the third time) . Eventually they left the body outside. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 50, Ḥadīṯ No. 4987]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, the great fat man will appear on the Day of Resurrection with a weight less than that of a mosquito . Then read: » ...and so We will give them no weight on the Day of Resurrection. «“ [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ No. 4991]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A (Jewish) rabbi came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and said: “You Muhammad, or you Abu-l-Qasim, verily Allah bears on the Day of Resurrection (the following on His fingers:) the heavens on one finger, the earths on one finger, the mountains and the trees on one finger, the waters and the earth on one finger, all other creatures on one finger, shake everything this and says: “I am the king, I am the king.” Then the Messenger (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) smiled in amazement and agreement. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) then recited: " They have not valued Allah as Befits Him (literally: according to His true worth) when the whole earth will be held in His hand on the Day of Resurrection and (also ) the heavens will be folded at His right hand. Praise be to Him! He is exalted above what they associate with (Him). « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 4992]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah, the Most Blessed and Exalted, will take the earth into His grasp (on the Day of Resurrection) and the heavens with His right hand curl up and say: “I am The King. Where are the kings of the earth?”” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 4994]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, will roll up the heavens on the Day of Resurrection and He will take them into His grasp take it with His right hand and say: “I am the King. Where are the tyrants, where are the arrogant?" Then He will roll up the earth with His left hand and say, "I am the King. Where are the tyrants, where are the arrogant?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ No. 4995]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The people will be gathered on the Day of Resurrection on a white dusty ground that looks like the surface of white flour . No one can find an orientation feature for themselves on this!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 4998]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "The earth will be like dough on the Day of Resurrection, which the subjugator will eat with his hand as a food for will turn over the inhabitants of Paradise, just as one of you turns over his bread dough on a journey." Then a man of Jewish faith came and said: "May the Merciful bless you, Abu-l-Qasim. Shall I not tell you about entertaining the inhabitants of Paradise?" The Prophet replied: "Yes!" The man said: "The earth will be like dough for bread." And his words were consistent with those of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). on him, agree. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) looked at us and laughed until his molars were visible. Then the man said, "Shall I not tell you about their food (that day) ?" The Prophet replied, "Yes!" The man continued, "Their food is balam and a whale." Then the companions asked: “And what is that?” He said, “A bull and a whale. A piece of their liver will be enough (as food) for seven thousand people ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5000]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
While I was walking with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) towards a palm grove and he was leaning on a leafless palm branch, we passed some Jews. Some of them said to the others: “Ask Muhammad about the soul!” Another of them said: “Why do you have doubts about him? You will never hear from him what makes you suspicious." Some said: "Question him!" Then they asked him the question about the soul and the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) was silent for a while and gave them permission no answer whatsoever. I knew he was about to receive a revelation. Then I took a step back from him for decency. When the revelation was ready, he recited: “ They ask you about the spirit (soul) . Say: The spirit (soul) is from the commandment of my Lord*, but you certainly have little knowledge given to you. «

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Abu Jahl said: "O Allah, if this is indeed the truth from You, then let stones rain down on us from heaven or bring down upon us a painful punishment! The following verse from the Koran was then revealed: “ But Allah would never punish them as long as you are among them; and Allah would never punish them as long as they ask for forgiveness. “ “ And what do they have that Allah should not punish them for keeping (you) from the protected place of worship? And they were not her protectors. Their protectors are only those who fear God! But most of them don't know. « [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5004]

The Hadith of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): 
Masruq reported: We were once sitting with 'Abdullah who was lying on his side. A man came to him and said: "O Abu 'Abdu-r-Rahman, there is a narrator near Kinda who claims that the miracle of smoke (the Qur'an has spoken of this phenomenon, the Surah 44 ad-Dukhan (The Smoke)) will come. And it will take away the breath of the disbelievers while it afflicts the believers in the form of a cold." 'Abdullah sat and said with anger: "O people, fear Allah! Those of you who have some knowledge should only tell us what they know. And whoever does not know something, let him say: " (Allah knows best) ." It is better for one of you who has knowledge, if he does not know something, to say: "( Allah knows best)." ." Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, said to his Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): " Say: I do not ask you for any reward for this. And I am not one of those who impose unreasonable things. "When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saw that the people were turning their backs (on the message of Allah) , he said: "O Allah, (I ask You for) seven years as hard as this Years of Yusuf.” So the people experienced a year in which there was a famine so great that they ate skin and dead animals out of hunger. When one of them looked skyward, he would see something resembling smoke. Then Abu Sufyan went to the Prophet and said: “O Muhammad, you are sent to instruct (people) to obey Allah and to maintain ties with relatives. And your people have (almost) perished. Pray Allah for them." Then Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, revealed (the following verses) : " So await the day when the sky will produce clear smoke " " which will cover the people. This is a painful punishment. « » “Our Lord, take away the punishment from us; We are (now) believers." He (the Messenger) said: "Would Allah take away the torment of the Hereafter (from the disbelievers) ? (If by painful torment He meant the torment of the Hereafter) "Allah said: " Am Day when We will attack with the greatest force, surely We will retaliate.« By the greatest blow He meant the battle of Badr. So the signs mentioned in the Qur'anic verses, namely: the smoke, the greatest blow, the punishment imposed on the unbelievers, the victory of the Byzantines over the Persians ten years after their defeat, have already occurred. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ No. 5006]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The moon split into two parts at the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "Be Witnesses (about this) !” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5010]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The people of Makkah asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to show them a miracle, and he showed them the splitting of the moon twice. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ No. 5013]

Ibn 'Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The moon split in two at the time of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ No. 5015]

Abu Musa Al-Ash`ary (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None is more patient with hearing evil than Allah, the Almighty and Exalted: some associate other gods with him and some claim that He takes a son and still keeps them healthy and provides them with a living." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5016]

'Abdullah Ibn Qais (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: None is more patient with hearing evil than Allah the Exalted; Some put other gods alongside Him and claim that He takes a son for Himself, and He still gives them sustenance and keeps them healthy." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5017]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "Allah, the Most Blessed and Exalted, says on the Day of Resurrection to the one among the inhabitants of Hell who will be punished with the least torment: “If the earth and everything in it were given to you, would you redeem yourself with it?” He said: “Yes!” Allah then said to him: “But I asked of you something easier than what you already have the loins of Adam, namely, that you do not associate with Me." Here the narrator said: I believe that the Prophet added this sentence: "and I will not bring you to hell, but you did not hold on to anything other than that you associated with Me.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5018]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
A man said: "O Messenger of Allah, how is it possible that the disbeliever will be shown on his face on the Day of Resurrection?" The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) replied : "Is He (Allah) Who made him walk on two legs in this world unable and does He not have the power to make him walk on his face on the Day of Resurrection?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ- No. 5020]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The parable of a believer is like a plant that the wind does not let it sway. In this way the believer is always tested. The parable of a hypocrite is like a cedar that stands stiff and straight until it is ( suddenly) broken." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5024]

Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The parable of a believer is like a supple plant that can be moved by the wind. It bends due to the wind, then stands upright again until it becomes ripe. And the parable of a hypocrite is like a stiff plant that stands up straight until it is suddenly and forever broken." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5025]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Among the species of trees there is a tree whose leaves do not fall off, and this is the parable of a Muslim. Tell me which tree is this!” People searched and thought about the tree species of the desert. 'Abdullah said: "It occurred to me that it was the date palm, but I stopped myself out of shame." But the people said: "Tell us, O Messenger of Allah, what tree it is?" He said: "It is the date palm." I told 'Umar about it, and he said: "If you said: This is the date palm, I would prefer that to so and so." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ No. 5027]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "None of you will be saved by his deeds!" One asked: Not even you, O Messenger of Allah?" He replied: Also I will not, unless Allah accepts me in His Mercy. But try to do what is right!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5036]

Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prayed until his feet swelled. Then the people said to him: "Why are you doing this when Allah has forgiven you your past and future sins?" The Prophet replied: "Should I not be a grateful servant?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ- No. 5044]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood in prayer until his feet became cracked. Then she ('A'ishah) said : "O Messenger of Allah, why are you doing such a thing when Allah has forgiven you for your past and future sins?" He replied: "O 'A'isha, should I not be a grateful servant be?" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ no. 5046]

'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Shaqiq Ibn Salama said: We were sitting at the door of 'Abdullah waiting for him. In between, Yazid Ibn Mu'awiya An-Nakh'iy passed us." We said to him: "Give 'Abdullah word of our place!" Then he entered. Immediately afterwards 'Abdullah came out and said to us: "I have been informed of your place. But what prevents me from coming out to you is the fear of boring you. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to carefully choose an appropriate time for admonishing us so that we would not be bored." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 51, Ḥadīṯ No. 5047]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, said: 'I have prepared for My righteous servants ( in Paradise) what no eye can see " No soul knows what joys* are secretly held for them as a reward for what they used to do . «

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, there is a tree in Paradise under whose shade a rider can ride for a hundred years." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52 , Ḥadīṯ number. 5054]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "Indeed there is a tree in Paradise in whose shade a rider can ride for a hundred years without the end of it " [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5055]

Abu Sa`id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, there is a tree in Paradise in whose shade a rider on a fast trained horse can ride for a hundred years rides, but without reaching its end.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5056]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah calls (on the Day of Judgment) to the inhabitants of Paradise: 'You inhabitants of Paradise!' They say: Here we are, O Lord, at Your disposal and for Your pleasure. Good is in Your hand." He says: "Are you satisfied?" And they say: "And why should we not be satisfied, since You have given us what You have not given to any of Your creatures?" Allah says : “I will give you something better than this!” They say: “O Lord, what can be better than this?” Allah says: “I will keep My goodwill upon you forever, and thereafter never be displeased with you be!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5057]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, the inhabitants of Paradise will see the highest place in Paradise, as you see a star in the sky." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ No. 5058]

Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
Abu-l-Qasim (the Prophet's epithet) , may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: “The first group (of people) to enter Paradise will shine like a full moon . The next group will look like a shining star in the sky. Each man among them will have two wives. The bone marrow of her legs can be seen through the flesh (due to her purity) . And there are no bachelors in paradise.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5062]

Abu Musa Al-Ash`ary (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “In Paradise, every believer will have a tent made of a hollowed-out pearl, the length of which is sixty miles. The believer will have spouses who will live in this tent. When he makes the rounds of his wives, they cannot see each other." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5070]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, created Adam sixty cubits tall, gave him his shape and said to him: " Go and greet the sitting angels present with the salutation of peace (Salaam) and listen to them salute you, and this will be the greeting of your offspring." Adam said: "As-Salamu 'Alaikum (Peace be upon you) ! ' They replied: 'Wa 'Alaikum Salam Wa-rahmatul-llahi (Upon you be the peace and mercy of Allah) .' And they added the words (the mercy of Allah) for him . It will then happen that everyone who enters Paradise will take the form of Adam, sixty cubits tall. Since then, the human figure has become smaller and smaller until this time." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5075]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said (to his companions) : "This fire of yours, which the son of Adam (i.e. people) kindles, is only equal in heat one part of seventy parts, which make up the heat of the Hell-Fire." Then they (the companions) said , "By Allah, it would have been enough (as a punishment) if the Hell-Fire had only been as strong as the earthly fire, O Allah Messenger." The Prophet replied: "The fire of hell exceeds the fire of earth in heat, including other sixty-nine parts. The heat of each part is like that of earthly fire.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5077]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Hell and Paradise were fighting with each other. Then Hell said: "The violent and the arrogant will enter me." And Paradise said: "The weak and the needy will enter me." Then Allah, Most High and Mighty, said to Hell: "You are My punishment, with which I punish whoever I want - or perhaps He said: with which I strike whoever I want. - “ And He said to Paradise: “You are My mercy, through which I have mercy on whom I want to have mercy . For both of you, quantities of creatures will be appointed to fill you."" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5081]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: “Hell will say (on the Day of Resurrection) : “ (Is there more?) ” until the Lord He who is exalted, blessed and exalted, has his foot in it. Then she will say: “That’s enough. That is enough, by Your majesty." And it will contract." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5084]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Death will be presented on the Day of Judgment in the form of a white ram." Abu Kuraib added : “He will stand between Paradise and Hell.” - They (Abu Sa`id and Abu Kuraib) agree on the rest of the Hadith - He ( the Prophet) further said: “It is said: “O you inhabitants of paradise! Do you know this one?” “Then they will look at it. They will answer: “Yes! This is death." It is then said: "O you inhabitants of Hellfire! Do you know this one?” Then they will look at it. Then they will answer: “Yes! This is death." Then it is slaughtered at the command of Allah, after which it is said: "O you inhabitants of Paradise! Now there is only eternity and death no longer exists. O you inhabitants of hellfire! Now there is only eternity and death is no more." The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) then recited: "Warn them of the Day of Sorrowful Repentance when the matter will be decided while they (all of which) are careless, and while they do not (yet) believe. « And he pointed his hand at the world. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ No. 5087]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah will let the people of Paradise enter Paradise (on the Day of Judgment) and the people of Hellfire enter Hellfire . Then a shouter stands between the two and shouts: “You people of paradise, there is no more death! You people of hellfire, there is no more death! Everyone remains as he is forever.”” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5088]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The molar of the disbeliever - or the canine of the disbeliever - will be like the mountain of Uhud and the Thickness of his skin like the distance of a three-day journey.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5090]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The distance between the two shoulders of the disbeliever in the Hellfire will be such that a speeding rider could cover it in three days. ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5091]

Haritha Ibn Wahb (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying (to his companions) : "Shall I not tell you about the inhabitants of Paradise?" They replied: "Yes!" Then he said, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, " Every weak, humble person whose request, when he calls on Allah, is heard by Allah." Then he said: "Shall I not distinguish you from the inhabitants of Hell Tell them?" They replied: "Yes!" Then he said: " Everyone who behaves rudely, presumptuously and haughtily." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5092]

'Abdullah Ibn Abu Zam'a (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) delivered a sermon. He spoke about the she-camel and about the man who killed her and explained the verse of the Koran: " When the most unfortunate of them arose. "Saying: "A wicked man of repute, who had a high position in his tribe like Abu Zam'a, came forward to kill her (the she-camel) . Then the Prophet spoke of the women and admonished (the men ) in relation to them. He then asked, “Why does one of you beat (whip) his wife?” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ No. 5095]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: I saw 'Amr Ibn Luhayy Ibn Qam'a Ibn Khindif, the father of those Banu Ka'b, his entrails in the Hellfire drag.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5096]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) saying: "People will be barefooted, naked, and (in men) with their foreskins (on the Day of Judgment ). gathered." I said: "O Messenger of Allah, men and women look at each other?" The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) replied: "O 'A'ishah, the event will be greater than that of them watch!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5102]

Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying in his sermon: "You will certainly meet Allah like this: on foot, barefoot, naked and (in the case of men) with the Foreskin.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5103]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The people will be gathered in three groups (on the Day of Resurrection) . The people (of the first group) will be filled with hope and fear. The people (of the second group) will ride two, three, four and ten camels each. And the rest (the third group) will be gathered by Hellfire itself. It will spend the night with them, where they will spend it. It will take their nap with them where they will take it. It will spend the morning with them where they will spend it. And it will spend the evening with them, where they will spend it." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5105]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said, referring to the verse of the Qur'an: " On the day when people will rise up for the sake of the Lord of the worlds?" « “Each of them will stand in his own sweat up to half his ears.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5106]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "People will sweat so much on the Day of Resurrection that their sweat will seep through the ground seventy cubits and reach their ears or to the mouths covered." Thaur (a later narrator) was not sure whether the Prophet said ears or mouths.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ No. 5107]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If one of you dies, his place will be shown to him morning and evening. If he belongs to the inhabitants of Paradise, he learns that he belongs to the inhabitants of Paradise; and if he belongs to the inhabitants of Hellfire, he learns that he belongs to the inhabitants of Hellfire. He is told: “This is your place on the Day of Resurrection when Allah will raise you up.”” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5110]

Abu Ayyub (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out after sunset, he heard a noise. Then he said: “ Jews do this when they are punished in their graves.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5114]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When the servant (of Allah) has been laid in his grave and his companions have finished the burial and are about to leave, the deceased himself hears their steps. Two angels then come to him, sit him upright and ask him: "What did you use to say about this man (Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ?" The believer then says: "I bear witness that he is the servant of Allah and His Messenger is." It is said to him: "Look at your seat in Hellfire!" Allah has given you a seat in Paradise instead!" The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) further said: "He then sees both (seats) !”” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5115]

Al-Bara' Ibn 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited: " Allah confirms those who believe by the constant Word... " and then said: "This verse was revealed regarding the punishment in the tomb. The question will be asked of every person (after his death) : "Who is your Lord?" He (the believer) will answer: "My Lord is Allah, and my Prophet is Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him") This is what the words of Allah, Mighty and Exalted, mean: " Allah establishes those who believe by the constant Word in this life and in the Hereafter." ... «" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ No. 5117]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever is held 
accountable (for details) will be punished (by Allah) ." I asked: "Ha Allah, The Almighty and Exalted, did not say: " He will be subjected to a light reckoning. " He said: "It is only a demonstration! Whoever is questioned about details in the account will be punished (by Allah) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ no. 5122]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "When Allah wants to bring down punishment on a people, it falls on all those who are among them condition. Then they will be raised up (on the Day of Judgment) according to what they have done.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 52, Ḥadīṯ No. 5127]

Zaynab bint Gahsh (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him ) woke up from his sleep and said: “There is no god but Allah. Woe to the Arabs from any evil that comes. A hole has been dug in the dam of Ya'ğuğ (Gog) and Ma'ğuğ (Magog) today." Sufyan made the sign of ten with his hand (to show the width of the hole) . Then I said: "O Messenger of Allah, will we perish while there are righteous people among us?" He replied: "Yes, if the atrocities increase. " 5128]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Today a hole was dug in the dam of Ya'ğuğ (Gog) and Ma'ğuğ (Magog) . And Wahieb made with his hand the sign of ninety (to show the width of the hole) . [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ No. 5130]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once moved in his sleep. We said (later to him) : "O Messenger of Allah, you have done something in your sleep that you have never done before." Then he said: "What is surprising is that some people who belong to my Ummah (community ) belong to the (Holy) House to kill a man from Quraish who is taking refuge there. When they find themselves in Baida' (a place between Makkah and Madinah) , Allah will sink them into the earth." We said: "O Messenger of Allah, on the journey there are ( various types of) people." He replied: “Yes, among them there will be people who will be aware of their destination, people who will be forced to do so, and emigrants. But they are all destroyed in the same way, and raised up in different ways. Allah will raise them up (on the Day of Resurrection) according to what they intended." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5134]

Usama (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) looked down (from a height) on a fortress in Madinah and said: "Do you see what I see?" He continued: "I see Verily the confusions that fall between your houses, like the falling of raindrops.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5135]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “There will come a time of tribulations and temptations when the one who sits will be better off than the one who stands, and the one who stands will be better than the one who stands Walking, and the walking is better off than the one who takes part in what is going on around him. Whoever seeks the temptations of that time will perish. And whoever finds a place of refuge at that time, let him remain in it.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5136]

Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "If two Muslims stand opposite each other with their swords , both the one who killed and the one who was killed will be killed the hellfire." I said, or it was said: "O Messenger of Allah, this is about the one who killed, what is the matter with the one who was killed?" He replied: "He also wanted to kill his companion .” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ No. 5139]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The Hour will not come until two large groups of people fight each other and a great slaughter takes place among them. And both parties will make the same allegations.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5142]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The Hour will not come until the Haraj multiplies. The people asked: "O Messenger of Allah, what is the Harağ?" The Messenger of Allah said: "The murder, the murder!" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5143]

Huthaifa Ibn Al-Yaman (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
By Allah, it is I who have the most knowledge of the turmoil that will take place between me and (the coming of) the Hour. I have this knowledge, not because the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) told me something that he had not told anyone else, but because I was present when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) spoke about the turmoil in a meeting. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) enumerated the tribulations, saying: “Three of these turmoils will affect almost everyone. And there will be, among other things, confusion like the winds of summer: some will be (relatively) light and others strong." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5146]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The hour will not come until the waters of the Euphrates disappear and a mountain of gold appears for its sake people fight each other. Ninety-nine people will be killed out of every hundred people . But everyone will say: “Perhaps it will be I who survive the battle.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ No. 5152]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The Hour will not come until a fire is kindled from the land of Hijaz and illuminates the camels' necks in Busrah (Palestine) !" ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5164]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying as he looked towards the east: "Verily, there is the origin of (or all) troubles. Verily, there is the origin of (or all) confusion, where the horn of Satan appears." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5167]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The Hour will not come until the women of the tribe of Dauz go around the idol of Dhul-Khalasa. Dhul-Khalasa was an idol located at a place called Tabaala, which the members of the tribe of Daus used to worship in the pre-Islamic period." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ No. 5173]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The Hour will not come until a person passes by someone else's grave and says: 'If I were in his place!' ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5175]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The hour will not come until a man from the tribe of Qahtaan drives the people before him with his stick ( i.e. subdues them.) ” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5182]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The Hour of Judgment will not come until you fight a people whose faces resemble hammered shields. And the hour of judgment will not come until you fight a people with shoes made of hair." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5184]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "You will fight against the Jews and kill them until the stone says: 'O Muslim, this is a Jew, so come and kill him.”” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5200]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: The Hour will not come until the Muslims fight against the Jews and kill them and the Jew hides behind a stone and a stone tree will hide. Then the stone or the tree says: “O Muslim! O servants of Allah! This one is a Jew behind me, so come and kill him!" The only tree that does not do this is Al-Gharqad, because it belongs to the trees of the Jews." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5203]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: “The Hour will not come until there appear almost thirty swindlers and liars, all of whom will claim to be the Messengers of Allah.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim , Chapter 53, Hadīṯ No. 5205]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I accompanied Ibn Sa'id on the way to Makkah. He said to me, “I have met people who said I was the false Messiah. Have you not heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say that no children will be born to him?" I replied: "Yes!" He continued: "I have fathered children. Have you not heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say that he will not enter Madinah and Makkah?" I replied: "Yes!" Then he said: "But I was born in Madinah and am now going to Madinah Makkah." Finally he said, "By Allah, I know his birthday, place of birth, and where he is." This confused me. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ No. 5209]

The Hadith of Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both: 
Muhammad Ibn Al-Munkadir said: "I saw Jabir Ibn 'Abdullah swearing by Allah that Ibn Sa'id is the false Messiah." Then I said (to him) : “Do you swear by Allah?” He replied: “I heard 'Umar swearing to it in the presence of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) did not disapprove of this.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ No. 5214]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab went with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to Ibn Sayyad. They found him playing with the children at the forts of the Maghala clan. At that time, Ibn Sayyad was on the threshold of puberty. He did not feel that we were there until the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) slapped him on the back with his hand. Then the Prophet said to Ibn Sayyad, "Do you bear witness that I am the Messenger of Allah?" Then Ibn Sayyad looked at him and said, "I bear witness that you are the Messenger of the unread." Then Ibn Sayyad told the Messenger of Allah, Allah's peace and blessings be upon him: "Do you bear witness that I am the Messenger of Allah?" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) refused and said: "I believe in Allah and His Messengers." Then he asked him Prophet: "What do you think?" Then Ibn Sayyad said: "Sometimes a truther comes to me, and other times a liar comes to me." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said to him: "But you are confused!" Then He further said: "I have hidden something for you." Then Ibn Sayyad said: "It can only be a trick." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: "Go away! You will never rise above your rank." Then 'Umar Ibn Al-Khattab said: "O Messenger of Allah, let me cut off his neck!" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If he were really the false Messiah, then you wouldn't be able to overpower him. And if he were a liar, then it would be of no use to you to kill him." Salim Ibn 'Abdullah said, I heard 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar further report: After that the Messenger of Allah and Ubayy Ibn Ka'b went to Al-Ansary the palm trees where Ibn Sayyad was. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) approached, he hid behind the tree stumps, hoping to hear from Ibn Sayyad before Ibn Sayyad could see him. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw him lying in a bed covered with a velvet blanket, murmuring softly. Ibn Sayyad's mother saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) hiding behind the tree stumps. Then she said to Ibn Sayyad: “O Saaf! (that is the name of Ibn Sayyad) Here is Muhammad!” Then Ibn Sayyad stood up excitedly. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If she had let him, he would have made his case clear." Salim further narrated: 'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar further narrated:The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood in the midst of the people, praised Allah with what He deserves, pointed out the false Messiah, and finally said: “I warn you about him. There was no prophet before me who did not warn his people about him. Nuh (Noah) warned his people about him. However, I tell you something about him that no prophet has told his people. Know that he is one-eyed. And Allah, Blessed and Exalted be He, is not one-eyed." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ No. 5215]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Never did a Prophet come without warning his community about the one-eyed liar." So he said: "He is a One-eyed and your Lord is not one-eyed. On his forehead are written the letters KFR (Infidel) .” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ No. 5219]

Huthaifa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The false Messiah has a blind left eye. He is hairy and has a paradise and a hell with him. His hell is paradise, and his paradise is hell.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5222]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Shall I tell you about the false Messiah something that no prophet has told his community? He is one-eyed. He brings with him something like paradise and hell. He will say, “This is paradise.” But it is hell. I warn you about this just as Nuh (Noah) had previously warned his community about it.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ No. 5227]

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudry (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
One day the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) told us about the false Messiah. From what he had told us, he said: “He (the false Messiah) is going to Madina. He was forbidden entry there by Allah. He will reach a saline marshland near Madina. On that day there will go to him a man who is the best of all men - or among the best of men. He said: "I testify that you are the false Messiah about whom the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) told us." Then the false Messiah said: "How do you feel about it if I kill him and then revive him. Do you then doubt this thing?” The people will say, “No!” Then he (the false Messiah) killed him (the man) and revived him. When he revives him, the man will say, "By Allah, I have no better proof that you are the false Messiah than what I see now." Then the false Messiah will try to kill him, but Allah will not give him any power over him.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5229]

Al-Mughira Ibn Shu'ba reported:
