No one asked the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) more questions about the false Messiah than I did. Then he (the Prophet) said , “Why is he troubling you? He cannot harm you." I said: "O Messenger of Allah, they say that he has the food and the rivers with him." He (the Prophet) replied: "Nevertheless he is of no importance to Allah." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Hadīṯ No. 5231]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: There is no land into which the false Messiah will not enter, except Makkah and Madinah. And there are no entrances (of these two cities) that are not protected by the angels , who line up against him (the false Messiah) . He (the false Messiah) reaches a saline marshland; and Madina will then shake three times. After that, every disbeliever and hypocrite will come to him (the false Messiah) from Madina.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5236]

Sahl Ibn Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "The hour and my revelation are (close in time) just like this." (And he indicated with his index and middle finger)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5244]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The hour and my revelation are (close in time) just like this." (And he indicated with his pointing and Middle finger)  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5245]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The desert Arabs used to come to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and ask him the following question: "When will the Hour arrive?" He then looked down at the youngest them and said: "If this man lives so long and does not grow old, your hour will come." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5248]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
A man asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), while a boy from the Ansar named Muhammad was present with the Prophet: "When will the Hour come?" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). Blessings and peace be upon him, said: "If this boy lives so long and does not grow old until the hour comes." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5249]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Between the two bubbles there are forty." They ( those present) said: "O Abu Hurairah, do you mean forty days ?" He replied, "I can't tell you." They said, "Do you mean forty months?" He said, "I can't tell you that." They said, "Do you mean forty years?" He said, " I can't tell you that. After that, Allah sends down water from the sky; and they (the people) will sprout just like the herbs. There is only one bone in man that will not decay. This bone is the coccyx, from which the creation of man is repeated on the Resurrection Day." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 53, Ḥadīṯ no. 5253]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The dead person is followed (at his burial) by three people, two of whom return and one who remains with him: he is followed by his people, his possessions and his deeds, from which his people and his possessions return, and with him his deeds remain." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5260]

'Amr Ibn 'Auf (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent Abu 'Ubaida Ibn Al-Jarrah to Bahrain to collect the security tax (Jizya) . Previously, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) concluded a peace treaty with the people of Bahrain and installed Al-'Ala' Ibnal Hadramy as governor there. When Abu 'Ubaida returned with the proceeds and the Ansar heard of his arrival, the morning prayer was due to be performed with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). When the prayer was finished and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was about to leave, people stopped him. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw them, he smiled and said to them: "I assume that you have heard that Abu 'Ubaida brought something from Bahrain." The people said: " Yes, O Messenger of Allah!" He said: "Await the good news and be hopeful about what gives you joy; for by Allah, it is not poverty that I fear for you! Rather, I fear for you that the world will open up to you and give to you in abundance, just as it gave to those before you in abundance, and that you will compete with it, as they once competed with, and also that it will corrupt you, as it once did with others corrupted." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5261]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If any of you looks at another who has been favored over him in wealth and offspring, let him look at another , who is inferior to him and from whom he himself was preferred.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5263]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) telling the following parable: 
There were three of the people of Israel whom Allah wanted to test. The first was a leper, the second was bald, and the third was blind. He sent to them an angel in human form. He went to the leper and asked: “What would you like most?” He answered: “A beautiful color and pretty skin and healing from this disease that made people avoid me.” The angel ran his hand over his body , and his illness disappeared and his body became a beautiful color. Then the angel further asked him, "What possession would you most like to have?" The man said, "Camels (or cows - the narrator is not sure here) ." The man was then given a pregnant she-camel, and the angel said, “May Allah bless them for you.” Then he went to the bald man and asked him, “What do you want most?” The man replied, “Beautiful hair and replacement for what is missing, which is why people despise me.” The angel departed with his hand (over his head), and his illness was cured and he got beautiful hair. Then the angel asked him, "What possession would you most like to have?" The man said, "Cattle!" and a pregnant cow was given to him, and the angel said, "May Allah bless her for you!" Then the angel came to the man who was blind and asked him, "What would you most like?" He said, "That Allah would restore my sight to me so that I can see the people around me." The angel stroked his hand over his eyes, and Allah restored his sight. Then the angel asked him, “What possession would you most like to have?” The man said, “Goats!” and a pregnant goat was given to him. These animals gave birth to their young, and soon one had a valley full of camels, another a valley full of cows, and the third a valley full of goats. After some time, the angel visited the leper in his original form and said to him: “I am poor and have used up all means of subsistence during my journey, and now I no longer know who to turn to but you and to Allah. I ask you, in the name of Him who gave you a pleasant color and fair skin and wealth, to provide me with a camel to complete my journey." He answered, "I have many obligations to fulfill." Then the angel said: “It seems to me that I have seen you before. Were you not a leper who was shunned by people, who was poor, and whom Allah made rich?" The man said, "I inherited this property from my ancestors." The angel said, "If you speak a lie, may Allah restore you to the state in which you were." Then he came to the bald man in his original form, repeated his request and received an answer similar to that which he had received from the leper. He also said to him: "If you speak a lie, may Allah restore you to the state in which you were." Then the angel visited the blind man in his former form and said to him: "I am a poor traveler. My supplies have run out and I cannot reach my destination except with your or Allah's help. I ask you in the name of Allah, Who has given you back your sight, to give me a goat that may prove helpful in achieving my goal." The man said: "I was truly blind, and Allah gave me back my sight . You may take what you want and leave behind what you want. By Allah, I will not deny you anything, whatever you wish to take in the name of Allah, the Almighty and Exalted." The angel said: "Keep everything you have. All three of you were tempted. Allah is truly pleased with you and angry with your companions." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5265]

Sa'd Ibn Abi Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Surely I am the first Arab who shot an arrow for the sake of Allah. At that time we fought alongside Allah's Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and we had nothing to eat except the leaves of trees such as Al-Hublah and As-Samur ( legume and acacia species respectively) until the defecation of some of us looked like sheep droppings. The people of the Banu Assad tribe began to reprimand me for my religion. So I would have failed and my actions would have failed. But Ibn Numair did not say the word “Izan” (i.e.).  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5267]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The family members of Muhammad never ate a meal of wheat bread for three days in a row from the time they came to Madinah until he (the Prophet) died. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5274]

'A'ishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: 
We, the family of Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), sometimes spent a whole month without lighting a fire ( for cooking) ; for (our food in such cases consisted only of) dates and water. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5280]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) died, there was nothing on my shelf that any living being could ever consume, except a small amount of barley grain, which I had kept on my personal shelf. I ate it for a very long time. When I measured it, it came to an end. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5281]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) died, all the people could afford the two blacks, namely dates and water. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5284]

Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
I swear by the one in whose hand is my life, - Ibn 'Abbad said: that Abu Hurairah said: "I swear by the one in whose hand is the life of Abu Hurairah, - that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) never fed his family with wheat bread for three days in a row until he died." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5286]

'Abdullah Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) once spoke to his companions about the people of Al-Hijr (the people of Salih) , saying: “They were allowed to enter the city of people who were punished only when they were crying. If you are not in this state, then do not let a punishment like the punishment of those people befall you." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5292]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The one who takes care of a widow and the poor is equal (in terms of reward) to the one who fights in the cause of Allah , or the one who prays all night without suffering fatigue, or the one who fasts all day without breaking his fast." [ Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5295]

Jundab Al-'Alaqiy (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever tries to make people hear about him (that is, about his good deeds), Allah permits it be heard. But whoever tries to be seen by people (as a righteous person) , Allah allows him to be seen as a (hypocrite) ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5302]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "The servant of Allah speaks the word, but with that word he rushes into Hellfire farther than the distance between the east and the land West down.”
  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5303]

Usama Ibn Zaid (may Allah be pleased with them both) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: “On the Last Day, man will be taken and thrown into Hell. There his intestines dangle and he turns with his intestines just like the donkey that turns the mills. The inhabitants of hell come to him and say: “So-and-so, what’s wrong with you? Have you not commanded what is right and forbidden what is wrong?" He answers: "Yes. I commanded it, but I didn't do it. I also forbade the wrong, but I did it anyway."" [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5305]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saying: "Everyone in my community (Ummah) can expect forgiveness of their sins, except those who make their sins known . Part of the manifestation is that the servant (of Allah) commits an act in the night and at dawn - where his Lord has granted him concealment - says: “You so-and-so, I did so-and-so last night!” He spent the night in the concealment that his Lord has granted him, and stands up, throwing off the veil of Allah from himself." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5306]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Two men sneezed in the presence of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). Then he (the Prophet) wished mercy on one of them, but did not wish it on the other. The one who was not wished for mercy said, “So-and-so sneezed and you wished him mercy. I sneezed too, but you didn't wish me mercy! He (the Prophet) replied: “He has praised Allah, but you have not praised Allah.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5307]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Yawning is from Satan. If one of you is about to yawn, let him resist it as much as possible!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ No. 5310]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “A community of the Children of Israel is lost. Nobody knows what happened to her. But I think they are the mice. Don't you see that when you offer them the milk of a she-camel, they don't drink it? but if you offer them goat's milk, they drink it." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5315]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The believer should not be pierced by the same hole twice!” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Hadīṯ No. 5317]

Abu Bakra, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
A man praised another in the presence of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He (the Prophet) said: “Woe to you, you have cut off the neck of your companion. He repeated this several times and continued: If any of you really wants to praise (another) , let him say: "I consider him to be such and such." And with Allah his reality remains hidden. One must not forestall Allah. I consider him so-and-so if he knows so-and-so.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ-No. 5319]

Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) heard a man giving praise to another man, praising and praising him. He (the Prophet) then said: "You have severely whipped (or: broken) the man's back ." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5321]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
'Urwa said: "Abu Hurayrah narrated a hadeeth (of the Messenger of Allah) and said to 'A'isha while she was praying: 'Listen, owner of the room! Listen, owner of the room!" When she had finished her prayer, she said to 'Urwa, "Have you not listened to him and his words?" The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) used to make his sayings in one Form that every person who wanted to learn it by heart could follow literally." [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 54, Ḥadīṯ no. 5325]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "It was said to the children of Israel: Enter the gate by prostrating yourselves and saying: Hetta (i.e. forgiveness !) “that your iniquities will be forgiven.” On the contrary, they entered the gate crawling on their backs and said: “Henta (i.e. wheat!) ”” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 55, Ḥadīṯ no. 5330]

Anas Ibn Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: 
Allah, the Almighty and Exalted, sent Jibril (Gabriel) to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) regularly just before his death until he died. Especially on the day of his death, Ğibril (Gabriel) was with him more often than before. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 55, Ḥadīṯ No. 5331]

'Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
Tariq Ibn Shihab said: "The Jews said to 'Umar: 'You are reciting a verse from the Qur'an. Had it been revealed to us, we would have made the day of its revelation a festival for us." 'Umar said: "I know in what place and on what day this verse of the Qur'an was revealed, and where the Messenger of Allah (blessings of Allah be upon him) did All hail be upon him when he was sent down. It was on the day of 'Arafa when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood there." Sufyan said: "It is doubtful whether that day was Friday or not!" By this he meant the day when The Qur'anic verse: " Today I have perfected your religion and completed My favor upon you, and I am pleased with Islam as a religion for you. « was revealed.  [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 55, Ḥadīṯ No. 5332]

The Hadith of 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her: 
'Urwa Ibn Az-Zubair reported that he asked her ('A'isha) about the Qur'anic verse in which Allah said: " And if you fear, not righteously To act with regard to orphans, marry two, three, or four of whatever women seem good to you. … “She (‘A’isha) said to him: “O son of my sister! These are the orphan girls who are in the care of their guardian and share in his assets. He desires to marry her because of her wealth and her beauty, and wants to be unfair to her by offering a lower dowry than the other men should give her. This was followed by a ban that orphan girls may not be married without authorization unless their guardian is fair to them and gives them the highest dowry that is otherwise customary for their class. Otherwise, the order was given that they (the men) should do whatever they like in women except the orphan girls. 'Urwa said: 'A'ishah further narrated: The people asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) for guidance regarding the orphan girls after this verse of the Qur'an was revealed. Then Allah, Exalted and Mighty, revealed the following verse of the Qur'an: " They ask you for advice about women. Say: "Allah teaches you about them, and what is recited to you in the Book about the orphan women to whom you do not give what is prescribed for them and whom you desire to marry*" ' A 'Isha added: Allah means by the Qur'anic verse " ... what is recited to you in the Book... " the first Qur'anic verse previously mentioned, in which Allah says: " And if you fear not to act fairly towards the orphans , then marry whatever women seem good to you, ... " 'A'ishah further said: What Allah says in the other verse of the Qur'an: " ... and whom you desire to marry*, ... "means that the person entitled to care usually has that Orphan girl who is in his care and he doesn't want to marry her unless she is particularly rich and beautiful. Therefore, the ban was made that the orphan girls, because of their wealth and beauty, may not be married unless their dowry is paid in full.”

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The following verse of the Qur'an: " ... and whoever is poor, let him subsist in a lawful manner. ... « was revealed about the person responsible for the orphan's possession. This person takes care of the orphan's money and looks after it. If he is poor, he may take from it (the orphan's property) what he needs to eat. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 55, Ḥadīṯ No. 5339]

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
Allah, Exalted and Mighty, revealed the following verse of the Qur'an: " When they came to you from above and from below, and when their looks became uncertain and their hearts reached their throats * ... « on the day of the Battle of Al-Khandaq.

'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, reported: 
The following Qur'anic verse of Allah, may He be exalted: " And if a woman fears insubordination* or shunning from her husband,... " was revealed about the woman who was with her husband lived together for a long time; and he wanted to divorce her. So this woman says to her husband, “Don’t divorce me! And I release you from your obligation to me.” That is why this Quranic verse was revealed.

The hadeeth of Ibn 'Abbas may Allah be pleased with both of them: 
Sa'id Ibn Gubair reported: The people of the city of Kufa were divided over (the explanation of) the following verse of the Qur'an: " And whoever deliberately kills a believer, his reward is hell, ... « I went to Ibn 'Abbas and asked him about this Qur'anic verse. He replied, “This verse is one of the last verses revealed. Nor has it been abrogated (i.e. abrogated or replaced) by any other verse . [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 55, Ḥadīṯ No. 5345]

Ibn 'Abbas (peace and blessings of Allah be upon them) reported: 
Some Muslim people met a man with spoils of war. He said, “Peace be with you.” But the Muslims killed him and took his spoils. Then the following verse of the Qur'an was revealed: " ...and do not say to one who offers you peace*, 'You are not a believer'... " But Ibn 'Abbas pronounced the word thus: As-Salaam   ( السلام ) instead of As-Salam ( السلم ) .

Al-Bara', may Allah be pleased with him, reported: 
The Ansar (the Muslim helpers from Madinah) used to enter the houses from the back after they performed the pilgrimage and returned. Once a man from the Ansar entered the house through his door. Then it was said to him: "Why did you enter the house through the door as opposed to us?" Then the following verse of the Qur'an was revealed: "... And piety* does not consist in this, that you enter the houses from the back comes. ... «

The Hadeeth of 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him): 
He reported the following verse of the Qur'an of Allah, May He be Exalted and Mighty: " Those who call on them seek (and compete with) their Lord for a means, whoever of them was closest (to Him) ... « that a group of Jinn (Jinn) professed Islam. These were worshiped (by the other Jinn ) . Those who worshiped them continued to worship even though the worshiped Jinn professed Islam. [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 55, Ḥadīṯ No. 5356]

The hadeeth of Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both: 
Sa'id Ibn Gubair reported: I said to Ibn 'Abbas: "How about Surah At-Tauba (The Repentance) ?" Then he (Ibn 'Abbas) said : “It is not penance. It is rather the exposure (of the unbeliever and hypocrite) . (The pronoun) minhum (of them) , which refers to the disbelievers, was mentioned very often in this surah that it was believed that all the disbelievers were mentioned in it." I said, "And what is the case with the surah Al-Anfal (The Spoils) ?" He (Ibn 'Abbas) said: "It is the Surah of Badr (A Battle) ." I said: "And Surah Al-Hashr (The Gathering) ?" He said: " It was revealed through Bani An-Nadir.” [Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Chapter 55, Ḥadīṯ No. 5359]

Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with both of them, reported: 
'Umar preached from the pulpit of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). He praised and praised Allah. Then he said: “Then! Indeed, when the prohibition of the intoxicant was revealed, they were made of wheat, barley, dates, grapes, and honey; and the intoxicating thing is everything that impairs the mental power of man. You people! I hoped that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) would have made three things clearer:

Hadith of Abu Zarr (may Allah be pleased with him) 
Qais Ibn 'Ubad said: "I heard Abu Dharr swear that the following verse of the Quran: " These are two adversaries* who argue with each other about their Lord. ... « was revealed about those who fought (against the enemies) on the day of Badr . These were Hamza, 'Ali, 'Ubaydah Ibn Al-Harith, 'Utba and Shaiba, the sons of Rabi'a, and Al-Walid Ibn 'Utba.
